name: Formalhaut II
description:
Formalhaut II is a daring game of tactical ship to ship combat." (from the Formalhaut II rules booklet.)

Game includes a third dimension using a "Declination" system from -10 to +10 to represents the "height" or "depth" of a ship relative to other ships and objects. Ships use "rocket" power to move one hex and/or one declination each movement phase. Hyperjump movement allows a ship to move to any hex and/or declination and is secretly pre-plotted two turns before the actual movement occurs.

Ship weaponry includes missiles (track and run), guns and defensive shields. Guns and shields must be powered by allocation of power points.

Formalhaut II
Published 1975
The Dave Casciano Co.
Attack International Wargaming Association
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Starcrossed
description: Players or teams simultaneously compete to connect stars using as few movies as possible, or movies using as few stars as possible. Make the shortest connections and advance the farthest.

name: Convoy Terror
description: One of many games featured on ads in comic books from the late 50's into the early 80's. The "Convoy Terror" War Game by Five Star Toys (of Rego Park NY, later of Commack, NY) seems to have been an early version of Helen of Toy's "Fighting Ships." In fact, Five Star Toys may have been an early incarnation of Helen of Toy, Co. Like Fighting Ships, Convoy Terror featured 132 pieces - "Two Complete Modern Navies in Gray and Green." It also included a paper Playmat "Battle Area", "2 Gyroscopic Indicators", and a "Comparison Chart" showing real US and Russian Naval ships.
publishers: Five Star Toys, Helen of Toy

name: The Legend of the Lone Ranger
description:
Each player controls a Lone Ranger, and all players share control of Tonto. Players travel to different old west areas searching for outlaws to capture. Capture outlaws to collect the reward. If an outlaw escapes, his reward increases. The winner is the player with the most total reward money after all the outlaws are captured.

On your turn, roll the single die and choose to move either your Lone Ranger pawn or the Tonto pawn. Landing in one of the areas allows you to draw a card from that area. There are three types of cards you can discover:

1) Law abiding citizen - returned to the bottom of the stack.
2) Wanted poster - keep this in your hand to search for the outlaw.
3) Outlaw - If you have the wanted poster turn him face up for capture, otherwise he goes to the bottom of the stack like a normal citizen.

As outlaws are exposed you can try to capture them by landing on a tin star space and rolling a die. If you succeed, collect the outlaw and the reward amount. If you fail the reward goes up, all of the cards are collected, shuffled and redealt, and you must try again next turn.
categories: American West, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Okehazama 1560
description: "Okehazama 1560" consists of 100 pieces , a 29.5 x 42 cm map(printed in English) and 7 pages of rules(in Japanese). Players play the battle of Japanese Daimyo. Circumference of Okehazama is printed in a map. Turn length is one hour and units are two hundreds to fourteen hundreds soldiers. Player numbers are one or two and playing time is three hours.

name: Tsushima: Death Ride of a Fleet
description: A two-player simulation of the naval battle of Tsushima in the Russo-Japanese War. The game is based upon (or inspired by) Ben Knight's Command Magazine #8 title: Jutland: Duel of the Dreadnoughts. The game scale is twelve (12) minutes per turn, one (1) nautical mile per hex, and individual counters represent divisions of 2-5 ships (4-10 for destroyer divisions).

name: Desert Fox: Tobruk '41
description:
This game covers the Crusader battles.

On December 9, 1940, British forces launched Operation Compass, forcing the withdrawal of Italian forces from North Africa. In February 1941, Hitler decided to dispatch the German Afrika Korps to North Africa. Rommel's Afrika Korps immediately launched a counterattack, encircling Tobruk in Libya. On the other hand, the British army launches "Operation Crusader" with the aim of liberating Tobruk. In November-December 1941, the two armies began to clash.

“Desert battles are similar to naval battles. There is no clear front line, and it becomes a mobile battle. Rather than the size of the occupied land, the strength of the defeated enemy is the issue. It is designed to reproduce it.”
These are the words of designer Ginichiro Suzuki, which is written in the introduction. This work, a war simulation game released by Epoch Rec Company, is based on the concept of enjoying the true fun of maneuver warfare by hiding troops, which is rare in ground warfare.
In producing the new edition, we respected the content of the original publication in 1981, but made clarifications where necessary. In addition, regarding changes related to game balance, "selection rules" are adopted in the rules.

Scale:

1 hex = about 3 km
1 unit = brigade, regiment, battalion


Number of players = 2　
Play time = about 240 minutes

Contents:

240 counters (13.5mm square)
1 A1 size map
1 rulebook (16 pages)



First edition was game III in Series: World War Game (Epoch).
Reprinted as an issue game of Command Magazine Japan #158 in 2021.

(from Command Japan translated and user's description)
publishers: Epoch, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Sengoku Kassen Emaki
description:
This is a Risk style wargame during the Sengoku period of Japan.
Sengoku Kassen Emaki means Picture scroll of Battles in Sengoku period.

name: The Successors
description:
[From the manual]

A module for Ancient Empires.

"You have won a great victory."
"Yes, one more such victory and Phrrhus is no more."

Soon after the death of Alexander in 323 B.C., his kingdoms became divided. The Successors represent the armies and leaders born out of this turbulent period. Inside this module for 'Ancient Empires' you will find all the details to re-fight the great battles of Pyrrhus, the Ptolemys, and Seleucid dynasties, and much more.

Ancient Empires has quickly become the standard by which all other rule systems for miniatures are measured. Combining ease of play with careful attention to historical detail, the discerning gamer is able to accurately recreate the wars of antiquity.

CONTENTS:

- Over sixty pages of rules and scenarios, spanning the later Successor armies.

- Easy to use charts and tables listing over one hundred different troop types, including historical leader ratings.

- Background and history of the wars and times.

- The first Ancient Empires update.

Expands:

Ancient Empires: A Simulation of the Wars of Antiquity
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ozymandia
description: An original game set in the fantasy world of Ozymandia. Players compete to take over five cities by moving their pieces from area to area (using simultaneous Diplomacy type notation) and resolving combat (again, Diplomacy style), which includes using sorcery to bombard an area with lightning bolts.

name: Imperial Infantry Squad
description:
"Imperial Infantry Squad" is a tactical-level wargame of combat "in the distant future after man has reached the Stars." It can best be described as "Squad Leader" meets "Star Wars" meets "Starship Troopers".

The unit counters represent infantry squads, individual leaders. and support weapons. The support weapons consist of light, medium, and heavy "energy weapons" and demolition packs. Infantry types are bit different than your typical grunt. Types include light, heavy, and powered infantry that can fly using rocket packs. There are three "forces" represented by the counters: Confederation Infantry (the earthlings), Mercenaries (non-Confederation humanoids), and Telzans (lizard like aliens).

The game mechanics are mostly simplified versions of Squad Leader's mechanics with a few alterations as well as the additional nuances required for the futuristic infantry types and aliens.

The game mapsheets are geomorphic to accommodate the various scenarios that are included.

The production quality of the game is not bad, but not up to the better games of the same era (like Squad Leader). Although it's highly (if not shamelessly) derivative, Imperial Infantry Squad a decent tactical-level sci-fi wargame.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Simulation

name: La Guerra de los Mundos
description:
Based on H.G Wells's novel, the board game "LA GUERRA DE LOS MUNDOS" allows the players to take control of a Martian's ship invasion and to compete against other players in trying to gain the maximum possible area.

A game of trickery, strategy and diplomacy where you try to conquer for your Martian allies before humans gain control
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement

name: Crashdance
description:
This game was self published by Manfred Schüling and later redeveloped by Zoch into a game called Big Bang!

It features a heavy wooden board and lots of colour 'marble' type pieces and is an abstact game.

name: Donde No se Ponía el Sol
description:
Alea Magazine issue 30.

Donde No se Ponía el Sol (English: Where the Sun Never Set) is a wargame which includes four battles from the era of the Spanish tercios: San Quintín 1557, Otumba 1520, Nieuport 1600, and Tunis 1535.

name: Picdoku
description: Picdoku is a brand new pictorial version of the Sudoku craze that has gripped us all! It can be played individually or competitively by 2 players or teams. Each game includes 182 sturdy re-usable tokens and 30 double-sided playing boards so that 60 different games can be played again and again.

name: Team Work: Musik
description:
It adds a musical theme for the series of Team Work Original games. It can be played as an expansion or stand-alone.

Expands:

Team Work Original

name: Torpedo
description:
Torpedo is a game for the Icehouse pyramid system based on the Cheapass game Light Speed. In Torpedo, players place pyramids on the table in real time, representing either a large, medium or small spaceship. After all of a player's pyramids have been placed, combat is resolved. A laser level can be used to resolve line-of-sight questions.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Winner in 4th Competition

name: Dong Wu Qi
description:
動物棋 (dòng wù qí) literally translates into English as "Animal Game", though the name Animal Chess is more usually applied to Dou Shou Qi (which is better translated as Battling Beasts Game), from which this game is derived. The other progenitor game for Dong Wu Qi is Lu Zhan Jun Qi and it would be accurate to describe Dong Wu Qi as a hybrid between Dou Shou Qi and Lu Zhan Jun Qi.

In brief, the 8 kinds of animals in Dou Shou Qi are doubled for each player and pieces are placed face down on the board as in Lu Zhan Jun Qi rather than face up as in Dou Shou Qi. The board has similarities with Lu Zhan Jun Qi, with safe areas for animals to move into, and a base at each end of the board which the opponent is trying to get an animal into. The hierarchy of pieces is the same as in Dou Shou Qi, with the Elephant as the strongest piece, but susceptible to the Mouse.

Play is as in Lu Zhan Jun Qi - pieces are known only to their owner and combat (when a piece moves onto another) is resolved by a third person acting as a referee.

Unlike the traditional games of Dou Shou Qi and Lu Zhan Jun Qi, which many companies manufacture, Dong Wu Qi appears only to be made by one or two companies - currently, Da Fu Weng (Uncle Wang) produces this game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Professor Noggin's Countries of the World 2
description: A companion game to the original Countries of the World card game. Learn more facts about lesser known countries and the continents they belong to.
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: HeroCard Galaxy EGG Expansion Deck
description:
From the back of the box:

EGG Expansion Deck

The EGG attacks with its arsenal of quantum weapons to overload, overwhelm, and overpower the enemy.

The EGG is a HeroCard Galaxy expansion deck, the battle for cosmic domination. The EGG can compete in any HeroCard game or be combined with other decks to create a customized character.

Contents
33 Character cards
1 Figure

Expands

HeroCard Galaxy
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Cobras in the Cockpit
description:
From the website:

Cobras in the Cockpit is a game based on a fictional movie where YOU play the SNAKES! Your objective: throw the plane into chaos! You will hiss, rattle, squeeze, and bite your way through the plane, earning points for each section you throw into chaos. But other snakes will try to stop you, so watch out!

There are 4 types of snakes: Cobras, Rattlesnakes, Kingsnakes, and Pythons, each one having special abilities that make them unique. Each player chooses a breed of snake to play and then moves their snakes through the plane, trying to scare the passengers and crew. When all sections of the plane have been thrown into chaos, the game is over and the snakes with the most points win.

Beware of the Bad Mother F$%#@! and the Air Marshall! Spook people with snakes on a plate and snakes in the head! But don't forget that snakes don't plan good and snakes can barely see!*

The game comes with a 5 piece board, a deck of 99 cards, 4 snake species cards, 20 snake markers, 10 chaos markers, rulebook, and scoresheet.

Cobras in the Cockpit supports 2-4 players and the average game takes 30-60 minutes.


actual names of cards; bad grammar intended
categories: Animals, Aviation / Flight, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Adesso ci penso
description:
Aim of the game is to build up a complete and grammatically correct sentence. Each player can use just a word on each one of the seven cards he/she holds knowing that:
- on the cards a verb is in infinitive tense and it can be declined in every tense;
- adjectives, nouns, articles can be male of female, singular or plural;
- commas and full stops can be freely added;
- no other word can be used but only the ones on the cards, and just one word per card.

name: Sentiers Obscurs
description:
This game covers various engagements of the war in French Indochina (1950-1954) where both players have their own identical map but only the Vietnamese player has complete knowledge of his opponent's situation.

Units are individual men, 10m hexes, time scale not specified (probably minutes).

Magazine game.

name: Palatinus: Insula Tiberina
description:
This is one expansion given to the buyers of Palatinus in Essen 2006.
It replaces one random territory tile from the base game.

name: Fast Trak
description:
The Exciting Game of Racing

On a player's turn, they roll the dice and move their own car the full amount on one of the dice, and move one of their opponent's car the full amount on the other die.

Be the first player to cross the finish line on the final lap and win the race.

name: Horse, Foot and Guns
description:
Phil Barker's Horse, Foot, Gun is a set of tabletop rules that is based on the same system as De Bellis Antiquitatis: Quick Play Wargame Rules with Army Lists for Ancient and Medieval Battles and its successors. It covers the period from 1701 to 1915.

Re-implements:

De Bellis Antiquitatis: Quick Play Wargame Rules with Army Lists for Ancient and Medieval Battles
De Bellis Multitudinis: Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles – 3000 BC to 1500 AD
Hordes of the Things
De Bellis Renationis
categories: American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: You Only Dice Twice
description:
You Only Dice Twice was created for a two-player dice game design competition. The hardest thing to include in most dice games is some kind of player interaction, so that was a major design goal.

Players race to be the first to close out the most and most valuable number categories. Each turn, you roll six dice, but you can only use three of them for yourself--you have to let your opponent use the other three!

The only things needed to play are six ordinary dice, two pencils, and the provided score sheets.

name: Niagara
description:
Niagara is a wargame designed to be played on its own or as a vehicle for minitatures campaigns.

Players maneuver on the strategic map using the front sides of the counters.

When a battle is to be fought, a tactical map and the back side of the counters are used.

As a miniatures game, units are moved on a map the same as above. Battles may be resolved using miniatures rules or, if the forces are too small, too unbalanced, or in some other way inappropriate, the battle can be resolved using the "quick combat" method included in the game.

The game is set during the War of 1812, fought in Canada between United Kingdom and the United States of America.

name: UNO: Boston Red Sox
description: This themed vesion of Uno features the 2004 World Series Champion Boston Red Sox players and team. This version of Uno includes a special card/rule that does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "ESRUC" card and rule commemorating Jason Varitek and Keith Foulke in the ultimate celebratory embrace after winning the championship.

name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: Sports Highlights
description:
Additional 80 card for the game You've Been Sentenced with sports themes.

Expands:

You've Been Sentenced
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Sports

name: Pirates III
description:
Join the pirates and set out on an adventurous journey with this new Pirates of the Caribbean game. You will learn what it feels like to win a fight and to go through hardship as you sail through the stormy sea. The player who, despite all obstacles, obtains the most coins from the pirate treasure is the winner.

This game is based on Het Piratenspel.

name: Nsolo
description:
A mancala game. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Nsolo:

Nsolo, also called Nchombwa, is played by the Angoni in Malawi and Zambia. It is the one of the largest mancala games known to exist. A close variant of the game was already described in 1913 by Meredith G. Sanderson, a military doctor in the British colony Nyasaland (today Malawi). The rules which are given in this description were reported in 1975 from Ndola, Zambia. The holes are usually dug in the ground.

Rules:

The game is played on a board ranging from 4 x 8 to 4 x 36 holes.

Each player owns the two rows on his side. If a very large board is used, two teams are fighting against each other.

Initially, there are two stones in each hole except in the rightmost holes (as viewed from the respective owner) of each inner row which are left empty. The largest variant needs 284 stones.

At his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes one for one in a counter-clockwise direction in the consecutive holes of his two rows. If the last stone falls in a non-empty hole, its contents (including the last stone) are picked up and then distributed in the same way.

The move ends when the last stone is dropped into an empty hole.

It is only permitted to move singletons for a player if he has no holes left which contain two or more stones. However, singletons may only be moved if the next hole is empty.

If the last stone falls into an empty hole of the players inner row and the opposite hole of the opponents inner row contains stones, these enemy stones are captured.

In addition, this move entitles a player to remove, from any part of his opponent's area, the same number of stones as were captured from the occupied hole.

The captured stones are removed from play.

The game ends when a player resigns or does not have any stones left. When the board position repeats, the game is a draw."

name: The Road
description:
This is a set of 14 geomorphic 8" by 8" color-printed on card stock map sections for use with Car Wars, Battlecars, and Highway 2000.

Sections include: 2- and 4-land road sections, intersections, and curves, along with 15 2" by 8" sections to customize main roads. Also included are various pieces of "street furniture" like traffic lights and road signs and some unusual features like a large crater and sections of a canal or river.

This is part of the Task Force Games' AutoVentures series (which includes Gauntlet, Turbo Fire, Hell On Wheels, and Street Fighter).

The sheets are not dissimilar to the City Blocks supplements for Car Wars. The various sections of the The Road are stapled together into a module-size booklet when new.

This is Task Force Game product# AV 1004

name: Uncle Albert's Auto Stop & Gunnery Shop 2038 Calendar
description:
Uncle Albert's Auto Stop & Gunnery Shop 2038 Calendar is the fourth in a subset of expansion for Car Wars. This was a real calendar and it provided 22 new weapons and options for use with the Car Wars Series of games.

The Uncle Al's subset of expansions includes:

Uncle Al's 2035 Catalog (1985)
Uncle Al's 2036 Catalog Update (1986)
Uncle Al's 2038 Catalog Update (1988)
Uncle Al's 2038 Calendar (1988)
Uncle Al's 2039 Catalog Update (1989)
Uncle Al's Catalog From Hell (1992)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Auction Blocks
description:
Auction Blocks is a bidding game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game. Stonehenge is being dismantled, and everyone wants a piece! The thirty stones of the outer ring are auctioned, one at a time, and then the five trilithons. Players place blind bids for a stone, but the bids utilize the trump rule of a trick-taking game. Additionally, a player may include a trilithon card with their bid to nullify that trump rule, making that particular auction a standard blind bid. The winner of an auction gets the stone, which is worth points equal to however many of that stone she now has (×2 if the new acquisition is a trilithon). The winner of the auction gets no new cards, and the lowest non-zero bid gets two new cards; everyone else, one. The first player to 20 points wins; or, if the last trilithon is auctioned with no one getting there, the highest score wins.

Auction Blocks is an official game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game.

name: Tatü-Tata: Das Polizeispiel
description:
Sound the alarm, the police are after the crooks! In which building are they hiding? Through which exit will the notorious gang try to flee? Only a clever policeman who keeps good track of the situation will cath the most tricks.

Tatü-Tata Das Polizeispiel uses the same "sensory" ideas as Haba's Tatü-Tata game, but this is a standalone game and not an expansion to that one.

The game comes packaged in a tin police van with rolling wheels that holds all of the game pieces but also can be used as a toy on its own.

name: Tank Attack
description:
"Red Tanks vs Blue Tanks, this game puts you in command of a Tank Division. You must use your supplies carefully and maneuver your Tanks with skill or face defeat. The battlefield is simple, the Tanks are ready. Are you ready?" From the Rulebook

Tank Attack is game for 2 players in a squared board. It uses a combination of piece movement, dice throwing and card playing. The two players try to defeat all the other player's Tanks or reach his HQ. The battle can turn quickly with the use of the supply cards that can grant you an Air Strike, a Team of Engineers to repair broken Tanks or even a very useful Hijacker.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Dim Sum Derby
description:
In Dim Sum Derby, each player is hungry for a particular combination of dim sum. As dim sum becomes available, players try to eat the dim sum they crave. Players can rotate dim sum offerings between the players, add more dim sum to the table, add things to the cart, and other perform other manipulations to get achieve their culinary goals.... To quote the rules:

In summary:

A dish can come off the top of the cart in front of you to get onto the table IF there is room for it.
Once on the table you place a portion marker on the card to indicate you have put some on your plate.
After the card holds the maximum number of portion markers (see the number and circles on the card) it is scored.
If you have a Yen card that matches the dish then you place the portion markers on your Yen card. If not, you discard the markers. No markers should return to your initial supply unless a Derby card states otherwise.


The game ends when a player either places her last portion marker on a dish, or has at least one portion marker on each of her Yen cards. You total your scored portions and partially eaten dishes, then subtract then number of Yen cards on which you have no markers whatsoever.

name: Swing States
description:
Swing states is the game of political domination! Players take turns rolling for votes and then players use those votes to choose which state to influence.

On a Player's Turn:
The current player rolls 4 6-sided dice. If a die has your parties matching color on it it is counted as one vote for your party.
(colors are included in the published version,
otherwise 1-2-3 = Elephants 4-5-6 = Donkies. With your party's votes, you may purchase state/s influence.

States are influenced by Votes. Your own
parties color costs 1 vote, while your opponents color and the independent party's color (Green) cost 2 votes to influence. You may influence as many states as you can with your votes.

If a state is already occupied you may influence it by paying double the cost it would normally cost you. The only states that don't apply to these rules are the Swing States (Orange Colored states)

name: Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion
description:
Thirty years ago MBI dumped their industrial waste into the ground beneath Endicott, NY. Today, the deceased walk the earth as a result of the toxic plume that was created. Now, it's up to you to find a way to stop this infectious contagion from spreading before MBI returns to clean up their accident...with a nuclear purge.

Endicott Epidempic: Infectious Contagion is a game for 1 to 8 players. Each player plays as a character with unique abilities allowing them to combat the Zombie hordes. The object of the game is to find the Hermit, his critical Intel and his escape route before all of the players have become infected by the never-ending wave of Undead. Additionally, all this must be accomplished before the 4 Countdown Cards have been drawn, which will lead to the Nuclear Purge and an instant lose for all players.

Endicott Epidempic: Infectious Contagion is also great for solo play. You can play with some or all of the characters, or play as a single character and take a stand as the only uninfected human in the county. Once you become infected, all hope is lost.

There are 70 Cards:
4 Countdown Cards
8 Character Cards
30 Zombie Cards
15 Item/Weapon Cards
7 Event Cards
3 Cure Cards
3 Hit Chip Cards [requires manual cutting]

While Infectious Contagion is a spin-off card game, Endicott Epidemic is also available as a full board game with more objectives, more items, more gameplay styles, and of course - more Zombies!

Endicott Epidemic: Infectious Contagion will also be expandable with new card packs including advanced Zombies and Zombie Bosses, Upgraded Weapons, New Items, and objective-based area cards that augment the gameplay to make the already intense battle against the Undead even MORE exciting.

Game Mechanics/Design and Artwork by Douglas Harvey
publishers: Superior Print On Demand (POD), T.O.G. Entertainment, Inc.

name: Virgins
description:
In Virgins you play the Lord of two villages, and as Lord you choose which villagers stay and which villagers travel to other player's villages. Adding fuel to the fire, a Dragon has taken up residence near by!

The Dragon has agreed not to burn down your villages if you sacrifice Virgins to it (bit of a stereo-type, that). For the good of your villages you've got to keep your Virgins uh, virgins.

So send any Strapping Youths, the Bad Boy, and that smooth singing Musician off to another player's village! Don't forget to keep the Sheriff in a friendly village to keep the peace and if you can, make sure the Bartender only gets the Blacksmith drunk!

If there are no virgins to sacrifice at the end of a round the dragon does what dragons do best. Burning down your villages and gobbling everyone up even you Lords!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Mature / Adult
publishers: Perspective Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Vancouver in a box
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A version of Monopoly featuring the city of Vancouver, B.C., Canada
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Inch Worms
description:
Hiding under the Grassy Mound are ten wiggly, squiggly Inch Worms, some short and some long. In this game of matching, measuring, and worm-catching fun, building the longest worm wins the game! The spinner will tell you which color to find. Pick any Inch Worm and puuuulll! Keep pulling until you see your color.


Push the head of each Inch Worm through the bottom of the Grassy Mound, one worm per slot.
Make sure only the head is peaking out, and no colors are showing.
Spin the spinner!
Choose an Inch Worm to pull. Stop pulling when you reach a color that matches your spin.
Did you spin a worm? Congratulations! You win an entire Inch Worm! Choose ONE of the remaining Inch Worms on the Grassy Mound and pull it all the way out. Add it to your Worm Pile.
The game ends when the last Inch Worm is pulled out of the Grassy Mound. Connect Inch Worms from your Worm Pile together, head to tail. Now measure – the player with the longest connected Inch Worm is the winner!


Counting Variation

Flip the spinner.
Pull out the same number of segments show on the spinner – the colors do not count in this game.
If the whole Inch Worm comes completely out of the Grassy Mound, add it to your Worm Pile.
If the Inch Worm ends before you have counted up to the number you spun, choose another Inch Worm and finish your count. For instance, if you spin a 6 and the worm ends after 4 segments, continue pulling a second worm for 2 segments.
The tail counts as one segment, the head does not.
The game ends when all Inch Worms have been pulled out. The winner is decided using the rules for the color game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE Card Game
description:
ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE is a Card Game of survival horror where 2-4 players each control groups of Humans and Zombies in an effort to survive the Zombie Apocalypse. Humans are greatly outnumbered, but are able to use Weapons and Refuges for protection. Cards like Zombie Horde and Reinforcements can quickly change momentum, but be especially careful of the Zombie Apocalypse card which always keeps the Humans' chances of survival slim at best. In the end, the player with the most Humans and Zombies left standing (or shamblimg), as well as in their Kill Pile, is declared the winner.
With various "Theme Decks" available (which pushes the number of unique cards in the game to nearly 300), there is a simplified Deck Building system in place that allows some customization while keeping deck strengths equal. Deck Building is more about "atmosphere" than anything else in ZA.
Finally, all cards use stunning photography! Each card bleeds creepiness and dark humor unlike anything ever seen in a Zombie card game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Roar!
description:
Once upon a time, a woman who sold rice cake encountered a hungry tiger on her way home. The tiger said, “Give me a piece of rice cake, or I’ll prey on you!” The woman had no choice but to give the tiger some of hers, then the tiger ate it and went somewhere.

After a while the woman met the tiger again. The tiger asked for more rice cake but she had no more. Then the tiger roared and preyed on her.

The tiger which knew that she had two kids ran her home. Could two kids safely flee away from the tiger?

Roar! is a twisted trick-taking game, based on a Korean traditional folk tale, “The Sun and the Moon”. In the game, each player takes a different role: Brother, Sister, Mother and Tiger. According to their roles, the players must plan different strategies because they have different scoring manners: The Brother who is considerate toward to his younger Sister should take as less tricks as possible while the Sister should win as more tricks as possible. The Tiger which disguised as their Mother will reveal itself as a Tiger with roaring when the two kids lower their guard. At the end of a round, the one who has less tricks than the Tiger will be preyed by the Tiger.

옛날 옛적에, 떡 장수 아주머니가 집에 오는 길에 배고픈 호랑이와 맞닥뜨렸습니다. 호랑이는 “떡 하나 주면 안 잡아 먹지!”라고 말했습니다. 아주머니는 호랑이에게 가지고 있던 떡을 조금 주었고, 호랑이는 떡을 먹고 어디론가 사라졌습니다.

얼마 후에 아주머니는 그 호랑이를 다시 만났습니다. 호랑이는 아주머니에게 떡을 더 달라고 했지만 아주머니에게는 남은 떡이 없었습니다. 그러자 호랑이는 으르렁거리며 아주머니를 잡아 먹었습니다.

아주머니에게 두 아이가 있는 것을 알고 있던 호랑이는 아주머니 집으로 달려갔습니다. 그 두 아이는 호랑이에게서 무사히 달아날 수 있었을까요?

“어흥!”은 한국의 전래 동화, “해님 달님”에 기반한 특이한 트릭-테이킹 게임입니다. 이 게임에서 각 플레이어는 서로 다른 역할을 맡습니다: 오빠와 여동생, 엄마, 호랑이. 플레이어들은 자신의 역할에 따라 유일한 다른 점수계산 방법을 가지기 때문에 서로 다른 전략을 구상해야 합니다: 어린 여동생을 배려하는 오빠는 가능한 한 적은 트릭을 가져와야 하는 반면에 철부지 여동생은 가능한 한 많은 트릭을 가져와야 합니다. 아이들의 엄마로 변장한 호랑이는 아이들이 방심할 때에 “어흥” 소리를 내며 자신이 호랑이임을 밝힐 것입니다. 라운드의 종료 시에 호랑이보다 트릭을 적게 가지고 있는 사람은 호랑이에게 잡아 먹힐 것입니다.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulls-Eye Baseball
description:
A tabletop baseball dexterity game. Players bounce balls off a mini-trampoline and try to get them in the target holes to get runners on base and score runs. An electronic announcer keeps score.

There are 4 game modes:
Half-Inning Rally - Score as many runs as possible before 3 outs.
30-Second At Bat - Score as many runs as possible in 30 seconds.
Home Run Hot Shot - Score as many home runs as possible before 10 outs.
Nine-Inning Match-Up - A full two-player baseball game.

name: Moral Conflict 1940
description:
Moral Conflict 1940 is a strategic team game played by 2 to 6 players, which powerfully reconstructs the military, economic, diplomatic, technological and moral conflict as it enveloped the globe in course of the Second World War. It is possible to learn and practice not just teamwork, but also strategy, negotiation, planning and focus to achieve victory. This is a streamlined 12-sided dice version, ideal for play from 90 minutes by experienced gamers.

Victory points are collected in the beginners´game like many one dimensional military games, by capturing territories and defeating the other players. In the advanced game it is possible to play and win through the further four dimensions.

FIRST the military war of great land, sea and air battles.

SECOND the economic crisis, the struggle for economic growth and access to critical oil and iron ore resources. The price of military war is clearly seen and the player who amasses much wealth can win even without fighting.

THIRD the diplomatic pressure to coerce neutral nations into trade or conflict. The excitement of winning a major ally such as the Soviet Union and the pain if they change sides.

FOURTH the race to develop new war or economic technologies, such as jet aircraft, radar, rocketry or more efficient manufacturing through prefabrication and standardisation.

FIFTH the moral decisions which shaped each nation´s conduct. Seizing power through violence and treachery is contrasted with close cooperation, trust, sharing and self-sacrifice in search for peace.

The interplay of all five dimensions on each other is the unique Moral Conflict experience. Each game progresses differently with almost unlimited options.

An extra guide book, with historical background, teaches strategy in five dimensions and how to master each dimension to win the game and in real life.

Information on Moral Conflict 1941, a deluxe 20-sided dice version for sophisticated gamers, is also to be found on BoardGameGeek. Look out for information on BoardGameGeek for Moral Conflict 1939, an easy 6-sided dice version for play by most games enthusiasts.
categories: Civilization, Dice, Economic, Educational, Fighting, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Territory Building, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Par For The Course
description:
Australian golfing game.

Rather familiar territory. Tee up, establish wind direction, line and distance and roll the dice to simulate a game of golf. Basically, you choose your wanted line of shot and the dice may adjust the shot randomly.

Contents:
Game Board
Direction and Distance Finder
Slide rule
Distance gained by shot, hook or slice deviation chart
Wind duration and effect chart
Score card sheets
Pencil
3 dice

Endorsed by Billy Dunk (whoever he might be).

name: Attack the Tower
description:
Attack the Tower is a card game inspired by defend the tower videogames. There are a print & play version on the publishers website. Two players duel in a fast paced turn based battle. Each participant chooses an army, and must dispose of their heavy and light infantry, shooters, cavalry, siege weapons and special abilities to defeat the opponent.

There are 2 types of cards: bases and abilities. Bases must be played on a territory. Each player has 3 territories and each territory can have up to 3 bases. Troops are recruited on a base and a base can have up to 2 troops.

On his turn a player must decide to reload or not. If he does both players recruit a troop on each of his bases and draw 2 cards. The player can also attack on his turn. Attacks are always from a territory to another. All troops must participate on an attack.

Each troop has a power that counts both for attack and defense. Bases always have a power of 4. To destroy a base one must destroy all its troops first. The goal is to destroy the opponent's Palace that sits behind his territories and has a power of 10. The Palace can only be attacked if at least one of the territories has no bases on it.

name: The Legend of Cheung Po Tsai
description:
During the Qing Dynasty, following the death of the infamous pirate Cheung Po Tsai, four factions compete to claim his treasure map by being the first to sail all the way around Cheung Chau island.

Each round, players must play cards matching the wind direction determined by the spinner, in order to make progress around the board. They can also play cards to shoot at opponents (they can return fire) to move them backwards along the track, steal cards from opponents' hands, swap places with an opponent, or just to move extra spaces or draw extra cards.

Each faction's character has some special abilities. The factions are fishermen, pirates, and the Qing and Portuguese navies. The first player to reach the last (24th) space on the board wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Mad Rush Rally
description:
Track Design to the Finish Line!

Mad Rush Rally is a game where you take turns building the track while you're racing on it! This allows you to create the track to suit your own strategy. You can even design your own short-cut to jump to first place!

Players gain insane and fun-to-use items; Items like the Booster, which let's you jet ahead of the competition; the Dodge Ball, which whacks your friend into missing their next turn; the Squirrel, which creates a roadblock forcing players to change course; or the Bomb which decimates the track and all on it! Plus more items that shift the balance of the game! What's more, some items are left on the track to be used by or to hinder your friends, making each game even more unique.

Mad Rush Rally offers a familiar but fresh experience combining kart racing inspired video games with a simple yet revolutionary map-building game mechanic that brings fun back to the table.
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Lagoona
description:
From the publisher's website:

An exciting reaction and dexterity game
The shells are turned over using the little hammer. If pearls appear, the players must quickly look quickly to see which side the whale is "swimming" on. If the colours match, they may grab the whale. Whoever manages to grab it may place a pearl in their boat. The winner is the player who fills their boat first.
This game focuses on dexterity, concentration and responsiveness.

name: Jake and the Never Land Pirates: Never Land Challenge Game
description:
Join Jake and the Never Land Pirates for a high-spirited adventure! Grab your pirate gear and crawl, tiptoe, and jump through the vine archways to earn gold doubloons. Each turn offers a chance to prove your playful pirate skills, whether it’s tucking the cannonball under your chin or balancing Jake’s sword on your head. Collect more coins than Captain Hook to win!

In this game, the players have to collect coins by performing challenges. The game comes with a starting plate, a red X and two archways which are setup before play. There are also several accessories.

Each turn, a player draws a red and a blue coin, and flips them over. On their backs are instructions; together they form the challenge, such as "Crabwalk to the X and back waving the sword like a pirate!". The player may exchange his blue coin as often as he wants to get a challenge that he likes better.

If the player succeeds in the challenge, he gets the coins, otherwise, the coins go to Captain Hook.

The game ends when three coins with the text "Game Over" have been revealed. If the players have collected more coins than Captain Hook, they have won the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates

name: Condottiere: The Dogs of War
description: Tactical miniatures combat in the late medieval/early renaissance period, with a focus on Italy. Units are maneuvered, with combat decided by dice, playing cards and special fate cards. Campaign rules for Condottiere companies are included, as are armies from outside Italy. Designed for 28mm miniatures but conversion to other scales is easy. Single or multi-basing. Troops have 20mm frontage, 20mm depth for infantry and 50mm depth for cavalry. Units are 16 infantry, 10 cavalry or 2 cannons and 8 crew.

name: A Reign of Missiles
description:
The Gaza Missile Crisis
November 2012

A Reign of Missiles is a low-complexity, solitaire simulation game of the Gaza Missile Crisis of November 2012. The player takes on the role of the Israeli military high command as it attempts to fend off the missile strikes launched by Hamas from Gaza.

The player is also attempting to manage the crisis in order to keep it from escalating into a larger and bloodier conflict that could engulf the entire Middle East. The game’s rules control the actions of the Hamas forces in Gaza.

name: Sprücheklopfer
description: Creative cardplay for young and old storytellers. "Whoever digs a pit for others, has gold in the mouth", so goes a famous saying. But wait, that's so not so! In this game, there are 60 playing cards with the first part of the sentence. Now we have to ponder what might these strange sentences. Because the players determine which answer they like best - and who scores.

name: Shizzle
description:
From Patch's website:

"Heat up game night with this sizzling dice game! Toss the one-of-a-kind dice into the innovative Twist & Tumble Dice Cup, twist, and watch the dice tumble out! Create a line of color or number matches that will score big or make others lose big. In this game, you definitely want to Shizzle, and it’s better if you don’t fizzle!"

Players take turn rolling the dice and try to create a line of dice where the next die in line matches the previous by color or number. The more dice in your line, the more points you earn! You can reroll unused dice as many times as you want as long as you're always adding to the line. If not, you choke and lose all the points you've earned that turn.

The game ends when the bank is out of chips. The player with the most points at the end wins.

name: Ultimate Warriors Death Battle Game
description:
Ever wanted to see your favorite Warriors battle each other? This is the game for you! Pick from 8 fierce and mighty Warriors for the ultimate battle to the death.

Game Objective: Pick three Warriors and Battle to the Death!
- Use energy for movement and perform special abilities unique to each character.

Starting the Game: Each player rolls a die; highest die starts the game. Game play continues with player on left.

Winning the Game: Player with the last Warrior standing is the winner!

name: Blind Alley: The Game of Mazes
description:
This game is somewhat similar to Milton Bradley's Pathfinder; it also has each player create a maze and then try to solve the opponent's maze by moving through it and being told when walls are encountered.

However, in Blind Alley the wall pieces come in a variety of shapes, each of which is a different color. When your piece hits a wall you are told what color it is, which may enable you to make deductions about where other walls are based on the shape of the piece. Information-marking walls are provided in the maze wall colors to allow easy tracking.

name: Stack The Bones
description: This great game is a bone-yard of fun for adults and kids alike. Using one hand only, each player removes a bone from the stack and places it on the top. The last player to place a bone without toppling the stack wins! A classic game that calls for serious bone stacking skills. Features: Wooden game pieces; Packaged in an illustrated gift box. For one or more players.

name: No Benefits
description:
No Benefits is a card game about your job. The job you’d quit in four months, five years ago. Relive one week of your life in one hour.

Remember how you said you wanted to be a writer? An artisanal pickle maker? Now's your chance. It only takes you two hours to finish your data entry, but management doesn't know that. Do you really want to make copies of copies all day? Why not work on your novel and brine pickles in the bathroom instead? You’re pulling a paycheck either way. At the end of the day, players that didn't complete their tasks will be reprimanded, unless of course they can play an excuse to get out of it. Watch out for Wednesday, though, as there's always something that goes wrong on hump day.


No Benefits is set in an average workplace, where players are average employees trying to get through the daily grind. You need to balance not getting fired with working too hard, in order to finish the week as the least productive worker.

The goal of the game is to gain the most slack by the end of the 5 day working week (5 turns).

Each turn, players will be given an assignment from the day's inbox by the current Assistant Manager. On Wednesdays, crisis cards are also drawn and dealt with. Players can then play morning memos, plan their workday by selecting Grind cards to play, and then revealing their selected cards to show their progress towards their assignments. Players with incomplete assignments can plead their case with excuse cards. Without an excuse, players receive a write-up, and are fired if they gain 3. Finally, any late memos are resolved and that round's slack scores are tallied up.

The game involves a careful balance between putting off work for points, or doing work to gain sway and perks from your superiors.

name: Monopoly: The Wizard of Oz 75th Anniversary Collector's Edition
description:
With a pop-up 3-D center board, all new game directives and board design that evolves from sepia to color, MONOPOLY: The Wizard of Oz 75th Anniversary Collector's Edition is truly a Wizard of OZ game that celebrates America's most beloved film in its entirety.

Special Features:

Custom illustrated game board with 3-D pop-up center, illustrated and built by renowned artists Otto Sturcke and Mike Butkus, and the paper engineering mastery of Bruce Foster (the pop-up folds out from the board just like opening a pop-up storybook)
Never-before-seen gameplay that adds a whole new level of strategy to the game
Legend cards with directives for pop-up game play
22 of the top locations in The Wizard of Oz, starting in sepia and transforming into color just like the movie
6 Collectible Tokens: Toto, Scarecrow Diploma, Cowardly Lion Medal, Tin Man Heart, Ruby Slippers, Witch's Hat
Custom Money issued by the Bank of Emerald City
Classic "Houses" and "Hotels" are transformed into custom "Farmhouses" and custom "Emerald Cities"
Red dice that glitter with white pips



Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Źródło
description:
The Source is an adventure board game published by City Hall of Sieradz. Players are divided into two groups. First group takes roles of investigators trying to locate legendary Source which is hidden somewhere in Sieradz. Second group takes the role of ghosts trying to prevent finding of The Source. Game introduces players to history of Sieradz and has many educational values.

---

Przygodowa gra przygotowana przez Urząd Miasta Sieradza w celu promocji miasta. Część graczy wciela się w poszukiwaczy, którzy starają się znaleźć legendarne Źródło Inspiracji, które znajduje się w Sieradzu. Pozostali uczestnicy są duchami historycznych postaci związanych z miastem i starają się nie dopuścić poszukiwaczy do Źródła. W tym celu wysyłają na nich lunatyków i mgłę. Gra zawiera wiele elementów edukacyjnych związanych z historią Sieradza.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire (Second Edition)
description:
In an almost identical format to its predecessor, players answer multiple-choice trivia questions of increasing difficulty, with the option of quitting with their winnings up to that point. This adaptation has makeshift versions of the TV show's "Ask the Audience" and "Phone a Friend" lifelines. Players rotate as host, and after everyone has taken a turn as host, winnings are totaled.

Based on the original ABC version of the world-famous game show, hosted by Regis Philbin from 1999-2002.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Redshirts: Reinforcements Deck
description:
Currently contains five extra special cards for the base game.

Special Cards:

Taboo - Medical
Location - Fantasy Planet
Equipment - Plot Device
Mission - Guard the Galaxy
Event - Hail Mary Play
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Science Fiction

name: Redshirts: The Celebrity Away Team
description:
This is a special set of cards which that WeaselPants were only given out during the Kickstarter campaign for Redshirts 2.
After the campaign, all remaining cards were given to their respective celebrities. Availability will depend on them at that point.

Eight intrepid souls famous in geek circles have bravely volunteered for the untold horror that is the life of a Redshirt:

David Reddick
Not only did he create nearly every piece of art for this project, he is also the writer and artist of Intelligent Life, Legend of Bill, and Rod & Barry

Howard Tayler
The creative powerhouse behind the web classic Schlock Mercenary.

Lar deSouza
You know and love him from the art of The Least I Could Do and Looking For Group.

MC Frontalot
He is the godfather of Nerdcore.

Scott Kurtz
Creator, writer, and artist of one of the most popular online comics of all time: PVP.

Larry Correia
The man who wrote the Monster Hunter International series.

Michael Z Williamson
The author behind the Freehold Universe series.

Jonathan Coulton
The internationally renowned musician who actually wrote a song about this game. He claims it's about some book some hack sci-fi guy wrote. Pay no attention to that, we know what its really about.

name: Skōsh
description: Skōsh is the team-play trivia game for people who have more fun figuring it out than knowing it all. Draw from hundreds of questions, then pool your wits and take your best guess - you might miss the mark but the closer you get, the faster you advance. Keep score with a tug-of-war by trying to pull the puck away from your opponent's winning circle and into your own. It's free-wheeling fun for all whether you miss by a mile or win … by a Skōsh.

name: Чудесные башни (Wonderful Towers)
description:
Чудесные башни ("Wonderful Towers") is a card game in which players will turn their towers from upside down to normal position.

In the beginnign of the game each player is dealt 7 cards that form his upside-down tower. Each round the player must perform one of the following actions: take a card from the deck and replace a card in his tower with it; or you play the property of one of previously discarded cards. The winner will be the first one to build his wonderful tower.

name: Herr der Ringe Mau Mau: Freie Völker
description:
This game is based on the public domain game "Mau Mau", which is basically the same as "Crazy Eights", but it has some twists:

There is always a location card active providing an ongoing special rule (the location will change several times during a game), and the One Ring card is not played to the discard pile, but in front of a player and can be stolen by other players. Being the ring bearer will give you points at the end of the round, but it can hamper you during the round, so it's a bit of a risk.

This set can be combined with the Mordor set. Or each can be played on their own. The two are not just reskins of each other. They actually have different rules (while sharing the basic Crazy Eights mechanism).

The covenant formed around Frodo, Gandalf and Aragorn was known to have discord, and in Herr der Ringe Mau Mau: Freie Völker you can determine who in the group has the final say.

name: Urban Explorers: Teruel
description:
Urban Explorers: Teruel is a card game for 2 to 5 players. The goal is to pick up more points than your fellow players while exploring the city.

Starting from the center card, players will explore the cultural and touristic Points of Interest step by step, and they try to arrive to each place before the other players in order to collect the points.

Each one turn, players will play one card. Then, the current player can move his pawn in any direction using the cards as stepping stones. If the card where he finally stopped contains any point piece, the player will keep all of them.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Buzoku
description:
ブゾク "Tribe" is a rather abstract cardgame rendering the conflict between two Mesoamerican tribes. The game plays over four alternatingly good and bad seasons: trying to increase the size of the tribe in each good season, and attempting to avoid the perils of the bad seasons.

It's explicitly a team game. Teams alternate play: but unlike most such card games, each team-mate plays a card secretly together, then discusses (without revealing anything about the played cards) which should take effect first. Each card played adjusts the ownership of important resources, might grant a hunting token, or might increase (in a good season) or decrease (in a bad) the size of the tribe. Largest tribe at the end of the game wins.

name: Help Peggy
description:
Peggy’s new apparel store is about to open, but some clothes are still scattered all over the place! She must rely on the helping hands of her best friends to overcome this crisis! Help Peggy! is a cooperative deduction game. Players are acting as Peggy’s friends, trying to sort clothes by color & type before the time runs out. Can you help Peggy open her store in time?

Use all 16 apparel tiles. Shuffle all tiles face down, and place them into a 4x4 grid on the game board.During their turn each player will choose 1 of the following 3 actions to do , Inspect Tiles and Reveal Tiles and Exchange Tiles.

name: Mia and me ... "Rettet Centopia!"
description:
A co-operative game for 2-3 players.

The players have to work together to help Mia, Mo and Yuko to save the unicorns populating Centopia.

On their turn the player rolls up to 4 dice setting aside all symbols of the evil Panthea and choose one action fom the remaining dice (mainly moving the characters). Next player can roll only the dice not set aside. If all dice are locked another Munculus is added to the board assigned to guard a unicorn of matching colours. To save a unicorn the players have to match the number of Munculi guarding the unicorn. If there are ever 4 Munculi guarding a unicorn players lose, otherwise they win if all unicorns are saved.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Djumble
description: In Djumble, players reveal cards from the deck that have descriptions such as "green", "floats", or "weighs more than 1 kg", then everyone races around the house — or wherever they're playing — to find something that fits as many of these categories as possible, then they argue about which things fit best in order to score points.

name: Mismo!
description:
From GMA News Online (August 2009):

'The object of the game is to win three rounds, each one marked by a Mis, Mo and ! chip. Each player receives 10 answer cards, each of which contains a word from Filipino popular culture. Two roulettes, loaded with adjectives, are spun. The adjectives are formed into a question - Ano ang kadiri-to-death na mayabang? – and players attempt to respond with their cards. Hilarity ensues over the incongruous, often absurd answers.'

name: Ante Portas
description:
Ante Portas is a 2 player card game about the campaign of Hannibal against Rome. You have to use your cards to defeat your enemy. The game is assimetrical as the two player have different option for the use of the cards, so playing one or other side is a different playing experience. The game is card driven with a strong bluffing element.

About the gameplay:
Every card has a Roman and a Carthagian part and the players can use only one part, but the card goes to the other player after use.
Each card can be used as an Event, army or other special use depending on your side. Marching time for the Carthagians to move your army or morale/money for the Romans to keep your Empire together. Your choices will decide the faith of your Empire.
It has only 20 Event cards so its very quick, but there is the possibility to deeper startegy and tactics.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: The Memory Palace
description:
Players explore their imaginations and test their memories while creating silly stories about 27 different animal tokens. Players share wacky stories as they place their tokens facedown in a room. Be careful, there are Memory Monsters lurking in the palace trying to confuse. Successfully remember where each animal is on the board without turning over a Memory Monster and everyone wins!

Kids have fun creating silly stories and pushing their imaginations to the limits! Silly animals and colorful rooms of the palace keep kids engaged and their stories even sillier!

Components:
16 Palace tiles
27 Animal tokens
3 Memory Monster tokens

Similar to Memo-Palace.

name: Atari's Asteroids
description: Asteroids is a board game adaptation of the Atari video game from the 1980s.

name: Operation Pincher: Stalin's Drive In the Middle East, 1949
description:
Operation Pincher (OP) is an alternative history wargame, designed by Ty Bomba, which allows two players to investigate the strategic parameters that would’ve been in place in southeastern Europe and the Middle East had Stalin attacked there at that time, most likely in conjunction with a drive into Western Europe. His goal in starting such an operation would’ve been to blitz to the oilfields and Allied base areas in North Africa and the upper Persian Gulf. That would’ve effectively broken the geostrategic back of the British Commonwealth of Nations, disrupted Europe’s oil supply, and delayed the US from being able to mount an atomic bombardment campaign into the USSR.

The scenario is based on the actual “Pincher” series of defensive plans drawn up in the Pentagon from 1946 through 1949.

There are rules for US atomic bombs, but their use is constrained by politics. That is, the late 1940s marked the arrival of the anti-imperialist (“third world” or “nonaligned”) movement on the world stage. So, if the Americans try to win by using enough bombs to blow to bits Stalin’s attacking horde, they do so much damage to the environmental and socio-political ecologies as to undo that victory in the strategic sense.

The extra-large-hex 34x32” map covers from Albania and Thrace south to Benghazi and Kuwait and east to Tehran and the Caspian Sea. Each hexagon represents 60 miles (97 km). Each of the eight full game turns represent two weeks of ‘real time.'

Communist units of maneuver are Soviet and satellite-nation armies (plus super-elite Guards Airborne divisions) along with Allied armies, corps, divisions, brigades, and regiments. There are no US units on-scene at the start of play, but army “regimental combat teams” and Marine Corps regiments and a brigade rush in as reinforcements. Air power is abstracted, with counters and rules showing the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary air superiority over portions of the map.

Since this is a secondary theater (in regard to a presumed main front in Western Europe), the Communist player is never certain exactly what his order of battle will be until set up. He knows, however, it will contain a total of 12 to 14 Soviet combined arms, mechanized, shock and tank armies, along with 10 satellite-nation corps and armies (and possibly three to seven divisions of ultra-elite airborne divisions).

Each match generally runs through three phases. In the first, the Communist juggernaut drives deep across Turkey and into Mesopotamia. Only the Turkish and Israeli Armies, and the use of a-bombs by the US, can slow the advance. As Soviet losses mount and US prestige sinks, the middle stage begins. It’s characterized by both sides maneuvering, seeking to hold or take still-contestable key areas. The Soviet guards airborne force is most likely to make its appearance. A-bombs are still going off, but their targeting has to be ever more selective and there are fewer such attacks. During this period a well executed Soviet campaign will achieve its victory objectives. The end game sees an Allied counteroffensive, as that player throws in everything he’s got to try to take back from the Communists enough victory hexes to overturn what will otherwise be their end-of-play win on points.

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Cerberus Occultist
description:
Description from the publisher:

Known for their obsessive need to study, the students of House Cerberus have a tendency to delve in knowledge that is best left alone. Unfortunately, this causes some promising students to descend into madness. The truly gifted, however, learn to tame this dark knowledge and unleash it against the foes of Crystalia.

The adventurous girls of Takoashi have barely gotten into summer, and already they want to go back to school! Schooling monsters that is! Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Cerberus Occultist comes fully equipped, complete with a hero card, cast in luxurious resin as a multi-part kit.

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Siren Enforcer
description:
Description from the publisher:

Few can resist the allure of the students of House Siren. Trained in the arts of charm, persuasion, and manipulation, graduates of House Siren go on to positions of power throughout the realms. It is a foolish adversary who dismisses a student of House Siren as a mere diplomat or sophisticate. Wielding massive hammers, these powerful students are trained to knock you out with more than their looks.

The adventurous girls of Takoashi have barely gotten into summer, and already they want to go back to school! Schooling monsters that is! Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Siren Enforcer comes fully equipped, complete with a hero card, cast in luxurious resin as a multi-part kit.

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Unicorn Diviner
description:
Description from the publisher:

The adorable students of House Unicorn prefer to avoid combat whenever they are able. On the rare occasion an adventuring party can coax a House Unicorn student to join them, they are gifted with a unique and powerful ally. Staying at a safe distance from the fray, the House Unicorn student provides potent magical confections that delight the tastebuds and entice their party to unparalleled acts of heroism!

The adventurous girls of Takoashi have barely gotten into summer, and already they want to go back to school! Schooling monsters that is! Super Dungeon Explore: Takoashi University – House Unicorn Diviner comes fully equipped, complete with a hero card, cast in luxurious resin as a multi-part kit.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Dreadnought Card Pack
description:
Dreadnought is a Dominion Cardassian ATR-4107 class ship. As a card pack, it comes with cards, token and a dial.

It is a part of card pack wave 1.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Die Kolonisten: Kaizo Kolonisten
description:
This scenario, included in Lookout magazine "Neues vom Ausguck" is supposed to increase the difficulty of the game by alot. In short, you only play era 1 and without colonies.


Wer sich ein wenig in moderner Internet-Kultur auskennt, dem wird "Kaizo Mario" sicherlich ein Begriff sein - eine ultraschwere Version des beliebten Konsolenspiels "Super Mario World" von Nintendo. Dieses Szenario ist ganz im Sinne von "Kaizo Mario" unverschämt schwer und soll euch vor eine echte Herausforderung stellen. Wer traut sich?

English Translation:
Anyone familiar with modern internet culture will be familiar with Kaizo Mario - an ultra-hard version of Nintendo's popular console game Super Mario World. This scenario is outrageously difficult in the spirit of "Kaizo Mario" and should present you with a real challenge. Do you dare?
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: Sonic Boom
description: Monopoly with Sonic the Hedgehog.
categories: Animals, Economic, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Jewelers Row
description:
Jewelers Row is a new Button Shy Wallet game in the limited "Select" Line. Consisting of only 18 cards, a rulebook and bi-fold wallet, Jewelers Row brings the excitement of app-inspired "Match-3" gameplay to your tabletop.

Deep beneath the street of Jewelers Row, gnomish gem crafters forge intricate pieces coveted throughout the realm. As one of these gnomish craftsmen, you will specialize in two prized gem types. Be careful not to use too many of the same gem in one piece, or customers will question their authenticity. You can always shift the blame to your competition, though; they’re certainly doing the same to you…

Players will each take turns placing cards containing a grouping of gems next to, or on top of other gem cards, hopefully scoring points on each placement. Points are scored when 3 or 4 of the same gem type align, but if you reach 5 or more of the same, you will start to lose points. Losing points isn't always a bad thing in Jewelers Row, however, as just before you score you will send the points in your lowest scoring gem color to your neighbor. Players then score for their top two gems, and only those two.

As you try to maximize your highest two gem types, you will want to watch your neighbor on your left to try to knock them down a notch, and watch the neighbor on your right to see the damage they're sending your way.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Angrath Minotaur Pirate
description:
Part of the Rivals of Ixalan line.
A Planeswalker deck that is ready for play out of the box, and can be used by new players as a starter deck. It revolves around red and black mana, with mainly pirates as creatures.
The leader of the band is Angrath, a Planeswalker that inflicts damage on multiple opponents, resurrects pirates, and can take control of the opponent's creatures.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Supervillain: This Galaxy Is Mine! – Reaction Expansion
description:
Quick reaction is good not only in the Wild West (where the sole Secret Facility is Saloon, Colt Frontier Six-Shooter is used instead of Asteroids, while the only Minion is your horse). There are plenty of specialists in the space able to perform cunning tricks at breakneck speed! For instance... e-r-r-r... can’t find other examples... OK, for instance, me.

Oops, and another Villain — who used to rub hands foretasting some nasty success — finds himself among the ruins of his foolish hope. His Project failed to be completed on time, while the assault of his best Minion Operatives — successfully countered. Quick reaction rules!

Minion Ops with Reaction ability are played in response to certain actions of another Villain. These may be played during the other Villain’s turn, during your own turn (in theory), and basically at any time when the required condition is met.

In addition, you may play these Minion cards as regular Mobs. The Reaction ability pertains only to the Minion Ops.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
publishers: Moroz Dev Studio, Rightgames RBG SIA

name: Doctor Smuglfreud's Marvelous Machine
description:
In this set collection programming card game, your old mentor has invited you to the unveiling of his masterpiece, a modular perpetual motion machine, only to disappear just as the event is about to begin! It is up to you, his former apprentices, to save the day and demonstrate this strange machine in his absence. Wow the audience, earn Prestige for your mentor, and discover the bizarre secrets of Doctor Smuglfreud's Marvelous Machine!

The premise is simple: module cards can interact with each other to generate a perpetual cycle of movements. There are many ways to get it right...but even more for things to go horribly awry! As you experiment with the temperamental machine, you will learn how to assemble sets of cards to make sensational combinations.

Three modes vary gameplay and win conditions:


Rival Mode: compete with your rival to earn the most Prestige within the round limit.
Demo Mode: work together or alone to earn the goal amount of Prestige (or more!) as quickly as possible.
Puzzle Mode: work together or alone to create one spectacular design.


This game was first developed as an entry in the 2018 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest, where it won several awards:


#1 Most Innovative Mechanic
#2 Most Thematic Game (Steampunk)
#3 Best Artwork (Giampiero Randazzo)
and more...


Features:

Award-winning print-and-play game
Art from the MARVELOUS Giampiero Randazzo
Three game modes with distinct flavors and playstyles (competitive timed, cooperative/solo timed, cooperative/solo untimed)
Ultra-portable components, including an optional custom tuck box
Design codes for sharing configurations or asynchronous play
Top hat not included


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: A Walk in the Woods: A Print and Play Game
description:
A Walk in the Woods is a print-and-play game that was submitted for the Roll and Write Global Jam 2018. Autumn is the time for taking a relaxing hike in the woods and seeing all the beauty that nature has to offer. In A Walk in the Woods, players take the best path to see as many features as possible and score the most points.

A Walk in the Woods takes 15-30 minutes and is for 1-10 players. This is a print-and-play game which requires the following:
- Player Sheet
- 1 red die
- 1 green die
- 1 yellow die

One player rolls all three dice and then selects two of the three dice. The sum of those two dice is used to determine which shape can be added to their path. Once a shape is added to the player's path, any features that are covered by the new path are scored at the bottom of the player’s sheet. After each player selects their two dice to use, there will be 1 die left over. The player will fill in one side of the top most incomplete shape on the Bonuses section of the player sheet that matches the color of that die. When all sides are filled in, the player gets a special power they can use on any future turn.

The game ends on the round when 1 or more players extend their path to or past one of the 6 ending Finish squares. In the solo variant, the game ends after 22 turns.

name: France '40: Victory or Defeat
description:
France 1940: Victory or Defeat, allows one or two players to examine the strategic possibilities inherent in the campaign that occurred within France and the Low Countries in that year. A second scenario allows for an alternative history examination of the opportunity the French had in September 1939 if they’d kept their promise to launch a “major offensive” into Germany within a week after that nation invaded Poland. All the orders of battle are entirely historical in both scenarios. The main body of rules is written with the 1940 scenario in mind. All changes required for the play of the 1939 scenario are identified as such in each specific case.

Each full game turn of the 1940 scenario represents 3.5 days. In the 1939 scenario each turn represents two days. Each hex on the map represents 16 miles (26 km) from side to opposite side.

World at War Magazine #68
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Bucket of Doom: Toxic Edition
description:
Your favourite storytelling card game is back, with more dark humour than ever AND a toxic twist.

Not familiar with the Bucket of Doom? Where have you BEEN?! This thrilling 17+ card game is one you really don’t want to lose. Let us explain:

Step 1: Read out one of the doom cards to discover what sort of mess you're in - for example, let's say you're trapped in the Death Star garbage crusher and the walls are closing in.

Step 2: Take a look at your 8 useless object cards. These could be anything, from a severed finger or Heather Mills’ false leg, to a pantomime horse outfit or Elton John’s favourite toupee. Come up with a cunning escape plan and share it with your fellow players - remember to be convincing, inventive, and a little bit absurd.

Step 3: Vote on who had the best plan, the one with the most votes wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Vocablos
description:
Vocablos is a card game published in Argentina by the Tinkuy publishing house. The objective is to form words by combining the letters and syllables obtained during the game.

Nine cards are placed in the center of the table, face up. Each player must form words composed of at least four cards. for that you must use letters and syllables that are on the table. Then the used cards must be replaced and it will be the turn of the next player. At the end of the game, the one who has added the most points will win.

—description from the publisher


Game modes

Vocablo: Place nine cards face up. Each player must make words by combining the letters and syllables available on the table. The winner will be the one who achieves the most points with the "words" formed in a certain number of games.

Chinchón: Eight cards are dealt to each player and the remaining deck is placed on the table. The objective is to form words with four or more cards, taking some and discarding others. The first person to complete their game can "cut" the game. The player who manages to add 200 points will be the winner.

name: Taboo: Kids vs. Parents
description:
Kids vs. Parents edition of the TABOO game. The game includes 2 decks of cards featuring a deck designed especially for kids, featuring a familiar guess word and only 2 forbidden words on each card. Players race against the included timer as they give clues to get team players to guess as many words as they can within a minute. But don't mention unmentionables, or it's time for the squeaker, which means losing the point. The game includes over 1,000 guess words on 260 cards -- 130 cards for adults, and 130 cards designed with younger kids in mind.

—description from the publisher

name: Zapanhak
description:
Zapanhak is a simple solitaire survival game that can be played using regular playing cards and a few tokens or coins. This game mimics a classic CCG duel but pares it back to its most basic elements. You play as a sorcerer fighting for your life against a horde of deadly creatures, casting spells and summoning creatures of your own.

Creatures are made up of two cards: one for attack and one for defence. You bring your ally creatures to life by choosing which of the cards in your hand will be used for their attack and defence. Each of your creatures will be given a turn each round, which they use by attacking or blocking an enemy creature.

You and your virtual opponent take turns sending creatures into the arena, with enemies in one row and allies in another row underneath. The goal of your enemies is to kill you and anything that gets in their way. Your allies benefit from your spells and can combine some attacks and defences, as well as save certain turns for later use.
