But your enemies are relentless and have a greater range of attack and defence.

To win, you must play through the deck and defeat the entire horde of attacking enemies before your life is reduced to zero. You lose if you fail to achieve this objective for any reason.

AWARDS FROM 2019 SOLITAIRE PRINT & PLAY CONTEST:

1st place - Best Traditional Card, Tarot, or Decktet Game
2nd place - Best Push Your Luck/Survival
3rd place - Best Overall Game
3rd place - Best Rule Book


-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Schrödinger's Cat
description:
The year is 1935, and, taking a cue from Albert Einstein, Erwin Schrödinger has published a thought experiment known as “Schrödinger’s Cat.” A financial benefactor with an interest in physics and a lack of understanding of the term “thought experiment” has funded a special think tank to determine once and for all if the cat is in fact dead or alive. Regrettably, for those tasked with running the experiment, Schrödinger himself has snuck into the group and wishes nothing more than to sabotage the experiment as he believes the Benefactor has missed the entire point.

Schrödinger's Cat is a quick social deduction party game for 6-12 players. Game-play typically lasts 10-15 minutes. Player roles include a host, Lab Techs, Schrödinger himself, a Financial Benefactor and several Think Tank Physicists.

Roles are split into two teams, blue and red. On the blue team are the Financial Benefactor, the Honest Lab Tech and the Think Tank Physicists. Their goal is to determine weather the cat is dead or alive successfully. On the red team are Schrödinger and his Lab Tech. Their goal is to ruin the experiment.

The experiment is prepared by placing the two sided cat meeple into the experiment box (mint tin). One side shows the cat as dead, the other alive. The tin is passed and shaken by each player. The host reveals the status of the cat to the two lab techs. The host also introduces Schrödinger to his lab tech. The identities of Schrödinger and the lab techs are unknown to the other players.

Through stages of voting and deliberation the players determine if the cat is dead or alive. They also distribute influence to select a think tank chair. If think tank chair is on the blue team AND the think tank gets the state of the cat right, the blue team wins. If the red team tricks the think tank into voting wrong OR is selected as the think tank chair they ruin the experiment and win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Memory, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Rebirth – Learning The Ropes
description:
Training Scenario Card originally part of the DC Deck-Building Game: Rebirth Launch Kit.

This scenario is perfect for running demos with or teaching people how to play the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Upset Kakumei
description:
The climbing game Upset Kakumei, a derivative of daifugo, allows you switch the strength of cards.

At the start of a round, each player is dealt ten cards, each of which has two values. Cards may be played in sets of X-of-a-kind of increasing value (with X=1,2,3), or a 革命 — "kakumei" or revolution — card can be played to reverse the value of numbers; otherwise, a player may pass. The game ends when someone has played all of their cards. Alternatively, you can play multiple rounds and score players based on when they exit a round.

name: Teropaïpaï
description:
Teropaïpaï

The principle ?
You have just bought a small plot of land to support yourself and you need to create a vegetable garden.

You have one goal:
turn all your seeds into beautiful plants!
For this you will need to carefully select your seed cards: companionship, the association of plants is the key to your success!
The end goal is to score the most points by turning your seed cards into plant cards and by using as much natural resources as possible.
Be careful, however, nature is usually lenient, but it can be capricious, you will have to deal with the unexpected!
Without counting on your garden opponents, who will not miss an opportunity to put coal in the holes!

—description (translated) from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Lose a Turn, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Happy Cats
description:
You will need all your wits about you to come out on top in this game of competing cats.

Fluffy balls as far as the eye can see – a paradise for all cats! But make no mistake: none of them want to share. Each cat tries to grab as many of the fluffy balls as possible. But who will succeed with their clever card play?

The aim of the game is to collect as many fluffy balls as possible and end up with the most points – with some skillful card play.

The game ends when the last fluffy ball is taken.

The player with the highest total score wins.

name: Escape to Nowhere: Army Group South, December 1943-April 1944
description:
"Escape to Nowhere: Army Group South, December 1943- April 1944" uses 16-mile hexes and army and corps units-of-maneuver to cover the liberation of the Ukraine and the Crimea by the Red Army at that time.

Designed by Ty Bomba using the same alternating-actions system as the earlier game "Codeword Thunderclap: Army Group Don, November 1942 – March 1943".

Published in Command Magazine Japan #156. December 2020.

name: nickname
description:
Call by some NICKNAME and ask for a Item card. It's fun when you meet someone for the first time.
"nickname" was born out of the thoughts of middle school girl "Nanana Kudo".

[Rules]
Pick any player who seems to have the card you want and collect it by guessing.
This is a game where you collect four Item cards from the same nickname group.

Close to rules called Author, Quartet


When you ask for help, you call any your opposition under they's first name such as "Doctor", "Teacher", "Leader" and "C.E.O." which are written on a Item card that you want.

"DR. Albert, can I have a FLASK?"
"TEACHER John, give me a TEXTBOOK. Please."
"C.E.O. Steve, Can I borrow your LUXURY CAR?"

That's how each of you call each other in different ways during the game.
And the player with the most nickname groups wins.

name: The Best of Christmas Game
description:
Best of Christmas is the newest member of the LOGO board game family, featuring all your favourite picture, theme and pot luck cards.

Covering all the things we love about Christmas it even has the cutest Christmas tree that you decorate as you play the game.

It's a perfect bite-sized festive flash of fun to get you in the Christmas spirit.

HOW TO PLAY: You are testing your Christmas knowledge to climb up and decorate your side of the Christmas Tree. You’ll be asked questions which you’ll have to answer correctly in order to dress up the tree. The first team to decorate all the way to the top puts up the gold star and wins the game.

name: B-movie
description:
Hire the best Hollywood actors for your next horror movie. But the other directors will try to make you recruit nerds to keep the stars! B-Movie is an original bluff game, it’s not you who are bluffing others, but them who are trying to trick you!

There are 5 families of 8 actor cards with values ​​ranging from -4 to + 5. The players have two actor cards in hand, but only see their backs. They don't know his family or his worth. On your turn, you must propose an actor from your hand to the other players, who can accept or refuse to engage him.

If all players give the same answer (only YES or NO) he can give the card to any player. If both answers are present, he can only give the card to a player who answers yes. In all cases, he can keep the card to himself.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
publishers: Bad Taste Games, Boom Boom Games

name: SenbaZuru
description:
Senbazuru is an ancient Japanese legend that says that anyone who makes a thousand paper cranes will receive the favor of one crane. The thousand origami became a symbol of peace in Japan from the story of Sadako Sasaki (1943-1955).

In this exclusive strategy game for two players we will have to build origami and place them on the table, if we place them well, we will be able to keep the opponent's origami.

Each player, in turn order place one of the 4 tales from their hand, catching all the origami place in one diagonal line of the same color. then draws a new tile. The're some tiles with special effects alowing you to win more point or block some origami lines.

name: Quarantine King
description: The goal of Quarantine King is simple- become the Quarantine King by stashing up the most days worth of supplies before The Store (Draw Pile) runs out. This is done by stacking identical pairs of Supplies and looting Supply Stashes from opponents. Pandemonium ensues when attempting to loot Supply Stashes from opponents. Building your own Supply Stashes is smart, but it is strategic to loot your neighbors’ Supply Stashes. Identical Supplies and Wild Cards (Toilet Paper and Hand Sanitizer) give you the opportunity to loot! Additionally, Action Cards can give you an advantage over your opponents and increase your chances of becoming the Quarantine King.

name: Flex NBA
description:
FLEX doesn't change the game - FLEX is the game!

Flex NBA is the very first Battle Tile and Augmented Reality (AR) board game that fuses professional sports with the latest in augmented reality technology. Created in partnership with the NBA and NBPA, FLEX NBA lets fans play as their favorite NBA players, using their FLEX 'superpowers' to take down opponents!

The game comes with 10 NBA player tiles, from which each of the 2 players drafts a team of 5 tiles. Players also have the option to purchase expansion sets that include additional NBA player tiles so that they can build their collections. Players don't need to watch actual NBA games in order to play the game. The game mechanic itself is similar to many other TCG's out there (although because of our NBA license we can't call ourselves a TCG - hence why we refer to ourselves as a BTG - battle tile game).

Once players have assembled their lineups, they then take turns rolling the play action die and taking actions based upon the results of the roll. There are additional status FX tiles that enhance the player's move set and give them various competitive advantages. With many of the moves that a player makes (aka Flexes), they will whittle down the other player's confidence points (health) until the opponent's team is depleted of CP.

The mobile companion app integration serves 2 primary purposes - 1) it is necessary to view the player tiles' AR animations, and 2) it is necessary if players wish to register the unique bar codes on their player tiles to our database and thereby claim ownership (per our NBA license, we cannot use the words NFT or blockchain, but that's what it actually is).
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Ownership, Real-Time

name: Valdés
description:
Valdés is an animal watching game, a card game for kids.

Each turn, a player will play 2 of their 3 cards on each animal postcard, and if there are 4 cards of the same animal, they earn a postcard of that animal. First player to get to 5 different animal postcards, wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Barnyard
description:
Barnyard is an 18-card drafting game designed specifically for 2 players in which you will compete to corral the best combination of farm animals that you can. Manage an ever-shifting barnyard of animal cards and carefully wrangle the animals you want into your corral to score the most points and win the game!

On your turn, you'll choose an animal in the farm and use its power to manipulate the animals in the Barnyard line. Then, you'll flip that animal over and add it to the back of the line.

Next, you'll take whatever animal is currently at the front of the Barnyard line and add it to your corral.

Be careful! Some critters get along better than others, so you’ll have to carefully plan the layout of your corral if you want to score the most points and win the game.

Want to ramp up the complexity? Every copy of Barnyard comes with the free 6-card Farmers Expansion. Work towards your own secret corral objective to score even more points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Factory 42: Kickstarter Promo Deck
description: The Kickstarter promo cards. Add three new event cards to the Factory 42 game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Ogre Sandwich
description:
Take the perfect ingredients and make the tallest sandwich. Gain points for sets of Toppings, Critters, and the tallest sandwich. The Chef with the most points wins. Careful: you will lose points for ingredients that fall off the sandwich.

You are an Ogre Chef, and you must compete against other Ogre Chefs to impress the Ogre King with your culinary skill. Gather ingredients and Stack them on your sandwich to create the most delectable meal in the swamp. At the end, carefully present your sandwich to the Ogre King. The Ogre King demands a perfect sandwich and he’ll only eat the most delectable offering…May the best Ogre Chef Win.

What Players Do: Roll two dice, the first dice is a mandatory action that involves taking an ingredient of the indicated type from the supply and putting it on your sandwich. The second dice roll is an optional bonus action that will let you grab additional ingredients, place additional ingredients, steal ingredients or force another chef to remove an ingredient from their sandwich.

Game Mechanics: The placement of the ingredients has a few rules. Chefs may only use two fingers when placing an ingredient on their sandwich. Critters must be placed standing up. Lettuce and Cheese must be placed over the top of the critters on your sandwich when you place it. Once you have placed a cheese or lettuce, you must place all future critters on top of the top layer of your sandwich, no tucking critters underneath.

If a critter falls over, you may pick it up one time and attempt to place it again. If you knock anything else over or off of your sandwich during this second attempt, follow the rules for a knocked over or knocked off ingredient.

If a critter is knocked over but remains on the sandwich, it does not count towards your set of critters at the end, but it is still worth 1 point.

If a critter or ingredient is knocked off the sandwich, meaning it touches the table in any way, remove it and any ingredients on top of it from your sandwich. Those ingredients are removed from the game.

The game comes with two modes: Standard Play: Ages 8+ and Basic Play: 5+.

-description from publisher's website

name: Escape Room: In der Hand des Entführers
description:
The original Escape Crime Game in the practical card box

The daughter of a very rich industrialist was kidnapped - ransom demand: one and a half million euros! The criminal police put YOU on it, their special officer for tricky cases. You set about investigating, but are knocked out from behind at the point where the ransom is handed over. When you wake up, you find yourself chained in the basement of an abandoned office building with no food or the slightest clue as to what is in store for you. Can you break free, track down the missing girl and escape the kidnappers' hideout alive?

name: Ernest et Célestine
description:
Help Ernest and Celestine to sneak into the town to find themselves back.

Trace a symbol on one of your partner back.
If they guess right , Ernest and Celestine get closer!
But if they are wrong , the cop may block the possibility for our two friend to find each other again.

It's a simple kids/family oriented cooperative game, in the universe created by the book of Gabrielle Vincent.

name: Give 5!
description: Give 5 is a board quiz in which players will have to guess the most popular answers to various interesting and sometimes strange questions. Players place bets, play various bonus cards and receive coins for correct answers to a question. The game is easy to learn, extremely gambling and exciting, perfect for playing with children. It can be played by a large company, divided into teams, you can play alone or one-on-one according to special rules.

name: Adventure Games: Books – Die Akademie der Zeitenwächter
description:
The first book to the successful Adventure Games.
One book, several possible outcomes and over 100 different decision possibilities.

—user summary

An exciting event is coming up for Drake: his final exam at the venerable Raven Academy. If he passes, he will finally be appointed a Time Keeper.
But mysterious events prevent Drake's graduation and ensure that he finds himself in a seemingly hopeless situation. Trapped in a strange time and pursued by a dark creature, he must quickly find a way out.
In order for him to succeed, he urgently needs your help!

The interactive reading experience based on the successful game series. A thrilling story with exciting twists and turns that you can influence.
Investigate the game locations, find and combine objects and solve puzzles.
Use the over 100 decision options to determine the outcome of the story.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Snarkas
description:
Battle to collect cards and win gems in this interstellar and highly competitive card game. The first player to earn 50 gems wins.

In Snarkas, each player receives a hand of cards, and 4 cards are dealt onto the table. On each player's turn, one card is played. That card is either added to the table, or used to collect cards from the table through matching or adding.

The game includes cards numbered 1-10, along with 2 different robot characters (Asters and Jolts), and ZAP cards that clear the entire table. Some cards have gems on them, which will add to a player's point total.

If any player is able to clear the table with any card other than a ZAP, they yell "SNARKAS!" and earn the shiny Snarkas gem worth 10 gems!
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Matching, Trick-taking

name: Blackhorse
description:
Summer 1989: The Iron Curtain is not coming down. Tensions are high. Will war return to Europe?.... Blackhorse is a grand tactical game of furious mechanized command in the summer of 1989. Units are companies and platoons... Hexes are 1000 meters across. Turns are three hours each, using an innovative system emphasizing friction and the importance of command and control. Blackhorse puts the player in the shoes of the commanding generals of the Soviet 79th Guards Tank Division and an array of U.S. units drawn from the 11th Armored Cavalry Regiment and the 3rd Armored Division. The Cold War has become damn hot. Will you be up to the task of winning this small piece of it?

—description from the publisher

name: Mycélium
description:
"Mycelium is a resource necessary to mushroom life, but it is becoming increasingly scarce. The little creatures will fight to take over the last Mycelium stocks."

In Mycélium, players are trying to get the most points by capturing opposing mushrooms. The game contains 60 Mushroom cards numbered from 1 to 10, in 6 different colors. In the beginning 9 cards are laid in a 3x3 grid and the remaining cards are split evenly in three stacks.

On their turn, players choose a mushroom card to attack an orthogonaly adjacent mushroom card. In order to attack, you need a higher value than the defending mushroom card, with the exception of the 1 being able to attack the 10. The attacking card is placed face up in front of the player, and the attacked card goes face down to the player's score pile. Throughout the game, each player will only be allowed to attack with three different colors of cards.

The game ends when a player cannot make a legal move or after a given number of round. Whoever collected the most points (summing up their scored cards) wins the game.

A solo mode is also available.
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Pieces as Map, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Magic: The Gathering – Murders at Karlov Manor
description: A series of shocking murders involving some of Ravnica’s most powerful citizens has the city on the verge of chaos. Now detectives are on the case . . . and you’re one of them. Return to the fan-favorite plane of Ravnica in Murders at Karlov Manor, Magic’s unique take on the murder mystery genre.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination

name: Lazy Bellboys
description:
Two bellboys who want to be lazy try to carry as little luggage as possible. But be careful! Customers who have not brought any luggage with them will be asked to remove all of their luggage at check-out. Manage the luggage while listening to the customer's complexion.

Lazy Bellboys is a trick-taking game for two players. You will be in charge of managing the luggage of three groups of guests (families, celebrities and hitmen) staying for 7 nights and 8 days. Although we struggled with the unpredictable amount of luggage, we managed to get it into the cabin. At checkout on the 8th day, which was very troublesome, we had to carry out a large amount of luggage.
publishers: 卸売センターサンエイ (Oroshiuri Sentaa San'ei)

name: War of the Networks
description:
Game of television network battles for ratings. Each player plays one of four semi-fictional TV networks (ABZ, NBZ, ZBS, IND), and the goal is to have the most money when the game ends, after three rounds.

Players move pawns around a standard square-track board, with spaces that trigger various events: drawing an event (Flash) card, buying a TV show or star, etc. Stars are assigned to shows, shows are assigned to time slots. Shows may be bumped to the next night to accommodate a new show just purchased. Each player goes around the board once, populating his Friday night schedule. Once all players have completed the round, each 30 min slot awards money to the top-rated network, with ex-aequos splitting the money. The process is repeated for Saturday and Sunday. When going around the board again, visiting an owned show space forces a payout to the owner. Finally, the Sunday round is followed by an additional weekend scoring, where the ratings across all three nights are summed and compared. The richest network wins.

Note that when one rolls doubles, one either moves ahead the full die score, or one goes backward by the single die score. This adds strategy.

The game was later republished by Avalon Hill as TV Wars (q.v.), but the latter's rules are considerably different.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Viceroy: Balance of power Promo Card
description: A Viceroy character card that was given out to backers of Mayday's Garbage Day Kickstarter campaign. It is the same as the "Viceroy" character card from Viceroy: Promo Cards, but includes dots that makes it playable in Garbage Day too.

name: Rock 'n Roll
description:
Tie the bandana, put on the sunglasses, shrug on the leather jacket, grab your "axe".........and the dice.

Rock 'n Roll is a free print and play dice game in which players compete to become the biggest rock band and make the greatest albums.

Playable solo or multiplayer, players roll dice over an in-game four year period to practice as a band, go out partying to get fans, get famous in the news, hit the studio to release the next big album, tour the country or just earn some cold, hard cash.

Taking on concepts of Yahtzee and push your luck games, Rock 'n Roll gives hard decisions, direct competition and a rockin' theme. Will you be the next big thing or yet another failed garage band?

name: Master of the Amulets
description:
Master of the Amulets was MicroQuest #7 in the Metagaming MicroQuests series, programmed adventures for Melee and Wizard.

Expands:

Wizard
Melee
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Minimap Resolution, Role Playing, Simulation

name: La sombra del aguila
description:
La sombra del Aguila (Shadow of the Eagle) rules are a consolidation of the game system that appeared in Alea Magazine issue 16. With a basic rules and advanced rules.

It includes three scenarios:

Alcañiz 1809,
Maria 1809
Castalla 1813.

name: Frantic Frogs
description:
This is a reaction game were each player has a number of frog cards showing how many frogs are trying to eat insects in your group.

At the start of each turn, a player rolls the fly die, showing the number of insects for the round, and then each player tries to find a match and be the fastest to grab the colored frogs. However, speed is essential, as the other players may get there before you!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Napgammon
description:
"Napgammon" is a light weight wargame of luck and maneuver. It takes the core roll-and-move mechanism of Backgammon and applies it to a two-dimensional point-to-point map with differentiated terrain and movement costs. As in Backgammon, players roll two dice at the start of their turn and make one move for each die. Rolling doubles allows four moves, but also enables multiple divisions that begin the turn stacked together to move as one, potentially achieving superior combat odds and an advantageous column shift. Combat is resolved using an odds-based, but completely deterministic, CRT, and losses are permanent. A pool of reinforcements can be brought in from your Capitol city. The game is won by either completely surrounding your opponent's Capitol, or by Eliminating sufficient enemy units that you outnumber them two-to-one.

This is the second of Hollandspiele's annual holiday mini-games, the first of which (Christmas at White Mountain) gave birth to the successful Table Battles. It will be packed in, free of charge, with any order placed during the 2017 holiday sale containing at least two games. After the sale, it will be made available for purchase as a downloadable PNP game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jet Billiards
description:
Jet Billiards is a beautifully crafted dexterity game. The game comes with a wooden framed octagonal board with a cork surface, four round goals, and four score keepers (similar to an abacus). The components include four squeeze bulb cue sticks, four Styrofoam balls (in four colors), one cork ball, and two wooden disks.

The object of the game is to be the first to score ten points. Points are scored by using the squeeze bulb to shoot the cork ball at your Styrofoam ball in an attempt to get your ball into your opponents' goal. The wooden disks are used to close off goals when there are less than four players.

This is a very unique, fun, and beautiful game that's long out of print and needs to be seen to be appreciated.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ogla-Razik Kazon Expansion Pack
description:
The Ogla-Razik is a Predator class Kazon carrier ship commanded by First Maje Jal Razik. This type of vessel is often used as a warship by the Kazon and though it is not very maneuverable at lower speeds, it is heavily armed.
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Ogla-Razik Kazon Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 12 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Grit & Gold
description:
Grit & Gold is a lone player's mine crawling, tile laying, old west adventure.

You play a desperate prospector facing off against a horde of bandits - searching their goldmine hideout, relieving it of gold, and potentially escaping with your life.

A tile laying and movement puzzle game with a bunch of luck and dice chucking mixed in.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Terraformer
description:
Construct ecosystems, animate planets

In this card game your spacecraft, equipped with terraforming machinery, has entered orbit around a distant, lifeless planet. Before you can colonize, you must first make the environment suitable for humans. Each player's spaceship is an ark with a collection of unique plants, animals, and microorganisms capable of populating entire ecosystems. Together, players will fill the oceans and continents with life, construct food chains, cause and fight natural disasters, help their fosterlings adapt and survive in strange conditions. In the end the one terraformer whose creatures prove the most resilient and prolific throughout the new world, overcoming the competition, receives the honor of naming this human-made paradise.

—desciption from the back of the box

name: Not Not
description:
Not Not is the multiplayer adaptation of the eponymous video game by Alt Shift, a speed game combining orientation, logic and reflexes, based on two cognitive biases: multiple negations, as well as incongruent words (colors are written in another color than the one they designate).

It's up to you to filter out this irrelevant information that slows down your reaction time in order to tap as quickly as possible on one of the cards that meets the criteria generated by the dice and thus win it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Four Senses
description:
Slip on an eye-mask or play with your eyes closed.
Take turns placing differently-shaped wooden pieces on the game board.
Forget about trying to see and use your memory to imagine what you are touching with your fingertips!

Be the first player to achieve one of three winning conditions:

line up 4 identical pieces in a row
line up 4 different pieces on the same level
or create 3 rising steps – 1-2-3.


Four Senses is a three-dimensional game for 2 or 3 players, especially suitable for any player with restricted sight.
Equally challenging and fun regardless of vision limitations, this highly tactile game with wooden pieces is based on touch and does not rely on artificial sound effects.
Whether you and your friends are sighted or sight-impaired this game provides a fun evening of strategy, gaming and fun conversation.

—description from the publisher

name: Stonez
description:
Abstract game wherein players are to place five tiles in a row. Tiles are drawn randomly from the bag.

On a turn, a player may --

Draw a tile from a bag, with the player's color face-up.

Rotate a tile.

Remove one of your own tiles from the board, and any single tiles created from this action are removed.

Change the color of a tile, provided the player has power over it.

Place a protector marker over a tile.

name: Madcap Marathon
description: In MadCap Marathon, players each have a different obstacle course and race their balls to the center. Players weave, shoot, and bounce their balls through mazes and other bumpy obstacles to be the one with the most balls in the goal before time runs out.

name: Defenders of the Realm: Battlefields – Greenleaf Village and Fire River
description:
2 new battlefields for the Defenders of The Realm: Battlefields stand alone game

Not part of the retail edition, and first released as a promo for Kickstarter supporters.

name: X-Men Deck the Mutants Card Game
description:
A fast-paced and fun card game for fans of the X-Men superhero comic books. The players are all mutant "heroes" trying to capture "Evil Mutants" to score points and win the game.

Dice with special stickers are rolled each turn to determine what actions a player must take. These include drawing cards, swapping cards, and even a little bit of "go fish."

Then the player captures one of the Evil Mutants in play with groups of cards from his hand.

In addition to the cards and dice, a scoring track is provided with plastic markers for the players to keep track.

This is one of a series of X-Men related games designed by Richard Borg for Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Rebel Yell!
description:
Rebel Yell is a simulation of American Civil War small-unit tactics. The playing pieces in the game represent companies of infantry and cavalry or sections of artillery Each infantry and cavalry unit has one strength point and is equivalent to between 45 and 100 men, depending upon the scenario. Each artillery unit has two strength points and equals two guns. The players of Rebel Yell assume the roles of divisional commanders.

Each game turn is broken down into segments. During an action segment, the units of a particular player may conduct a single action. In the beginning modules these actions are: Move, Fire, Assault, and Rally. During any Small Arms segment, the units of a particular player may only fire.

There are no movement phases, fire phases, etc., as there are in other Civil War games. This absence, in addition to the fact that player segments are structured reciprocally, produces a feel of simultaneity uncommon to other designs.

One of the most difficult problems faced by the Civil War tactician was the “problem of approach,”—in other words, how he should maneuver his unit to some objective while keeping his casualties and disorganization at a minimum. A commander who did not pay heed to the destructiveness of “modern” weaponry would find his formation damaged up to three hundred yards from the enemy. Rebel Yell addresses this problem. Within restrictions, defending units may fire at the enemy as he advances. Like a real-life commander, a player can no longer be certain that when he initiates an advance, his units will reach their objective. Players may find that even one or two companies Standing to Fire will be difficult to dislodge by frontal assault.

Although Rebel Yell is a complex design, it is not out of the reach of the novice gamer. The rules are programmed, allowing small portions to be digested first and getting players into the game quickly. Provisions are made for such factors as infantry line formations (Standing to Maneuver, Standing to Fire, Skirmishers, and Cover), volley effects, leader quality, morale, and regimental flags. The rules for cavalry and artillery are also extensive.

Once players have learned all the rules (or even before), they can design their own scenarios. The game includes six geomorphic maps. Because the maps can be aligned in a variety of ways, the players can recreate a “microscopic” examination of virtually any Civil War engagement.

Although an excellent multi-player game, Rebel Yell accommodates the solitaire player, Likewise it can be played in a physically limited area. Rebel Yell is “big’ only in the sense that it is detailed.
publishers: (Self-Published), Game Publications Group, One Small Step

name: Topitop
description:
From the Blue Orange Games website:

Building Sand Castles has Never Been So Exciting! You will be given two buckets and a few sand piles. Taking turns, you will move sand piles or your buckets to build sand castles. But watch out! Protect your castle because your opponent may use it to build his own. The first player to complete two sand castles wins. A strategy-packed game that will challenge all ages.

name: Penguin Plunge
description: From the publisher: Stack'em Splash'em Bring'em home! The winter thaw is finally here and the penguins are ready to play! They want to swim and slide, dunk and dive...and especially PLUNGE down the ice tower. But YOU want to collect 'em in 1,2,3 order and race back to your igloo. You'll need to think ahead and use some clever moves to stack'em, and bring 'em home.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Math, Racing
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Fisher Price, Mattel, Inc., Playchest Games

name: Pictionary: Special Montgomery Ward Edition
description: This small sized edition of Pictionary plays similar to the original, but the drawing is not timed as there is no timer included. As wit traditional Picionary, players are drawing a picture based on a word from a card and trying to get their team-mates to guess the word in order to score points or advance.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Co-Co Pio
description:
Co co pio is a card game in which the aim is to be the first to get your hens to have three chicks.
Each player must play thir cards:
- to protect their farm with the dog or the incubator
- make it grow with eggs or chicks
- or to pester your opponents' farms with magpies, foxes, worms, cats, ...

name: Hero is an ATM
description:
Hero is an ATM is a 3~5 small game.
In this game, every player will be a greedy priest, who only want to earn money. We can create monster to fight hero and take their money, treatment hero and ask for reward, or sell useless products to hero.
After 6 rounds, who get the most money will win the game.

—user summary

name: Cholas
description:
You are a sculptor who must prove to be the best.

After his recent victory in the war against the Pandyas, their arch rival, the Chola King decides to build a temple tower as a mark of his victory. The King, whose dynasty built thousands of temples in South India, invites sculptors from across his empire to help build the temple tower. Each sculptor is expected to bring stones from their region to build the temple together with other sculptors. The sculptors are expected to use all stones available to build. The King also sets the reward objectives for every stone and sculpture placed on the temple tower.

The sculptor can gain rewards incrementally when placing stones of other sculptors on the temple structure. When placing their own stones, the sculptor does get any reward points. But the sculptor does get points for pattern(s) created on the temple structure using their stone. Hence the objective for the sculptors would be to focus on building the temple structure with as many stones possible and creating patterns using their stone. It is important for the sculptor to ensure patterns are not created with stones of other sculptors.

The game ends when the temple tower is completely built with stones and sculptures or when a sculptor is unable to perform any of the possible actions. The sculptor with most reward points is declared as the winner or the best.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Secret Santa
description:
Tonight is Secret Santa night!

The players will come with their own secret presents and try to finish the night with the best presents brought by their opponents (and the "Unknown Visitor" in the 2 and 3 player games).

You will need your deduction but also your bluffing skills to win this game! Will you be able to gather the presents that give you the most points or will you have plenty of tea bags? In the latter scenario, do not forget your tea pot! It might be useful...

name: Not It!
description:
In Not It! you join the fun in a magical land as Knights, Princesses, Unicorns, Wizards, Dragons, and Ogres play together in the castle yard.

When the King rolls the 3 dice out of the castle door you must find a card in your hand that does not match any of the dice and then shout "Not it!" Spot the card that does NOT match, do it fast, and don't be last! If you get rid of all of your cards first you win!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Best Friend S
description:
Best Friend S is a party game.

Guess my favorite travel destination!
Ask a question to the other players.
As an answerer, come up with something that will please the giver.
Show that you "care" and understand the giver to win the place of BEST FRIEND!

100 question cards included.
For example, "Guess my best answer for what I'd want to do on my last day on earth", or "Guess my best answer for what I was in my previous life".

Including new infinitely-rewritable "Pixel slates" & Special pens, so players do not have to prepare writing materials.

name: Lost Idols
description:
Hello and welcome to Lost Idols! In this fast-paced collecting card game, you are one of several hunters looking for the Lost Idols of Tiki Island. The first person to collect all six wins. Good luck and happy hunting!

Each player starts with the same six-card hand. One each of numbers 1-6. The remaining cards, including the Wild Card, are shuffled and placed face down as the draw deck.

At the beginning of each round, each player chooses a card to play. When a player has chosen, they will place that card face down in front of them to show the other players they are ready. Once all players have chosen a card to play, each player flips their card over to reveal what they have chosen. Highest card wins the round. When players reveal their hand, the winner keeps their card face up in front of them. The remaining cards go into the discard pile. At the end of each round, all players draw another card from the draw pile so everyone has six cards in their hands at the beginning of each round. When there are no more available cards in the draw pile, reshuffle the discard pile and use as the new draw pile.

Sound easy? Not so fast!

There are some special rules when playing the game.


Number 1 card always beats a Number 6.
A number 3 card gives you the ability to choose to keep your number 3 card or trade for your opponents 1 or 2 card.
Wild card always wins the round and can be played as any number of players choosing.
If two or more players play the same number card, they cancel each other out. If there are only 2 players, neither player wins and the next round is played.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Kinesis
description:
Be the first to get one of your pieces across the board. Pieces move only one space on the board but can slide great distances on top of "sticks". Use chains of sticks to quickly advance your stones. But careful...the chains can also be used by your opponent.

1992 Mensa Select
publishers: Cherry Street Games, Word Origin, Inc.

name: The Boer War
description:
A strategic-level game on the Anglo-Boer War of 1899-1902.

One turn = one month
One hex = 15 miles
One strength point = 500 men (British), 333 men (Boers)

Components: one standard-size game map, one sheet of counters, and a rule book.

Scenarios include the Traditional War, the Guerrilla War, and the Campaign Game.

The game was included with the 3W game The Defense of Rorke's Drift, but is a completely separate game.

ONE MUST OBTAIN THE DEFENSE OF RORKE'S DRIFT GAME IN ORDER TO GET THIS GAME.

name: Susi Spinne
description:
From the publisher:

Early in the morning, Susie the Spider proudly sits in her large web watching her little spider children, who are busily gathering dewdrops. A great time they're having, as they hop around the web, push each other along its threads, or quickly move a bit towards their mother. A thrilling, tactical dice game!

name: Sator
description:
Sator the first game from a pentalogy of abstract games based in the Latin magic square.





S

A

T

O

R



A

R

E

P

O



T

E

N

E

T



O

P

E

R

A



R

O

T

A

S




The game can be downloaded from the author web page in catalan and french:

http://www.comascoma.com

name: MonstroCity: Rampage Expansion
description:
The MonstroCity Rampage Expansion introduce 6 new exciting Monsters, new reinforcement cards and a new challenging way of playing the game, the Scenarios.

The expansion has 4 Different Scenarios:
-Retrieve Monster DNA
-Mystery Formula
-Rescue Maddie Newton
-Dr Spotnik Demise.

Each scenario has different goal, different setup, extra rules that affect gameplay and new victory conditions.

Each game session takes 20 to 30 minutes, depending on the number of players.

-description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Total Depth
description:
Subtitled "An Oil Man's Game", this game for would-be oil well operators Ages 12 and up was produced in Dallas, Texas.

As in Monopoly, players roll dice to move around the outside board edge. Other similarities include an extra turn when doubles are rolled, two decks of cards ("Production" and "Exploration"), income tax, income upon passing the start space and even incorporation of the unofficial "Free Parking" variant, here called the Slush Fund.

Different is an interior board path and an elevated 6x6 drilling board. Landing on an outer board space usually offers the chance to lease a plot on the drilling board if not already leased. Travel on the interior board, possible only by landing exactly on its entrance or possession of a plastic permit token (obtained by landing on other spaces), permits drilling once one has a drilling company. This is very much a costly hit-and-miss affair, especially when drilling without any other proven oil fields nearby.

If the player does not go bankrupt, eventually his plots should be populated with a lot of black plastic pegs indicating gushers rather than the yellow ones which signify dry holes. Then each time a player passes the start, he is paid based on the number of barrels he is pumping.

Unlike Monopoly, the idea is not to drive others into bankruptcy, but to be the first to reach one million dollars. While there is a good atmosphere of real drilling situations, there is also much chaos in the dice, cards and spinner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Dungeonrunner
description:
Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dunger Derby the Board Game
description:
Dungers are smelly, short sighted, hairy, violent beasts lacking intelligence. What to do with them? RACE THEM! Up to 5 players can grab their Dungers and race through checkpoints to be the first to cross the finish line. However Dungers have trouble listening and are as likely to run into a wall or the the completely wrong direction as they are to head where you want (oh and did we mention the traps on the track?)

Each turn a player indicates the direction he hopes his Dunger will run. Dice are rolled to see if he is listening. If he is not listening you roll to see what direction he is going to run. Then dice are rolled to see how far your Dunger runs that turn. Running into walls and boulders knocks your Dunger out but knocks some sense into them letting you control their movement better when they wake up. Running into another players's Dunger results in a fight with the winner getting to decide the direction the loser's Dunger runs for his next turn.

Dunger Derby the Board Game has easy to learn rules is meant to be played in 45 minutes or less for a great family game night. We have test gamed the game with several 6 year olds (with the parents helping them play) and we've had them have a lot of funs watching the pigs run, knock themselves out or get into fights. As a result we've rated Dunger Derby the Board Game for ages 6 and up based on our testing.

name: Exile Sun: Race for the Gate Expansion
description: This planned expansion for the "Exile Sun" game adds new map tiles and special agenda cards that directly feature the Colonies race to discover ancient relics of the Outbound Gateway. Only by reconstructing a few original components can the original link to Earth be reestablished. Players now may pursue the discovery of these relics to gain leverage in their grasp for power!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Gorilla
description: A card game similar in many ways to Uno. There are four suits and different animals of each suit. Players attempt to get rid of their cards by matching the animal or the suit. Special cards can cause other players to pick up cards or miss a turn or even reverse the order of play. First player to lose all his cards is the winner.

name: The Siege of Leningrad
description:
This game depicts the efforts of Army Group North from 1941 to 1944.

The area encompassed by the Map sheet covers the Baltic coast up to Leningrad & past-including part of Lake Ladoga, North to past Tikhvin, over to past Demyansk, & South to past Ostrov & Tartu.

The RULES have Special provisions for: Railroads; Engineers (Soviets ONLY); Weather effects (WINTER:Frozen Lakes/Rivers hexes); Airpower (German Airstrikes ONLY); Artillery (Ranged-Soviets ONLY); Supply Units (Germans ONLY) & Supplying Leningrad.

There are 5 scenarios:

Breakthrough on the Luga Front - 8 Turns 1 - July~17 Sept.,1941
Battle in Northern Russia - 9 Turns - 18 Sept.~5 Dec.,1941
The Seige of Demyansk - 10 Turns - 12 Jan.~22 April,1942
The 2nd Battle of Lake Ladoga - 8 Turns - 28 Nov.,1942~26 Feb., 1943
The Destruction of Army Group North - 12 Turns - 29 Nov.,1943~27 March, 1944


Sequence of play is as follows: Germans begin first, 1.Reinforcement Phase; 2.Supply Determination Phase; 3.Movement Phase; 4.Combat Supply Determination Phase; 5.Combat Phase; 6.Mechanized Movement Phase; followed by the Soviet Player performing these same phases. NOTE: in some of the later scenarios, the Germans "skip" their entire FIRST turn, thereby allowing the Soviets to start the game.

There are many details on the map including the German Demyansk Pocket. Leningrad forts are represented. Supply level is recorded as units in the city have to trace supply to it.

The game scale given is: 10.5 Km across a hex, Regiment/Division/Corps level but NO Historical designations, for Units, and each turn equals 10 Days.

Published as a magazine game in JagdPanther #13 (Apr 1976) and has now been re-released in PDF format by Amarillo Design Bureau.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., JagdPanther Publications, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Kooky Carnival
description:
Nine skill and luck games are assembled to recreate the experience of a carnival midway in a board game. There are two versions of box art for this game but the contents for both games are the same.

The nine stunts that players must perform to earn money.
1. Flip Flop - flip the egg and catch it in the pan without dropping it.
2. Big Mouth - use the big disc to snap the small disc into the open mouth of the tiger.
3. Movin' Mouse - tip the cheese and guide the mouse out the front hole.
4. Sock 'Em - pull back elastic with shooter and knock the pins down.
5. Loose Juice - pour the marble from large glass into small without touching them together.
6. Spinneroo - spin the top - go under the bridge and guide into the hole.
7. Shell Game - guess which pylon the pill is under.
8. Shuffleboard - snap the disc into the best spot to score high.
9. Wheel of Fortune - pick a number and bet some money on it.

name: Baffle Box
description:
The game contains a plastic board with 6x6 holes in it, 36 marbles, 6 colored pegs and 6 white pegs.

Players try to get rid of their marbles by placing them in the holes in the board. If a player thinks that a row is full of marbles he can challenge the move. The winner of the challenge gets rid of one of his marbles.

When a player has no marbles remaining the round ends.
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Four in a Row 3D
description: Four in a Row 3D! is a great two player game where both players try to make four in a row with their rings (one color for each of them). The first one to get four identical color beads in a row wins. This game is the same as the classic four in a row game except this time it is back in a new 3D form, 4x4x4 grid to add a new edge to the game. There is also an 5x5x5 version (see picture).
publishers: Monkey Pod Games, Taş Devrı Oyuncak

name: Aero
description:
Aero is an abstract strategy game designed by Gustavo Nascimento. Below, in Portuguese, an excerpt from the back cover of the game:

"AERO is the first release on Hydra Games, and it's already a classic: an abstract strategy game for two players, with complete information, good momentum and no element of chance.
The components are high quality and resistance with PVC rings and chips.
The game has huge replayability because the initial position of the initial transparent rings can change every round, providing very different matches."

In Portuguese:

"AERO é o primeiro lançamento da Hidra Games, e já nasce um verdadeiro clássico: um jogo de estratégia abstrata para dois jogadores, com informação completa, boa dinâmica e nenhum elemento de sorte.
Os componentes são de alta qualidade e resistência, com argolas e fichas de PVC.
O jogo possui imensa rejogabilidade, pois a posição inicial das argolas transparentes iniciais pode mudar a cada rodada, proporcionando partidas extremamente diferentes."



THE GAMEIn a 6x6 board, 2 players alternate turns putting rings and chips (inside the rings) in the spaces. The winner is the first player to use all of his chips or all of his rings.

Anytime a player gets to form a row (orthogonally or diagonally) with 4 rings or 4 chips, he is allowed to put a new chip on the board.

A player can put a chip over an opponent's chip, but be aware: the third chip played in a single stack is the last one, and it allows the player to change the color of the ring - blue player can take a red ring from the board and put a blue ring in the same space if he got to play a blue chip as a third one in that stack.

There are also 4 white neutral rings in the start of the game, used to give even more replayability.

name: Whitewater: Cranky Beavers
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion was included as a convention and retail give-away on a tile sheet titled: Game Variants & Mini Expansions Set #1.

This expansion adds a movable obstacle into play, the Cranky Beaver, and gives options for a Sudden Death Ending and a Rough Rapids variant.

name: Paper Pinball: Sherwood 2146
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

Sherwood 2146 is one of three Paper Pinball titles available, together with Laser Sisters and Wolf Hackers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Forks: Mini-Expansion
description:
Contents:
3 Ability Cards
5 Scenario Cards
1 Company Card

Adding Cards to the Base Game:
The ability cards can be added to those in the base game. The scenario cards and company card are only used when playing the scenarios of the mini-campaign.

About the Scenario:
The scenario describes events that happen over the course of five games of Forks. During the scenario, players must choose what happens, which will introduce new rules and situations to the game. The scenarios can be played multiple times with the same players, as different choices will lead the game down different paths. For your first game playing the scenario, we advise you to play without the Merge/Swap card or abilities.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Sunlight
description:
Step into the world of Sunlight, a roll and write game that will transport you to the arid desert where cacti thrive. This game is perfect for players who love strategy and are looking for a fun and engaging way to spend an afternoon or evening. With a cactus theme, players will get to embrace the beauty of the desert and collect points by strategically placing their cacti on the grid.

The objective of the game is simple: collect as many points as possible by placing your cacti in the best position on the grid. Each turn, players will roll a set of dice that will determine the type and the location of their cacti. They must then decide where to place their cacti on the grid, taking into account the placement of other cacti and the scoring opportunities available. As the game progresses, the sun will move across the sky, casting its light on different sections of the grid. Only cacti that are in the sunlight will earn points at the end of the round, adding an extra layer of strategy to the game.

For players who prefer to play on their own, Sunlight also features a solo mode where you can play against an AI opponent, Nyx. In this mode, players will still roll the dice and place their cacti on the grid, but their decisions will also impact the AI's score. The AI will make its own decisions based on the player's moves. With its solo mode, Sunlight is the perfect game for players who want to test their skills and strategy against a challenging opponent, even when they are by themself.

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Environmental, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Cannonades
description:
Each player is the captain of a fleet of pirate ships, and their goal is to sink all of the opponents’ ships – shooting cannonades, of course – and remain the only pirate still afloat. During your turn you can add ships to your fleet or try sinking those of your friends by shooting cannonballs at them. Simple? Yes! The game is explained in 30 seconds but finding and developing a strategy to have the upper hand might not be so easy!

—description from the designer

name: Charoodles
description:
From the manufacturer:

"Charoodles - the nonstop, fun props charades game!

"Can you act like a jellyfish using a foam square as a prop?

"Charoodles (sha-roo-dles) is an exciting new way to play charades using props. Players divide into teams and take turns acting out the items listed on one of the category cards. But there's a twist! Players MUST use props (a tube, a cup, a ball, and a square) to help them give clues. A 90-second timer makes the game fast paced and often downright hilarious."

name: Dragons: The Classic Game
description: Played on a 5x5 square board, this Canadian game is subtitled "The Classic Game", presumably because it is an orientally themed uber-variant of Tic Tac Toe. Each of the 3x3 corner quadrants of board represent the different seasons, and the goal of the game is to get a row of three stacks of counters placed in one of the seasons. Players alternate placement of counters on empty squares until such time as somebody gets three in a row in a season (or overlapping seasons). When a row is formed, all single pieces in the involved seasons are removed, and the player's removed pieces are stacked onto the last played piece of his color. One goal should always be to minimize stack sizes, because when you run out of pieces to play, you have to use up a turn reclaiming a non-critical stack from the board. The first stack a player forms will of necessity be at least three high, but subsequent stacks can be held to two piece height due to the fact that stacks themselves are eventually used to help form rows, and only single pieces are removed to form new stacks. First person to get three stacks within one season wins.

name: Metropoly
description:
For ages 13 and up. Contents: one gameboard, 55 shop cards, 14 owner cards, 26 instruction cards, 6 tokens, 18 counters, 2 dice and fake money.
This game has mechanics similar to classic Monopoly, but it offers more options and a different gameboard.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Warage: Accademia
description:
Expansion Set for Warage Starter Set.
This expansion adds 3x of every Spell, Flash, Companion Card from the Starter Game allowing a single player to build a more focused deck or more players to use those cards while building own decks in a multiplayer game.
This expansion does not add new content, it adds just more copies of the same content of Starter Set.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Lion of Malaya
description:
Publisher's ad copy: "This game from designer Arrigo Velicogna recreates the Malayan Campaign in WWII. A motley assortment of Indians, Australians, and Brits are trying to hold Singapore and Malaya against the Imperial Japanese war machine.

Clever fatigue rules simulate the mounting exhaustion and dread. Nuanced air rules-- that's right, baby!, Air rules!-- and the assignment of tank and anti-tank assets deftly emphasizes their importance in modern warfare. The Commonwealth is in a desperate situation, but the game's just as tough for the Japanese, who must win a total victory, or no victory at all. It's WW2 gaming at its finest, and it's coming in the sixth issue of Yaah! Magazine.

The game uses 84 counters, one 11x17 inch map of Malaya, and an 8.5x11 inch inset map of Singapore. Extensive designer's notes and historical background material is provided as well."
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Rapid City
description: Rapid City is a game of observation and speed. Three to six cowboys can play. A deck of cards is created 3 cards per cowboy and 6 cards matching to the inhabitants of Rapid City. Each turn the top card is revealed. The players react according to that card: shooting on other cowboys, defender stay still. When a player doesn't act correctly, they receive a bullet. When a player receive their 6th bullet, the game is over and the player with the least bullets is the winner.

name: Candy Catch
description:
A sugary glance and catch game.
Observe the sweets, count the colours and shapes and then take the right counters first.
Contents:
56 cards: each card has sweets on one side and a number between 0 and 4 on the other. The sweets come in 4 different colours (yellow, red, green and blue) and 4 different shapes (a dummy, crocodile, bear and sweet in its wrapping). 9 counters, of which 4 colours, 4 shapes and 1 sweet wild card with 4 colours

Turn over the top card on the pile and place it next to the
pile. At this point, look for the colour and shape that appear the same number of times indicated in the card you have just turned over. Once you have found them, take the counters.

When you have all stopped taking counters, the players who have guessed right earn a card to be put to one side. As there are always 2 cards to be earned (one for colour and one for shape), take the turned-over card and the card on the top of the pile.

Sometimes, no colour or shape appear in the required quantities. In this case, you only need to take the wild-card sweet. The player who get it, earns 2 cards.

The game finishes when there are no more cards in the middle of the table. The player with most cards wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Gualicho
description:
Gualicho is a card game where you can combine very special powers!

The first to discard all of his cards wins... But it won't be that easy! Because raising new cards is going to be the slightest thing that can happen.

Some GUALICHOS ("spells") make the game difficult and others are hilariously uncomfortable garments that can accumulate.

But luckily there are powers that defend, heal and even divert the GUALICHOS so that they fall to another.

A game to laugh wildly while you can.

name: Warhammer Quest: Cursed City – Nightwars
description:
The first expansion for Warhammer Quest: Cursed City has arrived. Use your collection of Soulblight Gravelords models to represent new vampire lords trying to fill the power vacuum left by your Heroes after the first quest. You’ll find three new journey types, new missions, even more challenging enemies, and new Elite Classes to empower your Heroes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Trix
description:
In Trix, you're trying to get other players to guess particular words while giving them only two words as a clue — and preferably only one!

Lay out nine cards on the table: three person cards (blue), three action cards (red), and three place cards (green). Look over the cards, secretly choose three of them, then give players a one- or two-word clue. If you choose "Japan", "Fight" and "Soldier", for example, you might give a clue of "Oriental Warrior". (If you present a one-word clue like "Samurai", you score a bonus.) You win points according to how many players guess your cards; the other players win points based on whether they guess correctly and on who guesses first.

name: Iron and Fire
description: Iron and Fire is a diceless simulation of battles of the American Civil War in the Valley of the Shenandoah in 1862. The game uses terrain and counters included with the game with essentially a miniatures system of tactical combat and movement. Orders are issued to units with impulse counters. Combat is resolved by calculating "total fighting power" of units rather than rolling dice and looking on a chart. There are several tactical battle scenarios and also rules for an operational level game with point to point movement, with individual battles resolved with the tactical rules.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Q-bitz Solo
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Use Q-bitz Solo as a solitaire challenge or to add another player, a new color and additional pattern cards to the original Q-bitz game. This personal-sized version of our best-selling game includes 20 new pattern cards, a wooden tray, 16 cubes and instructions, all packed in a travel-friendly tin box."

name: Bodyguard
description:
Bodyguard is a card game in which a president, a bodyguard and any number of assassins try to reach their goals over the course of several rounds. In each round, a different player plays the president.

The president wins by eliminating any assassin (or surviving by the end of the round).
The assassins win if they kill the president.
The bodyguard wins by rescuing the president.

The president deals the role cards to the other players, with one card remaining unassigned. Also, each player holds six hand cards. On a turn, a player can either play an action or a hit card. A player who has four different hit cards in front of them, is eliminated from the round (typically meaning the end of the round, unless the bodyguard is eliminated first). If the president receives the fourth hit card, the bodyguard can play three different hit cards to rescue the president. Afterwards, points are awarded and another round start, until each player has played the president once. Highest overall score wins the game.

name: Magnetism Intelligence Strategy Game
description:
Players take turns placing magnets within a designated area. If a magnet is placed close enough to one or more other magnets that the mutual attraction makes them slide towards one another and stick together, the responsible player must pick up all the stuck magnets. The first player to empty his or her hand of magnets wins.

—user summary

name: Who Lives Where?
description:
In this childrens game, each player is given a set of different animals. Twelve wooden houses are placed in a circle in front of the players. During a turn a player will select an animal from their set and move it beside one of the houses. The player then lift off that house's roof and places their animal inside that house. But, if there is already the same kind of animal inside that house, the player takes their animal back and it is the next player's turn. The player who gets rid of all their animals first is the winner.

This game, translated to English as "Who lives where?", is available in two designs. One design contains the following animals: elephant, duck, rabbit, hedgehog, camel, cat, crocodile, rhino, seal, turtle, pig and whale. The other design contains the following animals: dolphin, cockatoo, bat, fox, cock, shark, kangaroo, hippo, parrot, snake and goat.

—user summary

Find the right home for the friendly animals, and try to remember where it is! Who Lives Where? Animals Memory & Matching Game is a terrific smart game for preschool kids. This game is a shape sorter, a matching puzzle, and a memory game – all in one box. The game set comes with 10 wooden cut-out mini houses, 10 wooden roofs, 20 colored wooden animals, wooden storage tray and simple instructions. Children will like matching the little wooden house pieces to an animal that fits into the puzzle shape inside the house. Preschool players uncover house roofs looking for the right home for their animal friends, and play a memory game trying to remember where that specific home is. The matching game is designed for 1-4 little players and provides 40 wooden pieces for expanded imaginary play!

—description from the publisher

name: Zombie!
description:
The zombies are coming! No one has anticipated their arrival, and for good reason ... they are your neighbors, your friends, your family. In this apocalyptic adventure, you play the brave Judy, whose mission is to help the population escape the ghouls, without being bitten herself. Unless you choose to play Ben, an unfortunate zombie forced to devour alive, without being killed.

Are you ready for anything to survive?

Zombies is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!
publishers: Ediciones MasQueOca, Fox Games, Hobby World, IDW Publishing, Makaka Editions, Mandala Jogos, Van Ryder Games

name: Candygrams
description:
Each player starts with 25 letter tiles and builds their own color-coded crossword. Players begin by each building a “base word” that uses all three colors (pink, yellow, and blue). In each following round, after any one player rolls the dice for a “color combo,” every player connects one new word to their own crossword, matching the color combo rolled. Match the color combo by using any combination of both colors rolled — and only those colors — to form your entire new word. The game continues in rounds until the first player to use all their letters in their crossword (and then quickly grab both dice) is the winner.

There are two different ways to play: “Standard” and “Express.” Standard has a relaxed pace of play, while Express is a fast-paced word race.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Lightning & Bolt
description:
LIGHTNING & BOLT is an asymmetric, co-operative game built for parents and kids—or anyone who wants to mix together a lighter and heavier game for a great time.

LIGHTNING & BOLT is a dice-rolling, tile-flipping, bot-destroying search-and-rescue mission with superheroes, robots, and extreme asymmetry. To win, you need to rescue all 9 neighborhoods, fighting off the evil bots that are terrorizing them, reuniting friends and family, and cornering the Evil Doctor in his secret lab!

Game Play:
Lightning always plays first. On her turn, she can move, smash DocBots on her location by rolling her die, and rescue neighborhoods she's cleared of bots. Lightning ALWAYS defeats all DocBots on her space, even if she rolls below the number of bots surrounding her. But, when she rolls low the extra DocBots make her trouble meter tick upward—one for each extra bot. Once her trouble meter is full, Lightning is trapped, and can't move until Bolt comes to rescue her!

Lightning rescues neighborhoods by flipping over tiles that have been cleared of DocBots. Once she flips over a neighborhood tile, it stays face-up until the next neighborhood is rescued. If the tiles match, they're safe, and remain up and clear of bots for the rest of the game! If they don't match, they both flip back face down, and moving back to fac edown tiles you've visited before brings a new batch of DocBots to fight.

On Bolt's turn, the giant robot rolls three dice, and assigns them to the actions described on its player mat. Some actions (like moving and searching a neighborhood) require 1 die assigned, regardless of value. Others (like attacking DocBots or rescuing Lightning from trouble) depend on the value rolled. If Bolt needs to increase the value of its roll, it can increase its heat by 1 per die re-rolled. But if Bolt's heat meter gets full, it overheats, and must spend all three dice on the following turn to cool down. Still, sometimes overheating is preferable to taking too much damage from being swarmed by DocBots in neighborhoods Bolt enters—bots Bolt doesn't defeat remain on its tile turn after turn, dealing continual damage and preventing it from moving or taking any actions until Lightning swoops in, destroys the bots, and spends a turn repairing her robotic friend.

If Bolt rolls a 6 on any of its dice, it can choose to assign that die to downloading an upgrade, drawing a card from its upgrade deck. On the following turn, dice can be assigned to that upgrade to activate it.

To win, Lightning & Bolt must match all four pairs of neighborhood tiles. But if at any point they reveal the Evil Doctor's lair, all unmatched tiles are shuffled, setting back our heroes badly! However, if all four matches are made, and the last tile flips up to reveal the Evil Doctor's lair, Lightning & Bolt have cornered him, and take him off to jail, saving Midtown once again!
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: My Zoo
description:
Start your own zoo in 'My Zoo', a board game for the whole family! Each player has a zoo and needs to take care of placing an animal in its natural habitat. To get animals for your zoo you have to exchange animal cards in your hand to the market, based on the supply and demand. Players will have to fill their five enclosures with animals this way. Who will be the first to place a rare five star animal in the zoo and win the game?

Introduction
Each player has a zoo with five enclosures of which there are different habitats avaible. The players need to place animals out of their collection into their natural habitat, but in order to do so they have to exchange other animals cards in their possession to the market. This way the players have to fill their five enclosures with animals.

The animals also have a special action when placed in a enclosure or brought to the market, which the player can use to sabotage other players. A player who places a rare five star animal into its zoo wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational

name: Unlock!: Lastman
description:
Lastman is a French series of graphic novels created by Bastien Vivès, Balak and Michaël Sanlaville.

"Unlock! Lastman" is a 24-card mini-adventure in the Unlock! series of card-driven escape room games. It is only for 1 to 2 players, ages 10 and over and plays in about 15 minutes.

Some bookstores in France gave this out to customers who bought two Lastman books.

It requires a free companion app to play.

name: Greetings from Grandville
description:
Welcome to Grandville, home of the Pizza Palace and the famous Golden Gopher!

Walk, bus, bike, or take the subway in a race around town to be the first to see the sights in Greetings from Grandville. There's more than one way to get where you're going, but you'll have to get there first to win.

With beginner and advance options, this game is a sightseeing adventure for the whole family!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Bad Actors: Free Your Wild Side
description: Bad Actors is an inhibition-crushing character impersonation party game. Your wicked imagination turns simple questions into hilarious experiences. Players answer questions impersonating characters like geekiest tech nerd, mad scientist or fanatical sports fan.

name: Escape from the Space Station
description:
An out-of-this-world mini escape room game!

It’s not every day you find yourself trapped on a space station that’s hurtling towards an asteroid belt. And when the station is thrown off course, there’s no time for panicking! Your only shot at safety lies with a note written in a strange alphabet – it looks as if you’ll have to put your intergalactic thinking cap on! There are 12 different puzzles, from tricky picture puzzles to crazy mazes, and the solution for each one will translate a single letter of the note. Only once all 12 puzzles have been solved correctly and the note has been decoded, will you be able to make your escape from the space station!

Testing a variety of key skills from logic to numbers, there's a puzzle for everyone!

-description from publisher

name: Das Geheimnis der Abtei
description:
Each player gets four monks in one color. The player looks at the monks and places them on the starting field, so thta the other players can't see the monks. In play the players aren't allowed to look at the monks.
