At the player's turn, he/she throws with both dice and chooses one monk. It's not allowed to devide the points of the dice along the monks. The player can choose to add or the deduct the numbers of the roll. Monks can move in any direction except for walls and bushes.

In order to find out, which of the strange monks is the intruder, the players have to question them. The questioning can take place only in the garden and only if a player with one of its figures comes exactly on the field of a fellow player figure. If this succeeds, then the active player picks up carefully the figure and looks at the figure secretly. Afterwards the monk is placed to its starting position.
If two monks are occuing a space, other monks cannot question them, until one of the monks leave. When both the dice display the same amount a questioning can be broken by another player.

The player who knows which monk is the intruder, can start the persecution. The player has to throw the same amount with both dice.From this moment the player can only move with one monk, until he reached the intruder. The monk has to land on the same space has the persected monk and the player shows the monk. If the monk is the intruder, the intruding party is out of the game. Otherwise the persecuting party is out of the game.

The last order of monks standing win the game.

name: Let Them Eat Shrimp: Shark v. Squid Expansion
description: This is an expansion to Let Them Eat Shrimp and must be played with the base game. It consists of squid tiles and shark tokens. The squid tiles may be used to attack the shark, take shark tokens, and score points.

name: Dark Continent
description: Players develop their colonies among the 21 areas on the map to increase their income. Military action is possible but not the main part of the game. victory is dependent on saving income each turn and ending positions on map, not the income earned.
categories: Economic, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Territory Building
publishers: Aaabcuz, Schutze Games, Warp Spawn Games

name: Dice Quest
description: Dice Quest is a pseudo fantasy role-playing game that was designed to have the minimum elements of an RPG, without being an actual RPG. The game mechanics allow players to create their own RPG-style adventurers who possess a Character Class, Hit Points and Experience Points for leveling up. Each pocket-sized game box includes 4 Specialty Dice, the game rules, a pad of Character Sheets and pad of graph paper for laying out the dungeon. The four specialty dice included with Dice Quest substitute the need for a game moderator or "Dungeon Master" and allow players to create the labyrinth, encounter monsters, resolve combat and collect treasure while on their dungeon outing.

name: Die Flößerei
description: You move around the board to cut down trees, then use the river to transport the logs to the cities and sell them.

name: Alien Armada
description:
Alien Armada pits human defenders of the far future in a desperate struggle against an invading fleet of alien ships and the alien's clone soldiers. Using an easy-to-learn, but subtle game system, Alien Armada presents an infinite variety of strategic and tactical options to all of its one to four players. In addition to its two-player scenario, there are solitaire and multi-player scenarios. The game contains a full-color 22"x34" game map, 300 back-printed, mounted playing pieces, a die and a twelve page rules book with separate player record sheets.

--From a Centvrion Games brochure
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation
publishers: Centurion Games, Jersey Devil Game Company, Inc.

name: The Sunrise Bridge
description:
Platoon Leader is a system for playing Advanced Squad Leader and tactical level miniatures using a series of interrelated scenarios referred to as a 'campaign game' or CG. The aim of PL is to provide for an enjoyable 'campaign' experience within a reasonable time frame, playable by the average gamer over a couple of evenings.

This Platoon Leader 'Booster Pack' depicts the drop of the British 6th Airborne 'Red Devils' at the Primosole Bridge in Sicily on 14 July, 1943 and the ensuing battle. In addition to a set of new PL CG Cards for each side, one overlay depicting the bridge and several unmounted control counters, you receive the entire PL 2.0 Upgrade rules package, including Chapter Divider.

Expands:

Platoon Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: I Wanna be President
description: Campaign throughout the country, performing the usual rituals: make speeches, raise money, advertise, and take stands in order to obtain the most votes.

name: Army Lists for The Shock of Impact
description: Pre-built army lists for use with the 'Shock of Impact' miniatures rules.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Jam Dudel
description:
This book (in German) is a collection of 30 games by various designers plus a few traditionals. It focuses on games that can be played with larger groups, and games that can be played using every-day material.
Among the featured authors are Heinrich Glumpler, Reiner Knizia, Uwe Rosenberg, Sid Sackson, Michael Schacht, and many others.

name: Guesstures: Bible Edition
description:
Guesstures®, Hasbro's family fovorite of split second characters now comes in a fun-filled BIBLE EDITION from Cactus Game Design, Inc.

QUICK! You only have few short seconds per word! Your four words this round are “Baptize,” “Cross,” “Moses” and “Lamb”. It looks easy, but it’s not. As soon as your team guesses the word on the card – grab it before it gets swallowed by the card-hungry Mimer-Timer™. Then hurry on to the next card!

The harder the word, the more points it’s worth.
Grab the most points to win!
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Religious

name: Hammer Horror Forbidden Terrortory
description:
Players try and rescue a Victim whilst trying to destroy Dracula before he gets uber strong. Players need to collect protection to avoid the ghouls dotted around the Count's lair. Players get five days to complete this task. But beware one bite from a vampire makes you a vampire too!

Game BITS:
3 Decks of cards all showing clips of the famous Hammer Films
12 Hand painted replica figurines of the classic Hammer Monsters
1 Game Board
3 Special Dice
1 DVD Over an hour of Sound and Movie clips that interacts with the game.

name: The Entrepreneur Card Game
description:
The Entrepreneur Card Game is a strategy game for 2-6 players. The objective is to accumulate as much wealth as you can by opening businesses, collecting assets and incorporating those businesses.

It's easy to play - once you know what the powers of the cards are - and all that information is explained fully in the Official Rules. Rip-off your friends, bankrupt your family...make it in big business!

...Thank goodness it's played in the safety of your home.

name: Taacoca
description: Taacoca is a two-player abstract board game played on a hexagonal board. The objective of Taacoca is to reach the opponent's Home row with one of the player's stones.

name: History of War: Allied Expansion
description:
The Allies expansion set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces new units into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards. The Allies Expansion Set may not be played stand-alone.

From the back of the box: (including typos)
For the first time in card game history, fans of both card an strategy games will be able to experience a phenomenal and stunning new gaming experience. Units that you are likely to encounter: Spitfires, p-38 Lightning, B-17's, German Ju-87 Stukas and Heinkel HE-111 bombers. Thanks like the well known Sherman and the deadly Tiger. Also the naval power does not stay behind and will be represented by powerful units like the German Super Battleship Tirpitz and the powerful British Dreadnoughts, while next to them invisible submarines roam the wide deep Atlantic trade routes...

Card mix: (55 cards)
14 x land units
15 x air units
11 x naval units
5 x action cards
3 x territory improvement
5 x base improvement
2 x territory
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: History of War: Axis Expansion
description:
The Axis expansion set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces new units into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards.

The Axis Expansion Set may not be played stand-alone.

From the back of the box: (including typos)
For the first time in card game history, fans of both card an strategy games will be able to experience a phenomenal and stunning new gaming experience. Units that you are likely to encounter: Spitfires, P-38 Lightning, B-17's, German Ju-87 Stukas and Heinkel HE-111 bombers. Tanks like the well known Sherman and the deadly Tiger. Also the naval power does not stay behind and will be represented by powerful units like the German Super Battleship Tirpitz and the powerful British Dreadnoughts, while next to them invisible submarines roam the wide deep Atlantic trade routes...

Card mix: (55 cards)
14 x land units
15 x air units
4 x naval units
10 x action cards
5 x territory improvement
5 x base improvement
2 x territory
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: La Vuelta al Mundo
description:
A family travel game around the world. Players have to visit 6 mandatory cities plus some secondary ones. The first player to arrive in each of the mandatory cities must wait two turns, the rest of the players don't but have to visit some of the secondary cities related to that mandatory one (for example La Havana is the first secondary city of New York).
There are 3 means of transportation:
-road, the player always move but very slowly
-boat, must roll 3+ with a dice
-plane, must roll 6+ with two dice, but each move is further.

When all players have visited all mandatory cities, they must return to their start city in Spain.
The cities give points to the player (mandatory cities more, secondary less). At the end the player with the most points win the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivial Pursuit Junior: Fifth Edition
description: In the fifth edition of Trivial Pursuit Junior players roll dice and move around the board answering questions in six categories. As with other Trivial Pursuit games, the board spaces are a wheel with spokes, and the spaces are color-coded to trivia categories. The goal of the game is to answer a question in each of the six categories on the "pie space", and then return to the center of the board to answer a final question and win.

name: Albert's Insomnia
description:
Rules of the Game:

4 cards are dealt for all players to see, two of which have yellow backs. The first player uses as many or as few cards as needed, (the only rule is each card can only be used once per turn) to create an equation that equals 1. The next player uses the same cards to create an equation for 2 and play continues as high as cards or ability allows. The player that finds the highest consecutive operation wins!

Publisher Blurb:

Albert’s Insomnia is a mental math game using math operations, which can be differentiated for all grades, inclusive of K-5, 6-8 and even high school level students (when factorials and exponents are incorporated into the game). Because Albert’s Insomnia is easily differentiated, it provides the teacher or parent with flexibility to adjust the game to each student’s level. A teacher can easily raise or lower the ability level of the game by choosing different numbers with which the student(s) can work. It allows for individual use, small group and whole class learning experiences. The game can teach students in small groups and as a whole class to work collaboratively and cooperatively, encouraging team work within the classroom.

Because Albert’s Insomnia is a mental math game, it gives students the opportunity to think and solve equations in order to achieve success in the game. Albert’s Insomnia is not a game where students methodically repeat drills in order to learn their math facts. Students naturally acquire this ability through the different processes needed in order to complete the solutions. Students are able to first visualize the numerical operation by the number on the face of the card, then by referring to the different operation signs (add, subtract, multiply, divide). The game can also allow for tactile bodily/kinesthetic engagement as students move the cards or touch the cards while working through their solutions. Students inherently begin to acquire the knowledge of multiplication and division through their repetitive use of the numbers to consecutively count the sheep in the game. When students achieve a solution, they reinforce their newly acquired skills and the other students participating in the game also hear the repetition of the mathematical equation, which provides reinforcement of the necessary math skills needed for students to be successful in math.

Albert’s Insomnia appeals to students because it is purposely sized to fit in small hands. It does not have the look or feel of flashcards, allowing students to feel like they are always playing a game instead of doing school or homework. But because they are instantly and continuously engaged, they are learning while having fun. The developers purposely designed the game so students never feel as though they are going through math drills, and as students achieve their goals to win the game, the teacher or parent wins because the students have learned and practiced their math facts and order of operations while playing the game. Even reluctant math students get hooked on Albert’s Insomnia because each hand begins very easily, and players are fully involved in “playing a game” before the more challenging aspects of math kick in. ENJOY

name: Shootout in Silver Creek
description:
Shootout in Silver Creek is an entertaining and fast-paced dice and card game.

Take a trip back to the old days of The Wild West and try your hand at running the town of SILVER CREEK. The fight for Silver Creek ain't fer yer average cowpoke. You and your gang are not alone in eyeing the possibilities of the town. So now, the down and the dirty fight has begun in earnest, where all bets are off!

The game offers many opportunities to be a real outlaw: fighting, brawling, shooting, robbery and hanging are a small part of what your gang has to go through to claim the prize that is Silver Creek.

You are divided into two bands of outlaws, fighting each other using cards played each turn. On your turn, you can play both a single Instant Card and a single Shooting Card. The Instant Cards offer a variety of special effects, while the Shooting Cards allows you to roll the dice and see if you wound your target! Every outlaw begins the game at 10 health, and if you ever run out you're out of the game.

When there is only one gang left standing, they gain control of Silver Creek and win the game. Good luck cowboy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Cubo Queenie 3: Diagonals
description:
4 extra rules to let you score even in diagonal!

If you ever played Cubo with the base rules, it is time to spice it a bit more letting even the dice in the diagonals. So your Cubo will score 8 times instead of 6!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Phone Phever
description:
Phone Phever is a new, fun, fast-paced, family-friendly party board game that perfectly blends the wonder of smartphone technology with the simple fun of a traditional board game. Players/teams match both wits and smartphone skills in a FRANTIC RACE to answer fascinating trivia questions and complete hilarious challenges, all of which cleverly explore how the world's favorite invention -- the telephone -- has shaped music, movies, TV, history and technology, law and politics, and the rest of Western pop culture. Feeding your smartphone addiction, and cravings for social interaction, Phone Phever will provide countless hours of laughter, excitement, conversation, and learning.

Drawing upon the unique knowledge and abilities of individual players, Phone Phever is the ideal gift for smartphone users and board game lovers. It’s also easy to play: roll the die, pick a card, and tackle one of 1,200 questions or challenges. Best of all, to play Phone Phever, only your phone needs to be smart! Will you be the first to reach the Phone Phever store?

Phone Phever is the first hit game of Bear Mountain Games, a company committed to creating high-energy and intellectually challenging games for today’s modern family. This one-of-a-kind family and party board game has already won several board game awards. Phonetastic!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Party Game, Trivia

name: Story Time Dice: Fairy Tales
description:
From the publishers website...

Roll your own "Happily Ever After!"

Story Time Dice are back and better than ever! Roll your way into a fantastical world of fairy tales. These seven jumbo polyhedral dice illustrate 70 classic fantasy concepts and shimmer in the sunlight.

Join twelve heroes to outwit twelve vile villains across six whimsical settings. Overcome eight obstacles with the help of twenty magic tools, but stay wary of the troublesome twists! Will your "ever after" be happy? The answer is just a roll away!

Once Upon a Roll...

If you need a little help getting started, every set of Story Time Dice: Fairy tales comes with a handy dice guide with 7 suggested games to play. They range from simple storytelling games for beginners to complex, turn-based party games with lots of rolling. There's even a special crossover game for owners of Story Time Dice and Story Time Dice: Scary Tales! Are you brave enough to play them all?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: March Hares
description:
In the springtime you may be lucky enough to see the March hares chasing and battling each other in the fields as part of their elaborate contests for dominance. This is a light and quick card game where you do battle with a rival, running, jumping and boxing, trying to force your opponent to run out of options.

The game involves two players each having a small deck of 18 cards and taking it in turn to play a card which follows their opponent's play either in suit (run, jump or box) or value (1, 2 or 3). The suits dictate an action: run involves drawing cards, jump involves returning a card to their deck, and box forces their opponent to discard a card. The numbers dictate a penalty number of cards to draw if the player cannot follow the previous play.

Game play focuses on managing the number of cards in your hand and in your deck so that you always have an option for your next turn. If you ever get into a situation where you are unable to complete an action, you lose the game.

name: Korruptivity "Lite"
description:
Players are corrupt politicians in this game. They fight for authority points, which they can get by completing "procedures". A player start a procedure by a deal-card, but after that every player can add cards to that procedure.

This is the small card version of the original game, and contains 55 cards.

—user summary

name: Era of Voyage: the DICE
description:
Era of Voyage: the DICE is a dice game based on age of exploration. It is not an expansion of Era of Voyage, but a standalone game.

Purpose of the game
The player is a merchant in a port city. The goal is to be a successful merchant who has greater influence than any other merchants.

Game Outline
Select an investment destination map by randomly selecting 7 cards from multiple trade cards and 1 card from the base card.
Players will roll two dice when they turn their turn. Select "income" or "investment" from the outgoing eyes and execute it. "Revenue" can earn "additional income" from the trade route card that invested as "basic income" corresponding to the outcome. "Investment" obtains the right of "additional income" and "victory point" by investing in the trade route card corresponding to the outcome.
If you do not like the outcome of the dice, you can also reorder by paying the prescribed money.
"Luck" is necessary because this is a dice game in this work, but "thinking" is also necessary how to use dice. Let's aim for victory by combining "luck" and "thinking" well!

Contents
· Card: 24 sheets
· Chips: 150 sheets
· Dice: 2 pieces
· Instructions: 1
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Check the Fridge!
description: The deck consists of 48 food cards, each displaying one of six kinds of food, including three cheese cards. The nine cards in each of the five non-cheese foods (suits) are numbered in such a way that each such suit contains three triplets that add up to twenty five, eg, 4, 6, and 15. The object is to collect the most triplets. Each player begins with a hand of five cards. In turn order, a player asks for a food. Every player who has a card or cards of that food in her hand must offer all of those cards and no others to the questioner. Players who do not have that food in their hands may either sit out or bluff by offering the questioner one or more cards of any type. The questioner chooses one offer, sight unseen, and adds those cards to her hand. Players meld their triplets when they create them. Play continues until only the cheese cards remain in players’ hands. Players score one point for each melded triplet and minus one for each cheese card in their hands.

name: Mech Command RTS: A.I. Unleashed
description:
Play Solo or with a Team against the A.I. The cooperative expansion adds new rules, missions and components designed to allow players to challenge the game itself. Using a special A.I. card deck enemy units are given behavior patterns and target priorities when they are produced. This rule-set features 3 categories of enemies each with their own unique mechanics; automated turrets, seeker drones and AM's (automated mechs). Plus a unique boss that is revealed in later missions.

4 Additional LED Laser Miniature Bases!
4 Automated Turret Models
6 Seeker Drone Models
Giant BEHEMOTH Boss Model
60 Card A.I. Deck
Energy Wall Chipboard with Stands
New mission objectives and tokens
Cooperative Mission Campaign Book
Additional Gems, Damage Blocks and Tokens

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game

name: Teli tyúkól
description:
This game is mainly for children. Its a simple dice rolling game where you get eggs then chickens. Later on you can have an encounter with a fox. If you are not prepared you gonna regret it. Great fun for familys and kids.

—user summary

Content:

54 egg tiles
48 chicken tiles
36 hen tiles
4 rooster tiles
4 player boards
2 dice
rulebook


Aim of the game
Players have to collect 9 hens to fill their hennery. The first player to complete it wins the game.

In every turn players have to choose one of the following actions:

Dice rolling: The active player gets an egg, chicken or hen for every die, depending on the results (details below)
Swapping: The active player can swap his/her tiles (with one tile in the common supply). He/She can swap only 1 time per turn: 3 eggs to 1 chicken or 3 chickens to 1 hen or 3 hens to 1 rooster


Dice rolling details:
If the results of the two dice are not the same, the active player gets tiles for both dice

1, 2 or 3: egg tile
4 or 5: chicken tile
6: hen tile



E.g. Player rolls 2 and 5, He/She takes 1 egg and 1 chicken from the common supply and has to place them next to the player board.

If the results of the two dice are the same, something bad happens as described below

1 and 1: player has to give one egg from his/her stack to a player of his/her choice
2 and 2: player has to give one chicken from his/her stack to a player of his/her choice
3 and 3: player has to give one hen from his/her player board to a player of his/her choice
4 and 4: player loses all of his/her eggs
5 and 5: it's bird flu epidemic. Player has to roll one die:
1, 2 or 3: player is out of the next turn
4 or 5: player loses all of his/her chickens
6: player loses all of his/her hens


6 and 6: There is a fox on the farm. If the player has a rooster, it protects the farm from the fox, nothing bad happens. If He/She does not have a fox, He/She has to roll a die. The fox will take as many as hens the die shows. If He/She has not got enough hens, fox takes chickens, if He/She hasn not got enough chickens fox takes eggs.



E.g. Player rolls 4 and 4, He/She loses all of his/her eggs. Eggs return to the common supply.

If player gets a hen, He/She has to place it on his/her player board, other tiles must be collected next to it.

name: Vievarium
description:
A board game with 99 different cards about events in real life so players will see the consequences on their boards.

There are gold cards that adding a really fun interaction between players. The main goal: try do reach the objective you fixed at the beginning between (Health, Happiness, Wealth, Culture) before getting too old and quit the game at 99 years old.

Each player has a board with 8 wooden cubes to mark their scores of each of column. They get older after each turn of the table. At the top of their boards, they have to put a wood cube at the beginning of the game so they will try to reach the top of that column to win before dying of 100 years of age. Each card has its own effect on the boards. Cards can be played to any player.

FRANÇAIS:
Faites les bons choix de vie pour vivre vieux et en santé!
Vievarium est un jeu où toutes les parties ne se ressemblent pas. Avec ses 99 cartes différentes, qui sait ce qui vous attend!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Drive Like Hell
description:
Drive Like Hell was a finalist in Button Shy Game's September Challenge where all 18 cards were required to be identical!

With your recently rescued lover in tow, you now flee the minions of Hell, and the Devil himself. The creature from the pit will own your lover’s soul unless you can reach the sanctity and safety of Saint Joseph's Cathedral. So shift your car into high gear and Drive Like Hell!

Object of the Game: To win the game you must reach the Saint Joes location without The Devil reaching you, having your vehicle receive four points of damage or having a Fiend reach your location.

name: Ages of Conflict
description:
Ages of Conflict is a multi-genre, or universal, tabletop miniatures war game. This is a game of mass battle in which you command an army with the goal of smashing your enemy into ruin. Ages of Conflict employs a flexible system allowing you to create units and armies from nearly any time and genre, including ancients, fantasy, black powder, and science fiction.

Scale Agnostic: Ages of Conflict treats the miniatures as representations of the soldiers in the unit allowing you to use any scale miniatures you prefer - 2 mm, 3 mm, 6 mm, 10 mm, 15 mm, 28 mm, etc.

Multi-Genre: One set of rules to battle with historical, fantasy, black powder, World War II, and sci-fi. This means you can also mix genres allowing you to fight an army of American Civil War Confederates against undead, a World War II Allied force against alien invaders, and so on. This does not mean the armies will be equal.

Army Lists: The Ages of Conflict core book includes over 50 historical army lists spanning the ancient world to the early Renaissance, 20 fantasy army lists, and close to 30 black powder army lists from the Seven Years War, the American War of Independence, the Napoleonic Wars, the Crimean War, and the American Civil War.

Customizable: Use your favorite miniatures and bases you already have. Uses a large variety of miniature manufacturers including MicroWorld, Baccus, Essex, Irregular, Victrix, Perfect Six, Old Glory, 2d6, and more. You can also use a variety of basing standards: 60 x 30 mm, 40 x 40 mm, 40 x 20 mm, etc.

Fast Paced: Minimal book keeping and alternating actions keep you engaged and the game moving at a brisk pace. There are no result tables to reference with each roll. Once you learn the turn sequence the only information you reference is your army roster sheet.

Solo Play: While not strictly designed for solo play, Ages of Conflict does play perfectly well as a solo game and includes guidelines for playing Ages of Conflict in solo mode.

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Pike and Shot, Post-Napoleonic, Renaissance, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Order Counters

name: Munchkin Farkle
description:
Play the classic game of Farkle in a whole new way!

Munchkin Farkle marries the classic dice game with the Munchkin sense of humor and stab-your-buddy mentality. Rather than the traditional race to win, Munchkin Farkle is a race to win...while making your companions lose!

Cheat, curse your friends, and occasionally run away as you push your luck on every roll. Add the most gold pieces to your hoard and win!

name: SANDANNOTOU
description:
SANDANNOTOU is a trick-taking game for exactly 3 players.

The game includes a board showing most of the ranks of the cards around the border of an octagonal board, and lines connecting each of the values. During setup, players draft placing towers onto spaces created by the intersecting lines or on a person sheet.

The cards played to a trick will generally form a triangle on the board. Any towers within a trick's triangle gain a token if the owner followed suit and loses one if they did not.

After all cards have been played, the game ends. Each token on a tower is worth 1 point, unless the tower has 4 token; towers with 4 tokens are worth no points. The player with the most points wins.

name: Storm The Capitol
description:
Storm the Capitol is the world’s first board game based around the events of January 6, 2021. Take control of one of 6 Patriots as you battle through the Capitol, collecting ballots, taking hostages, and fighting the police. Or play as the Capitol Police and use every means at your disposal to prevent the Patriots from getting to the roof with enough ballots to Stop the Steal.

—description from the designer

name: Casa dei Fantasmi
description:
From the box:
You have to catch the ghost hidden in the last room of the house! In order to do this, every player must find the right objects hidden in the house before the other ghost-hunters.

name: Gunship: Asteroids!
description:
Gunship: Asteroids! adds a new "terrain" to your BattleSpace, the Asteroid Field!

You and your Battle Group have a new Objective: In addition to the usual combat with enemy forces, you are ordered to enter the deadly Asteroid Field and retrieve the ones that contain X-Plodium, an ore vital to the weapon industry. Your goal is to be the first team to fill the hangar of your Carrier and make the jump to Hyperspace. As usual, your opponent has the same mission! Dodge giant flying rocks, fend off the enemy's attacks, grab the prize and make it out alive - easier said than done!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Fabula Regnum
description:
Eres un rey en una época de leyendas. Forja tu reino en un mundo de dragones, magia y brujería. no será fácil: otros reyes tiene la misma ambición. ¿Te atreves a ser parte de la leyenda?

You are a king in a time of legends. Forge your kingdom in a world of dragons, magic and sorcery. It won't be easy: other kings have the same ambition. Would you dare to be part of the legend?

Each turn, players reveal cards from the Fabula Deck. Gold, treasure, castle parts, troops to create an army, allies and threats may appear, creating an storytelling game. Each time you play, the fabulous tale will change.
Main objetive is to complete your Castle and get the Princess. There are several ways to achieve this and the ending of the tale depends on yours!

It also includes advanced game rules with a more complete combat system and the Black King being automatically controlled willing to defeat the other Kings.

name: PerPlexus
description:
From the instructions:

PerPlexus is a game requiring both quick thinking and a constantly changing strategy. The play board is a network comprised of 6 sliding play pieces or shuttles that can be moved right or left, offensively or defensively, by either player. The game objective is to place 5 stones in a row -- horizontally, vertically, or diagonally -- while blocking the opponent's attempts to line up 6 stones in a row. Each shuttle has spaces for 7 stones. PerPlexus requires that a player plan moves several turns in advance whether playing stones or moving shuttles.

name: Fast Break
description:
Fast Break is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game which simulates a basketball game through the use of collectible cards.

Fast Break mixes humour with basketball strategy. Coaches recruit Players from eight teams and use Action cards to Dribble, Pass, Shoot, Block, Grab and Steal.

Online Play


CCG Workshop (no longer available)

name: NGo: New Global Order
description:
In the near future our planet has been devastated by a global war, which ended with the modern amenities and technology. Only a few ill-equipped factories, decimated armies and insufficient resources have been in the hands of four groups scattered over the face of the Earth. You lead one of them.

N*Go is a strategy game board where you must become the protector of the planet's resources for the survival of your people.

Starting from a situation where all forces and resources are in balance, luck has no place here. There is no win card or dice that do the work for you, every attack has a possible defense and nobody knows the strategy of the opponents.

The rules are easy and simple, all goals are in sight of achieving these objectives... heck you have to be prepared if you want to get it!

Make alliances, colonizes virally, passively awaiting development of the strategy of your opponents ... or a mixture of all this. There is no right or wrong way of doing things here, you have nothing to lose, yet is all at stake.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Cyntopia: The Future Is Now
description:
Cyntopia: The future is nowis a cooperative, fast-paced and action packed tabletop boardgame which takes places in a dystopic future. You'll fight huge corporations as an Edgewalker and make your living while flirting with the line. Will you fight or fall?

Cyntopia: The future is now is now takes place in a completely new cyberpunk universe. It features a cooperative gamemode for 1-7 players, a modular boardgame, over 30 miniatures and a random mission system.

The goal of the game is to fulfill your mission as Edgewalker, the mission and corporation you work against will be drawn by cards and decide the first floortile of the boardgame.

During the Edgewalk you have to fight against the guards of the corporation in a simple, yet luck and strategy based fighting system. The success of each interaction depends on the dice roll.

name: Monster Menu
description:
Description from the publisher:

Time for a feast! The two monsters are particularly hungry again today. But be careful! The two gluttons may be fed only once! So Monster Menu is all about cleverly deciding how to distribute your cards. Who will be the best at pampering the monsters by feeding them the most matching food cards, and thus collecting the most points?

name: One Piece: Water 7
description:
In this new cooperative board game Luffy and his crew arrive in Water 7, the famous island-city with its seven naval shipyards. They soon realize that their boat, the Going Merry, is not reparable! They will have to find material in order to build a new one. But the CP9 will do everything to stop their progress and have kidnapped Robin. Will they be able to save their friend, build the Thousand Sunny and board it before the Aqua Laguna, a gigantic wave, invades the game?

From the hit manga and anime, One Piece.
An official TOEI Animation product ensuring quality and authenticity
Instructions available in Spanish, German, Italian and French.

On your turn you roll and reroll your progress dice to use them to get victory points, resources and move around the board, trying to get the pieces to build the new ship and to rescue Nico Robin. If you can not avoid the CP9 enemies, you will fight using combat dices and your resources against them.

The enemy figures are moved by an event deck of cards, and after some turns, the Aqua Laguna waves will start to invade the board. You and your team must be quick! If you are covered by the Aqua Laguna water, you can be eliminated. And if the water invades everything (all Aqua Laguna counters are used), all of you will lose.

However, if you finish the ship and rescue Nico Robin in time, the player with most victory points will be the real winner!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Splito Demo
description:
A free promotional demonstration version of Splito.

In standard Splito, there are 109 cards, for up to 8 players. In this free demo version, there are 27 cards, for 3 or 4 players. Each player receives 6 or 8 cards at the beginning of the game (depending if there are 3 or 4 players), compared to 13 in the standard version.

Generally, most rules are the same. At the end of each turn, each player chooses a card (Objective or Value) from their hand and decides to place it between themselves and their neighbor on the left or right. At the end of the 6 or 8 rounds, each player checks the Objectives in each zone between the players, and the two common Objectives, revealed at the beginning of the game, are also attributed to the zones that have fulfilled the conditions. The score of each player is calculated by multiplying the points obtained in the zone to their left by the points in the zone to their right.
mechanics: Alliances, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cargo Express
description:
In Cargo Express, 2-4 players take over the roles of train entrepreneurs that accept orders and transport goods.

Cargo Express is mechanically simple, but planning the best moves is complex. Moreover, each player has to cope with always changing conditions. Each game turn consists of a planning phase and three player turns in which one of three cards is played.

Let your fellow players watch sparks fly from under the wheels of your dashing train!
mechanics: Action Queue, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: uDog
description:
Using two standard decks of playing cards the players move marbles (the dogs) around a player board trying to be the first to return their dogs home from their kennels. It is played in teams of two with rules for a two player variant with each player playing two colors.

uDog is a beautifully crafted wooden board game that will bring some old-fashioned fun back into your home. In a world that is dominated by screens, this very simple-to-learn, but highly strategic game offers a lot of competition and fun as you gather around the table. Part card game and part board game, this multiplayer challenge is simple to learn and exciting to master.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Track Movement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Dozen Doubloons
description:
Dozen Doubloons is a solitaire card game for anyone aged 8 and up. It takes one minute to learn, just minutes to play, and keeps challenging your wits for hours. Kids won't know they're learning how to think strategically, and adults will wish they remembered how! Four levels of difficulty provide a challenge for anyone who sits down with Dozen Doubloons in front of them.

The deck consists of 54 cards. There are four sets of numbers 1 through 12, plus 4 BLOCK cards, and 2 WILD cards. The object of the game is to deplete all cards in play.

Shuffle. Deal 6 stacks of four cards face down, and a fifth card on each stack face up. The remaining cards are your draw stack. To play: combine up to three cards that equal 12, and place them in a discard pile. Turn over the next card in each of your stacks. If a BLOCK card shows up, do not remove the card but move it and all cards underneath it to a position above any other unblocked stack. You may not touch the BLOCK stack until the stack beneath it is depleted. Once the stack is depleted, slide the whole BLOCK stack down into position, discard the BLOCK card, turn over the next card, and continue playing.

When there are no cards that equal 12 (or if you choose not to use a combination that is available), turn over the first DRAW card. If it's usable, use it. If not, place it face down in front of you. Continue to DRAW cards as needed, and keep placing them to the right of the original card. If a BLOCK card comes up from the DRAW pile, discard it and ALL the other cards accumulated from previous draws--they are now out of play.

Once you have gone through your DRAW pile one time, the game is over. If you have not depleted all six original stacks, you have lost.

This is a summary of the rules and not meant to cover all possible scenarios.

name: Scavenger Hunt for Kids Board Game
description:
From the publisher:

To play, children turn over 6 cards and race around the house to find all the objects on the cards - such as "Something that begins with the letter M", "A book with more than 100 pages", "A picture of a smiling person" and many more.

When time expires, players count up what they've found and move their pawns 1 space for every object retrieved. If a player lands on a "Captain Cleanup" space then everyone must race to put everything they've found so far back where it belongs. The first player to move his pawn across the finish line wins.

name: Trio
description: Similar to Mag-Nif 's Rex but played on a staggered 3-2-3 square rather than on a triangle, this is a game of alignment constrained by the previously played pieces. Either player stacks pieces on long pegs, hoping to achieve as many lines vertically, horizontally or diagonally as possible --in three dimensions. All 24 pieces are played, then the alignments are counted: whoever achieved the most wins. Solitaire rules are also included.

name: Sprawl
description:
A game of strategy, resource management, planning, and diplomacy for three to eight players.

Object: To place as many of your pieces on the board as possible while blocking the other players from doing likewise.

You Need:


A chess board.
One set of Looney Pyramids (15 pieces of the same color, five pieces of each size) for each player.


On your turn, you can Build (Add to an existing tower), Branch (Lay pieces off of a tower or tower branch), or Spore (Start a new tower in a square targeted by a branch point).

When one player has no more valid moves, the game ends at the beginning of that player's next turn. Add up the points in your stash at the end of the game. If you have the least points in your stash at the end of the game, then you win.

Game System

Looney Pyramids


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Winner in 1st Competition


Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: 鬼戏•巅峰之争 Ghost Play
description:
Chinese-themed card game created by QMOND.ME

The goal of the game is try to exorcise more ghosts as you can. And help your teammates to do so. If the Ghost Lord appeared, then kill it as soon as you can or else the player who plays the Ghost Lord will win the game.

Now is the chaos of the world, the demons run rampant. Dark smoke two players camp brand camp, representing the main factions of the two channel division: "Peace Avenue","Tianshi" solution based on the moral acceptability of various occasional fight, the King of Ghosts was waiting in the wings seal.
Get rid of the color corresponding with their kid camp extra bonus points; always be some people harbor no deception: "depraved"
Evil ways players will need to try everything to make the other a player possessed by three demons, and then let the King of Ghosts possessed in his own body against other players. However, if the evil ways by three players to their kid possessed, the evil ways of death and the end of the game players, other players are settled scores.

10 Identity Cards

88 Day Cards （72 Standard Edition Cards + 16 Expansion Edition Cards）
Expansion Edition of Day Cards: Bagua Fu(red)*2、Bagua Fu(blue)*2、Wugui Fu*3、Yuling Fu*3、Poyuan Fu(red)*1、Poyuan Fu(blue)*1、Lianyu Fu*2、Yinhun Fu*2. They satisfied the players who like the games to be more difficult.

8 Character Cards
50 Night Cards (42 Ghost Cards +8 Event Cards)
9 Ghost Lord Cards
2 Reiki Token
1 Dice

game-play
Round stage players perform the following actions
1. day stage
use of spiritual power, remove license Taoism and use of hand instruments used in the card
2. night stage (playing King of Ghosts of the player draws a card Taoism)
ghost haunt, and open ghost ghost deck will be possessed in accordance with rules to determine which player on the exorcism can then be.

goal
1.King of Ghosts did not show up: public identity of all the players, clearing scores of the two camps scores, scores of high-camp to win (the team victory in the system)
2.King of Ghosts have appeared, and the King of Ghosts was punitive, public identity cards of all players, clearing scores of the two camps scores, scores of high-camp to win the King of Ghosts Ghost not dead deck was exhausted and the players play to win the King of Ghosts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Emplumados
description:
Emplumados is a card game in which we will be bird watchers and our goal is to get the best score. Keep your cards of different Habitats and of higher value, waiting for the right moment to win a hand... But beware: Depending on the round, some cards can subtract points!

The game of Emplumados consists of 3 rounds.

Players take turns playing hands, and whoever played the best card wins the trick. At the end of the round, the points are counted, and there may be more valuable cards, and others that remain, depending on the score that appears on the Habitat Marker.

After 3 rounds, the total points are tallied and the one with the highest score wins. In case of ties, those players share the victory.


Emplumados es un juego de cartas en el que seremos avistadores de aves y es nuestro objetivo conseguir el mejor puntaje. Guardá tus cartas de diferentes Hábitats y de más alto valor, esperando el momento oportuno para ganar una mano... ¡Pero cuidado: Dependiendo la ronda, algunas cartas pueden restar puntos!

La partida de Emplumados consta de 3 rondas.

Por turnos, los jugadores jugarán manos, y quien haya jugado la mejor carta se llevará la baza. Al finalizar la ronda, se contabilizan los puntos, pudiendo haber cartas más valiosas, y otras que resten, dependiendo el puntaje que figura en el Marcador de Hábitat.

Luego de 3 rondas, se cuentan los puntos totales y aquel con el mayor puntaje gana. En caso de empates, esos jugadores comparten la victoria.

name: Keltis Das Mini-Spiel
description:
Another offspring from the Spiel des Jahres Winner Keltis. A mini game of Keltis. Its a bit like the Keltis Mitbringspiel, players must mix-match tiles. The game was a promotion prize by the Landliebe dairy, makers of pudding, milk, ice-cream in Germany.

It consists of a (flimsy) card board board, made out of 2 pieces that will form a bigger board, 3 cardboard playing pieces per player (2 player), 1 scoring marker of cardboard, gemstones, 4 special chits for the board and 33 small cards.

Gameplay is similar to Keltis but simplified of course: From a starting point three paths can be reached. On these paths 9 chits (5 gemstones, 4 other chits) are openly laid. Each player gets 6 cards, the remaining 21 are put in a central card pile. Players lay one card on a private pile of a certain colour. The piles can be ascending or descending, but this choice can only made once. Once a card is legally added to a pile the player can choose to advance one of his playing pieces on one of the paths on the board. If one playing piece reaches a chit the chit is removed and gives points or if its a gemstone can be taken by the player. When the public card pile is exhausted the game is over. Players get points according to the advancement of their playing pieces (-2 to +10 points are possible on each path) and for each gemstone they collected (0 gemstones = -3, 1 gemstone = -1, 2 gemstones = 2, 3 gemstones = 3 4 gemstones = 6, all 5 gemstones = 10 points). The player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Brotherhood of Nine: The Hex Strategy Game
description:
Welcome to the world of team battles, where the right position of the warriors and skillful decision making are the most important things to achieve the victory. You command the squad of 9 soldiers, who become your Brotherhood of Nine for the time of the battle.
The goal of your Brotherhood is quite simple - destroy the enemy.

The fighting troops contain exactly nine warriors each, and that's where the name of the boardgame comes from. The main battle takes place on the board made of hexes that is nicely scaled for two, three or four players. There are several types of units in the game represented by the hex-shaped double-sided tiles. Before the battle begins all the warrior tiles are laid face down creating "the fog of war".

name: O.K. Corral
description: Each player get a random character. One card is flipped over and depending on the card and your character the players have to react with actions (or non actions). Some cards reward the fastest and some have a penalty for the slowest.
categories: American West, Card Game, Civil War, Party Game, Wargame

name: Gladiators
description:
A game of gladiatorial combat in ancient Rome. Played using counters or miniatures figures (54mm or 25mm) on a hex grid. For two or more players.

Gladiators was designed as a system for single figure miniatures combat. But it is more like a role-playing game's combat system than a traditional miniatures system. Combat takes place on a hex grid making Gladiators similar in nature to Steve Jackson's Melee system (the combat system which evolved into The Fantasy Trip which eventually evolved into GURPS). Of course, the rules are a bit more specialized than Melee in that they focus on the gladiator combat of ancient Rome.

Gladiators took two years of play-testing and conceptual development to create. A set of playable yet detailed and realistic rules for simulating gladiatorial combat. Players will be able to move their gladiators, feint, and dodge about as they prepare to lunge at their adversaries. They can slash or jab at their chosen targets, and must parry the return blows of their opponent. Shields can be used to bash opponents off guard. Accidents also have a place in this simulated universe. Men can trip or stumble, weapons or shields can be dropped, or nets cut to shreds. In short, an imaginative player can momentarily enter the arena and prepare himself for a contest which will be won or lost by the same elements that brought victory or defeat, fame and wealth or sudden death to a gladiator. Skills, cleverness, foresight, and luck all play their respective roles.

These rules open a new dimension of wargaming--the realistic and exciting simulation of one man versus one man in the arena. Give them a try. You'll find a game hard to beat for moments of challenge.

Contains 1 cardstock sheet of tables printed on both sides and 1 cardstock hex sheet printed on both sides (2 difference sized hexes, one size on each printed side).
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Mow 'Em Down: Walker Mowers Edition
description:
In Mow 'Em Down, players represent different landscape company owners who bid to win landscaping contracts throughout an ever-growing city. Players can bid only if they have enough lawn mowers available in their company. As players win contracts, they earn money to purchase more lawn mowers, which allows them to bid on future contracts. Contracts can expire, so players must be savvy with their bids to maintain a profitable business.

During one's turn, a player receives earnings from previously won contracts and purchases new equipment if desired. Then the player roles the die to determine which of three sizes of land tiles to act upon for the duration of the turn. Once the size of land tile has been determined by the die, the player chooses from one of three actions to take: BUILD, BID, or BOOT.

If the player chooses BUILD, the player expands the city by drawing and placing a new land tile of the determined size to the existing city.

If the player chooses BID, the player opens an auction on one or two land tiles of the determined size for eligible players to bid on contracts. (In most cases, the lowest bidders win the contracts.) The winning players will receive these earnings on future turns.

If the player chooses BOOT, the player cancels and removes a contract of the determined size and the affected player will not continue to receive these earnings on future turns.

Various bonuses and event cards can be earned or played throughout the game that add some random elements.

The game ends when the last land tile is placed onto the city and all other players take one additional turn. The player with the highest total value, including cash, earnings and equipment is declared the winner.

Home Page: http://www.mowemdown.com
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Raise The Ruins
description:
In Raise the Ruins, players are priests, fresh from their trials in the Temple of Favors. Many of Azytecal's once great temples stand on the cusp of ruin, the voices of the faithful no longer echoing throughout their halls, and the altars lay barren. Restoring these temples is the object of Raise the Ruins.

Players vie for the blessings of the three deities and send their followers to the forgotten altars bearing offerings. Raise the Ruins is a card driven set collection game with easy to grasp mechanics and engaging game play decisions for 3-4 players, Ages 10 and up, and plays in 45-60 minutes.

Components:
52 Offering Cards
8 Trophy Cards
12 Temple Cards
3 Deity Cards and 3 Wooden Deity Markers
2 Wooden Crest Markers
4 Favor Cards
24 Wooden Followers (6 in each color)
4 Score Cards & Wooden Markers

________________________________

Raise The Ruins will be available later this month in standard Small Box Games limited print run. Additionally, a add on pack will be available for those already owning TEMPLE. A downloadable version of the board for TEMPLE will also be available for downloading, and, in conjunction with the rules already available online, playing TEMPLE will be possible with a copy of Raise The Ruins

name: Behütunsburg
description:
In 13th century Bayern, family ties were strong, but for some, the lust for power was stronger. Rivalry among and within noble families would often lead to Machiavellian politics, outright theft and sometimes kidnapping. The Behütuns family was no different, as different branches of the family squabbled over money & subjects.

Gameplay:
Behütunsburg is a two-player card game usually played in 4 rounds. (Two copies of the game can be used to play with 3-4 players.)
Players will assemble a "court" of Barons & Knights with their Ladies, then a King and Queen, and finally adding a castle. Each of these elements are worth a certain number of victory points. Knights can be sent on quests to find treasure and more vassals for the King, (i.e. drawing more cards). Opposing players can attempt to disrupt plans by sending rogues to steal from the treasury or kidnap ladies, knights, barons or baronesses.

The round ends when a player with a complete court and castle discards their last card. Scores are totaled based on the victory points of the cards in play.
The goal is to have the most total victory points at the end of four rounds of play.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Medieval, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Antarctica
description:
Antarctica is a cooperative game, in which the players are trying to protect four young animals on an ice floe.

Every round, some of the ice melts, and the animals have to move further to feed. They are also threatened by hunters that are trying to shoot the seals and the penguins.

The players can deploy patrol vessels and helicopters to protect the animals against the hunters. When all animals are fully grown, the players win the game.

name: Fädelspiel: Auf dem Land
description:
Little threading experts can choose! Children may use the task cards. They must match the wooden pieces to the illustrations on the cards. The object is to thread the wooden pieces in the correct sequence.

They can also play a tactile game. Children pull the play figures out of the sensing bag, by feeling for the different shapes.

Contents: 2 threads with stable, 1 cow, 1 calf, 1 horse, 1 foal, 1 cloverleaf, 1 flower, 1 milk churn, 1 horseshoe, 4 templates, 1 little tactile bag.

Part of the Meine erste Spielwelt Bauernhof series.

name: Phalanxx: Charisma
description: A pre-order bonus for Phalanxx, adding an extra expert starting card. The card gives you an additional, fourth, white "1" die that helps you fulfill card requirements.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Stackers
description:
Stackers is played starting on a regular hexagonal base board consisting of 24 triangles.

Each turn, a player can place a piece consisting of three triangles on the lowest level, the second lowest, etc., until he adds a new level or passes. No two adjacent triangles can have the same colour, but all stacked triangles should have the same colour.

Once there are nine levels, stacked pieces can extend beyond the horizontal limits of the base board. (Even pieces that are placed on lower levels.)

The player who first manages to play all his pieces, wins.

name: Bazaar 1295
description:
Story of the Game:

In the year 1295 (the year ending March 20, 1917), that is to say, 95 years after the time when Tehran was determined as capital of Iran, the small bazaar (market place) of Tehran which had not so much flourish before facing an increase in number of immigrants. Bazaar of Tehran was gradually becoming a big market place which needed a capable manager. For this reason a competition was held between 5 experienced businessmen of that time in order to decide who will become the “Elder” one of the bazaar.

Aim of the Game: By the end of the 5th day, the player with the highest total of gold coins wins the game.

How to play:

Stage 1: Taking the Tile of Goods
This stage has 2 parts. In the first part: each player randomly takes tiles from the bag keep some of them to expose to other pkayer and return the rest to the bag.

Stage 2: Transaction
Any transaction is possible and free in this stage.
In this stage the players are permitted to transact and exchange any goods with the asset coins( gold coins ) or with other goods in only 2 minutes which should be controlled by a timer.

Stage 3: Costing and Sale (bidding)
In this stage ( considering the main board-game ) all the goods will be sold.each player holds one of the costing coins in his fists ( considering limitation of costing for each goods ) and keep his hand in front of the shop and all the players open their fists simultaneously. the person who has offered lower price takes action for selling his goods.

Stage 4: Storing
In this stage all the goods that have not been sold and remained in the shops will be flipped to the other side ( Black and white side) and will soon be expired. It means that , if they are not sold the next day,they will be removed feom the shop without receiving any amount of money and will be returned to the bag.

Stage 5: Movement of the day tracker token

End of the Game:
The game will be finished on the 5th day after the end of the sale.

—description from the designer

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2014
description:
Magic 2014 was released on July 19, 2013. The tagline for the set is "Ignite your Spark." As Bolas was the mascot of M13, Chandra was the mascot of M14. The returning mechanic of Magic 2014 is Slivers, a series of creatures of which each grants an ability to each Sliver.

Magic 2014 marked a change to the Legend rule. It made the "Indestructible" effect a keyword, and changed the phrasing for unblockable creatures to "can't be blocked." Slivers in Magic 2014 also worked subtly differently from Slivers in earlier Magic; they now only affected Slivers owned by the same controller, rather than all Slivers in the game. Slivers also received an art redesign that de-emphasized their original beak-headed, one-clawed, one-tailed insect-like appearance, and instead became monstrous humanoids whose appearance varied heavily by card, but had "normal" features such as faces and eyes. This redesign proved controversial; one reviewer noted "slivers are one of the most iconic designs in all of Magic: The Gathering. To essentially muddle them down into just another humanoid monster thing is really disappointing." Wizards of the Coast acknowledged the negative feedback, noting that some players disliked the new art style, and included a card in Magic 2015 that used the original Sliver appearance in Sliver Hive
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Last One Standing: The Battle Royale Board Game 2nd Edition
description:
In Last One Standing - The Battle Royale Board Game up to 8 players find themselves on an ever-shrinking map where they must move, loot and shoot their way to be the last one standing.

In the year 2026, a new reality television event has seized international attention called, Last One Standing. Participants from around the world compete for the title of world champion in this ultimate life or death battle. Last years event ended unexpectedly, so this year promises to be even better than ever! The competitors are parachuted onto an island where they will explore, loot, fight and kill for their own survival. Anyone can play, but in the end, only one can remain. Will you be the last one standing?

If you’re more of a team player, partner up and play the game in duos mode. Whatever the case may be, Last One Standing is your chance to experience the thrill of battle royale around the table.

Second Edition streamlines the rules, removing variable turn order from weight and instead adding in movement allowance. The Island Events are controlled by the amount of loot picked up instead of the the turn itself, providing more control to the players. In addition many cards were re-balanced.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Munchkin Temporary Tattoos
description:
Publisher's DescriptionMunchkin Temporary Tattoos

Each package includes:

2 copies of Cheat! (+2)
2 copies of Magic Missile (+2)
2 copies of Duck of Doom (+2)
2 copies of Loaded Die (+3)
2 copies of Super Munchkin (+2)
Official Tournament Rules

You may use these tattoos in any game of Munchkin or its sequels. You must be wearing the tattoo* and show it to the other players to use it. During combat, use one of the enclosed tattoos to get the bonus printed on that tattoo for your side, for that combat only. You may only use one tattoo (of any kind) per game unless you change sex. If you change sex you may use a second tattoo. You may not use more than two in a game no matter what.


On your skin.




OtherPart of the Munchkin series
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Crossroads of Heroes: Evil Sect
description:
The Evil Sect expansion adds a sixth character into the game. Whoever chooses to play as this character will start the game as an evil character and must destroy his opponents mercilessly or lure them to the side of evil!

Includes:
Evil Sect character card
Evil Sect Henchman
Basic Techniques (x3)
Evil Sect Signature Technique
Evil Sect Special Item
Evil Sect Favorite Food (x3)
Evil Sect Quick Reference Card (KS Version Only)
Evil Sect Duel Sleeve (KS Version Only)
Nemesis Token (x4)
Character Standee
Rules sheet

name: Bomb Squad #9
description:
Our fair city is under attack by militant anarchists and their nefarious time bombs. In response the Police Commissioner has selected you, our most expendable officers, to form Precinct 9's first Bomb Squad.

But it's not just the bombs you'll have to contend with. There's also the new sniffer dog that keeps setting them off, not to mention your back-stabbing colleagues who are all out for personal glory at your expense. Meanwhile the bombs keep on ticking down, one slip up means disaster, and someone keeps hiding the wire cutters!

Bomb Squad #9 is a game of bluffing and deduction, set against the slow ticking of a time bomb. Players search for the bomb and the wire cutters amongst nine face down cards. Each card has a special ability: allowing a second card to be seen (wire cutters, sniffer dog, metal detector), mixing the cards around (anarchist, panic), or just reacting to other cards (bomb, rat, can). On their turn, a player secretly looks at a card and declares it to the others. If they are not accused of lying, or if accused and acquitted, they get to perform the declared action. Certain combinations make the bomb explode, and if not defused the bomb explodes after six turns regardless. Bomb Squad #9 was derived as a combination and miniaturisation of Lost Legacy and Memory, but with a metal detector that actually beeps!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Print & Play

name: Time Bomb
description: Wind up the time bomb and the players toss the loudly ticking device amongst themselves. The player caught holding the device when it stops ticking and pops is eliminated from play. The sole surviving player is the winner.

name: Bite Night
description: Bite Night is a chaotic game for those who like action. First, players play cards from their hand face down onto a common pile, then they simultaneously flip over tiles and try to grab those which are best for them. At the end of the game, the played cards are executed in order and determine who can score how many points for which combination of tiles.

name: Black Sea Fleet 1914-1918
description:
DTP-style Wargame covering the naval war in the Black Sea in World War I.

Components include:

(1) 12-page rulebook, half of which is dedicated to Optional Rules, Designer Notes, Scenarios and a Unit Manifest.
(1) 11x17" color map
(2) Fleet Status Sheets
(1) Tables/Log sheet chart
(100) die-cut counters.

name: Pisces: A High-Stakes Fishing Competition
description:
The Pisces game is all about fishing, fish, and conservation. The goal is to obtain the maximum points by being the most successful at catching fish and receiving credit for implementing conservation measures to maintain a healthy population. Each fish follows a uniquely structured life cycle that models their real-world dynamics and susceptibility to overfishing, including snapper, tuna, sardines, sharks, mahi mahi, and crabs. Players select which fishing zone and species will present the best fishing opportunities each round. The availability of sea life to catch changes throughout the game, as the fish go through various life cycle stages and are harvested by the players. If they are abundant, they are easy to catch. But if they are overfished, it gets harder, just like in real life. Strategize to protect your stock from overfishing while collecting the boats and gear to tip the odds of a big catch!

-description from designers
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Modular Board, Passed Action Token, Random Production, Variable Set-up, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Pizza Party Throwdown
description:
Pizza Party Throwdown, the crazy new pizza toppings game! Players have 30 seconds to toss their “ingredients” onto the rotating pizza game board. It’s a rush against time to land your ingredients on the pizza before it finishes “baking!” Each player selects their color-coded ingredient – like pepperoni, peppers, mushrooms and of course, anchovies! Launch it onto the pizza using the special pizza chef launcher game piece.

Great for all ages! Three different challenges deliver various levels of difficulty, like trying to fill only half of your pizza, or land your ingredients on only one slice! Includes rotating pizza game board with built-in timer, four launchers and 32 ingredients.
—description from the publisher

In the game Pizza Party Throwdown there are three different ways to play but each one consists of players using catapult-like launchers to toss their ingredients onto the spinning cardboard pizza before the pizza stops spinning. In most cases, whoever has the most of their toppings on the pizza wins. Different play modes include simply having to put all of your toppings on the pizza first, putting all of your toppings on only one half of the pizza first, or putting two different toppings onto two different quarter sections of the pizza first.

name: Mauerhüpfer
description:
Mauerhüpfer takes the gameplay from Mensch ärgere Dich nicht — players moving their pawns along a track to a goal while landing on others to set them back — and puts a different spin on the game by zigzagging the movement track and giving players walls that they can hop over for shortcuts.

Your goal in Mauerhüpfer is to move your four pawns to the goal first. The movement track zigs and zags around five walls on the game board, with a starting space at the beginning of the track and two goal spaces at the end; land on a goal space by exact count, and that pawn exits the game, moving you closer to victory.

On a turn, roll two dice, then choose one of your pawns and move it a number of spaces equal to one die, then a number of spaces equal to the other. You can choose to move forward or backward on the track — or in both directions if you wish, with each die moving you in a different direction. The walls have the digits 1-6 on them, and if your pawn is next to a number that you rolled and you haven't used that die for movement, you can hop the pawn over that wall. Roll just right, and you can jump twice.

If you move in a single direction and your second move lands you on an opponent's pawn, you bump that pawn back to the starting area. If you move in both directions or hop over walls, you can possibly bump two opponents in the same turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ubongo! Junior Mitbringspiel
description: Ubongo Junior Mitbringspiel is a travel-sized version Ubongo Junior, with all players competing at the same time each round to place all of the animals on their board as quickly as possible. Whoever calls "Ubongo!" first keeps the card as a reward, and whoever ends up with the most cards wins! Two difficulty levels are included to help balance the challenge between skilled and novice players.

name: Okanagan: The Volcano & The Beaver Dam
description:
Two promos tiles for Okanagan: Valley of the Lakes.

The Volcano and the Beaver Dam are two Special territory tiles with the following rules:

Their sides can be connected to any type of territory.
The side of a territory tile is considered as closed when it is adjacent to the Volcano tile or the Beaver Dam tile.
When a player plays the Volcano or the Beaver Dam tile, instead of building a structure on it, the player must discard one of his available structures from his inventory


The volcano:
When a player plays the Volcano, he immediately chooses a special action from one of the 3 special action tiles available, applies its effect, and places it under its stack.

The Beaver Dam:
When a player plays the Beaver Dam, he immediately receives one reward token of his choice.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Magyar népmesék: A kártyajáték
description:
The card game of Hungarian folk tales can be played on two levels of difficulty. With the help of the starting game, even the very little ones can easily learn the rules, while the advanced version is made more exciting by the action cards for the older age group. The card game features well-known characters that are guaranteed to get cloudless minutes for the whole family.

Get the most points by collecting the heroes of folk tales and the tools that help them! But watch out! Dangerous companions of witches and devils can get in your way, but if you are skillful enough, you can trick them. The card game is a 120-card deck that you can use to deftly tactically cheat your fellow players.

A Magyar népmesék kártyajátéka kétféle nehézségi szinten játszható. A kezdőjáték segítségével már az egészen kicsik is könnyedén megtanulhatják a szabályokat, míg a haladó változatot az akció kártyák teszik izgalmasabbá az idősebb korosztály számára. A kártyajáték jól ismert karaktereket tartalmaz, mely garantáltan az egész család számára felhőtlen perceket szerez majd.

Szerezd Te a legtöbb pontot a népmesék hőseinek és az őket segítő eszközök összegyűjtésével! De vigyázz! A boszorkányok és az ördögök veszélyes társai az utadba állhatnak, de ha elég ügyes vagy, akkor kicselezheted őket. A kártyajáték egy 120 lapos pakli, amivel ügyesen taktikázva kicselezheted a játékos társaid.

name: The Mining Game
description:
Each player starts with $20 million and acquires mining leases. With skillful exploration, deposits of metal are discovered. Players compete for the available contracts to mine and sell the metal they have discovered. Players encounter variable metal selling prices during the life of their mines. The player who manages his operation well and earns the most money is the winner.
(summary from back of box)

From the front of the 1973 edition box: Devised by Dr. T. Jenkins, Senior Metalurgist Engineer with Australia's largest Mining Company.
A combination of skill, luck and decision making is required to play the Mining Game, which, for the first time gives na insight into operations of the Mining Industry. Suitable for ages 12 years to adult.

name: Think Twice
description: A easy to learn little dice game that asks you to Think Twice before you re-roll your dice. The game shares some similarities with Yahtzee and Cosmic Wimpout. You get 3 rolls of 6 6-sided dice and one special category dice. If you use all of your dice, your score doubles. If your dice match your category (high, low, same, different, odd, even) then your score doubles again. Once this score is made, you may chose to roll the Multiplier Dice. The Multiplier Dice will come up with 1,2,or 3, and this number is multiplied by your current score, but be careful, the multiplier die also has a 0.

name: UNO Tiki Twist
description:
An interesting variant on the classic UNO theme in which players spin a tiki idol to learn their destiny! The mischievous tiki idol has taken over the game and whoever he points to must obey his commands. Sometimes he will be kind, allowing you to discard certain cards; other times he will be cruel, asking you to pick up even more cards!

Sixteen unique action cards add unpredictability to every round.

Like other UNO games, the first player to get rid of all their cards wins the round. Points in rounds accumulate and the first player to reach 500 points wins!

name: Crosswords
description:
From the box:

The object of the game is to be the first to complete one's personalized crossword grid. Players move around the grid-shaped board by throwing the dice and correctly answering crossword-type clues. Players can move around the board in any direction. Along the outer [edge] of the board are 8 green squares. It is by landing on these squares that the player has the opportunity to answer a clue and fill in his/her own personal grid.

A handicapping system is presented to make the game more challenging depending on each player's level of expertise.

name: Wir füttern die kleinen Nilpferde
description:
Children roll and move among the hippos. When their move ends in front of a hippo, they feed it (give away one of their eleven chips). When they meet another child, they can give it one chip. The first child to run out of chips is the winner. A hippo that has eaten five chips falls asleep and doesn't accept more food.

Spiel des Jahres special award winner in 1983.
publishers: Edition Perlhuhn (Göttinger Spiele), Fagus, Namibian Games

name: Charlie Brown's All Stars
description:
From the box:

Here's a way to enjoy all the fun and excitement of Baseball right in your home...and there's no chance of hitting a ball through a window!because it's all played on your table top.There's a colourful baseball diamond featuring Charlie Brown and his friends and you can make a home run,score e triple,or even foul out!
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: The European Countries
description:
Game description from the publisher:

From one end to the other, the journey goes up and down through the 51 countries of Europe. No wonder the tourists no longer know where they are. Who can, guided by some hints, guess where they are at a given moment? The quicker you guess correctly, the more points you score.

In The European Countries, the player who knows Europe best and is the first to travel around the continent with his tourist wins the game. The game includes a variant for European experts.

name: Molino Del Rey: Gateway to Mexico City
description:
In August 1847, Winfield Scott’s US Army was at the gates of Mexico City after a string of victories over Santa Anna. However, Scott paused to negotiate. Both sides used the delay to regroup, but when Scott heard a rumor that the Mexicans were casting cannon (true) at Molino del Rey (false), he resolved to take the place. The Mexicans saw it coming and prepared their defenses. The result was a narrow but costly American win that left the city's defenses intact. A quicker victory might have pushed into the city and ended the war.

Game Contents:
• 11 x 17” map
• 40 die-cut counters
• Scenario Instructions
• Four page rule booklet

Scale:
• Level: Regiment
• Hex: 352 yards

name: Bubbly
description:
