The life of a soap bubble is not easy. Small and brave, it tries to fly as long as possible, fighting against the elements that surround it.

In Bubbly, you take turns playing as a soap bubble. As a bubble, your goal is to stay in the air as long as possible. Meanwhile, your opponents have no goal other than to knock you down. To do this, they play cards to create a path. You have to manage your hand as best you can to keep moving forward, at the risk of falling dangerously close to the ground. To go up or straight, you need to play a matching card; to descend, you can play any color.

The bubble that goes the furthest is declared the winner! Bluff your opponents to avoid showing your weaknesses and fly to victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Pass the Gas
description:
Players toss out ballast cards of varying weights and rise
by corresponding amounts, racing to be the first to reach the altitude goal. But a throw is also a "to-hit" roll which may go into another's balloon and force it downwards. In addition, it may hit a crewmember, knocking them out yet causing the target balloon to once again rise.

name: War of the Ring: The Game of Middle Earth
description:
Players command the forces of Gondor and Mordor to decide the fate of Middle Earth. The game involves the quest of the fellowship and the military situation simultaneously.

As the game was not properly licensed, it was quickly pulled from distribution and is, as a result, quite rare.

(Description from the Diplomacy Boardgame Compendium and Gallery)

This game is based on the basic game mechanics of Diplomacy (moves, holds, supports and convoys), but is set in Tolkien's world of Middle Earth. The game is played either by two opponents or four players (two per team, one controlling armies and fleets and one controlling the other individuals). Because the game is intended to be played by two opponents (a person or a team), the one part of the traditional game of Diplomacy that is not preserved in this game is the diplomacy itself.

Despite the lack of negotiations, the basic game mechanics are taken from Diplomacy but with a number of extensions or modifications. Armies and fleets are supported by supply centers, but can have single, double, or triple strength. In addition to armies and fleets, there are a number of characters/roles, such as Gandalf, Strider, The Ringbearer, and the Nazgul, each of which has certain attributes or abilities (for example some characters increase the strength of the army they accompany). There are a variety of special rules regarding terrain, as well as victory points given in special circumstances such as The Ringbearer getting to Mount Doom, a Nazgul with the Ring getting to Barad-Dur, the Ring being captured by Mordor's strongest army, and others.
categories: Bluffing, Fantasy, Negotiation, Novel-based, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Finger-Flick Sports: All-American Edition
description:
The All-American Edition contains three games: Finger-Flick Baseball, Finger-Flick Football and Finger-Flick Basketball.

In Finger-Flick Baseball, the batter flicks a disk from home plate trying to hit specific targets representing base hits. If he hits into the field away from any target, then the defender tries to flick the disk to an "out" target.

In Finger-Flick Basketball, the offensive team tries to pass the ball to their players and then shoot it into their basket. The defensive players attempt to stop their opponent from completing passes and taking shots.

In Finger-Flick Football, the offense tries to flick the ball to their players, moving down the field until scoring a touchdown or field goal. The defense's object is to knock the offensive player off his player targets and prevent him from scoring.

name: There and Back Again
description:
West Coast Games' name for their fantasy adventure game based on The Hobbit. The player attempts to maneuver the company on the playing map to the Lonely Mountain and back again to Rivendell. It is up to you which paths you take and how you handle the encounters.

Per an advertisement for the game, it included "a four-color playing map, 100 back-printed counters each representing a single character or creature, 12 page rule booklet."

name: The Conquest of Space
description:
The board displays thirty planets which are randomly connected by "warps" (the warps change each game). The game generally involves moving to planets with raw materials and transporting the raw materials to your home planet (or in some scenarios, to any home planet). Combat can occur between ships that arrive at the same planet, and some scenarios are conflict oriented. The game includes seven scenarios. The raw materials and ships are represented by translucent plastic chips of various colors.

And remember, the "shortest player goes first."
categories: Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Set-up

name: They Met At Gettysburg
description: A game on the Battle of Gettysburg, July, 1863. System is loosely based on the area movement games from Avalon Hill (Storm over Arnhem, Thunder at Cassino, Turning Point: Stalingrad and Breakout Normandy). 22x34" area map, 352 large die-cut counters, player-aid cards and rules. Game turns represent 2 hours, units are brigades. Sister game to Bloodiest Day: The Battle of Antietam September 17, 1862 (Antietam).
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Was fehlt denn da?
description:
With this release Adlung Spiele has made a card game version of the old game "Kim's game". The deck consists of 60 cards and on each card there is a different picture, eg. a city, a mug, a bike etc... One player places a number of cards on the table (the more cards, the more difficult). The other players study the cards for 30-60 seconds, then they close their eyes. The dealer turns one card over and on the count of three the other players can open their eyes and try to remember what's pictured on the flipped card. The first player to shout out the correct picture on the flipped card gets it. Get the most cards and win the game.

This game can of course be played with anything (a standard deck of cards, toys, kitchen utensils etc.) but it's more fun with a dedicated deck and since it is packed in a real small box it can be taken everywhere.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game, Real-time

name: Affenzahn
description:
Affenzahn depicts racing monkeys, using oranges as a scoring theme (do well, and gain oranges; react poorly, and lose oranges). Players each receive four cards, corresponding to themselves and the other three racers in the game (rules are included for 2 and 3 players). Players
also start with 5 oranges in their provisions (tracked on a scorepad). A neutral party begins to flip over the remaining cards one by one. Some are Way cards (no effect; anyone playing cards loses an orange), some are good actions (gain oranges), and some are bad (lose oranges).
The action cards contain ranking(s) (1st, 2nd, 3rd, or 4th), and the corresponding gain or loss for each ranking. When one of these actions comes up, players play one or two cards into a central area. These cards are then picked up and sorted through by the neutral players, discarding the second and succeeding instances of a given racer's card
(so, if the corresponding cards played were racers 1, 3, 1, 1, 4, 3, 2, 2, the order for card resolution would be 1, 3, 4, 2). The players corresponding to the played cards' rankings then either gain or lose oranges based on the ranks shown on the action card. The player with the most oranges after races equal to the number of players wins.

name: Petrol
description: You are a manager of an oil company and have to produce as much oil as possible, transport it and then sell it.

name: Millennium Wars: Iraq
description:
Millennium Wars; Iraq is a Games Magazine 100 Honoree for 2004. It is a series of strategic-level, two-player simulations of possible current and near-future conflicts.

Millennium Wars: Iraq, is a simulation of the Iraq War.

Contents:
140 Double-sided, full-color die-cut counters
One 11" x 17" Full-Color Map
One Twelve-Page Rulebook
One eight-page Tables reference book
One four-page Scenario book

The rules cover information warfare, air superiority, random events, political events and special ops, in addition to strategic movement, combat, reinforcements.

Expanded by:

Millennium Wars: Air War

name: Car Tricks
description:
Car Tricks is a unique car racing game in that no one person controls a specific car. Instead, players try to predict the entire order of finish for all the cars in the race. All players can influence the speed of a car through their card play. Cards are played in tricks that are used to determine what car can move that round, how far it will move, who will drive the car, and finally what player will lead to the next trick. The track itself is far from any ordinary race track with various short cuts and back tracks scattered throughout the circuit allowing for drivers of the cars to have quite a bit of control over their progress. In the end, the player that most closely predicted the finishing order of each car will emerge victoriously.


A note about how to "short cut" a homemade version:
Use the cars from Knizia's Formula Motor Racing game and the cards from Sticheln. Using the cards from Sticheln is a real time and work saver! Granted, they won't have the cool race car look but it's a nice trade off if you have the game sitting around.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Dioxoid
description:
From the rules:

Dioxoid is a game of chain reactions. Inside an oxygen molecule, two players bounce their electrons against each other to surround the opponent's nucleus. A single action may cause a reaction that advances or disrupts every electron, changing the entire game.

Description:

Dioxoid is an abstract strategy game. Each player has eight identical pieces which represent electrons. These move one space at a time. When an electron moves adjacent to any other electron, the non-moving electron is repelled and must move away; if it cannot, the moving electron moves away. The repelled electrons may cause others to move, etc. The object is to get all of one's own electrons into the opponent's starting spaces.

name: St. George's Valour
description: This game has two editions/printings. The second printing is from High Flying Dice games, and is a print on demand game, with improved graphics. Previously, this was a desktop-publishing game from Minden Games, Panzerschreck Magazine issue #8. This game covers the 1918 British commando raid on the German naval base at Zeebrugge. The player represents the commandos, and the game has rules governing the reaction of the German defenders. As with all Panzerschreck games, all components must be mounted and cut out prior to play.
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Minden Games

name: Dream House TV Home Game
description: Based on the game show that aired from 1968 to 1970, Dream House was a general information quiz where any player who gives a correct response to a question may not answer the next. After ten questions, the Catch-Up round begins where each team may answer one last question for 10 to 50 points. The winner gets a card representing a room of furniture, and the first to earn seven rooms wins the game. Players "buzz-in" using metal clickers.

name: Basic Fighter Combat Manual
description:
The Basic Fighter Combat Manual is a WWII air-to-air combat simulation published by Lou Zocchi in 1976. According to the author, Basic Fighter Combat is intended as a training device for Gamescience's Advanced Fighter Combat Game.

Planes included the basic game: SPITFIRE, P-51 MUSTANG, P-40 KITTYHAWK, F4F-3 WILDCAT, BF 109 E-3, Me 262 SCHWALBE, MACCHI 202 FOLGORE, Kl-43 OSCAR VAL AND SHTURMOVIK. Two expansion sets: Advance Fighter Combat Game as well as the 2012 Expansion Bomber Fleet adds to the system.

The game requires a D20 zero to nine twice die to play the game as well. This was sold separately directly from Gamescience.

Fighter Combat bears similarity to the earlier Gamescience title Alien Space. The compass rose airplane squares, printed on red construction paper, are very similar to the starship squares that were used in Alien Space.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Jubilée: Dieppe 1942
description:
The game was released in 1992, the 50th anniversary of the allied raid on Dieppe. Historically, the raid was a disaster, but also a useful experience when it was time to plan the landing in Normandy in 1944.

The game is fairly standard hex-and-counter with 130 combat unit counters and a mounted mapboard, and the system includes Zones of Control that stops movement (except for tanks) and an odds-based Combat Results Table.

name: Krokodil unterm Bett
description:
There are 24 wooden discs with a drawing on one side (cat, flashlight, owl, mouse spider...). There are two boards with an illustration of shoreline with a boat and a part of a garden. By selecting one of the boards or combining them there are 6 to 24 possible 'hiding' places (places where you can put the markers).

All the markers are put face-up on the board. Everybody makes up some stories for himself about the placement. All markers are turned face-down.

In turn each player tells one of his stories and turns over the corresponding marker. If he is correct, he can point to another marker and the next player must tell a story relating to that marker (and so on). If the marker does not correspond to the story, a wooden crocodile is placed on the markers. This marker may not be selected.

Whoever remembered the most markers correctly wins the game.

name: Volé
description:
You take the tricks you won and build them into sets. If you build enough sets to make your bid, you score big. Otherwise you go in the hole.
A Combination of Rummy and Euchre.
A special deck of 48 cards, scorepad, and rules.

name: Fall of Constantinople
description:
Fall of Constantinople was published in Panzerschreck Magazine #6 (Summer, 2001). The game consists of an 8.5 x 11 inch map, several dozen colorful but unmounted counters, and twelve pages of rules. The rules include many examples of play, several optional rules (among them two-player possibilities), and designer notes.

From the introduction:
Fall of Constantinople is a solitaire game about the climatic battle, following weeks of assaults and bombardments, that occurred during the great siege of 1453. The gamer commands the Ottoman Turks, and the system plays the Byzantine Christian defenders.

Can YOU create the decisive breakthrough needed to overcome the wearied defenders of Constantinople? Or will your siege be lifted once and for all? Play Fall of Constantinople and find out for yourself!

name: Cemetery Hill
description:
Cemetery Hill is an expansion for Advanced Squad Leader that uses the Platoon Leader campaign game system. The campaign depicts the fighting on Crete between Greek/New Zealand troops and German Fallschirmjager for the Galatas Hills. It includes a sheet of color overlays, new Reinforcement Group Charts depicting the Allied and German units, and a Platoon Leader chapter divider. (Platoon Leader is a system for playing ASL using a series of interrelated scenarios referred to as a Campaign Game).

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The Complete Mancala Games Book
description: This book features a foreword by Alex deVoogt and has rules for a wide range of two-row, three-row and four-row Mancala games. Some nice colour pictures of Mancala sets are included.

name: Carolina Rebels
description:
Cowpens and Hobkirk’s Hill; South Carolina 1781

Carolina Rebels is BSO’s follow-up to their popular “Civil War Tactical System” game, Louisiana Tigers, this time a company-level American Revolution gaming at a scale of 40 yards per hex and about 50 men per counter/unit.

Carolina Rebels emphasizes the limits of command, training, and discipline, all in the milieu of the very linear style of warfare in the pre-Napoleonic era. The system allows players to choose their method of approach and their style of combat. Will they go into close order, or spread our for better fire possibilities. What are the pros and cons of the rifle-armed American militia? Can your dragoon forces exert any influence?

Carolina Rebels contains a high amount of tactical detail, all in a very short group of rules, designed for quick learning and fast, easy play.

The two battles chosen highlight small tactics towards the end of the war, where both sides had ample opportunities to watch, learn and practice, with an emphasis on Formation. Some of the great commanders of the war, from Nathanial Greene to Daniel Morgan to the infamous, but capable, Banastre Tarleton are in full action at the surprisingly even battles at both Cowpens and Hobkirk’s Hill.

Carolina Rebels is designed for quick learning and easy play, using a system that has almost unlimited possibilities. Game rules are short, but there are lots of charts and tables to cover every aspect of battle at this micro level. The combat rules, covering both ranged fire as well as bayonet shock, will seem familiar, yet different. Playing time is less than 2 hours.

Each game of Carolina Rebels includes Rules, one sheet of Mike Lemick’s, colorful cut-and-paste counters, and 2 spiffy Bill Ramsay maps (in 4 sections).

Carolina Rebels was a nominee in the Charles S. Roberts awards for Best DTP-Produced Boardgame (Charles S. Roberts Awards) for 2005.

name: Panzerfaust: Armored Fist
description:
(The entry currently only has details for the 4th edition.)

If you would like a free PDF copy of the 4th edition rules, please see the Web Links section below.

Now featuring compulsory troop classes and morale ratings which give each nation an historical flavor, eg a small elite-veteran force of SS will outmaneuver and out shoot a larger reliable-conscript Soviet force which must use numbers to try to overwhelm the enemy. The morale system is now somewhat brutal, and there is an effective command-control system where each company HQ throws one movement-pip dice. Players purchase and field companies, though these can be 'ad-hoc' companies made up of platoons from different sources. The extremely detailed armor and gun charts have been completely re-written including footnotes notes on every item. Also soft skin and truck-mounted gun charts, and very detailed army and equipment lists for all thirteen nations. Usable with 1/300th, 1/76th or 15mm scales, these rules have a 1:1 ratio, though infantry are based in fire teams/crews. Infantry fire-fights are quickly resolved and require only 1 dice thrown per group of combatants, with casualties being complete teams. The nations covered are Belgium, Britain, Finland, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Japan, Poland, Romania, Soviet, US Europe and US Pacific. These rules are complete, no future supplements or expansions will be needed. Page count has increased from 70 to 121 pages. The rules are not full of glossy color photos, however, when it comes to content, they are without compare. Panzerfaust Armored Fist covers all thirteen major nations, for the entire course of the war, with complete equipment lists with years of service and rarity, complete tank charts, guns charts, soft skin charts, and very detailed organizational charts.

name: Tree of Knowledge
description:
The Tree of Knowledge is a Biblical question and answer game that includes over 750 charades and over 750 general knowledge questions.

Players or teams seek to collect all fruits of the spirit cards by answering questions and doing charades.

Players move about the tree going from branch to branch to acquire all the different types i.e. Joy, Kindness.... etc. The game involves rolling a dice and getting the following possibilities

1) People and Places question
2) Numbers question
3) Bible question
4) General Knowledge Question
5) Charades
6) Or Roll again.
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Fairly Tales
description:
Poison apples, beanstalks, and circumlocution for two or more storytellers.

Object: To guess words chosen by the other players from a fairy tale while keeping yours secret.

You Need: Pencil and paper for each player

Once everyone has pencils, paper, and magic beans, choose a fairy tale for the game. Once a fairy tale has been selected, each player needs to write down five words commonly associated with that tale.

The object of the game is to get the other players to say their secret words by asking questions and through general conversation. Once the game has started, you must not speak your own secret words.

On your turn, pick a person and ask him a question about the story. He has to answer it. Remember, not only is your subject not allowed to use his or her secret words, but you aren’t allowed to use your secret words either.

At the beginning of your turn, you may instead pass your turn. If all of the players in the game but one pass their turns in one round, then the game ends.

At the end of the game, jot down what you think each player’s secret words are. Take turns declaring your secret word guesses. Score one point for every correct guess. Score a point for every one of your secret words that no other player guessed. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Lest Best
description:
The game consists of a L-shaped frame on which 16 rings are distributed over 4 curved bars that connect the two sides of the frame (1,3,5 and 7 rings).

The game starts with all rings on the same side. A player then chooses on of the bars, and slides a number of rings of his choice to the other side (minimum one). Play alternates between the players, until one player is forced to move the final remaining ring thus loosing the game.

Overall winner is the player with most wins after 5 games.
publishers: MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Nomina
description: Abstract strategy for 1 to 6 players

name: Menuette
description: This card game was available just after World War II, the object being to gather a hand of cards comprising eight components of a meal, each component (roll, soup, fish, entree, green vegetable, potato, dessert, drink) having different values, and the highest-scoring meal winning the game.
publishers: Instruct UK Resources Ltd, Pepys (Castell Brothers)

name: Die! Die! Bang!
description:
Each player is one of five Alliances (a criminal organization) and undertakes various crimes in order to receive a reward.

Each player has a scoreboard (which records their 'crime', 'information', 'battle' and 'reward'), Alliance card and Karma table. A Boss is selected (the player with the most criminal convictions!). The Boss selects three Karma cards, takes one and passes two to the player on the left. The process is repeated until all players have two cards. All players roll the dice and place a mission card in the corresponding numbered area.

Players place Alliance cards next to the missions they select. Where more than one player attempts a mission they simultaneously show a thumbs up/thumbs down sign to declare whether they will co-operate or fight. If players co-operate they divide the reward. If players fight they divide into the groups, all who voted to co-operate (if any) are one group, fighters become separate groups of one. Battles are determines by dice roll plus Battle influence. The winner takes the reward. The first player to collect ten rewards wins the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Karee
description: Up to four players collect animal tiles and attempt to cover these with 'gates' during the game. Uncovered tiles can be taken by other players. Winner is the player who accumulated the most loose tiles or "Karee's" (4 equal tiles).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Monster Party
description:
From rules:
It's time of festivity and the monster is ready to scare all! But a true festivity must have cakies, here why the monster asking it at all the neighbors... but they must be attention to where they go! The vampiro cannot tolerate the garlic, mummia the scissors , the monster is in a position to instill terror but everyone of they fears something! The player who collect a cake from every neighbor will be the winner.
publishers: Hasbro, MB Giochi, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Code Casablanca
description: A game of secret documents and spies. Players try to decipher encoded messages, but have to be careful. There are five false documents in the game; getting information means finding the right documents. Ages 12 years and up.

name: 河井継之助 最後の賭け (Tsuginosuke Kawai's Last Gamble)
description:
Original game published in Command Magazine Japan #61 in 2005, as a companion to Hougoumont: Rock of Waterloo. Designed as a mini-game, it details the Battle of Hokuetsu in 1867 (Bakumatsu era) between the shogunate forces and the imperial forces in Niigata prefecture.

The game uses point to point map and chit activation mechanics.
This is the fourth game of 60 series, which can be played with only 60 counters and in 60 minutes.

The victory is determined by victory points, which are gained by important locations control. The Aizu alliance wins if it scores 1 VP; the Meiji government army wins if it earns 5 VP. All other results are a draw.

Contents:

1 map
60 counters
4 pages rulebook




河井継之助 (Tsuginosuke Kawai) was a Samurai:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawai_Tsugunosuke最後の賭け: last gamble
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Point to Point Movement

name: Tribes of the Four Seasons
description:
Each player represents a tribe that is striving to have the most influence over the resources available to the various settlements of the land.

The aim of the game is to have the tribe that exerts the most control over the resources of the settlements at the end of the game. The four tribes are Winter, Autumn, Summer, and Spring. Each tribe is good at using one specific type of resource, so needs to gather as much of the other 3 resources as possible. The resources are water (white snowflake), wood (orange leaf), animals (purple fish) and grain (light blue flower).

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for the piecepack four seasons expansion.

name: Jigquiz
description:
A superb question and answer game. Very good for language development. Two packs of cards - letter cards and question cards. Ideal for the whole family to play.
Jigquiz may also be played as a group activity with everyone writing down their answers to 10 or 20 questions.
A good game to keep in the glove box of the car to play while traveling.

name: Operations of SS Panzer Abteilung 102 in the Normandy Campaign
description:
Operations of SS Panzer Abteilung 102 in the Normandy is one of the first (or THE first?) Critical Hit modules for ASL. It is a campaign game, yet not based on Critical Hit's Platoon Leader system.

Contents:
- 4 pages of rules
- 1 large overlay (of Hill 112 - half an ASL board)
- 12 unmounted Tiger counters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Unauthorized Dr. Who CCG
description:
A fan created free to print CCG based on Dr Who (not related in anyway to the Doctor Who Collectible Card Game published by M.M.G. Ltd.)

From the website:
In the spirit of Who, the villains (Enemies) attempt to reach Goals played on Spacetime cards to score points. Meanwhile, the Doctor and his Allies try to stop them and score those points first. Each player plays both his own TARDIS crew and the Enemies their opponent’s TARDIS will face. First player to 10 points (and Reaching and Opposing at least one Goal) wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: The Lieutenant
description: This children's combat town game for Ages 8 - 15 was based upon the 1960s short-lived television series written by Star Trek creator Gene Roddenberry. The television show was a Marine Corps drama set at Camp Pendleton. The game comes with a game board, a small campaign map, a set of cards, spinners, and small cardboard tanks and riflemen.
categories: Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: Bockige Esel
description:
A hardly known Tom Schoeps game. Each player tries controls a donkey and tries to get his oranges into town first (because the earlier you arrive the better the prices are...).
On your turn you can move forward which costs one food. Distance is 1-6 depending on the space you are starting from. Second possibility is to move one space backwards which gets you one food. Each player also gets a set of tactical cards that allow to manipulate the distance a bit.
Games reminds a bit of Hare and Tortoise, but has got enough elements to be an 'independent' game.

name: Biloba
description:
Equipment:

* 9x9 board with 3 spaces removed from each corner and the center space marked (diagram on website)
* 16 stones per player

On each turn, each player moves one friendly stone. A stone may move to an (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent empty cell. If a stone moves to the center cell, it must move again to an adjacent empty cell (no stone may stay at the center). A stone may also jump over one stone (of either color) landing on the immediate next empty cell.

Captures are custodian, i.e., an enemy stone is captured when sandwiched between two friendly stones (orthogonal or diagonal). After the removal of the captured stone, one of the two friendly stones must move to occupy the captured stone position. Captures can be multiple (more than one custodian captures in the same move) Captures can also create a chain reaction, i.e., the friendly moved stone after the capture may produce another capture, and so on...

A player loses if, at the beginning of his turn, he has less than three stones and is unable to capture enemy stones so that his opponent also have less than three stones. In this later case, the game is a draw.

name: CirKle Duo228
description:
Quick, simple luck-driven card/dice-gambling game. As part of the Series: Cirkle, dice and cards have the same symbols (cross, circle, square, triangle) and colours (yellow, green, purple, blue) as each of these games, plus one added colour (black) and symbol (target).
Of each symbol/colour-combination there is one of the 24 Cards and it is on one of the total 24 sides of the dice.
The game is played in 3 rounds, “attacking” player (with the dice) and “defending” player (with the cards) changing roles.
At the first round the defending player gets all the cards, chooses 4 of them and places them in front of him. The attacking player now throws his 4 dice three times and gets all the matching cards and the points on them. The cards still on the table go to the “defending” player. After 6 times, the cards are used up, and both players count their score.
The second round players change roles.
After this, the player with the higher score decides, which player gets which role in the third round. Who wins this third round, wins the whole game. In a variant, players play only two rounds and the higher total score determines the winner.

There are more rules available, one kind of “Yahtzee”, and one tactical “memory”-variant, using only the dice or the cards.

name: Snarfquest Expansion 1 (Suthaze)
description:
An expansion for the first edition of Snarf Quest.

This expansion pack includes 20 cards (2 each of 10 new card designs) including the evil wizard Suthaze, also provided as a miniature.

Available with blue, black, white, red or yellow borders.

Expands:

Snarf Quest
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval

name: Snarfquest Expansion 3 (Aveeare)
description:
An expansion for the first edition of Snarf Quest.

This expansion pack includes 20 cards (2 each of 10 new card designs) including the robot Aveeare, also provided as a miniature.

Available with blue, black, white, red or yellow borders.

Expands:

Snarf Quest
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval

name: Snarfquest Expansion 4 (Raffendorf)
description:
An expansion for the first edition of Snarf Quest.

This expansion pack includes 20 cards (2 each of 10 new card designs) including the transformed prince Raffendorf the Rat, also provided as a miniature.

Available with black, blue, white, red and yellow borders.

Expands:

Snarf Quest
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval

name: Mutant Ninja Hero Turtles Pizza-Pets-Pats
description: In this game your target is to get a pizza complete with all sorts of vegetables available (6) and all sorts colors available (6). To get to this target, every player has to throw with two dices in their own turn. The color and vegetable on the pizza which have to be taken, will be made by the combination of dices. When the pizza piece in the game is still available. Everybody can start smashing on the piece, until a player has the piece.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Little Storm at Bedtime
description: It’s time for bed for Little Storm. Before he goes to sleep, he has a number of fun things to do. “Little Storm at Bedtime” is a game we have developed to promote good bedtime experiences. The game makes it possible for children and parents to talk about their own bedtime “rituals”.

name: Summoner Master
description:
This is a fantasy themed CCG from Thailand.

The inventors of this CCG called themselves "Phenomenon Party" and founded the Santo Nino Company Limited, who is publishing this game since December, 2000. Several pre-constructed decks as well as 2-3 booster expansion sets per year were issued since then.

The story of the game deals with 4 Kingdoms (Earth, Water, Wind and Fire Kingdom), but besides the characters from these kingdoms, there are also figures from the light and the dark universe.

The characters or monster cards are called as Seal cards and the supporting cards are called as Mystic cards. The Seal cards and Mystic cards can be indicated by its backside. The seal cards are blue and the mystic cards are red.

The types of Seal cards are described as the tribes or the class such as aria,bandits, beasts, dancers, divines, dragons, eggs, evils, insects, knights, machines, mages, merchants, monsters, musicians, scientists,Star, tamers and titans.

Mystic cards types such as relics, places, devas ,tarot,revelation (reveal events from God and surprise event.) and Star (Bless from stars) cards.

The complete rules can easily be found on the web, but they are only available in Thai.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Runaround
description:
In Runaround, your goal is to get your pieces out of your home, all the way around the board, and back again before your opponent. Sounds familiar, right? The twist is in the board: It's a "U" shaped board. Your pieces frequently pass your opponent's pieces on the other side of the wall. If your piece lands across the wall from one of your opponent's pieces, you swap places. Often, this'll jump you ahead and push your opponent back. As you play, you'll uncover a remarkable depth of strategy from this simple roll-and-move game.

Runaround is a game for two players. Runaround uses a six-sided die, five pawns per player, and a custom board. A two-player game takes about 40 minutes to play. Runaround is appropriate for ages 9 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Garibaldi. L'eroe dei due mondi
description: Garibaldi, l'eroe dei due mondi (2 Worlds hero)is a game published in the centenarian of the dead of Garibaldi (1882). This game has 3 of the less known battles of Garibaldi: Mentana, Digione and Salto di S.Antonio. Every battle has a different map and counters

name: Festival Climbers
description:
It is the season of celebration and it all starts when the young men of the village compete to ring the bell for
the honor of their families and to signal the start the festival. This ancient competition requires strength,
stamina and teamwork. Players will take the roll of a team of climbers that must race to the top of the
temple to start the celebration; they are bound by strict rules and are rewarded for how high on the temple
they are able to climb.

Free Game from Here: http://www.pyromythgames.com/free_games.html

name: Battles of the Middle Ages: Arsuf 1191
description:
Third game in the series, depicts the famous battle of the Third Crusade, where Richard I Lionheart defeated a Saracen force led by Saladin on the Mediterrean cost near Arsuf. It was a tactical victory for the Crusaders, that were however unable to retake Jerusalem.

4A4 full coloured map, more than 200 counters, 4 pages of rules

Available for download (it's a Print & play wargame) through Wargamedownloads.com

name: Spy express
description:
A free print and play dice game for two players. Roll special dice to find secrets dodge guards, suppress the alarm, and quickly too, because the clock is ticking!

On the web at:

http://www.bookranger.co.uk/SpyExpress/SpyExpress.htm

name: Oubliette
description:
Incarcerated and forgotten beneath the castle keep, four prisoners finally break out from their dank cells. The torch-lit catacombs shift magically, opening new paths for some and sealing off passages for others. Will you navigate the shifting tunnels and be the first to exit the oubliette to win your freedom?

Players will use cards to move themselves toward the exit, move their opponents away from the exit, and change the maze itself to suit their purposes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Mein großes Feuerwehr-Spiel
description: The players take the role of brave firefighters and who set out on various missions. The player who wins the majority of the assignments, is the winner. The game also provides interesting facts about the fire department. The game targets children's concentration, motor skills and thinking. The game is part of Ravensburger's 'Wieso? Weshalb? Warum?'-line.

name: Speedy
description: This game is about mice. The start player points at a card and all players try to find out which mouse is missing. The first, that names the correct color of the missing mouse, may retain the card. He, who has most cards at the end, wins the game.

name: Minimisère
description:
This game is played with a part of a standard deck of cards. Depending on the number of players, some cards are removed. Then tricks are played. The uniqueness of the game is that the score depends on the number of tricks won in a strange way. For example with five players there are five tricks, and the score is 1 for winning 1 trick, 2 for 2 tricks, 5 for 0 tricks, 6 for 3 tricks, 8 for 4 tricks and 0 for 5 tricks.

More information can be found at https://www.parlettgames.uk/oricards/minimis.html

name: Tracunhaém Disaster: Wargame in Brazilian Colonial Era
description:
Português : Tragédia de Tracunhaém é um wargame a nivel tático para dois jogadores que reproduz o ataque ao engenho perto de Tracunhaém. O jogo é para jogadores de wargame iniciantes com regras fáceis de asimilar e que permite o entendimento e a entrada neste estilo de jogo. Composto por um livreto de regras, mapa, tabelas e peças de jogo, inaugura nossa série Bellum Brasilis.

English : Tracunhaen´s Slaughter is a tactic wargame (platoon level), for 2 players. The game recreates the slaughter what 2000 potiguares indians attacks the "Tracunhaem´s Engenho" (Tracunhaem´s Sugarmill) and kill all Portuguese colonists and slaves. The main objective for Portuguese player is resist for 8 turns against the indians. The objective for indian player is kill all colonists and slaves. The game is for novice wargamers, easy rules and short time of play.

During the period of colonization of Brazil, in the year 1534, there was an incident known as Tragédia de Tracunhaém, in which Indians killed all the residents of a mill called Tracunhaém in Pernambuco. The justification for this attack was due to the kidnapping, followed by the disappearance of the chief Iniguassu’s daughter, after marrying a Mamluk adventurer. It was a requirement that both of them, after the wedding, remains in the Indian village, but this did not happen. Iniguassu’s first step was to send two of his sons to Olinda, in Pernambuco, to claim justice. Fortunately, they met on a visit to Pernambuco, the governor of Brazil, Antônio Salema, who ordered the beautiful Indian to return to her father’s house immediately. On the way back, they had to spend the night at Engenho Tracunhaém, by Diogo Dias. When dawn dawned, India disappeared, possibly hidden by Diogo Dias. His brothers complained a lot but did nothing and returned home without his sister.

Taking advantage of this, the French stationed in Paraíba instigated the Potiguares to revenge, and soon a contingent two thousand Indians of diverse Potiguares tribes marched against the mill. The Indians surrounded the fortified mill and used an unusual tactic: only a few Indians let themselves be seen to make it believe that it was the action of a small group. When the plantation’s defenders went out to counterattack, they were attacked by a crowd of Indians. The mill was burned, and it appears that only two family members survived because they were not at the mill. After this episode, other Itamaracá mills were also attacked, resulting in 614 deaths. This episode generalized the fear in the Portuguese settlers of the region.

It caused the king of Portugal to extinguish the captaincy of Itamaracá and create the captaincy of Paraíba, with limits from the mouth of the Popoca river to the Bay of Traição. In this way, it would protect the sugar industry, expelling the French, and expand the domain to the north of the Northeast region."

The Bellum Brasilis series was originally produced by the extinct Riachuelo Games and was directed to games at the tactical level, covering several episodes in the history of Brazil. This wargame is the first in the Voxelhouse Old School Wargames series.

—description from the publisher
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Felix Farbenschaf
description:
From the back of the box:

Conrad, the notorious colour sheep, is back in action! He eagerly dips his brush alternately into the red, the yellow, the blue, and the green paint pot: Conrad paints everything he has seen on his last trip – and that is quite a lot! Each of you gets three picture cards. Try and move Conrad to the paint pot cards and discard your card of the same colour. Be the first to discard all your cards and win the game!

name: Simpang Dago
description:
Simpang Dago in Bandung Indonesia is famous for its culinaries. Players act as professional food hunter, each looks for the best food in simpang Dago. At the same place "Angkot" is the King of the road, they can stop everywhere, block the whole road, and broke just in front of your nose. Even if you finally reach Simpang Dago, finding a parking slot on the forbidden area with a policeman just next in the corner is never been easy.

Simpang dago is the first Indonesian local boardgame for 2-4 players.Each player try to get the most delicious foods and try to send the others a bad one. It's easy to play but still providing deep strategy development for truly exciting game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Kunterbunte Autorelli
description: Get ready for the colourful soapbox race! Who will be the fastest today? This first games compendium playfully develops recognition and naming of colours and shapes as well as concentration and listening skills. In this racing game variously colored shapes (triangle, square, rectangle, round) move about the game board based on the roll of the two special dice. All of the shapes are in play no matter how many players are in the game, and three different games are included (on two different sides of the board) for kids of varying ages.

name: Borodino 1812
description:
The Battle of Borodino, fought on September 7, 1812, was the largest and bloodiest single-day action of the French invasion of Russia, involving more than 250,000 troops and resulting in at least 70,000 casualties. The French Grande Armée under Emperor Napoleon I attacked the Imperial Russian Army of General Mikhail Kutuzov near the village of Borodino, west of the town of Mozhaysk, and eventually captured the main positions on the battlefield, but failed to destroy the Russian army. About a third of Napoleon's soldiers were killed or wounded; Russian losses, while heavier, could be replaced due to Russia's large population.

The battle at Borodino was a pivotal point in the campaign, as it was the last offensive action fought by Napoleon in Russia. By withdrawing, the Russian army preserved its combat strength, eventually allowing them to force Napoleon out of the country.

Game allows to play either side and decide about the fate of Napoleon and his conquer of Russia.

name: The Salient of Fire. Kursk: 1943
description:
The Salient of Fire. Kursk - 1943 is about the the Manstein's offensive on the southern flank of the Kursk Bulge. The main task of the German player is to breakthrough three Soviet heavily fortified defensive lines near Oboyan. The Soviet player (the General Vatutin’s Voronezh Front) has to stop the elite German spearheads to prevent capturing Oboyan and famous rail station Prokhorovka using powerful reserves – 1st and 5th Guards Tank Armies. The game also includes the real historical scenario of the mighty tank clash near Prochorovka.

Game scale.
1 hex is 5 km.
1 turn is 1 day.
The counters represent regimental, battalion or brigade level units.

name: Wits & Wagers: Alan R. Moon Personality Card Promo
description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Alan R. Moon´s favorite questions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Gemischtes Doppel 3
description:
Gemischtes Doppel 3, the successor to Gemischtes Doppel and Gemischtes Doppel 2, is an unusual German memory-type game in which paired cards may look quite different as matching cards are connected through spoonerisms. Each card in a pair shows a word that is a similar-sounding anagram of the other card's word, with each word being accompanied by its own illustration.

The format originates in "the world's shortest column" (two words ... plus two pictures) from the weekly Süddeutsche Zeitung Magazin. The juxtaposition of incongruous concepts, the odd but perfectly understandable expressions for familiar concepts that often result on at least one side of the anagram, and the deadpan stock photography illustrations are all played for absurd humour.

This sort of memory based on playing with words is more difficult than the usual one. The funny images displaying these words add to the fun.

name: Vad ritar Picasso?
description:
How quickly can your teammates guess what you draw?
Stress, Laughter & nerve.
In 45 seconds you have to draw so the team can guess right. The words to be guessed and drawn is pulled out of a bag, and for every correct word you get to add the tiles on the board. The first team to 20 correct answers wins. But beware of the "art thief", he steals the tiles from your team if the other teampulls him from the bag.

name: 1955: The War of Espionage – Political Support Expansion
description:
The Political Support Expansion was given out exclusive to the 1955: The War of Espionage Kickstarter supportes.

It consists of a postcard printed on both sides with an optional rule for the game. On the backside is a timetable of the events of the year 1955.

The Rules

Setup
After setup, Place 2 cards from the Draw Deck face down on Political Support.

Trigger
Whenever a player Secures a Country, that Player immediately draws all card on Political Support into her hand. Then place 2 cards from the Draw Deck face down on Political Support.

Trigger
Whenever a Player plays a card with a name that starts with a B or D, immediately place 1 card from the Draw Deck face down on Political Support.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Tchuka Ruma
description:
Tchuka Ruma is a solitaire game from the mancala family, originated from around the Indian Ocean.

The aim is to get as many seeds as possible into the Ruma (the bigger hold/field.
Choosing a field, you plant the seed in classic mancala mode, going towards the Ruma and planting into it (and back if there are seeds left). Your next move depends on where the last seed was planted :
- In an empty field : game over, your score equals the number of seeds in the Ruma.
- In a small field : you must plant that field now, towards the Ruma.
- In the Ruma : you can choose any field to plant next.

The simplified version is played with two seeds in each field, the full version with six.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Farming, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Saaguan
description:
Saaguan is an abstract strategy game for 2 to 6 players designed by Andrew Cooke, an Englishman living in Yunnan, South China.

The game can be played in an hexagonal board of size 6 or in an octaboard each side 5 squares long. In both boards the outermost ring of the board is called corridor and the inner part is the arena.

Board starts empty.

In each turn, players can:

Add a triangular piece on the corridor, provided that it has less than 2 of his pieces already in there.
Move his pieces up to 3 times, being rotating them right or left (45º in the octaboard, 60º in the hexaboard) or advancing one house in the beam direction (pointing vertix).


A robot is eliminated when it has 3 robots pointing to it (imagine a beam coming out of its pointy vertix). Also, a robot is "locked" (hence can't be moved and its "beam" are disabled) when 2 robots are facing it.

The goal is to be the player who achieves the target score (2 - 6 players) or to eliminate all but 2 of the opponent's robots (2 players). Points are scored when eliminating enemy's robots.
mechanics: Line of Sight, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Dodéka
description:
In his turn, the player rolls the 3 x d12 dice and keeps what he wants. Then he may re-roll twice any dice.
The goal is score points for combinations:
f.e. pair scores 40 points, straigh scores 100 points, sum of 13 scores 250 points, three of a kind scores 500 points etc.
Game ends if any player has points 700 or more. He is the winner.
But if somebody gets combination sum of 13 including pair he wins the game immediately.

Contents:

3 x d12
45 chips
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Pioneer Rails
description:
The land is undiscovered...but pioneers will put roots down, and form outposts in areas with rich resources. But outposts are limited by the local resources they have available to them, and so, the railways begin to connect the outposts to trade with each other. Soon, outposts become towns, and then cities. How will your country develop?

A surprisingly simple game of country building, city connecting, and pick-up-and-delivering for one. The player places domino-like cards to create a map. Land cards indicate both natural resources and railways links. Outpost cards have both resource production abilities and resource demands. When placing outpost cards, gains resource cubes based the outpost's ability to produce a resource that matches the natural resources of neighboring land cards. If another outpost becomes linked to a another outpost via a connecte railway, and one outpost hHas a resource demand while the other has a matching production cube, then that resource can be delivered, increasing the recieving outpost to a town. A second delivery increases it to a city.

Designed for the 2012 print-and-play Solitaire Contest.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Tooth & Nail: Factions – Leadslinger Dogs of War Troop
description:
The Leadslinger Dogs of War Troop for Tooth & Nail: Factions is an additional Troop for the special Dogs of War faction. If playing Tooth & Nail: Factions with the Dogs of War faction, just add the stack of 5 Leadslinger cards during the setup per the regular Dogs of War rules. Just like the original four Troops in the mini-faction, this additional Troop acts as a soldier for hire within the game.

LEADSLINGER

Strength: 1
Action: Reaction: If an action would affect a single Troop, you choose what Troop it affects. Counts as any Tech Troop.
Troop Type: Tech
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Erwischt vermischt!
description:
Erwischt vermischt! is a party game which is played while doing other activities. It is based on the original game Erwischt! (aka J'te Gage Que... or I betcha...).

Each player receives a card with certain tasks which have to be fulfilled within a time frame upon which the players agree at the beginning.

In this version of the game the tasks are quirks which they have to adopt. The players have to identify the quirks of the other players. In order to prevent the other players from finding out the quirks from the card, the players have to adopt as many quirks as possible.

Players score points for identifying the right quirks of the other players and for their own quirks which haven't been identified. The player with the most points is the winner.

name: Prime Time: The Ratings Game
description:
PRIME TIME: The Ratings Game is a card game for 1-4 Players that puts you in charge of a major television network.

In PRIME TIME: The Ratings Game you are the head of a television network. It is up to you to create shows that will attract the highest ratings and beat out your rivals. At the start of the game your schedule is a blank slate. You will have to program shows for Monday to Friday night. You do this by programming (playing) cards onto the table. These cards represent the shows, actors, commercial breaks and more. At the end of the game, whoever has the highest rated shows on each night will “win” that night. Each night is worth points. The player with the most points wins the game.

Cast the actors, come up with special twists and don’t forget to program some commercials to pay for it all. What shows you create and when you program them are all up to you. Will you fight for the coveted Thursday night-time slot with a prestigious big budget show or try to tie up Monday and Tuesday nights with cheap programming? It’s up to you to take your network to the top of the charts and be the leader of Prime Time.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Andartes: The Greek Civil War 1947-49
description:
Wargame of the Greek Civil War, 1947-49. One of the few times a Communist-inspired insurgency was beaten by a Western government. Uses a development of game system used in several other insurgency situations (Algeria, Tupamaro and Shining Path).

Features include government political interference in how the Army is deployed and supplied, refugees, Balkan sanctuaries, and American support, and the Rebel player has the option of switching his forces to conventional warfare mode if he is confident (or desperate) enough to engage the Army in set-piece battles.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Bohnanza Schnupperspiel
description:
Bohnanza Schnupperspiel is a small, promotional copy of Bohnanza containing 54 cards.

Bohnanza is a card game in which you cannot rearrange your hand, thus having to play the cards in the order that you draw them. The aim of the game is to get coins by planting fields (sets) of the beans and then harvesting them. To help players collect sets, the game features extensive trading and deal making.

The Bohnanza Schnupperspiel was included in the Spielbox Magazine special Spiel '14 edition (Spielbox Sonderausgabe zur Spiel '14), which was distributed for free at Spiel '14.

name: The Mountain: A Solo Board Game Experience
description:
The Mountain is a board game experience for one player. It explores a pensive man's descent from a mountain from the moment he reaches the peak. You navigate the mountain while exploring the man's thoughts as he contemplates about the unknown abyss that lies exactly after his life's biggest accomplishment.

There are five exit points on the board, one for every element that will affect your journey - frost, sun, wind, sky and horizon. As you try and find the path down, you learn more about yourself through the story cards, divided into five different story lines that affect you as a protagonist.

However, the path down is not immediately obvious. Your movement subdues and stimulates the elements. If three or four elements are acting, you start suffering from ennui; a feeling that perhaps getting to the bottom of the mountain is not that important after all. If all five elements are raging, you will succumb to nature and die.

Traverse through the safest path and take care of yourself. This could be either the most important journey of your life, or your last.

Story Writing by - Johnathan Harrington, Mathew Agius Muscat, Fran Borg

name: Redshirts 3: Beating a Red Horse
description: Second expansion to the Redshirts base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Science Fiction

name: Was passt wohin?
description:
A game box forms a board that consist of tree, meadow and a lake.
And there is 14 chips that have pictures of animals, plants and things that child must put on the right spot of the board.
When all chips has been placed on their right spot on the board, the game ends.

Version for older kids, is that every of a two players has 4 spots on tree for himself, and chips are face down. Each player draws one chip and puts it on its place. Whoever puts chips on its 4 spot of a tree wins the game.
Harder version of a game is that all chips that are not placed on a tree are returned back face down next to unused chips.

name: Smic Smac
description:
Smic Smac, Collect the food cards to feed your hedgehog so they can sleep. Card game for 2-4 players. Includes 64 playing cards. Comes in a box with magnetic snap closure.

On your turn, turn over the food cards. If there are more hedgehogs awake than those drawn on the food cards, you may collect it. You may choose to hibernate your hedgehogs on your turn because when the 4 winter cards in the food cards open, the game ends and anyone with hedgehogs awake will lose! The player at that time with the most food will win.

1863 is a two player wargame of a pivotal year in the American Civil War. 1863 saw the Union victories at Gettysburg in the east and Vicksburg in the west, and the Chattanooga-Chickamauga campaigns when the Confederates had the opportunity to win a decisive battle and potentially gain foreign recognition.

Each player commands one of the two Theater of Operations; East and West. What makes this game unique is that one player commands the Union in the Eastern Theater, and the Confederates in the Western Theater; the second commands the Union in the Western Theater, and the Confederates in the Eastern Theater. Both players are competing to gain the most Victory Points in each Theater while defeating their opponent on the other.

The objective of each player is to score the most Victory Points in terms of seizing critical cities and winning battles. The idea is that you are positioning yourself for a major promotion for total command of all your side's armies for the rest of the war. Units represent corps, divisions and individual leaders with their staffs. Each turn is one month.

Published in S&T 297, Mar/Apr 2016
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame

name: Rummikub Kids Edition
description: A simplified variation on the classic Rummikub game of playing numbered tiles in sets and runs. Features 10 numbered tiles per suit rather than 13. It can be played at three levels of complexity: beginner, allowing runs or sets of two or more tiles with no jokers; intermediate, adding the jokers; and advanced, requiring sets and runs of at least three tiles as in regular Rummikub.

name: Cseresznyéskert
description:
Granny is preparing to make jam - but the fruit is still on the tree. In this fun board game kids collect cherry tokens cooperatively. They are not competing each other but the worms that want to get to the fruits faster. If the basket is full, the kids win!

Game play: the active player draws 3 cards. If a worm is shown, spin the worm spinner first to know which worm needs to be moved one step closer to the cherries. After this, move the pawns on neighbouring fields - of the color shown on the cards showing leaves. There are cherry tokens showing 1, 2 or 3 cherries. If any worm reaches a cherry token the players lose. If a pawn arrives on a '1' cherry token it can be taken. For a '2' cherry token 2 pawns have to be present on the given token and a '3' cherry token can be taken only if there are 3 pawns on the same space.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Welt der 80er Jahre
description: Welt der 80er quizzes players about the world in the 1980s, with a record-shaped game board highlighting a media format that disappeared shortly after that time. Players select questions from seven categories and test their knowledge: When did Katarina Witt win a gold medal? What show did Rudi Carrell host in the 1980s? Who was the German chancellor?

name: Never Have I Ever: Expansion Pack One
description:
Relive more of life's funny, embarrassing, and awkward moments with your friends.

Includes 77 play cards, 20 rules cards, 10 blank play cards, and 5 blank rule cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Ventisette
description:
In Ventisette ("twenty-seven"), the player's task is to save money throughout a month. The board represents a calendar where players can find events like receiving mails, buy stuff, great deals, even local elections and, at last, the 27th day, when players will receive money from their job. Players receives mails with something they can buy or bills they have to pay, like electricity bills, assurance bills,restaurant bills. Once a month ends players must make counts on what they pay and how much they can save. When they finish, a new month starts.
Players must choose how many months a play has.
The winner is the player who saves most and has the least debts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Stellar Conflict: Chimera / Secret Base
description:
A two-sided playable promo item for Stronghold's Stellar Conflict. One side is a heavily-shielded Secret Base and the other side is an automated neutral pirate ship called the Chimera. Both feature variable scoring options and new possibilities for creative game play.

This promo was designed for the North American retail debut of Stellar Conflict at the Origins Game Fair convention in 2016.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Real-time, Science Fiction

name: Uruk II: Promokarte Diplomatie/Diplomacy
description:
Diplomacy is a single-card promo with black border color. A player who has the Diplomacy achievement in front of them may hold unlimited cards in their hand while a god card takes effect. The player does not discard down to 5 cards.

The Promo card Diplomacy is included in the German magazine "Spielerei" issue no. 113 (Oct.-Dec. 2016)
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: C.O.G.: Dr. Widget Promo Pack
description: A set of 10 "Dr. Widget" cards, which are used as a game variant to add a new twist to the C.O.G. base game. Dr. Widget, the Director of the Cabinet of Gadgetry, has certain requests, the satisfaction of which can help you score more VPs.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Word Game

name: Cause of Death: Ghost
description:
This house is pretty haunted. Looks like you better start cleaning up the joint by getting rid of ghosts. But wait Aren't you a ghost? In that case, get these ghost hunters outta here! I don't
know, you all look the same to me.

Cause of Death: Ghost is a 4-9 player hidden role drafting card game. The object of the game is to have the most points by the end of the game. Points are earned at the end of each round by accomplishing the goal(s) of the character you drafted. The game ends after the final round. Play as many rounds as there are players
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Monster Sock Factory
description:
Fun game play: help dispatch sock packets for lovely little monsters. Be the first to ship 6 units to win the game

Math skills: kids play and understand the fundamental concepts of multiplication starting with multiplication as repeated addition

Family time: lots of fun for the entire family. Perfect way to spend an evening bonding over math's and fun

Ton of practice: each game session offers 4 times more math practice than classroom. Further, kids practice strategic thinking, patience & perseverance

Age 8+: perfect gift for boys and girls age 8 and up or in Grade 3 and up or those who are just getting started with multiplication tables

name: Last Days of Athobrae
description: Last Days of Athobrae is a competitive, turn-based, resource-gathering strategy game. Players take on the mantle of one of five unique civilizations trying to collect the resources that will allow them to build a spaceship and escape their dying planet. Each player's turn consists of 3 actions that allow them to navigate the planet, gather resources, build technology, and attack other players. Once all players have taken their turn, it is time for the doom phase, when world-convulsions shake things up! In a race against the world's demise and opposing players, first one to build and fuel their ship is the winner. If the world falls completely to pieces before anyone can escape, the game ends with no winner. Can you survive...?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Prosper
description: Immerse yourself in the stories and the people of the Book of Mormon in this fun new game for the whole family. If you match a card in your hand with one of the images on the colorful game board, you get to place one of your colored markers. Get five markers in a row and your opponents can’t stop you — but until then, watch out for the Laban card that will let them take one of your markers and hinder your progress. Be the first to get three rows of five markers each and you win! Find out how fun it is to Prosper in the land!

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Core Rulebook
description:
Welcome to the Multiverse!

Even in blackest day and darkest night, when all odds are stacked against them by super villains, interstellar invaders, crazed despots and maniacal anarchists, the world's finest heroes assemble to face the threat. Now, with the DC Universe Miniature Game, the stories of these epic battles between superhumans, gods and monsters is at Your fingertips...

In the DC Universe Miniature Game, You and Your friends collect a set of beautiful miniatures of your favourite DC heroes and villains, bring them to life by painting them, and then using them as playing pieces in an exciting multi-faceted, three dimensional tactical game. Every model in the DC Universe Miniature Games is supplied with a character card, which tracks a model's actions and health during a game. Most importantly, the character card keeps track of a model's Power Counters, which are used to fuel powers and abilities, from flight and teleportation, to heat vision and magical spells.

Picking models to battle in the DC Universe Miniature Game is really easy, and the game is designed to offer total flexibility in how You assemble Your teams. Firstly You need to decide if Your team is predominantly Heroes or Villains. You can choose any model of the same 'alignment' to join Your team. Some models have a Neutral alignment, which means the can join either team.

The game is scenario based, although You can play a simple deathmatch just for fun.

Sequence of Play

Each Round is broken down into four distinct phases, which proceed in the following order:


Power Phase: Players distribute Power counters to each of the models in their team, usually up to the character’s Power value. If a character is KO, Power counters are instead generated.
Initiative Phase: Players determine the order in which they will proceed through the round. This stage adds a level of unpredictability to the game – you might go first this round, but end up going last in the next.
Action Phase: The players activate each character in turn – moving, fighting, shooting, and resolving special actions. Play alternates, with the player who went first activating a single model, then the second player activates a model, and so on, until all models that can act have done so.
Final Phase: Some special effects must also be resolved in this phase. This is also a ‘tidying up’ phase, where Power counters are removed and scenario victory conditions are checked. If, at the end of the Final Phase, one player’s entire crew is Knocked Out and/or has been removed from play, the game ends and the other player is declared the victor.


Every test/combat (To Hit, Agility etc.) is resolved by rolling dice, usually 2d8.
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: City of Souls (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
A lost agent, a lost receptacle, an ancient guardian, and local legends all collide.
Death Valley, CA USA (1970 N.T.)

BEFORE YOU PRINT (a note from the designer).

The design goals for this scenario were as follows:

Create a slightly shorter scenario (real-time).
Design and develop a scenario with my son, Roman.
Puzzles that are challenging without being brutal.
Experimental ending


Also take into consideration:

The first half is more open; the second half is completely linear.
There is one puzzle which will stall progress until solved.
It's best played with four; combat will be harder with 3. Two players should control 2 receptacles each.
Printers should be set to 100% not "scale to fit" for optimal size.
Some duplex printers work better than others, please try a test print before printing the entire file.


If you're observant you might notice that this scenario has a similar story element to one of the officials. It is a complete coincidence. The story for City of Souls was fully developed before my son and I knew anything about the official expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: L'osti d'jeu 2
description:
Same thing as L'osti d'jeu, but with 406 new cards (150 black +256 red). It also include 80 blank card so you can make your own extension! Now with black card with double |...| and with asked references of movie, series and other Québec reference!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Le même jeu, mais avec 406 nouvelles cartes (150 noires + 256 rouges) + 80 cartes vierges pour créer ta propre extension! Ça inclut des cartes noires doubles |…| |…|, un plus grand ratio de cartes noires et plein de références québécoises, de télé & films que vous nous avez demandé.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: 21st Century Trivia Game
description: Trivia game with more recent trivia questions. Players need to answer two questions from each category before anyone else.

name: Gossip and the City
description:
Idols, athletes, performers, musicians, politicians: the celebrities in this seemingly glamorous place have shadowy sides that people can not see. If you sell such gossip material to a weekly magazine, or to the person, it will be a big deal.

In ゴシップアンドザシティ (Gossip and the City), the players are freelance reporters and collect celebrity gossip while also exchanging gossip with other players.

The lead player flips cards from a deck and other players make an offer of cards to exchange for the flipped cards. The lead player chooses one of the offers and takes those cards. However, there is an incentive not to flip too many cards.

The players will earn points based on the number of icons for each color collected, but this score is also affected by the numerical sum of the cards of that color collected.
publishers: ハレルヤロックボーイ (Hallelujah Rockboy)

name: Keen Up!
description:
Clean up, keep up!

Look at all this mess! The toys are lying all over the playroom — who could ever tidy them all up? Here is a fun and joyful clean-up adventure for your family: flip the cards and try to be the first to spot the matching toys on them. "Keen Up!" is a game to boost your child’s focus and attention while enjoying quality time spent together.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Black Stories Junior: Spooky Stories
description:
The successful mystery series Black Stories is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Spooky Stories are spooky riddles for young ghost chaser. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: 8-Bit Zombie Smash
description:
8-Bit Zombie Smash is a quick solitaire 'tile-laying' card/dice game that plays in 10-15 minutes. Your goal is to smash as many zombies as you can while creating safe houses within the neighborhood. You have a variety of weapons to use and certain areas to use them in. Try not to leave any zombies alone for too long because more will be created. Each card must lay on top of a previous card by at least one section or minus points are accrued.

There are 9 optional parameter cards that can be used with the game. You randomly draw one parameter card at the start of the game, which adds specific challenges and tactics to the game play.

This is a beat your high score style of card/dice game that only uses 18 game cards, 9 parameter cards and 10 d6.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Scripta
description:
Immerse yourself in the era of scribes and engraved stones. Write words together, collect laurel wreaths and get rid of your cards as soon as possible. Only one will win...It's up to you to make history.
The goal of the game is to find a letter to ask to continue the word in progress.
The first player must think of a word that begins with the letter drawn and put the second letter of that word down by choosing from the cards in his hand. The next player must think of a word starting with the two letters on the table and put the third letter on the table, and so on.

—description from the publisher

name: Bossbattle Bunnies
description:
Bossbattle Bunnies is a short, fun card game for 3-6 players. In this game you embark on a 10-20 minute bunny-themed dungeon crawl with your friends. You'll find loot, get cursed, fight monsters, and most importantly, test your friendships. It's easy to learn the game as you go along, so grab a beer (or a lemonade) and go adventuring!

As if a pocket-size dungeon crawl wasn't awesome enough already, this game doubles as regular playing cards. That means you can use it for Poker, Solitaire, Go fish and all the other classics. Talk about value-for-money! You can even take it to the bar, do some tricks and sweep someone off their feet. Just be sure to send me an invite to the wedding if you do!

Bossbattle Bunnies originally had my own artstyle for consistency, but then I figured it would be way cooler to have many different artists (18 in total) contribute to this project in their own style. This resulted in 54 unique illustrations that together turn this 2-in-1 deck of cards into a portable museum!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Wortblitz Kartenspiel
description:
A game with 50 round cards in a tin box. Each card has a letter and a category.

The players have to find a word which starts with the letter of the first card and belongs to the category of the second card. The player who finds a valid word first, collects the card, uncovers and reads the next pair of letter and category.

The player with the most gathered cards wins the game.

name: Isles of Terror: The Emerald Brood Expansion
description:
A new set of adventures and components to discover the Black Rock Isle and face an ancient nameless horror.

Contains 1 adventure book, 1 terror board, 36 exploration cards, 20 minion cards, 6 location cards, 6 location tiles, 3 terror tokens, 3 terror level tokens, 9 scenario tokens and 15 ritual tokens.

Contains the specified amount of cards and the adventure book in both German and English.

—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Isles of Terror: Tales from the Isles of Terror Expansion
description:
New single adventures to use with the components of the base game and its expansions. Note that each adventure is also fully adjustable to play with the components of the base game or any other adventure set.

Contains the adventure book in both German and English.

—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Kod Krakowa
description:
Kod Krakowa ("The Code of Krakow") is an educational game for young people created under the patronage of the City of Krakow. During the game, players move around the board made up of tiles (districts of Krakow). The game starts with six tiles - the oldest districts - and as it progresses, more districts are added. In each district there are some important places identified (divided into categories, e.g. Art or Spiritual Life) represented by tokens. The winner is the player who first collects a certain number of tokens of a certain type.
