An online knowledge platform is integrated into the game. On each of the elements (board tiles, tokens) there are QR codes, which link to pages with descriptions of districts and places in the game. The platform was prepared under the supervision of the Jagiellonian University staff. In the game there are also cards with important events from the history of the city, which introduce minor modifications to the game (e.g. give extra traffic to the player).

The game is not available for sale. It was distributed for free at promotional events and is available in city libraries.

name: Call of the Hunt
description:
Call of the Hunt is a tabletop game of an unusual format where the player is immersed in the detective investigation's atmosphere and becomes a detective his/herself.

You receive a box. Inside this box, you receive a weird and scary photo, a lot of evidence from a Maniac. This is the game where the box itself and the process of opening the box are part of the game itself.

The Maniac's goal is not just to send you the facts. This Maniac wants you to imbued with history and trust the Maniac.

Call of the Hunt game will not leave indifferent fans of detectives and thrillers, and overall most of the tabletop games fans. Just imagine yourself receiving a new game, new investigation in an unusual format.

Call of the Hunt is developed by a team of experienced game developers that specialize in mobile, social, and PC games. We've created an exciting, dart story that we love. But which no corporation will be brave enough to develop.

—description from the designer

name: ダイスニコフ (Dicenykov)
description:
In 20XX, Dr. Mad Dicenykov’s robot “Godra,” the strongest robot in the universe, was completed. The person who wins this robot -- ten times stronger than Helltoken -- will be the king of the universe! However, ten secret stone orbs scattered across the cosmos are needed to start Godra. Two evil organizations, the Magic Society Fumblers and the Revolutionary Army Sun Seater, race to collect the orbs. Dr. Dicenykov has promised ownership of Godra to the first organization to find them all. Now we see evil against evil dropped into the middle of the Cologascal Islands in Nankai’s secret area! Fight! Two dice will roll!

Overview
Players control evil organizations. Victory is won when 10 stone orbs are recovered before the other team.

The game is divided into rounds consisting of two parts:
Fleet battles
Landing operations

During fleet battles, players sink the opponent's ships with a die cannon (random type remote weapon).

In the second half, landing operations, the soldiers remaining from the fleet battle are divided to conquer “Island Cards” arranged in the center of the table. If players land the required amount of soldiers on the island, that player will earn the stone orb hidden on the island. However, it is important to be careful because the soldiers who land on the same island will eliminate each other. During the round, players receive support from the merchant, Gafnorick, from Dr. Dicenykov’s support organization. Players can build up their base with a variety of items like robot brigades that can be used as mercenaries, or a secret weapon that empowers the function of the die gun.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pieces as Map, Secret Unit Deployment, Turn Order: Random

name: Shadowrift: Promo Pack 1
description: This promo pack adds three new villager cards to your Shadowrift Game. The Guide, the bartender, and the Kidnapper.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Skip-Bo Pocket
description:
A pocket version of Skip-Bo, which only uses 93 cards (from 1 to 11) versus the 162 in the regular set.

Each player is dealt a stockpile of 7 (4 players), 10 (3 players) or 13 cards (2 players). The winner will be whoever manages to empty their stockpile first. Cards are played onto four shared building piles in numerical sequence from 1 to 11. On each turn, a player draws until they have three cards in their hand, and then plays cards from: their hand, a top card of their discard piles, or their stockpile. At the end of their turn, a player must discard onto one of their four personal discard piles. Strategy involves the organizing of cards into the discard piles, care in not setting up the next players for good plays, knowing when to play from which option, and especially the timing of playing a valuable "Skip-bo" wildcard.

name: Chocolatext
description:
Chocolatext is a two-player word game that contains chocolate letters in which players take turns challenging each other to create words in a category of their choice.

The game begins with a set of eight letters. One player defines a category and challenges the other player. The challenged player has to come up with a word in the chosen category that contains at least two of the eight letters. Then the challenger does the same, and so on, until six words have been said. Then the challenged player has to recite those six words in reverse order. If they remember each word correctly and in the correct order, they gain a point and eat one of the chocolate letters that was used in this round. Then the roles are reversed. After seven rounds, only one letter remains, and whoever has earned the most points wins and eats the last letter.

One game contains enough chocolate letters to play four times.

name: Streams Cross
description:
In Streams Cross, players aim to score points by filling out a cross shaped grid with numbers. Players earn more points for longer sequences where numbers do not decrease.

The game presents two rule sets for determining how the numbers are chosen. In one, a set of dice are rolled (with a different amount rolled depending upon the round). In the other, the players' finger(s) are used.

In either case, after the players have filled out 20 numbers, they sum their points and the player with the most points wins.

name: Arkanum: Die Schatzinsel
description:
Experience exciting puzzles - solve the puzzles to uncover the secret of Treasure Island.
Escape room game with web app for sounds and stories.
Board game for 1-6 adults from 14 years, 90-120 minutes playing time.
Unique 3D game board - scissors, pen, internet access and light source (cell phone or flashlight) required to play.
No destruction of material necessary! However, once you have solved the game, you know the solution.

name: Дубль. Крейзи ферма (Take. Crazy farm)
description:
Players have to act quickly to correctly solve tasks and find the right number of certain animals (cows, donkeys, pigs).

There are 6 types of tasks and players solve 3 tasks at the same time. Answers are given with the help of cards, after which it is determined whose correct card was laid first. That player receives a quest card.

The one who first collects a certain number of quest cards wins.

The game develops quick decision-making, attentiveness and logic.



Игрокам предстоит быстро и правильно решать задания, находить нужное количество определённых животных (коровы, ослики, свинки).
Задания бывают 6 видов, определите кого из животных: ровно 5, ровно 6, ровно 7, больше всего, меньше всего или НЕ столько же, сколько других.
Игроки одновременно решают 3 задания.
Ответы даются с помощью карт, после чего определяется, чья правильная карта была положена раньше.
За правильный ответ, данный раньше других, игрок получает карточку задания.
Тот, кто первым соберёт некоторое количество карточек заданий, побеждает.
Игра развивает скорость принятия решений, внимательность и логику.

name: Cthulhu Wars: The Eidolon miniature/card
description:
Initially part of the Cthulhu Wars: Onslaught 3 Kickstarter, the miniature is also available independently with rules on the publisher website.

How to obtain the Eidolon Loyalty Card: Pay 2 Doom to take this Loyalty Card. Then place the Eidolon anywhere on the Map.

Powers:
Hierarchy (Ongoing): The Eidolon generates 1 Power during the Gather Power Phase. He can be Captured like any Cultist and is Recruited, rather than Summoned. He cannot Create or Control Gates.

Eldritch Wisdom (Ongoing): If the Eidolon is in play, after any player's Action you can force each player to write down his or her next Action and then flip this Loyalty Card face-down. Example: an enemy who plans to Move must write "Move" but he need not say which Units are Moving, nor to where. On each player's next Action, they must perform that Action unless it is now impossible to do so. In this case another Action may be taken. Flip this Loyalty Card faceup in the next Doom Phase.

name: Parks and Recreation Party Game
description:
Remember what's important in life: friends, waffles, and work!

Relive your favorite moments from the hit TV show in Parks and Recreation Party Game. Pick one of Pawnee's famous parks and recreation projects, make deals, and recruit help. You probably need to work with your colleagues to get things done, but if you can take more credit, you'll earn sweeter rewards. When Li'l Sebastian is done eating, the game ends and whoever has the most waffles wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Efemérides Secretas
description:
4 game modes:

Timeline (2 to 4 participants)

Distribute 4 anniversaries to each player, placing them on the side of the illustration. Then leave an ephemeris in the center of the table with the date in sight. This last card will be the starting point of the timeline. In turns, each one must place one of their cards to the left or to the right of the initial event, depending on whether it happened before or after. Once located, it will turn you over. If he did it correctly, he will leave her in the timeline. If he did not guess correctly, the ephemeris is discarded and the player must take a new card from the remaining deck. This dynamic will be repeated with the rest of the participants. Whoever first manages to place all their cards on the timeline will win. The challenge will appear when cards are added, since there will be more options to decide.

Secret Ephemeris
Take a random ephemeris card, to discover what different people did, in different parts of the world and at different times. Do it any day of the year and at any time. Then, take out a card of questions, which will question us about issues of the anniversary that were not counted. The question may be answered orally or in writing, but yes or yes, it will have to be done creatively.

Ephemeris on Demand

Read ephemeris to inspire your own actions. This haphazard reading can also give us clues or hints of hope in times of uncertainty. It can invite us to reflect or help us solve dilemmas, as if it were an oracle.

An Ephemeris is Born

Make two lists: one of professions, jobs or hobbies (eg architect, teacher). Another with qualifying adjectives (eg: fast, insistent) The more original, the better! Then cross elements from both categories (randomly or by choice) and thus create a fantastic binomial (Gianni Rodari, 1973) such as: “Insistent Architect”. Name the new character, place it in a city in the world and assign a date. Imagine a short story: tell something that happened to him or tell what he was doing that day. They can also be inspired by the questions on the cards. You just have to get carried away by the fantastic combination of words!

name: Superclub: PSG Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date Paris Saint-Germain first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate Paris Saint-Germain fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Unsolved Crime Cases: Der Fall Lindberg
description:
Unsolved Crime Cases - Will you succeed in solving the case?

In this thrilling Crime Escape Game, the exciting case of the missing Lindberg couple awaits you. Newlyweds and just on their honeymoon in Scandinavia, the couple suddenly disappears seemingly without a trace. What has happened? A kidnapping? Blackmail? Or was it murder? Maybe the abandoned forest cabin will shed light on the mysterious disappearance? Visit all the places related to the case, collect clues as well as evidence, question the witnesses and interrogate your suspects in a thrilling multimedia finale.

A missing couple, an abandoned forest cabin in Scandinavia and a growing mountain of questions: What happened? Kidnapping? Blackmail? Murder? [...]
Assist Detective Aleksander Dahlqvist in this mysterious case and collect real evidence. You can record all your investigative progress on the clue board. Who will think creatively enough and convict the perpetrator? Only in the multimedia finale will you see if you are right with your conclusions. A case for real investigators!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Questions and Answers, Team-Based Game

name: Kugelblitz Tornado
description:
Who will defeat the black 8 and his fellow players in "Kugelblitz Tornado"!
In the whirling ball action, all players want to wait for the right moment to slide into the finish line before the big black ball. Throw the black 8 ball into the funnel and watch closely as it makes its rounds. And then match the right moment for you and your teammates to let your ball roll.
The action-packed ball fun "Kugelblitz Tornado" is suitable for 2-4 players aged 5 and up.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Кто украл репку? (Who Stole the Turnip?)
description:
You play detective chickens who are looking for turnip thief. All seven suspects are depicted on the game board this is: grandfather, grandmother, granddaughter, dog, cat, mouse and the turnip itself. Next to each suspect lies a round token, on the underside of which it is indicated, who is this character: innocent, kidnapper or accomplice.
Chickens walk around the game board, collecting cards of the investigation: clues, signs and witnesses. If you got a card, you can go to the suspect, present it, tell why it points to this character, and look at his token in secret. When you find the kidnapper, you will have to come to him and bring charges: a motive card and three matching consequence cards. Tell why the attacker stole the turnip, how do you managed to figure him out and whether he had an accomplice. If you do everything right you will win.

name: Funny Lines
description:
Funny Lines is a party game you can play just with 3 to 50 players. The game can be played in 2 team mode with 4 players or more.

On the front of the cards there are images to guess. On the back of the cards are the costs of the clues.

Each team selects a player to do the drawing. Don’t worry. You don’t need to be good drawer!

Each team buys clues by paying into the pot and each drawer draws the clues bought by their team. Note that both boards are visible at all times to all players and you can thus use the other team’s drawing to guess.

You may guess at any time but guessing is not free. The first team to guess takes all the Fricos from the pot.

The boards are erased and a new round begins with a new card.
The game ends after 6 cards. The team with the most money wins.

name: Lost Adventures
description:
Lost Adventures is an adventure archaeology movie game that captures the cinematic sweep of this genre of film. The game is played over two phases:

In the Map Phase, you will travel the world to acquire information about the lost temple, and select character cards to help prepare for its perils. On each of your five turns, you perform four steps:
1. Travel to a different city
2. Face an encounter
3. View temple secrets cards
4. Add a character card to your tableau

In the Temple Phase, you will jockey for position against your opponents as you face the temple's perils. On each, you write down a bid. You will move as many spaces on the temple track as the number of players with a lower bid. Then, reveal the temple peril: cards in your tableau matching the peril offset your bid, the remainder must be paid by taking on hubris.

At game's end, you must try to purge your hubris in the final hubris challenge; failure means your face has melted off! The player who is furthest along the temple track, with face intact, is the winner!

-description from designer

name: Luddite
description:
Luddite is a roll and write style game with a fully integrated graphic novel. In Luddite, one to an unlimited number of players will progress along the story of the novel whilst competing to destroy ever more complex automata. Creating a full campaign style game.

As a Luddite you will be hacking into the neural networks of the NED automata. These bionic, dog-like creatures are capable of performing almost any complex task to which they are assigned and, as such, have begun to replace vast swathes of the human population. As a Luddite, you will work to destroy these infernal machines.

During each game, players will roll three communal dice then use these dice to interact with the various modules of the NED. They will move their Neetle nanobot through the systems of the NED, opening and closing logic gates to enter and destroy key systems of the NED robot. All the while, collecting valuable resources to help them along their way.

Each round players must add one of the dice to the clock module, the higher the die added, the more damage done to the NED but also the less time the player has inside its systems, creating a push-your-luck style tension to each decision.

If players do not get their Neetle nanobot to the exit node of the NED before the clock runs out, their hack will be a failure.

The integrated graphic novel comes with hundreds of complex images from artist Adam Beachey all from within the vast Solar 175 universe.

-description from designer
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: BIRTH or BURST
description:
BIRTH or BURST is a cooperative game for 3-6 players. In this game, players work together to control the temperature in order to successfully hatch penguin eggs.

To win:
The game will be cleared if the temperature can be successfully adjusted without bursting for 10 turns.

How to Play:
Each player plays one card each turn that regulates the temperature. The sum of the numbers of the cards played will be the temperature to be increased or decreased.

name: True Crime Stories
description:
The U.S. Postal Inspection Service is the oldest federal law enforcement agency in America – and they've seen it all. They've uncovered letter bombs, recovered millions in stolen money and taken down an entire mafia ring. Now, it's time for you to unravel some of their most high-profile cases... and crack them yourself!


Take on a mafia kingpin in SOCIETY OF THE BLACK HAND (1/5 Difficulty)
Bring down a corrupt art gallery in OPERATION BOGART (3/5 Difficulty)
Unmask a criminal mastermind in DIGGING FOR GOLD IN PARADISE (4/5 Difficulty)


NEW MEETS OLD
This adult party game may feature America’s oldest law enforcement agency, but using phones, email and the internet makes it a strategy game for everyone too!

(Internet Connection Required)

–description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 2nd Best!
description:
Second Best is a abstract board game for two players.
Each player puts a piece on the board. If you can put your own pieces on the board in a row of 4 squares, or stack 3 of them on the same square, you win. However, if the other party says "Second best!", You have to think about a different move.
It is the ultimate brain game in which each other's thoughts are intertwined while the best hands are sealed.

This is abstract game for 2 Players.

—description from the publisher

Purpose:

Continuously your 4 pieces top of each grids.
Stack your 3 pieces at one grid.


how to play:

Alternately play you & your opponent.
When your turn. You put your piece any grid.
You can stack a piece on other pieces.
But 3 stacks is max each grids.



If you have no more pieces, you can move your piece for adjacent grids or opposite side grid.



When your opponent played, you can say "2nd Best!" once per turn.


"2nd Best!" is rewind your opponents play, and your opponent has to be other choice.

Special situations(caution):

If your opponent can't moves any pieces, you win. As well as after you say "2nd Best".
If you achieve your purpose & your opponents purpose at the same time, you win.
"2nd Best!" is avoid the losing once per turn. You have to make unavoidable situation to win.


—description from the designer

name: Miam
description:
In Miam, players are merchants who are buying food stuffs at market, then selling them for cash, with more goods of the same type bringing a bigger payout. Whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins.

To set up the game, one player shuffles the 55-card deck – which consists of eleven categories of food (bread, pasta, cheese, etc.) with four cards in each category, four jokers, and seven special action cards – then spreads out the cards face down on the table. Each player starts with five money.

On a turn, a player uses special cards (optional), turns two cards face up, keeps one of these cards while flipping the other face down, sells sets of food cards (optional), and auctions cards on hand to other players (optional). The special cards, which are claimed like any other, allow a player to steal one card from an opponent or keep both cards revealed that turn. When a player sells a set of food cards, she receives 2-16 money for selling 2-5 cards of the same type; these cards are then removed from play. A player can auction any number of cards, with opponents bidding in round-robin fashion for the entire lot.

Once the last card has been claimed from the table, the game lasts three more rounds with players being able to take only the optional actions listed above: using special cards, selling sets, and auctioning cards.

name: Vier im Zoo
description:
At the zoo are lots of animals to see, but after we see them once, will we find them again? Do we know where all the animals are hiding?

In Vier im Zoo, first the cards are laid out face up, then after all players have had a look at the cards, they are turned face down. Starting clockwise, each player takes a turn shaking the wooden disc inside the cover, then trying to find the corresponding animal card. Whoever is first to find four animals wins!

name: Captain's Wager: The Maelstrom
description:
A great storm ravages the skies, grinding airships to kindling and sending pirate crews scrambling. Whole crews are sucked in and spirits drift out, bringing curses and spreading chaos. as the haunting worsens, you risk losing your loot and being doomed to captain a ghost ship for all eternity.

Maelstrom is an expansion for Captain's Wager which adds:
4 Crew Cards
30 Haunt Cards
15 Treasure Cards

And a Haunt Mechanic giving players an extra resource to manage if they wish to resist the rising haunt levels and avoid becoming a ghost ship incapable of winning with mortal wealth.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: The Maury Game: You Are Not the Father
description:
Based on the popular paternity test episodes of the long-running American TV talk show, The Maury Game: You Are Not the Father recreates all the ourtageous back-and-forth drama you'd expect as 2-6 players attempt to prove that they are not the father.

Each player starts the game with their own DNA test results envelope that contains two "You Are NOT the Father" cards and one "You ARE the Father" card. At the end of the game, one of those cards will be pulled at random from your envelope. If the "You ARE the Father" card is pulled, you lose and everyone else wins.

Players take turns playing argument cards to add additional "You Are Not the Father" cards to their DNA test results envelope, gain popularity with the audience, or make the other players lose popularity, all in an effort to increase their odds of not pulling the "You ARE the Father" card at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Single Loser Game, Take That

name: Sweets!
description:
In Sweets!, players each start the game with three sweets cards from the fifty-card deck, with five cards placed face up in the tableau. On a turn, a player either draws a face-up card or the top card of the deck (unless they already have five cards in hand), swap two or more cards with an equal number of cards from the tableau, or eat a set of sweets in their hand to score points.

Once the deck is exhausted, each player eats once, then they tally their points based on the number of stars on the cards they ate. Whoever has the most points wins.

name: Rabbids: Das Familien-Partyspiel
description:
Rabbids: Das Familien-Partyspiel is a collection of sixty short games featuring the funny little rabbits from the Rabbids video game. Your aim in all of these games is to achieve whatever goal is set out for you, whether through skill, intellect, speed or just plain luck. In this game, you'll be called on to do everything, and everyone will receive chances to score. Each game lasts no more than two minutes, and the rules are simple enough that players will be able to jump into games quickly.

In the end, whoever wins the most Rabbids mini-games wins the whole shebang!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Dice, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: 10 Down
description:
In each round of 10 Down, players are dealt ten cards. On their turn, they can swap one card at a time. The object is to create a sequenced run of cards from 1 to 10; that's a "10 Down" and you earn one point token! If you can create a color set, in order, of three or more cards (e.g., 7, 8, 9 yellow), you receive bonus tokens. The first player to collect ten points wins.

You may call your "10 Down" hand as soon as you get it, but you may want to press your luck and wait until you are able to build a color set of three or more cards to earn additional tokens. Keep in mind you never know when someone else is going to call. How long can you press your luck?
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Crazy Cat Lady
description:
In Crazy Cat Lady players must fill the void in their life and cross the threshold into becoming a Crazy Cat Lady! While trying to acquire cats players must balance a job, renovate their home, and deal with general cat maintenance.

The entire game is represented by a deck of 36 cards. Using three smaller decks from these cards, players draw cards using a set amount of points each turn, based on their current job. By acquiring and playing these cards you can advance your career and gain more points per turn, renovate your home to house more cats, and of course acquire more cats as well. The forth deck however causes you to draw an event that adds common cat complications to your life. Plays in 5 minutes (or less).

New Print-And-Play Available Now as of May 7th, 2017 featuring art by Kyle Ferrin!

If you like the game you can purchase a professionally printed copy at the following web address: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/crazy-cat-lady
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Abyssal Line
description:
In Abyssal Line, you are an oceanographer seeking to cultivate interest in the wonders of the ocean's depths while studying its creatures. To better pursue these goals, you have become the captain of a deep-sea sightseeing vessel. Your passengers expect exciting encounters with mysterious creatures at the bottom of the sea; ensure they have an enjoyable trip, and their satisfaction will increase.

However, navigating the darkest depths of the ocean is no easy feat. You need to seek inspiration from the creatures that dwell there in order to upgrade your ship's equipment. Doing so will make it easier for you to sail your plotted course.

You also want to publish your findings as you expand your knowledge of deep sea creatures while piloting your vessel.

Will you be able to overcome the adversities of the abyss and gain prestige as both deep sea captain and oceanographer?

—description from the publisher (translated)

あなたは深海遊覧船の船長として乗客に深海の魅力を伝えながら、
深海生物の研究も行う海洋学者です。

神秘的な深海生物との出会いは乗客に感動を与えます。
充実した船旅を実現し、乗客の満足度を高めましょう。

しかし、暗くて深い海の中での操船は容易いことではありません。
深海生物の特性をヒントに遊覧船の設備を改良することで
思い描いた航路を実現しやすくなるでしょう。

そして、遊覧船の運航中に得た深海生物の知識を元に研究発表を行うことも海洋学者として重要です。

深海遊覧船の船長として
また、海洋学者として多くの名声を得ることができるでしょうか。

—description from the publisher
publishers: analog lunchbox (アナログランチボックス)

name: Il était une fois... la vie
description:
Meet Maestro and other characters from the TV series "Once upon a time... Life" while they try to uncover the mysteries of the human body. The game includes more than 2500 questions in 5 categories that are: the blood circulation system, the nervous system, the digestion system, the immune system and disease.

The gameplay is co-operative: the players try to carry oxygen to the body of Psi girl before she gets ill by the looming viruses. If the players succeed, they win the game. If they fail, Psi catches cold.

There are 4 difficulty levels in the game so that it is playable by children and their parents together.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Balancing Cactus
description: Balancing Cactus is a children's dexterity game. First the cactus base is placed in the center of the play area. Players then take turns placing wooden cactus pieces, or stems, onto the base or onto other stems that have already been placed. A player who causes the cactus to fall over is eliminated and play is restarted with all of the remaining players until only one player, the winner, remains.

name: Farook
description:
This is billed as "the ultimate tic-tac-toe" and has some resemblance to nine men's morris. The array is 4x4, and players alternate placing one of their 6 pieces on, placing one of the two wild pieces on, or moving/jumping with one of their pieces or the wild pieces. The goal is to get 4 in a row, make a square (2x2), or occupy all 4 corners. There are a number of anti-stalling rules and stakes raising, as in backgammon to round out the game.

1993 Mensa Select

name: Война
description:
In Война (War) each player take control of a German, division, allies division (deck). The card represent resources, battle groups, planes, artillery, heroes, tactical decisions, battle events…

There are different series "The Kharkov to El Alamein", "Stalingrad", "Victory Day"…
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Rightgames RBG SIA, Stolitsa Design Group

name: Sticks
description:
Sticks is in the Rummy family of card games. It is played with 2- 8 players with 4 decks (including jokers). Melding of sets and runs is similar to Rummy but each player has their own goal (written on a "stick"). Players have a hand of 15 cards and goals ranges from the use of 5 to 12 cards.

Each round players draw new sticks (goals) only if they completed their stick during the previous round. Those who did not complete their stick must try again to complete the same stick in the new round. Winner is the first to 7 sticks. A scoring variant is sometimes used where the game ends at 7 sticks but each stick is valued by the number of cards necessary to complete the goal.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunny White Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Bunny White
Nu 01: This is a single Specialty Bunny. The player with these bunnies down may play two cards per turn.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Eiertanz, Das Kartenspiel
description:
From the publisher's website:

Alarm in the hen house! Everybody tries to snatch the most egg cards and not let them drop. That is not so easy: whoever receives an egg card has to clasp it under his chin, between his knees or in other very unlikely positions. When it comes to the big egg dance, everybody has to run up to the matching hen ? but keep in mind that scoring is done as soon as one player loses one of his egg cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Monopoly: Supernatural Join The Hunt
description:
From the box:
Join Sam and Dean in the epic struggle against evil, and race to end the war between Heaven and Hell with the Supernatural edition of Monopoly.

This is a Hot Topic Exclusive Release.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Melvin vs Kronk
description:
Melvin Vs Kronk is a game of dexterity where players compete from precious gems. During the game, everyone gets face down cards with different face expressions of Melvin (the Geek) and Kronk (the Orc).

One by one, the players reveal one card from their deck placing it above any cards played by themselves previously. When cards from at least 2 players match, player race to slap the gem pile. Whoever does it first, takes two cards, chooses one and distribute the other one to whomever they want.

Also, the first player to slap the gem pile, will collect all cards played during that turn. If a player run out of cards, he will be eliminated from the game in the next round.
The game ends when either (1) the gem pile run out of cards or (2) there are only two players left in the game with cards. Players then reveal their gems and whomever scored more gems wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Objective Kassel: 7 Days to the Rhine, Volume 4
description:
"Objective Kassel" is a two-player alternative history wargame intended to investigate the operational parameters that would have been in place during the first four days of fighting in that border area of West Germany had the Soviet Union decided to try to attack sometime in the early 1980s. It was during that timeframe the Warsaw Pact achieved a possible decisive “correlation of forces” between their militaries and those of the West.

This game is the fourth volume of the AFCENT (Allied Forces Central Europe) Series. Each single-volume game uses the same system and will be playable alone or mated to other games in the series. Each hexagon on the map represents 2.5 miles (four kilometers) from side to opposite side. The Warsaw Pact regiments, while the units of maneuver on the NATO side are battalions. Air power and electronic warfare counters and rules abstractly represent, the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary superiority within those sub-realms of conflict. Each day of real time consists of one nighttime and two daylight turns.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 280 counters

name: Starforge
description:
In Starforge, each player starts with an asymmetrical faction of constructible ships made from custom acrylic game pieces. In the center of the table is a row location cards that can be conquered and mined for resources. Through their choice of tactics, and how they build their ships, the players can battle and outwit their opponent achieving victory by command points, resource capture or enemy destruction.

Starforge is a PART-BUILDER game, where what you choose to build affects how the game unfolds.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Set-up

name: Zanimatch
description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game of observation and speed.
You must be quick and stay concentrated!
The first to find an animal on the big card "meli-melo", puts down his/her card quickly, quickly !"

name: Teacher's Quiz 2
description: Trivia game for kids including six categories (Games, generals, sciences, history, math and language.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dark Shadows
description:
Dark Shadows was the first of two board games based on the TV series to come out onto the market in the late 1960s. Each player is dealt 4 cards of varying types. Players use these cards to drive their movement across the board by matching a card to a particular space. Each turn, a player either plays the appropriate card to move ahead or discards one and stays put, then draws a new card. The first player to reach the end space is the winner.

Some strategy is added by the nature of the board spaces. Certain paths will call for any card that matches a number value (1 or 2) or color (red or black). Others require a specific symbol (bat, spider, poison cup, or knife), or one of the special vampire cards (Barnabas or the generic Vampire). There are alternate paths a player may choose which are shorter, but require more specific items.

Re-implemented by:

Creature Castle
Black Hole: Space Alert Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Artisans of the Taj Mahal
description:
Recruit craftspeople, construct the iconic mausoleum of the Taj Mahal and maintain the monument’s beautiful gardens. Erect towering domes, intricate minarets and enormous archways to earn the most points and be declared Master Architect!

Players choose how to best use shared dice on their individual print and play boards to construct their buildings. One die is used to determine the location and the other is used to determine a value. The value might need to be the same as the other rolls for that location, or the values might need to be in ascending order, or maybe the values all need to be even numbers. Players can individually manipulate dice values with raindrop powerups, but there are a limited number so they must be used wisely.

name: Napoleon at Chattanooga
description:
This is a self-published game that can be downloaded for free at several sites over the Internet (including the designer's site, so this is not a violation of any type).

From the introduction in the rulebook:

"Napoleon at Chattanooga is a painstakingly-researched, meticulously accurate simulation of Napoleon's campaign in the Tennessee Valley. It is also a two-player game of exploration and conquest in the Solar System, which is also painstaking but not necessarily accurate. This game is the first in the ACW (Advanced Chart Wars) series and is also considered part of the ongoing GBoTGCN (Great Battles of This Guy Called Napoleon) series by most of the people working in the stockroom."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: Alesia
description: A wargame from France dealing with the ancient siege of Alesia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Backseat Drawing Junior
description:
From back of box (not a neutral description):

Backseat Drawing Junior brings the outrageous fun of Backseat Drawing to the entire family. Players race to identify a drawing done by the "artist" - but the artist doesn't know what he or she is drawing! It's up to the "director" to tell the artist how to draw the picture without giving away the name of the item shown on the picture card.

The laughter builds as the artist attempts to follow directions and everyone tries to identify the drawing. With Backseat Drawing Junior everyone can play and the fun never stops!

Re-implements: Backseat Drawing

name: Akce X
description:
Plagiat of "Scotland Yard".
Made in Czechoslovakia some time in the late 80s.
One of the players takes on the role of Agent X. His job is to move from point to point around the map of Praha taking taxis, trams, boats or subways. The detectives, the remaining players acting in concert, move around similarly in an effort to move into the same space as Agent X. But while the criminal's mode of transportation is nearly always known, his exact location is only known intermittently throughout the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Activity Pótkérdések I.
description: Hungarian expansion to the well-known party game Activity where you have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This expansion contains 220 new cards with 1320 phrases.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game

name: Activity Action
description: Another version of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe expressions verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this version every expression is an action. It contains 438 cards with 1314 expressions.

name: Spot!
description:
The cards show three circles or three squares in different sizes and colors. They are arranged either centrally or off-centre.

A SPOT occurs when you can form a pattern from exactly three cards in the same colour. Players try to find as many SPOTS as possible in order to collect the most cards.

name: Lausch Genau!
description:
Pssst – hey, if you want to make it in the safecracking team of Klepto Manni, then you'll need to listen carefully, that is Lausch Genau! Why must you quiet the lips and open the ears? Because you need to determine the code required to break the bank, and doing that will take concentration.

Each round, players secretly place 0-4 glass beads in their personal plastic cup, then they successively shake their cups. Players must then secretly guess how many beads are under all the cups in play. Guess correctly, and you then move your car on the game board to the next house waiting to be visited by your crack team.

The first player to reach the last house on the game board wins.

name: Babylon 5 Component Game System: 2258 Starter Kit – Earth
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: デザインタウン: 再利用 (Design Town: Reuse)
description:
デザインタウン: 再利用 (Design Town: Reuse), an expansion for the deck-building game Design Town, includes two different double-sided cards, with 10 copies of each card. The cards are:


Hardware store/urban redevelopment office: This interferes with the development of your opponent's cities.
Flea market/recycling box: This card can be used when needed to give you extra money.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Ninja All-Stars: Momotaro
description: The life of Momotaro is as strange as Kagejima. He was found as an infant, floating down the river in a giant peach, by an elderly farmer. Growing up on stories of predation by the Ijin lcan and their oni allies, he turned his interest and his tetsubo toward confronting that threat. His legend, strength, and resolve grow with every mission.
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: High!High?High!!
description:
User summary
High!High?High!!

In the game of High!High?High!!, players try to collect cards so that card values are arranged in ascending order, while avoiding collecting the same value as an opponent's.

Each turn, you draw a card. You may place that card face-down in front of you if the card's value is higher than the highest card you have in front of you, or lower than the lowest. You may collect up to five cards in this way, but players may end collecting earlier because bonus points are added according to the order they finished.

At the end of game, reveal all cards players have collected. You add up total value of your cards from the lowest, but if one of your cards has the same value as one of an opponent's card, you must stop counting immediately. Add the bonus points previously mentioned, and that's your score. The highest scorer wins the game.

Backs of cards are color-coded according to their values. Cards with values 1-4 are blue, 5-8 are yellow, 9-12 are red. You should consider the color of the opponents' cards and decide if you take the drawn card or not.

Publisher's summary
数字が被らないように推理してカードを獲得していくバッティングゲームです。
裏向きに置かれたカードはターンが進むにつれ明らかになっていきます。
カードのデザインにもヒントが。
他のプレイヤーが置いたカードを推理しつつ、いち早く自分の場を完成させましょう。

name: Junior Pharao
description:
A simplified version of Ramses II for children.
The nine animals of the young pharaoh are hidden below the pyramids. The players assume the role of explorers and search for them.

An animal card is turned over. The active player moves pyramids like a sliding puzzle until he reveals an animal (or the mummy). If he found the correct animal, he takes the card. In any case, it's now the next player's turn.

The animal stack contains two kinds of special cards:
When a sandstorm appears, the whole board is rotated, making it harder to memorize animal positions and free paths.

When the mummy is wanted, a turntable below the board is rotated, causing the hidden mummy to move to another place. For the extra effort, finding the mummy you get a bonus pharaoh card.

When the card stack runs out, the player who collected most cards wins.

name: Extinction
description:
Extinction is a dinosaur battle royale card game where you must protect the last dinosaur eggs of your species. Build your herd of dinosaurs and send them to destroy your friends' nest before they get to yours. Defend yourself against rival herds with well timed Triceratops shields, redirect damage with an Ankylosaurus tail whip, or just completely wipe out your friend's herd with a meteor strike!

Each player starts with 4 cards, 6 Dino eggs (Life Points), and a Herbivore Habitat. Start your turn by drawing 2 cards from the Draw Pile, then choose up to 3 cards to play before ending your turn. To survive Extinction, you'll want to build an army of Dinos. You can play 2 types of egg-smashing Dinos: Herbivores and Carnivores. Since you start with a Herbivore Habitat, you are free to play Herbivore Dinos on your turn. If you're lucky to draw a Carnivore Habitat, you'll be able to cause more destruction upon your opponents with your Carnviore Dinos!

All Dinos start as Hatchlings that deal baby damage to opponents. If you want real egg-crushers that deal even more damage, just feed them food! Food can be used in two ways: to grow Hatchlings and to fend off Dino attacks! Managing your food can make or break your chances of survival, so plan wisely.

When it comes down to the end, there can only be one person to survive Extinction. This game forces you to test your friendships. Will you ally with your best friend or cold-heartedly wipe them out? Do whatever it takes to be the last one standing and earn the righteous title of Sole Survivor of Extinction.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Bye Bye Mr. Fox!
description:
Bye Bye Mr. Fox!​ is a co-operative game that teaches young players about teamwork and strategy. Work together to help the hens keep their eggs safe from the cunning Mr. Fox! Spin the spinner to see what will move this turn: an egg, a chicken, or Mr. Fox? Move three eggs into each hen's house to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Gamot
description:
“Before you looms the dimly lit entrance of the most feared dungeon in the land. It is called the GAMOT. Within the Gamot lie dangers untold, for no hero has yet returned from its deep depths. The journey here has not been an easy one. You dismount from your trusty steed and ready your sword and shield. If you conquer the Gamot, you will earn the greatest glory in the land and with it a place among the King’s personal guard. A worthy position for a hero such as yourself!

As you approach the entrance to the Gamot, you can smell the foul stench of death and are overcome with an unexplained dread. While you steel your nerves against this dark air, you hear the sound of hoof beats behind you. Your horse has fled in fear… You are truly alone now. You step into the entrance of the Gamot, filled with determination. As you do so, however, the floor gives way and you find yourself suddenly tumbling down an incline. You hit the ground below with a hard thud. After taking a moment to regain your bearings, you search in the darkness for your sword and shield. They are nowhere to be found! Rising to your feet, you see that you have fallen into a long corridor lined with doors. A haunting laugh echoes in the dungeon. The only thing that stands between you and whatever horrors await you in the dungeon is your will to live and your desire to prove yourself the greatest hero in the land…

Will you survive the Gamot?”

Gamot is a solitaire dungeon crawling card game, designed to be quick and playable on-the-go. You take the role of an adventuring hero as you attempt to navigate the perils of the dungeon. You will search for weapons and items in which to defend yourself, while fighting fearsome monsters and drinking potions to keep your health up! No two games are ever the same!


Arm yourself with swords, bows and warhammers, or locate powerful weapons such as the Golden Trident!
Use special items like the Magic Ring to rearrange the shape of the dungeon!
Choose wisely when to face a threat head on and when to run!
Face monsters such as werewolves, black knights, great worms and the dreaded and deadly lich!
Search the halls of the dungeons for potions to help you recover from your wounds suffered at the hands of these brutal beasts!



Gamot is the perfect game for on-the-go players! Gamot requires little space to play, plays as quickly as you can make decisions and can be carried in your pocket. Designed to be played while waiting in lines, travelling on buses or trains, or on your break at work, Gamot also works for filling in time while you wait for your turn at the gaming table. With only a deck of 54 standard playing cards (and some small counters that you can easily replace with your memory or a scrap of paper and a pencil), and developed to appeal to both your mind and your wallet, Gamot provides a great and inexpensive dungeon crawling experience that won't break the bank!

Gamot is easily learned, but tough to master. Gamot is also family-friendly, and requires only basic math skills to get started.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tiny Epic Defenders: Deluxe Edition
description:
This entry is for deluxe edition of Tiny Epic Defenders, which also includes Kickstarter Mini-Expansion.


GENERAL INFO: Cooperative, 1-4 players, 30 minutes.
THEME: Fantasy, set in the world of Tiny Epic Kingdoms.
HOOK: Fast paced, portable co-op, with a unique turn-deck mechanic.
WIN: Defeat the Epic Foe!
LOSE: Let the Capital City get destroyed!
STORY: After the Great War (Tiny Epic Kingdoms), many of the factions, shattered and defeated, looked for something to cling to. One final hope before the last of their race would flow like the river into the ocean of history, gone and forgotten. It was the sages of the Order of Gamelyn who answered their prayers. They provided a new perspective on unity, and a way of life that would welcome peaceful members of any faction. A utopia for all. With very few options and a will to survive, this world alliance became an inevitable truth in the eyes of many of the factions’ leaders. Even factions who hated one another had nothing left but each other. Under the guidance of the Order of Gamelyn, a Capital City was chosen and factions from all over the world came to call this city their new home. At last, the world was at peace… but not for long. A great storm is coming and in the darkness of the mist, there be demons.

You have fought hard and established your Kingdom, but peace never lasts.

Your scouts report that hordes of treacherous monsters is approaching the outskirts of your Capital City. If your Capital City falls you will lose everything, along with your Kingdom.

Gather your friends and defend against the onslaught in this exciting and unpredictable cooperative micro-game!

In Tiny Epic Defenders, players must select their classes and work together to defend against the evil horde and slay the Epic Foe.

Will you take on the role of the Barbarian, the Sorcerer, the Cleric or the Warrior? Each class has a unique player power that you will need to use.

In this fast-paced game, players will scramble between various regions outside their Capital City fighting off enemy hordes! Each region will offers unique properties that players must account for in their strategies.

If your group is fortunate enough to defeat the wave of monsters, you may live long enough to face the Epic Foe! Which Epic Foe will it be? Will you be prepared!?

Does your group have what it takes to survive? Will you have the skill to be crowned the Tiny Epic Defenders!?
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rubik's Perplexus Hybrid
description: Rubik's Perplexus Hybrid is two puzzles united in a mobile labyrinth: a unique Perplexus coupled with a Rubik's Cube! You have to rotate the faces horizontally and vertically to recreate the path of the labyrinth and move the ball forward in 3D and by rotation. Finishing the labyrinth allows you to finish the Rubik's Cube. In all, it has 100 obstacles to overcome!

name: Finding Sasquatch
description:
We set out to build a game that truly captures the legend of Sasquatch. There have been more than 10,000 reported sightings of Sasquatch in the US alone, yet no one has successfully proven or disproven their existence. In Finding Sasquatch, you'll find elements of the legend of Sasquatch - mystery, deception, fact-finding, adventure, and a little right-place-at-the-right-time. We hope this game can bring some mystery and excitement to your game nights, and maybe even create some believers.

What makes Finding Sasquatch unique?

Gameplay depth: There are unique strategy elements around determining how and where to find Sasquatch and players must be strategic about how they influence Sasquatch's location, what information they share with other players, and what information they keep for themselves.

Caters to broad audience: The game has multiple layers of strategy and complexity, making it great for everyone from newbies to hardcore gamers. Play it for family game night, with your gaming group, or just 1 on 1 with your bestie.

Beautiful artwork and high quality cards: To fully capture the Sasquatch theme we focused on getting the artwork, graphic design, and physical features just right. Gameplay aside, we think you'll be pleased with the quality of the product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Mythology

name: Wolfpack
description:
Kill (collect) as many sheep and strange wolves as possible. And don't always just be nice - this is how you get to victory faster.

Cards are drawn one after the other from the flock of sheep. As soon as the action cards are used, the game gets really exciting.

The game ends. when all strange wolves are eliminated or there are no more sheep on the table that can be picked up.



Reisse (sammle) so viele Schafe und fremde Wölfe wie möglich. Und dabei nicht immer nur nett sein - so kommt man schneller zum Sieg. Es wird der Reihe nach Karten aus der Schafherde gezogen. Sobald die Actionkarten eingesetzt werden, bekommt das Spiel so richtig Spannung. Zudem ist das Spiel hochwertig verpackt und erstklassig designt. Empfohlen ab 10 Jahren empfohlen und für 2 - 5 Spieler.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Multiple Maps, Take That

name: The Last Starfighter: Tunnel Chase
description: Fight the tunnel chase battle of the movie "The Last Starfighter". May also be played by more players where the last player alive wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Track Movement

name: Quadryx
description:
Quadryx is defined as a "logic game of strategic control". It's an abstract game played by 4 players on an octogonal game board divided in 37 square spaces. Each player has a group of 9 square tiles, each divided in 4 triangles of different colors. Each player will be represented by a one color, and the goal of the game is building squares (quadryx) by joining two triangles of the same color, while trying to make it difficult for the other players to do the same. The one who builds the most quadryx wins.

It's also possible to build a fulldryx, which is 4 quadryx of the same color joint together. If there is a tie on the number of quadryx, the winner is the one with most fulldryx.

Quadryx (also known as Qryh) is an ancient game whose origins go back to the 11th century. It was brought back thanks to spanish teacher and researcher Antonio José López,who spent almost 25 year gathering information from historical documents about a similar game from the Escuela de Estudios Talmúdicos de Lucena (Spain), where Jews, Christians and Moors took part equally.

According to the researcher, there is historical evidence of its presence on Lucena's nobles' homes around 1100.
Later, the game re-appears on El Cairo, where the greek sailor Saulo de Quirón finds it and gives it as a present to King Alhamar of Granada (Spain), who gave it to his concubines from the Alhambra's harem. It stood there from 300 years until the kingdom fell in christian hands.
In 1501, Abraham Cohen, a convert merchant from Lucena found it in Granada's Aljaba, and remembered seeing it when he was young, so he took it back to Lucena.
From that moment on, the game's trail was lost.

It was first brought back on May 2001, and it was later launched internationally by Famosa on 2002.

name: Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 5 - Set 3
description:
Car Wars Fifth Edition Starter Set, Division 5 - Set 3 is a complete starter set for Car Wars: the basic rules, counters and components, and two cars. The cars are Napalm vs. Dagger (with each have modifications). Division 5 duels allow a total of $5,000 for a vehicle. The Car Wars Turning Key included in the set is especially helpful.

Part of the Car Wars (Fifth Edition) Series.

Expands:

Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Lowdown Dice Game
description:
In the Lowdown Dice Game, players attempt to get the lowest score possible by rolling color and number dice and filling in the results on their individual player boards using the included dry-erase markers.

On your turn you roll 4 dice - two number dice and two color dice. At the same time, the player to your left rolls 2 dice, a color die and a number die and keeps the results hidden from you. You must choose either a) take a color and number die from the four you rolled, or b) take the mystery dice rolled by the player to your left. Whichever you take, you must write the number you selected in a space matching the color you selected on your player board. The remaining players then each choose a color and number combination from the remaining dice and write that on their board. Remember, the higher the value of the die, the more points it's worth (and you want the lowest score possible).

If you ever manage to create a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of numbers that are either 3-of-a-kind or 3 numbers that add up to 10, you get to cross out that row, reducing their value to zero.

The game ends when any one player completely fills in two of their three grids, then all players add up the total value of the numbers showing on their boards. The player with the lowest score wins.

name: Marlborough at Blenheim
description:
Simulation game of the Battle of Blenheim, Marlborough's famous victory of 1704 during the War of the Spanish Succession. One player plays with the British and the Imperial troops, the other with the French and the Bavarians.

Game includes a 17" by 22" map, a 8-page rulebook, a charts and tables sheet and 120 back printed counters.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: You're Pulling My Leg!
description:
You'll laugh out loud as you and your friends try to fool each other with outrageous stories about your lives. When a card is drawn and a question is asked, the secret roll of the die tells you if your answer should be true or made up.

When you hear a story, bet tokens on whether you think your friend is telling the truth or pulling your leg. You'll win tokens if you're right but lose them if you're wrong. Think you know your friends? How well do they know you? Bluff other players but don't let them fool you. Score enough tokens and you win!

Tell me about...

a time in your life
you would repeat.

something you got away with as a kid.

something you learned about life from
your mother.

Recommended age: Ages 13 and up

name: Four in a Square
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Just as the Four in a Square suggests, you want to be the first player to form a 2x2 square with four balls of your color.

On a turn, you place a ball of your color in an empty spot, then slide a board tile to try to get four of your color in a square. That's it!

name: Mega Man: The Board Game – Rush Character
description:
Created by Dr. Light to help Mega Man in his travels, Rush is a faithful companion, and is helping Mega Man fight the Robot Masters of Dr. Wily in Mega Man The Board Game!

Contents:
1 Rush Figure + Character Card
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Foursight
description:
From the back of the box:

FOURSIGHT - a classic game for two, is the only board game that actually allows you to play half of your opponent's pieces as well as your own. To win, you must learn to think like your opponent and have the foresight to change your strategy as conditions of play change. Your object: get 4 in a row to win immediately or three in a row four times. Colored scoring pieces may only be played on neutral (foundation) pieces. Plan your strategy well, because once you've placed your pieces on the board, they can't be moved.

FOURSIGHT combines the simplicity of tic-tac-toe with the challenge of chess for a game of infinite variations.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: The Nations Assemble
description:
The Nations Assemble is the fifteenth game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

It was on this front where Napoleon massed the bulk of his best troops to once and for all shatter the assembled might of the Allied forces opposing him.

The Nations Assemble is a mini-game, postcard sized. Rules at the back, map front and 17 double sided counters along the sides.

The game is a hex and counter game where troops are activated though a standard deck of cards: black activates French units, red Coalition. How many and all is determined by the specific card.

Combat is resolved by comparing combat strengths of the units and drawing cards from that same deck. Whenever a joker is drawn, the turn is over, the deck is reshuffled and a new turn begins.

The player who controls both towns of Probstheide (L4) and Wachau (O3) wins the game, otherwise it is a draw.

This game is part of a series of postcard games about the battle of Leipzig, which can be played individually or combined into a single game called A Bridge Too Few (for this you will need an article published in the 2013 Against The Odds Annual):
13) Marschall Vorwärts!
14) "A Matter of Honor, Sire"
15) The Nations Assemble
16) Trapping the Ogre

name: Swords
description:
Swords is a fast-paced simultaneous action card game for 2-5 players that feels like a multi-person sword fight! It's quick, fun, intense, strategic, and not too difficult to learn. Players play their cards at the same time either on themselves or on an opponent and each card has a different effect depending on where it's played!

Swords is an exciting game of quick decisions and sudden changes in fortune, just like a real sword fight! You and your opponents make your decisions in secret and execute them at the same time, strategies adapt by the second, and every hand is a surprise! You can win by playing aggressively, always attacking and making opponents draw cards, or you can hope that the others will be so busy fighting each other that they won't notice your quickly diminishing hand as you Yield and discard an extra card. Often a person you were just attacking might suddenly become an ally when you realize, almost too late, that someone else is about to win and you need to team up to take them down! There are many different strategies, some readily apparent and others more sneaky, and reading your opponents is just as important as making the right choice at the right time!

Here's a quick summary of how to play!

Everyone starts with seven cards. Each round, players each choose a card in secret and then play their cards at the same time. The goal of the game is to run out of cards first.

There are four types of cards: Attack, Defend, Yield, and Riposte.

You can play any card on yourself or an opponent and each card does a different thing depending on where it is played!

Attack when played on an opponent makes them draw 2 cards. If you play it on yourself you lay a trap for any player who plays a card on you, making them draw 4 cards. But look out, it's risky! Anything that's played on you still hits you, and if no one plays anything on you the trap backfires and you have to draw 2 yourself!

Defend when played on yourself does what you might expect, it defends you! When you play it on someone else, it acts as a sort of guard break, negating cards they've played on themselves... just watch out for that Attack trap, Defend is defenseless against that!

Yield lets you sneak an extra card into the discard pile when you play it on yourself. When you play it on an opponent, however, instead of putting that extra card in the discard you give it to them! Like some kind of card vampire!

Riposte is like a counter attack when you play it on yourself, it bounces Attacks, Yields, and Ripostes back at the person who played them on you. When you play Riposte on someone else it immobilizes them for the next turn, leaving them wide open! Careful though, if more than half of the people playing lay down Riposte on the same turn it causes a Clash and every single person has to draw 2 cards!

The main game is played with 3-5 players but there is also a fun and sneaky 2 player variant that shakes things up with a hidden Dagger mechanic!

A battle usually lasts around 5 to 10 minutes! You can play single battles or play a war where battles award 1 point for a tie or 2 points for winning alone, and the first player to 6 points wins the war!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Apples to Apples: 15th Appleversary Edition
description:
From the back of the box:

Whether it's your first visit to the apple orchard or you've been drinking the cider for years, everyone will find outrageous laughs in the Apples to Apples 15th Appleversary Edition!

It looks a little fancier - all dressed up in black and gold, with updated content to keep things fresh - but it's still the same classic game play that's sold more than 15 million copies! Just play a Black Apple card from your hand that best matches the White Apple card. If the judge picks your card, you win the round!

Packed with exclusive Appleversary scoring tokens and bushels of cards never before seen in a Party Box, the Apples to Apples 15th Appleversary Edition proves that some things just get better with age!

name: My 5 Pets
description:
There are 5 pet shops in the game, each offering a specific pet (dogs, cats, rabbits, parrots and chameleons). Players are trying to amass the largest collection of pets by claiming pets from the pet shops.

The game is played over a several rounds, each of which goes through the following 4 phases:
1. Supply - The pet shops randomly gains new pets.
2. Donation - The players each donate a new born pet to the respective pet shop.
3. Claim - The players attempt to claim older pets that the pet shops are giving away by bidding. Pet shops give away older pets to the first customer that wants them. However if more than one customer wants to claim the same pet, they will decide to keep the pet to avoid a confrontation. However, if one of the claimants can provide a more conducive shelter for the pet, he will be given the pet during a confrontation. This phase will recur until all the pets in the shops are given away or the players all decide to stop claiming pets.
4. Birth - The players' pets give birth to new born pets.

Play continues through the 4 phases in each round recurrently until the deck runs out.

At the end of the game, players tally the number of pets they have as well as check who has the most shelters for each type of the pet. The player with the most shelters for each type of pet takes a penalty(loses some pets) as they are deemed to have too many shelters and thus insufficient space for the pets to live comfortably. The players with the most pets for each pet type gains a bonus (gains more pets of that type). After applying the penalties and bonuses, the player with the most pets win.

name: Exact Change
description:
Exact Change
Best Game on the market to teach children to count money!

Teach children to count money with a fun game the entire family can enjoy!

Exact Change combines an excellent teaching lesson with fun, fast paced action that the entire family will love. The goal is to play all of your cards first. You can discard cards by matching the color of the last card played, by matching the currency value (play a penny on a penny), or by making EXACT CHANGE. Making exact change allows you to discard multiple cards that add up to the value of the last card played. If the last card played shows a quarter, you can make exact change by playing two dimes and a nickel- allowing you to discard three cards in one play!
If you’re looking for games about money! Look no further! Exact Change is the best game on the market that teaches children to count money! Exact Change is a favorite of teachers!

Winner of iParenting Media, Dr. Toy’s Top 100, Creative Child Magazines Seal of Excellence, and the National Parenting Center’s Seal of Approval awards!

Winner of a 2013 KIDS PRODUCT OF THE YEAR AWARD & a 2013 PREFERRED CHOICE AWARD in the Educational Products & Cards Games for Kids categories!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Number
publishers: Continuum Games, Crossen Creations, Learning Resources

name: Gui Bo Shi Sheng Xiao
description:
Every player is a little turtle and you need to study hard to pursue your PhD. In this game, all you need to do is rolling the dice and following the instruction on the place where you stop. The winner is the one who go to the destination first.

This game is an old Taiwanese game.

name: Serial Killer: Second Edition
description:
Serial Killer 2nd Edition is a 4-50 players bluffing and hidden role game.

In Victorian era, surrounded by crime and suspicion, the citizens and police must find and arrest the killers before blood of the innocents are spread everywhere in the city.

When the game begins, the Serial Killer can "kill" other people by secretly sending the signal (eg. touching, nudging, winking etc.) And whenever a player receives the signal, He/She must die and be eliminated. However, If a Police is eliminated, It's time to find the Serial Killer(s)! the remaining players must discuss and vote for elimination. The Citizen team wins when all Serial Killers are eliminated. In contrast, the Criminal team wins when the number of Serial Killer(s) equals to half of the remaining players, or all Police and Detectives are eliminated.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Real-Time, Role Playing, Voting

name: Simon²
description:
This is a two sided version of the original Simon game. One side features classic Simon-style game play in three modes: Classic Simon, Challenge Simon, and Group Simon.
The reverse side of game features two separate and complete game play areas for head-to-head play and four games: Double Simon, Extreme Simon, Ultimate Simon, and Counter Attack Simon.

name: Gold Up
description: A light party game where players are pirates collecting the most treasure possible by matching colored key cards to colored chests. Watch out though as some cards allow players to steal collected chests and keys. Whomever has the most coins at the end of the game wins.

name: Maybe It's Poison
description:
Maybe It's Poison is a game for 3-8 players where several guests sit down for tea, but only a few leave alive. Cups are shuffled and placed facedown on the table in front of each player with one extra cup than there are players. Players take turns to check the cups, memorize them to discover their delicious tea, and use action cards to rotate the cups' positions. The person with the tea in front of them when 'Cheers!' is said wins! The rest are poisoned...

—description from the publisher

name: 18Texas
description:
Welcome to the Lone Star State!

The railroad development in Texas was concentrated in the east with the major cities of Dallas-Fort Worth, Austin, Houston, and San Antonio serving as commercial hubs.

18Texas is one of the simplest 18xx games designed, but retains the core features of what makes 18xx game so engaging. Build your railroads from the Piney Woods in East Texas to the wide desert swaths of West Texas. The map primarily covers the eastern portion of Texas where the railroads were most abundant.
The game starts with private companies that are much simpler than most 18xx games, but each game will be a little different with a random company selected by Jay Gould. This company will have a head start on the other companies because of this initial investment. However, the other players will have a chance to catch up with balanced private company powers of their own!
Enjoy your time criss-crossing the state with twisting tracks!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hexagon Grid, Market, Network and Route Building, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Ringmaster
description: Colorful, but simple spin and move game revolving around a circus theme.

name: Pirates! Stratego
description:
Stratego Pirates is an exciting game for two brave pirate captains!

Can you lead your pirates to victory? The aim of the game is to conquer the flag by boarding your enemy's ship.

By cunningly flipping the action cards, you can influence whether you get to board, fire the cannon, fight or feed one of your opponents to the sharks.

Will you be the first to capture your opponent's flag? If so, you win the game!

For 2 players and ages 5+.

The difference between Stratego and Pirates! Stratego is the use of the canon and the use of the action tiles. This makes it a much more luck based game and more suitable for little children.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Pirates

name: Harry Potter: Kampf gegen die dunklen Mächte
description:
In Harry Potter: Kampf gegen die dunklen Mächte ("Battle against the Dark Forces"), each player slips into a random role, possibly a Hogwarts student, wizard, or witch with magical abilities, and possibly an insidious Death Eater.

A game lasts one night, during which players use their special abilities, and one day during which everyone votes on who could be a Death Eater. The role of the player with the most votes loses, as does everyone on their side of the battle, so choose carefully! A free game master app guides the players through the evening and offers atmosphere at the gaming table.

Harry Potter: Kampf gegen die dunklen Mächte features gameplay similar to One Night Ultimate Werewolf.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Brunch at the Coliseum
description:
From the publisher's web site...

"Play a gladiator, slave or even a lion as you do your best to win the favor of the Emperor in the Roman Coliseum. Combat isn't your only weapon, and remember, you don't have to run faster than the lion..."

From back of game:

Can you run faster than the lion?

Chris throught he could... so did Dan.

Who knows their fate? Only you can decide.

Brunch at the Coliseum is a hilarious game of strategic and tactical survival for two or more players ages 12 and up. Violent themes.

name: Chicane
description: In a hand of Chicane, each of the Decktet cards is treated as just having one suit. For the double-suited number cards, only the top or bottom suit is active in a given hand. Players bid to determine which it will be.

name: Can't Catch Me, Olivia!
description:
Now you've done it...you pushed Olivia a little too far! Move Olivia around a self destructing grid of 5x5 cards and have her catch your opponents before they have her catch you! Survive three rounds of play to be the winner!

Players draw cards not from a deck, but from a board that Olivia starts the game in the middle of. Players can then move Olivia around the board by swapping her card with other cards. The board gets progressively smaller as the game goes on, a mechanic you need to use to your advantage to knock out other players or end rounds while you're ahead on points. Drawn cards allow you to move Olivia, discard cards from the board, secretly swap the card in your hand with one on the board, and, eventually, have Olivia catch other players who are not protected by any cards between them and her!
