In Starting Lineup Talking Baseball, one or two players take on the role(s) of Major League Baseball managers. Each player tries to out manage his opponent using teams made of up of actual MLB players.

On defense, the manager can choose the pitch type and location. He can also choose to intentionally walk a player or to bring his infielders in to increase the chances of getting a runner out at home.

On offense, the manager must choose the type of swing (bunt vs. power, for example). He can also increase the chances for a hit if he can guess the location of the pitch. The manager may also choose when to attempt a stolen base.

Both managers may, of course, make substitutions.

The game came with All-Star Teams comprised of American League and National League players. Additional cartridges that contained all 26 MLB teams (as of 1988) were available so that you could play a game between any two teams.

name: Monopoly: ESPN Ultimate Sports Fan
description:
Are you one of the millions that tune in to SportsCenter daily? Do you rely on ESPN for all of your up to the minute sports news and scores? Ever dream of owning and running ESPN? Well, now it’s possible. The MONOPOLY Brand is proud to present the ESPN Ultimate Sports Fan Edition of the world’s most famous board game.

For over 25 years, ESPN has been the World Wide Leader in Sports and now you can buy, sell and trade all of the programs that have made ESPN the most tuned into sports programming network. SportsCenter, Pardon the Interruption and College GameDay are yours to own and control in this classic game of risk taking and deal making.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: I Say, Holmes!
description:
The game is afoot as you leave Holmes’ apartment at 221-B Baker Street and make your way through London and The Country to solve a mysterious case. Travel about by Train or Hansom Cab to visit locations like Scotland Yard, the West End, a Country Village, or return to Baker Street where interesting twists ensue.

Players will find clues, receive telegrams, don disguises, call the local constabulary, deal with inspectors, and name suspects in their pursuit to discover and arrest the villains who are hiding in other player’s card hands.

Are you a mastermind who can find a villain like Professor Moriarty, or will he manage to flee England and escape?

Time scale: Each game equals one case that is chock full of movement, locations, information, suspicion and action.

name: Commander-In-Chief
description:
Commander-In-Chief is a fun fast-playing abstract strategy war game published by X Plus Products in which a player's Air, Land and Sea military vehicles work as a unified Armed Forces assault team to "capture" their opponent's Commander. The board consists of a traditional 8 square x 8 square checkerboard grid divided into two Land areas separated by a Sea area. Vehicles are restricted to movement within their assigned battlefields: Through the Air, On Land and/or In the Sea.

Pieces transverse the board in a Chess-like manner. Play evolves, turn by turn, with each player analyzing the current battlefield situation, adjusting their game plan accordingly and executing commands (movements of the playing pieces) in a collective effort to achieve the game's objective. Certain Air pieces (Bombers and Helicopters) can Go Over pieces; likewise certain Sea pieces (Submarines) can Go Under pieces. Additionally, certain pieces (Bombers and Tanks) can Block. The complete Original Release Basic Training Game Rules include "Object of the Game" options, "Team Game Play" options and "Advanced Game Play" options. "Future" options will include new movements, expansion pieces, additional damage control options, new attack features, mini wars and expanded terrains as variants to the Original Release Game Rules.

While this abstract strategy war game does not include random chance, it does allow for piece enhancements both during game play and during board set up which increases come from behind opportunities and can be used to level the playing field between players of various skill levels. The game can be played one-on-one or as a social game with teams. The military theme, the terrain feature of Air, Land and Sea areas of the board and the movements of the pieces themselves relative to the military vehicles they represent give the game a real world appeal.

The two Armed Forces consist of the following fifteen pieces per side: one Commander, two stealth Fighters, two army Tanks, one stealth Bomber, two submersible Submarine warships, two Helicopters, four amphibious assault vehicles (Amphibians) and one surface combatant Destroyer warship. This military themed board game, representing two Armed Forces, "Supports Our Troops" as the game of the "Y" by donating $1 to the Armed Services YMCA for every game sold.

Commander-In-Chief is a 3-In-1 board game that includes Chess & Checkers; these Classics are played on the dark and light colored side of the double sided game board. Additional game play options include: Tic-Tac-Toe and The Triangle Puzzle Game. Lastly, the 30 pieces that come with the game are miniatures, 30 Military Toys, designed for play with or without this board game and the 30 bases that the miniatures mount on, when inverted, become 30 Stackable Spinning Tops designed for multiple family fun games.

name: Kill the King
description:
Kill the King is a tactical board-wargame where two players control one army each. One player attacks a castle while the other player try to defend it and prevent the attackers from killing the king. The attackers have to hurry because the defenders will soon be reinforced by its own cavalry. Returning to save the day.

You can also play two alternate game modes of Kill the King in addition to the normal mode. The first is a regular battle between the two players armies outside the castle walls. The second is a big version of the normal mode where you combine two game boards. One player defends the combined castle of the two game boards, while two players try to attack the castle on one side each.

The pictures are not from the finished game but from the prototypes.

name: Puzzle Duel
description:
Each players gets a puzzle-frame, 8 big pieces and 8 small pieces (one or two squares).
You put five big pieces into the frame. The empty spaces you fill up with the small pieces. Then you remove the big pieces. After that the players give each other their puzzle-frame and the five pieces. The first player that can put the five pieces back into the frame, wins the game.
To make it more difficult, you can give each other 8 pieces. In that case, you don't know which five to use.

name: True Stories 2
description:
A cheeky game about ludicrous tall stories for 2 up to 6 players. Life writes the craziest stories. But what can we believe, and what is just a pack of lies? Who is lying his head off? Find it out – with the game for know-alls, wiseacres and lovers of unnecessary knowledge.

Aim of the game
Find out which stories are lies and collect points. That is the only way to win this game.

The Question-Cards
Every question-card contains one question, three wrong answers and one correct answer. The correct answer is marked in colour. Also, the correct answer is always either the first, or the last answer on the card.

name: Peter and the Grown Ups
description:
Peter and the Grown Ups is a game of strategy and bluffing in which you play a group of adults who have mysteriously been spirited to Peter's island. To blend in with the locals, you have to earn their trust.

Explore the island by drawing a location tile, then performing the action you find on that tile — or, if you prefer, you can bluff and state you have found another tile and perform a different action, but you'll have to be convincing! If an opponent calls your bluff, you lose trust points and you won't be able to perform any action.

At the end of the game, the player with the most trust wins.
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Activity Multi Challenge
description:
Description from the publisher:

Activity has been around for more than 25 years, and Activity Multi Challenge is the latest version of the game, with players winning or losing together!

In this communication game, players on the team need to guess six terms before time runs out, and you need to plan well since 24 cards must be finished in order to win the game. Things to be guessed come in fifteen categories, and in addition to mentioning these categories to help others guess the hidden term, you can draw activity coins in order to give additional clues, with ten different types of activities being possible, from rhyming to alliteration to pantomiming to talking backwards and more.

name: Chio Hero
description:
Welcome to Chio Hero's world! Command your army in a tic-tac-toe battlefield, and explore a wonderful and mysterious world!

Chio Hero is a competitive card game. Players take on heroes from Riwarren Land to provoke an epic confrontation. Heroes are all equipped with their own tactics. You can either knock down your opponents by power of units or change the whole situation with spells. What will happen when marvelous skills are combined? You decide!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Take That

name: Inspiration
description:
In Ancient Greece, a Museion (Museum in Latin) was originally a temple for the worship of the Muses, later becoming a place dedicated to works inspired by these goddesses. The nine Muses were believed to provide mankind with inspiration for all the fine arts and sciences and worship of them was often celebrated with contests of music and poetry and games of skill and knowledge.

Created for The Fitzwilliam Museum by Oxford Games, Inspiration is a game of skill and knowledge with a difference—here the answer is provided and you have to supply the question! The object is to write a plausible question for the given answer in order to bluff fellow players into believing that your question is in fact the correct one.

At the start of play, you may select one of the nine Muses to be your inspiration throughout the game. In each round, one player picks up an Answer & Question card and reads the answer aloud. The other players write down (in secret) a plausible question for this given answer. All efforts are handed to the reader. The reader then reads out all the questions (including the question written on the answer card) taking care to disguise the author of each. Players take it in turn to select the question they believe is the one given on the Answer and Question card. When all players have chosen, the actual authors are revealed.

Contents
Forty-five Muse cards (five of each of nine Muses)
One hundred and fifty-five double-sided Answer and Question cards
Score pad
Six pencils
A Rules of Play and Information Scroll

name: Richard I the Lionheart
description:
"'The Devil is loose', spake Philip II of France to Prince John of England. Thus was announced the return of Richard I the Lionheart from prison to the leadership of the Angevin Empire. Weeks later, Richard's pennant once again flew over the battlefields of France, and Richard proved again himself to be the preeminent warrior of his time."

Richard I the Lionheart, is a strategic game of Richard's French campaigns during the period 1194-1199 . . . The game accurately reflects Richard's campaigns for France, and is suitable for moderately experienced players."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Algoritmo
description:
Algoritmo won the first edition of the contest for unpublished games, Premio Archimede, in 1994. Quality Game published it the year after.
Each player has a little plastic computer that runs on the board to get rid of all the "output cards" he got at the beginning. Each player has a little cardboard "console" with three boxes called A, B and C. The player draws three numbers from a special deck. He arrange them on the boxes as he see fit. To move on the board, dice are not used: the little computer can advance of A + B spaces, A - B spaces or, from certain spots, of B x C spaces. Numbers can be changed in certain spaces. When the computer stops on a space with a certain letter, the player can discard the matching "output card" if he has one. When a player lands exactly on the "End" space, the one with less output cards wins.

name: Win-A-Lot
description: A simple stock market game. Each player has a hidden card. On there turn they can buy and sell shares from the bank. After everyone has bought shares, all cards are revealed. Share values are moved up and down according to the revealed cards. The player at the end of the game with the most money wins.

name: Mortal Kombat Kard Game
description:
Based on the Mortal Kombat I and II video games - Mortal Kombat Kard Game puts you in charge of deciding the fate of earth; you choose to play as your favourite Earthworld or Outworld Kombatant in Two-Player Mode or in Multi-Player Brawl Mode.

The game objective is to win the Mortal Kombat Tournament which consists of a set number of Matches. The player who wins the most Matches becomes the winner of the Tournament. In order to win, players let their Kombatants fight in Mortal Kombat using kicks, punches, special moves, kombos and deadly finishing moves.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Super Striker
description: 5 a side Football game. Very much like Subbuteo but played on a Hard Board with a felt like finish. Push the players heads to make them kick, goal keepers dive and twist.
publishers: Mecca Jeux, Parker Brothers, Peter Pan Playthings, Spear's Games

name: Santa Claus is Comin' to Town
description:
From the Introduction in the rules:

"It's Christmas Eve. The little town of Elfenbein is covered with snow. To help Santa find his way in the snow, the people of the town have dug out 'streets' and crooked 'paths' between their houses. Now they are all waiting patiently in their homes for Santa's presents, roasting chestnuts on an open fire to kill the time. All people, except some naughty kids. They have discovered a new game: Santa watching! Santa enjoys the game too as he is the only one who has discovered the crooked paths. And when everything else fails to escape the kids he can always use some magic..."

Han Heidema gave out specially designed games as Christmas cards; one for every year from 1990 to 1999. This was card #9 and was sent out in 1998. It features artwork by Doris Matthäus.

One player is Santa and the other 2-3 players are the naughty kids. Each player is given the cards of one suit from a normal deck of cards. A round consists of each player simultaneously choosing a card to play. Whoever plays the highest card selects the order of play for the round. Each player's card will also determine how far that player can move. Santa scores points for dropping off presents at houses without being seen. The naughty kids each score points for seeing Santa and collecting the presents he's delivering. The game lasts 13 rounds (the number of cards each player has).

Mik Svellov's website states "Han Heidema was given credit as a gesture by Alan Moon."

name: Wicked Whist
description:
WICKED WHIST is a board game which adds another dimension to the classic card game - Whist.

The object of the game is to graduate from one corner of the playing board to the eye at the center. This is achieved by playing Whist and, after each hand, moving clockwise around the board - one square for each trick made. The first player to reach the center (having made exactly the right number of tricks) is the winner.

There are two ways of achieving this:

1. By completing full circuits of the board and by moving from one level to the next at selected points.

OR

2. By means of special squares which send you from outer to inner circuits (or vice versa) in a manner similar to Snakes and Ladders.

The layout of the board forces players to consider in advance how many tricks they require to win so as to land on an advantage square, or avoid a forfeit square. At the same time they must also consider what they need to do to force their opponents into minimizing the tricks they win, or forcing tricks on them so that they land on a forfeit square.

name: Quibbix
description:
On the "Spiel des Jahres" 1981 Recommended Games list, "Quibbix" is a timed tile word game.

A translation of Uwe Petersen´s short description on the "Spiel des Jahres"-site:

First you draw 10 out of 120 face-down letter tiles. Then you try to create words by using as many of them as possible within 5 minutes time. The points of the tiles – depending on the chosen difficulty from 1 to 3 – are written into your score-board. The score for the longest word is doubled. Then you draw 5 more tiles, combine them with your old tiles to new words and score them again. In a third round you again draw 5 tiles, create words as long as possible with your 20 tiles, score them and determine the winner by adding all points together. With these simple rules Gilbert Obermair (who left the jury of “Spiel des Jahres”) created one of the funniest word-games of the last time.

Originally published by Intelli in 1980. Ravensburger republished it in 1984.

name: El Dorado
description:
A very rare Rudi Hoffmann game.
The aim of the game is to reach the Isle of Dreams ELDORADO. Each player receives four markers, which are one color (red, yellow, blue or white) on top. All markers are green on the bottom. Players roll a single D6 and move any one of their markers the total count on their turn. Markers can land on top of one another, and, in so doing, trap opponents' markers, or their own until the top one is voluntarily moved off the stack. If a player's marker lands on the white spaces (in the water), that marker is turned into an island (green side up) and is stuck there, able to be used as a stepping stone for other players, for the duration of the game. The marker(s) that reach ELDORADO are stacked in the order that they reach there. Final score is highest for the top marker (last to arrive) and decreases for those lower in the stack. The winner is decided by the player whose marker(s) score the highest total points in the final stack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Calypso
description:
[Translated from French, so might not be completely accurate...]

Calypso is at the same time a game of memory and deduction. In the center of the table, 6 tiles show fish of different colors, with another colored fish on the reverse. There are 4 colors in total. When the die roll shows a blue fish, you must turn over a plate to reveal a blue fish. It is thus useful to remember the movements of the fish. But when your memory fails, your powers of deduction can take over.

Imagine that you must turn over a red fish and that the situation on the table is as follows:

Purple fish, Yellow fish, Yellow fish, Blue fish, Blue fish, Blue fish

You can deduce that a red fish is under purple fish. Indeed, the three blue fish are blue/red, blue/yellow and blue/purple. The two yellow fish are thus yellow/red and yellow/purple. The last fish is thus purple/red, the only missing combination.

This combination of reasoning and memory allows kids and adults to play each other. Whilst the adults can play the reasoning game, kids are generally much better at memory games!

name: The Amazing Moa Hunt
description:
(From the publisher's website)

The Amazing Moa Hunt is a truly iconic New Zealand game. If you like treasure hunts, you’re going to love searching beautiful Aotearoa for Moa treasures (footprints & eggs) by guessing the location of New Zealand towns and cities. Experienced explorers can play a second, even more challenging game. Using a set of clue cards, you can launch a fast paced battle requiring quick thinking and even quicker answers!

* Enjoy some fun family times together for Ages 8 and up
* 2 games in one for 2-4 players
* Build both knowledge and memory skills
* Perfect for both classroom and home use
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pizza Bake-Off
description: Players attempt to complete pizza recipes by collecting different resources from various places in the kitchen. Movement is done using addition and subtraction cards to move to various spaces - which reward the player with a topping or a special card they can use. The board is two-sided, so that players can play with single or double-digit addition.

name: Meias Palavras
description:
Imagine a sequence of words: pasta, Italy, Pope, etc ...
Pasta recall Italy, Italy recalls Pope. And Pope recalls...?

Each player starts with a part of sequence of words (six total). Exchanging bits of information one discovers the entire sequence before the others. He is the winner!

name: Critical Hit! Issue 4
description:
Fourth biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
Armored Assault Tactics by Capt. Robert Modarelii III
Rangers Lead the Way by Steven C. Swann
Interview with Brian Martuzas
Stagnation and Innovation by Kurt Martin
Ernie Pyle: The Battle of San Pietro by Ray Tapio
ASL Action in the U.K. and the Midwest by Pete Phillips and Burnie Hegdahl
Roasting Chestnuts by Ted Blek and Alan Freedman

Scenarios:
CH41 Test of Nerves
CH42 Teryaeva Sloboda
CH43 Opening Blow
CH44 Operation Norwind
CH45 Curtain Call
CH46 Zerf Stranglehold
CH47 Steel and Irony
CH48 Double or Nothing!
CH49 High Danger
CH50 Simmons' Rebuff
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Arcane Legions: Egyptian Army Pack – Cavalry
description:
From the box:

Mark Anthony commands the combined might of Greece and Egypt, but the sorceress Cleopatra VII commands him. Together they field an arcane army like none that has walked the Earth, its ranks filled with undead from Egyptian tombs, creatures of legend, the mighty Roman 13th Legion, and even the ancient gods themselves - all barely controlled by powerful sorceresses.
categories: Ancient, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology

name: Grunts
description:
Squad level war game with a Brit comic (think Warlord,Battle) theme.

The goal is to capture an enemy bunker in 6 turns using combinations of actions and assaults found on the game panels.

No construction needed. Just print and play on A4 (both sides) and find 1D6 and 6 coins.

Entry in the 2014 solitaire print and play contest.

name: Hell's Rising: Dante's Adventure
description:
This is a boardgame based in Dante Alighieri's literary work "The Divine Comedy". Your goal is the game is to collect souls.
To achieve such a task, you assume the role of one of the main characters. Dante, Beatrice, Orpheus and Virgil are the heroes available in the basic box of the game, up to 4 players can play.

There are no dices involved in this game. Players will be interacting over the board, using their few action points to progress in the game.
Many options are available, you can use your action points to recruit hosts for war, play your cards, declare wars, conquer teritories, stop wars, invoke guardians... The main goal of the game can be achieved following different strategies; and luck always plays its part too.

The dark art style designed by for this game has been mostly done "from and over the paper", her creator Melissa J.G. honors Dante's writtings this way.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based, Religious, Renaissance
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: First Dates: The Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

The official game of Channel 4’s cult show, First Dates.

What's it like?

It’s a bit like Mr & Mrs with attitude. You and your pretend date get asked seriously awkward questions and the other couples get to guess the outcome. Perfect for students, dinner parties and trips down the pub. The game is only loosely based on the TV show, so you can still enjoy the game without knowing too much about it.

How to play:

Players split into couples – they are on a fictional date in a restaurant. Turn by turn, each couple gets asked different questions from the ‘Starters’ deck.

Example: “Who has the better fashion sense?” The couples must decide on their answers without conferring. If they agree with each other and both write down the same name, they win 2 points. If they disagree and write different names, they win 0 points.
Meanwhile, the other couples get to bet on whether the active team will agree or disagree. If they predict correctly, they gain 1 point. If incorrect, they get 0.

Once every couples has answered a ‘Starter’ card, they move onto the even more awkward questions in the ‘Main Course’ deck, before finishing on the painfully-awkward questions in the ‘Dessert’ deck.

The winning couple is the one with the most points at the end of dinner.

name: Bazyliszek
description:
In the cellars of one of the tenement houses in Warsaw there is a basilisk - a creature that can turn a man into stone at a glance.

You go to the underworld to face the terrible monster. During the search, visit as many chambers as possible. Remember, however, to bring a mirror with you - maybe you can hunt down a basilisk!

Basilisk is a fast game of perceptiveness and memory, where children must memorize the appearance of rooms and find their mirror image. In real time, players reveal the dungeon cards and decide if they want to visit the given chamber (and keep the card), or leave the uncovered card on the table.

After each card has been revealed, the round ends and players check their cards and score. Each chamber with its mirror counterpart is worth 5 points and each single chamber is worth 1 point. But there is a twist, if a player have more than 1 card with the same, non mirrored illustration, he/she has been petrified by the basilisk and loses all cards from this round!

The game lasts 2-3 rounds, depending on the number of players. The player with the most points wins.

name: Pestka, drops, cukierek
description:
Pestka, drops, cukierek is a kid's journey to the world of economics. The game presents the basic mechanisms of demand and supply in an accessible way, and at the same time it tells an extraordinary story of a mysterious land hidden in Julek's pocket. The evil king forbids everything that gives joy, health and happiness! Your task is to make the magical land be vibrant again. But you must hurry - the evil king raises funds to pay for the army, which is to punish the rebel residents. The fate of the kingdom is in your hands!

The game was created on the basis of a book by one of the most valued Polish writers for children - Grzegorz Kasdepke.

Gameplay:
There are 7 action fields on the board. In your turn, you can move to any field in a clockwise direction (Players themselves choose how many squares they will move their pawn. But the consequence of this quick free access to various actions is the increasing frequency of paying tribute to the king.) On the action field, a player can perform the appropriate action: draw resources, change them into "goods" (for example a pencil into a picture), sell "goods" to inhabitants of gray houses or exchange resources. After each action, active player asks others if they want to pay him 1 coin to do the same action in a limited way.

The game may end in two ways: When the number of gray houses is smaller than the number of players - then the player with the most coins is the winner; When the royal treasury is full, then everybody lose.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Stubborn Mules
description:
NOTE: Compared to the former Das Störrische Muli edition, this one is for 2–5 players instead of 3–5 and you have one more die and therefore more choices and some other movement.

The game is quite simple and definitely family fare. Players race mules and men to the end of the track and back. However, it has some interesting features, particularly in the determination of the winner. Depending upon the number of players, in addition to the mules, there are either 1 or 2 men in the race, each of a unique color. Each player guides either a mule or a man. On a turn, two color dice are rolled and the appropriate tokens moved forward. If two of the same color are rolled, then that token moves backwards one space. Simple enough so far.

The twist is that the next player may opt to keep intact one of the dice and only roll the remaining die. This subtle rules twist allows for some 'catch-up' ability, as well as some nice hoseage as it makes it possible to move one player's token on several consecutive turns if all players keep that die intact. This may sound like a good thing for the affected player, but in reality being the first to cross the finish line is NOT always the best occurrence. What? Well, the game has a very clever mechanism to determine the winner.

If you are the first player to have your token cross the finish line, then you only win if the last piece remaining on the track is a man piece. Otherwise, if the final piece remaining is a mule, then that player is the winner! So, you have to make a judgment during the game as to whether you want to try to finish first or last, then attempt to move the other pieces accordingly.

name: Battle Fries
description:
Try to get the tastiest fries! Be the only one to dip your fries in a sauce, otherwise you might get stuck in it!

In Battle Fries, players each have a hand of 9 Fries cards. During each round, players choose a card secretly, then after a countdown, simultaneously choose a Sauce to send their Fries into. If a player is alone in a Sauce, he gets back his own played Fries card, as well as any Fries cards stuck in that Sauce during the previous rounds, or a Graillon, which also brings victory points. If more than one player chooses the same Sauce, they either be stuck in it, or lose the Fries card played.

Among their 9 cards, players have a Fricadelle card: played in a Sauce, it will clear the other Fries played in that Sauce in the same turn. But, if 2+ Fricadelles meet in the same Sauce, then they are lost, and the Fries recover the advantage.

Finally, the powers of the special Sauces are resolved: each game, the Mayo and Ketchup sauces, as well as 1 or 2 special sauces, are available. Each special sauce brings a particular effect to the player who is alone in it during a turn.

Once all 9 Fries cards have been played, each player counts all the points on the Fries and Graillon, and the winner is the one who has most!

Battle Fries is a fast-learned and fast-played game, that you can play with family and friends at the aperitif, just before eating delicious Belgian Fries and Sauces. Bon appétit!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: The Fairy & the Wizard
description:
The aim of the game is to construct a forest together before the witch casts his spells and cages all the animals. The game is played in turns and the players develop strategies together to ensure that the witch does not win the game.
If a player manages to form the full forest, all the animals are automatically freed and the fairy and the animals win the game!

In their turn the player rolls the dice and does whatever is shown on the face:
BUILD: take the number of forest pieces shown on the dice and place them on the game board following the illustration to create a forest of trees.
MOVE THE FAIRY: move the fairy forward as many squares as shown on the dice.
MOVE THE WIZARD: the player moves the wizard figure along the number of squares on the path shown on the dice and tries to do the action on the square the wizard has landed on.

If the players manage to place the final piece of the forest on the board, all the animals are automatically freed and the fairy and the animals have won the game.
If the wizard manages to turn over the 7 spell pieces, or traps 12 animals in cages, then he wins the game and the players must start again from the beginning.
mechanics: Connections, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Haste Worte? Das Kartenspiel
description:
Find three matching words as quickly as possible for a category and two specific letters. But be careful: If your teammates have written down the same words, you will unfortunately have to delete them and you will not get any points!

—description from the designer

name: Dig a Dino
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The discovery of a 66 million year old T-Rex tooth has ignited a bone-digging frenzy! You command a skilled team of paleontologists looking to win big; who knows what could be down there?

Unfortunately you are not the only team digging and you will have to battle for the limited tools available. Every day you will have to make important decisions over which tools to use; choose wisely!

In this light worker placement game, choose tools and dig through soil and rock to discover buried surprises. The winner is the one to have discovered the most ‘Palaeo Points’ by the end of the game.

name: Muzicando
description:
Muzicando is a card game about the rainbow colors and about musical instruments and notes. The deck consist of 56 cards 8 for each color of the rainbow. 7 cards have the musical notes from DO to TI and the eighth card is a representing a special personality like one of the followings:
Guido d'Arezzo, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, Franz Liszt, Ludwig van Beethoven, Frederic Francois Chopin, Johann Sebastian Bach and Niccolo Paganini.
Guido d'Arezzo was a music theorist of the Medieval era. He is regarded as the inventor of modern musical notation (staff notation) that replaced neumatic notation and thus he is the most powerfull card in the game causing all the players to skip a turn when played giving an aditional turn to the one who played it. The other personalities are some of the best composers of clasical music and when played are causing some players to skip a turn,

The main goal in this game is to be the first to get rid of all the cards. The mechanism to get rid of them is to put them on the table in turns in some ways that depends of an auction made in the first phase of the game. The players can bid for on of the 4 ways to display the cards on the table. These are Sarabanda, Glissando, Parada and Muzicando.

name: Uproar
description:
SIMPLE. FUNNY. UPROARIOUS. If you can read, you can play. Perfect for anyone who likes to laugh – a lot. Like, till it hurts a bit.
EASY TO PLAY. Take two cards, spot the only matching pair of words, and be the first to sound out the answer. Bring on your BWEEEOEW NOWNOW BWOW guitar solo, your WHOOOOSH BANG firework, your BUCKCAUUUK? confused chicken.
MULTI-GENERATIONAL. This party game is perfect for adults, grannies, grumpy uncles, trendy teens, and kids aged 8 years plus.
LOOKING FOR DRINKING GAMES? Yup, you found one. Our pocket-sized, purse-perfect pack can go anywhere: a friend’s birthday party, board game night, a family gathering where you’d rather play a hilarious new word game over answering questions about your life choices.

—description from the publisher

name: Communication
description: Game based on the advertising industry where each player is an agency trying to get contracts creating the best campaign for the specific customer. Cards contains words and phrases to compose a campaign with fantasy and humor.

name: Singularity
description:
Long long ago, in a galaxy probably fairly distant. There is a war between two to four sides. Each with the banner of a different colour. Only when they are the last colour standing will they be victorious. Only the best Hue may be victorious.

Singularity is a free and Print & Play, tactical wargame with fleets of varying sizes fighting in the depths of space. There are 4 phases to the game which are repeated until one player remains standing. The four phases are Ability, Move, Fire and Repair. Each of the phases are completed in order of initiative. Each of the five type of basic ship have a special ability as well as a full arsenal of deadly weapons to destroy the foes. Will you nuke them from afar or wait until they draw close and destroy them with quantum mines and flak barrages? May the best hue win!

Singularity is released under the Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 2.5 Canada License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.5/ca/
The game easily allows for new people to design and create their own ships and mechanics within the rules of the game.

To ensure you have the latest version: Please check http://www.graphinista.com/singularity/latest I always update BGG with the latest, but it can take a few days. If you'd like to see what I'm working on right now take a look at http://www.graphinista.com/singularity/ it's a jumbled mess of prototype images and ideas!
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Grand Opening!!: Gourmet Town
description:
An epicurean's dream exists in Japan--top quality restaurants offering the finest cuisine from all over the world are gathered in a district known as "Gourmet Town".

As a renowned restaurateur, you are tasked with delivering a successful restaurant in this hotspot of eateries. Quality is a given in this town that offers only the best, so the critical ingredients for success lie in correctly capturing the trends and opening restaurants at the optimal time. Trends are affected by other restaurants in town. They come and go, often rapidly and suddenly, constantly changing with time.

Sweet success is achieved through careful analysis and making tasteful decisions. The time is now to excite people's taste buds with your Grand Opening.

—description from the box
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Empire: Triumphs and Humilations for Power
description:
Empire - the triumphs and humiliations of power. The game consist of a grid map of Europe at the center. Players must control 7 adjacent areas of Europe to win.

Each player is given 5 armies (represented by 5 metal miniatures) which can be given secret values of 1-5 to represent strength. For movement, a dice is shaken and the points distributed at will throughout a player's armies. When 2 opposing armies occupy the same space a battle occurs. Players state the values of their armies (a player can attack an opponent with more than one army), but in doing so can bluff this value. The defender can admit defeat and pay one 'power point' for every attacking army, or not believe the opposing declaration and cards are revealed. The loser now pays 2 'power points' per army. The strength cards are burned and new cards drawn by each player. For every 3 'power points' a player hold, they can control an area of Europe (by claiming it with 1 of their 7 metal towers). If a player runs out of points, a tower must be cashed back in and so a region is lost.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Vietnam
description:
The game represents any of the multiple combats between the North American and South Vietnamese armies against the Vietcong and North Vietnamese troops.

the game contains 360 counters.

similar: Vietnam

name: Blood Bath at Orc's Drift
description:
Blood Bath at Orc's Drift is a campaign pack for use with 2nd edition Warhammer Fantasy. It contains the following components:

Orc's Drift Scenario Book
Command Sheets
Card Buildings
Cardboard Armies
Poster Map
Badge

The game is similar to other Warhammer campaign packs like Perilous Quest or Idol of Gork and provides a number of linked scenarios where the outcome in one scenario affects the starting positions in the next.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Final Frontier
description:
You command an intrepid starship crew, venturing onto new worlds and charting the unexplored quadrants of deep space!

Euro Game #3

Boldly go where no one has gone before in Final Frontier, where you command a vaunted starship crew of humans, aliens and robots, venturing onto new worlds and charting the unexplored quadrants of deep space to face fantastic challenges in the best storytelling traditions of episodic space operas.

While engaging in heroics and daring-do, relationships can form between your crew-members even as they win fame and experience, so only the best leader managing all of the skills and personalities aboard will triumph at the Final Frontier!

Final Frontier is a card-based adventure game for 2-4 players where players manage the crew of a starship as they perform heroic missions. Players take turns selecting different aspects of the mission (Hostile or Exploration, Deep Space or Planetary, Mission Leader, Number of Crew). Players select which crew will go on the mission based on their statistics. The mission is randomly generated by card draw. Dice are rolled to determine the outcome of the mission: success, failure or death. Successfully completing multiple missions earns victory points and possibly crew upgrades.

Dead bridge crew members can be replaced by ensigns. Red Shirts can be substituted to protect your more experienced and valuable crew members.

name: Kesselring
description:
From the introduction:

"Kesselring is a simulation for 2 players of the Allied invasion of Southern Italy in late 1943. One player controls the Axis forces led by Field Marshal Albert Kesselring and the other assumes the role of his historical opponent Field Marshal Bernard Law Montgomery".
This wargame was first presented in The Wargamer Magazine issue 5, and then released as a boxed edition.

The components consist of the following: a 20" by 30" 4-COLOR paper mapsheet; a 4-pages thick paper RULES booklet; a set of 182 cardboard counters; and players will have to provide their own 6-sided DIE prior to play.

The Mapsheet covers an area from just past Rome, south to the 'tip' & 'heel' of the Italian peninsula. Also on the Mapsheet are lettered boxes (A-F), directional boxes (NW, NE), a 'Sicily' box, Combat Results Table A & B, Bombardment Results Table, Terrain Defense Value Chart, Allied & German Replacement Points Tracks, German, U.S., British, & Allied Battlegroups boxes, Terrain Effects Chart, Turn Record Track (from Sept.8-'43~Dec.22-'43~each a week long) with Reinforcements/Replacements indicated, German & Allied (?) boxes, & a circular 'Phase Indicator' for use. The COLORS used are BLUE- (Water features), Light BROWN- (Mountain), BROWN- (Roads), & BLACK- (Town/City, Marsh, High Peak, Beaches, Minor/Major Airbases, Intrinsic Supply Source, and the lettering)-there are also places to indicate at Airbases where units on 'On Ground' or 'In Air'.

The game counters are Light GRAY- (Germans, Italians), YELLOW- (British), BROWN-Allied (NZ, Canadians, Indians, French, Italians), GREEN- (U.S.), all with BLACK print on them. There are also some 'silhouette' counters for Artillery, Anti-Aircraft, Fighters, Bombers, Naval, Bridge, Ambush, Demolition, Advanced Airfield, Forts, and other informational markers in various COLORS. There are also 'Break-down’ (from larger to many smaller units), and 'Battle-group’ (Remnants) counters included.

The Game Turn consists of the following phases with the Allied Player moving first: 1.Headquarters Phase-BOTH Players determine the disposition of these; 2.Weather Determination Phase; 3.Allied Movement Phase; 4.German Strategic Movement Phase; 5. Allied Tactical Movement Phase; 6.BOTH Players Conduct Bombardments; 7.Allied Combat Phase; 8.Allied Replacements & Reinforcements Phase; 9.German Movement Phase; 10.Allied Strategic Movement Phase; 11.German Tactical Movement Phase; 12.BOTH Players Conduct Bombardments; 13.German Combat Phase; 14.German Replacements & Reinforcements Phase.

Some of the 'Special' Rules cover: Weather; 'Hidden' movement (the lettered boxes-A-F & the [?] counters); Movement from the 'Off-Board' areas Sicily- (Allies), & N.W., N.E.~boxes- (Germans only); Sea Movement/Transfer/Invasions; Naval Guns Support; Ports & Beachheads; Destruction of Ports & Beachhead Supply; Demolitions & Ambushes; Para-drops (Allied only); Forts Construction (Germans only); Commandoes; and the Air Module. OPTIONAL Rules include: Invasion Shore Battery Rule, Optional German Order of Battle, and German Security Units & Engineer's Constructions. An Alternative Scenario is: EAST Coast Invasion. There are also some Clarifications, Errata, and Design & Player's Notes included on the inside last page.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt!
description:
Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt! features gameplay similar to that of Machi Koro, but instead of developing your own city, you are creating your own publishing factory. Editing, marketing, sales: Where should you start? Which projects are other players pursuing?

Machi Koro: Bau dir deine Verlagswelt! is a special edition of Machi Koro to celebrate the 200th anniversary of German publisher KOSMOS.

name: Gelini Nightlife
description:
It's Saturday evening and lots of guests are waiting outside the discotheques to be let in. As the host of their clubs the players are trying to control entry and to get as many guests as possible onto their dance floors.

The player furthest back rolls the die, and either accepts the roll or passes it, allowing the player next furthest back to use the roll, and so forth. When a player does use the roll, they move forward, and collect the dancer or special tile on the space. The player who fills his or her dance floor first wins; if someone reaches the final tile without anyone filling their dance floor, the player with the most space filled wins.

Gelini Nightlife is reminiscent of Tutankhamen, except in utilizing a die roll for movement instead of allowing players to move as many spaces as desired.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Thrash'n Roll: Stage Heroes
description:
This expansion introduces new band abilities which can be used in both standard and basic variants. Before the start of the game each player randomly takes one of the disc with a special ability and places it by his or hers band board. There is an ability depicted on the disc.

This (mini-)expansion is included in the Kickstarter edition of Thrash 'n' Roll.

name: Cribb Derby
description:
Cribb Derby combines Cribbage and Horse Racing. The key is the special track with colored peg holes that can be used during pegging to represent bursts of speed by the horses.

This game was originally published as Cribb Racing (Derby Edition), then reprinted as Cribb Derby.

name: Rock, Scissors, Paper
description:
This is not the simple game played with your hands ****




A two player game of strategy in which each player has a set of Rocks, Scissors, and Papers. Each type of piece has different movement abilities on a hexagonal board. They capture one type of piece but are captured by the other type (Rocks capture Scissors but are captured by Paper). Each type of piece interacts differently with pieces of the same type. Two Paper pieces stack on top of one another while Scissors lock together and Rocks knock one another about. The goal of the game is to capture the enemy's flags.

name: Gusher
description:
Gusher is the direct ancestor of Oil Power and King Oil and is similar in concept. The board is a hollow box with irregularly shaped wooden spacers between the top and bottom. The game board is shaken during the game setup to randomize the location of the wooden spacers (oil deposits). The playing surface is divided into 60 real estate parcels, each of which has from one to 10 drilling sites. Players bid to lease parcels, and once they acquire one or more leases, they may drill on their leased tracts at a cost of $10,000 per hole. This cost of drilling is lost if the result is a dry hole, but there is a large payoff for successful wells ("gushers"). Players begin with a stake of $300,000. The game ends when a player accumulates $1 million.

Although the game is largely a contest of luck, there is some strategy. Successful wells tend to be clustered. Thus tracts that are contiguous to parcels on which there are successful wells are more highly valued. Furthermore, because gushers produce revenue for the owner with each turn, successful wells obtained early in the game are considerably more valuable than those obtained near the end.

Play proceeds in turns, and each player upon his turn may designate one or two unleased tracts for bidding or he may choose to drill if he has previously acquired one or more leases and has undrilled sites. Players may sell or trade leases and drilling sites, and they may form partnerships to acquire leases or share the cost of drilling.

In a typical game setup, approximately 15% to 20% of the drilling sites will be gushers. A game generally requires about 20 complete turns.

Early 1940's editions employ a 20.5" x 20.5" game board; these feature boxes with deep, dark colors and silvered print. Later editions employ a 15.25" x 15.25" game board and light colored boxes with black print.

Game Contents: game board, General Information and Rules, Gusher Game Money, metal drilling derrick, round cardboard markers for leased tracts, round cardboard markers for dry holes, and round wooden "tanks" to collect oil from successful wells.

name: Round Four
description: Round Four is a variant of Connect Four. 2-4 players can play at the same time. The object is still to match four of your color chips in a straight line. The board is four circles inside of each other. the three outer most circles have 16 holes for pieces while the inner circle only has eight. Also some of the holes can fit two pieces inside of it, one on top the other. An added depth to this game is that each circle can be rotated clockwise. During your turn, you can either place a piece, or rotate one of the rings clockwise, causing all of the pieces to shift on that circle. The winner has four of his color pieces in a straight line starting from the inner circle and moving out.

name: Alien Invasion USA
description: Parasitic aliens have infiltrated a small Midwestern town! The town’s inhabitants must find out who amongst them have turned into aliens and defeat them. The 3 player version adds a splinter group of aliens who battle against the townspeople and their fellow aliens and a 4 player version includes government agents, who are only interested in taking specimens – both alien groups or townspeople if need be!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Earthquake
description:
From the box:

Twice now on our Farm we have had minor Earthquakes. They have been very scary and caused damage. What if a really major Quake struck our area? What if our family and the Animal families living in the nearby Forests were away in Meadows the day that the Big Quake began? In this game, you face this very situation. You are like Forest Rangers trying to help the Animal and Human families to get past the spreading Crevices and to their Homes. Your job is to work together as a Rescue Team, sharing your ideas and giving a helping hand to all the Creatures. The random set-up makes each game different & gets children thinking!

name: The Strand War Game
description: A game played on a grid superimposed over a map of the Western Front area. The object is to place a piece on the opponent's "capital" square at the opposite corner of the board. There are three types of pieces: artillery, infantry, and cavalry.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War I

name: Little Shoppers
description:
The game board is made up of colored squares winding around the board. The number of spaces a piece may move is determined by the color of the space. Landing next to the open end of a store space allows the player to take the product from that store, if it remains. Once all products have been taken, the players race back to their home squares. A player's score consists of the point total of their products (marked on the store spaces) plus bonus points awarded to the first three players to reach their home squares.

The game included 24 product playing pieces representing contemporary packaged goods.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Pick-up and Deliver, Track Movement

name: Tigo
description: Players attempt to arrange four counters with numbers from a set of 1 to 10, and three others with "+", "-" and "x", so that specified answers are reached. Cards set up the problems and a board makes them easy to see.

name: Plank
description:
Plank is a public domain game that was included by Sid Sackson in A Gamut of Games.

Players take turns laying "planks" and placing or moving markers on the resulting game board. Each plank has one red, one white and one blue field, which can only be occupied by markers of matching colors. The object of the game is to form a vertical or horizontal line of three markers, as in Tic-Tac-Toe.
publishers: (Public Domain), Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Solo Whist
description:
Bridge-like game played with a normal deck of cards. The difference is that there are only eight or so bids available to the players (ranging from "Proposition and Co-operation", in which two players attempt to take eight tricks, through "Mesaire" in which one player attempts to take zero tricks, up to "Abundance Declared", in which one player attempts to take all 13 tricks himself), and only one round of bidding (in which the dealer bids at the beginning and the end). Another unusual twist is that all of the bids bar one result in one player playing against three.

Special rules for three players.

name: Käpt'n Jan
description: Captain John is always busy sailing his ship transporting goods from far and wide. This is no easy task, because sometimes the parcels are long and thin, sometimes they have lots of corners or they are simply round. Now and then a great wave splashes onto the ship and sweeps a chest overboard. However, it is sometimes possible for the captain to fish the chest back on board again. If he maneuvers his ship well, the captain will manage to get all the goods to their destination safe and sound.

name: GoDice!
description:
(from the publisher)

The Strategy of Go. The Challenge of Dice.

GoDice! is a fast paced board game in the grand tradition of Chess, Checkers and Go. The rules are simple, but like these other timeless games, the possible strategies are endless. Are you ready for the GoDice! Challenge?

name: Professor Noggin's The Human Body Card Game
description:
Do you wonder about sneezing, saliva or your sense of smell? Ever ponder scabs, snoring or sweat? Then this game, all about YOU, is for you!

Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions. A special three-numbered die is included which creates interaction and promotes communication between players. Easy and hard levels keep kids interested and challenged - while of course having fun!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Medical, Trivia
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., KENSHO Kft., Outset Media

name: Napoleonic Wargaming
description: An introductory book on Napoleonic Miniatures Wargames, including basic history and a full set of tactical rules.

name: Three Way Cube
description:
Three Way Cube is a three-dimensional brain-twister. There are chances on all three levels.

The rules are similar to the rules of the mill-game. After the lots have been drawn for white and brown, each player receives 32 beads. Now both players by turn try to build up a vertical, horizontal or diagonal line. As soon as a player has built a mill he may take away a bead from his opponent. It is, however, only allowed to take beads which are seizable directly, that means which are on the top of a pin. If a mill is closed you may not take away a bead from his mill.

The aim of the game is to take all beads from the opponent or to block his beads in such a way that he cannot move any longer.

Similar to:

Score Four (though with different play and scoring)

name: Skurðir
description:
This Icehouse game of Martian transportation is inspired by the railroad board game genre. Players compete to build networks of canals connecting several transport stations, and earn points by transporting passengers from station to station along the canals they build. The player with the most points after all fifteen passengers have been transported is the winner.

Rules Link

name: Chicken Out
description:
From the box: "The game of scramblin' eggs!"

Twelve life-size plastic eggs, eleven containing small foam 'yolks' and the other with a foam chicken are placed on a circular battery-powered vibrating plastic tray. In turn, players select and open one egg.

If the egg contains a yolk, the yolk is kept & the empty egg is replaced on the tray. If the egg is empty, the player must put one of their yolks in the egg & replace it on the tray. If the egg contains the foam chicken, the player is eliminated. All other players must yell CHICKEN OUT & the eliminated player must return the chicken to the egg & replace it on the tray.

The first player to collect the required number of yolks (varies according to the number of players) or the last remaining player is the winner.

name: DICE Hockey
description:
From the Publisher:

DICE Hockey features the use of individual player cards. Players pass the puck around the ice using their own cards trying to work for a player shot or a goalie shot. Players will pass, shoot, and defend just like they do on the ice.

Each player has their own passing column on their individual player card. This makes for a fast action hockey game where you will get exciting possession after possession without referring to a chart.

Penalties, Face offs, Injuries, turnovers, special plays, and more are all included.

Lineup cards will keep track of your current lines and making line changes is so quick and easy you will barely realize you are making one.

A timing chart will help you keep track of when the period ends and the time remaining. You will also get score sheets and team reference sheets.

DICE Hockey also features a full career mode. Lace them up as a skater or a goalie and start working on becoming a legend on the ice. You start out as a border line player and as you accomplish certain tasks in a game you can earn points. Spend those points on card upgrades. The better you perform the more points you earn. You will get over 100 blank player cards in your game and more will be available for free whenever you need them.

DICE Hockey is available as both a print and play E-game or you can purchase the actual hard copy board game version. The print and play game comes with the 2007-2008 season and you will get the 2008-2009 season as soon as it ends and I have it available. If you want the printed copy, you get to select which of the two seasons you want to come with your game and you will get the other season emailed to you as a PDF. Or for just a little more you can get the game with both seasons printed and mailed to you.

name: Munchkin Christmas Ornament
description:
Publisher's DescriptionDeck the halls of your dungeon with this wooden ornament of the Super Munchkin from the cover of the original Munchkin game. This ornament measures approximately 2 1/2" wide by 3" tall. The design is laser etched, from both sides, into cedar wood. Grab one for your treasure stash!

Rule

If this ornament is hanging on a tree in the room where you are playing Munchkin (any version) or Munchkin Quest, on the 24th or 25th of ANY month, Santa will bring presents. Every time a player goes up to 5th Level, that player draws a face-up Treasure. Yes, if you go down to 4th and then back up, you get another present. Only one ornament allowed per game.



OtherNote that the Christmas Ornament comes in two versions: an older one where the Munchkin's eyes are nearly closed, and a newer one where they are wide open and bulging out. Also, the newer one appears to have addressed a problem with one of the feet breaking off.

Part of the Munchkin series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Hockey sur Table
description: Air hockey -- without the air (or the table for that matter!). A portable dexterity game that consists of 2 foam controllers plus wooden pucks, rails, gates, and scoring pegs. Quick to assemble and can be played on the floor or a table.

name: Seppuku
description:
Seppuku is a form of Japanese ritual suicide by disembowelment (“cutting the belly”). This practice was a key part of the Bushido, the code of the samurai warriors, and was used to avoid falling into enemy hands, and to attenuate shame. One might say that death is the very center of the Bushido, as the overall purpose- to die well and with one's honor intact.

You are a Daimyo, a powerful feudal ruler in ancient Japan. You must hire samurai to protect your land, and win battles courageously. Build your samurai's skills by adding armaments and playing modifiers. Custom dice and strategic hand management determine the most honorable warriors on the battlefield. The first Daimyo whose clan obtains the “Seven Virtues” of the Bushido will be announced as the winner.

www.seppukucards.com
publishers: Epic Atom Game Lab, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: CrossRoads at Darklion Pass
description:
CrossRoads is a competitive RPG board game. The game can be played with a light conquest approach or a very strategic competition between players. Repeatable play is very enjoyable and different each time.

Game Play: Each player will play with a hand of cards with each card having three potential uses during the game. Managing your cards requires strategy, planning, resource consideration, sacrifice, and making the right card selection to replenish your hand.

Players can choose to discard their cards to travel the game board and earn experience. They can use their cards to put together combination attacks against creatures in a quest to earn experience. The third option is to use cards to heal themselves when life gets too low. The game play is dynamic and competitive with other player disrupting plans and having plans of their own. You will need to manage your cards and maneuver your opponents to win the game.

Goal: The goal of each player is the have the highest experience total at the end of the game. Experience is earned by using cards to either travel over the players color on the game board or by using them to damage a creature within a quest.

Box: Wealth beyond belief is promised to the bravest and most acclaimed adventurer who can purge Dark Lion Pass of its frightful dwellers. However, everyone knows that the pass cannot be cleared by a lone adventurer.

You join a group of adventurers that agree to work together to clear the menace from Dark Lion Pass and share the treasures and glory that come from accomplishing such a grand feat. The agreement is a loose alliance… each adventurer seems to be attempting to steal the glory and hoard the best treasures.
Are they attempting to be the bravest adventurer and keep all of the reward for themselves?

During the adventure you will try to gain as much glory as you can by stealing the treasure and doing the most damage to the creatures that lurk in the passes. You may also manipulate the path that your party takes to enhance your glory even further in Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass.

Can you manage all of this with the limited resources at your disposal? Only time and an adventure of a lifetime will tell. Welcome to Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass!

name: Global Control: Neon Nightmare Expansion
description:
DESCRIPTION:
Neon Nightmare is an expansion for Global Control. Now more players can unleash more power and mayhem, using additional strategic choices!

NUMBER OF PLAYERS:
2 additional players (Up to 8 in total)

PLAYING TIME:
Approximately 60 minutes

GAME ELEMENTS:
•Original Global Control game is required to play this expansion set.
•Creates more card combinations for additional strategy
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame

name: Wits & Wagers: Scott Alden Personality Card Promo
description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Scott Alden´s favorite questions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wits & Wagers: Richard Borg Personality Card Promo
description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Richard Borg´s favorite questions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: StrikerZ Card Game
description:
StrikerZ Card Game Description:
StrikerZ Card Game is a fantastic football game with cards! It is not a game "about" football. It IS football! Players pick and discard through a full deck as they try to get one of the three combinations to shoot for a goal! Each team has 11 players, 3 super-subs and a manager! Enjoy light and fun strategy as the shooter and keeper try to outsmart each other on shot attempts: Big Goals! Big Saves!
Do you think that you will manage your team to easy victory? Will the referee and assistants influence the game for you or against you? Watch out as there are whistles, offsides, yellow cards and red card ejections! Either manager can make a key substitution at the right time to change the game! A game of skill and luck!
This is an excellent game for football fanatics, couples, or children.

For 2 players, Ages 7 to Adult, 30 minute time frame.

name: Pro Stadium Soccer
description:
From the publisher:

Pro Stadium Soccer replicates a professional soccer championship with each player managing a team vying for the title. Who will be able to sign the over-priced but highly talented striker? Should you raise your bid for a promising young defender? Will one of your opponents try to snatch away your star goalkeeper on the eve of a crucial match?

Pro Stadium Soccer lets you control your team's destiny: opt for a lightning attack or develop an ironclad defense; choose stability and balance or spend wildly and make impulsive decision. Pro stadium soccer offers the ideal opportunity to experience the pressures of managing a real like soccer club. Naturally, the road to the championship is littered with obstacles: injuries, red cards, and heartbreaking defeats may stand in your team's way.

At the end of the day, all that matters is becoming Pro Stadium Champion.

name: Viajantes
description:
From the 2011 Ludo Award Winner Marcos Macri, a new game for fast and vicious fun. Imagine you are traveling by train with a friend and then, in one connection, your luggage is opened any its contents spilled and mixed with the others passengers waiting the same connection. And at this same time, the train arrives. And so your quiet voyage turns into a mayhem as you need to find your things, put in your bag, sit in a good place at the train, and guarantee you can continue your conversation with your best friend: Yourself.

Each player assumes two secret roles and receives a hand of cards that can be objects for either of his roles or of other characters on the train. On each turn, a player has five actions points that can be used for:
- Put an item in a bag (Not necessary his own)
- Exchange an item from a bag to another bag
- Look at an hidden item in a bag
- Exchange hands with other player
- Buy clothes
- Exchange characters place on the train
When a bag has five items on it, it is automatically closed and that character can no longer be target of any action, except to change places with another character whose bag is also closed.

When the number of closed bags is equal to the number of players, the game ends and points are awarded to each player accordingly to theirs characters:
- Sitting position in the train
- If they are sitting near each other
- Own items on bag
- Cloth on bag
- Pair of other character item on bag.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Trains, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Welt der Kölner Das Quiz
description:
Objective: score most winning points knowing correct answers about Cologne.

With this quiz game the players will learn (with 220 questions) some detailed information about the city of Cologne.

2 different playing versions:
Version 1: active player draws a card and reads the question & 4 possible answers (of which 1, 2 or 3 may be right); now each player may invest gradually chips to be placed betting on different answers; correct answer(s) is(are) printed on the back of the card;
Version 2: find out the proper sequence of three answers regarding posted question
game ends finished a previous agreed no of rounds.

name: Kataktisi
description:
Players exchange turns trying to conquer areas by encircling them. Each area has to be cornered by three points at least and the player who controls more points adjacent to an area conquers it. Each area scores different points and the player with the most points, when all points have been claimed, is the winner

Σας παρουσιάζω ένα απόσπασμα από τα λόγια αγάπης με τα οποία στόλισε ο κύριος Τάκης (ιδιοκτήτης της “Δούρειος”) τους κανόνες του παιχνιδιού:

“Ζητείστε τα παιχνίδια με το σήμα μας – Έχουν ψυχή”

“Κι αυτό το παιχνίδι παίζεται από μικρούς και μεγάλους. Ένα γνωστό μου παιδάκι που είναι 4,5 χρονών, επιμένει να θέλει να το παίζει μαζί μου, κι ας μην ξέρει την αξία των αριθμών και ας μην μπορεί να ακολουθήσει κάποια στρατηγική!
Παιδιά, πρέπει να σας γίνει συνήθεια, μόλις τελειώνεται το παιχνίδι σας, να ξαναβάζετε αμέσως το παιχνίδι μέσα στο κουτί και το κουτί στο χάρτινο περίβλημα του και αμέσως στη παιγνιδοθήκη, για να το διατηρήσετε πολλά χρόνια και για να του δείχνετε την αγάπη σας.”

Τάκης Παπαζαχαρίου

I give you an excerpt of the heartfelt words with which Takis (the owner of Dourios) gave life to the games rulebook:

“Ask for the games with our Logo – They have soul”

“This game also can be played from younger or older players. A child I know, which is 4,5 years old, insists in playing with me, even if he doesn’t know the value of numbers and he is not able to follow a certain strategy!
Kids, when you finish playing, you must get used to put the components back to the box, the box back to its cardboard cover, and then straight back to the games case, so you can keep your game for many years to come and so you can show it your love”

Takis Papazahariou

name: Onk-Onk
description:
In Onk-Onk, the player sea lions compete against one another recklessly by throwing explosive fish back and forth in their annual game of Otariades, "otarie" being the French word for "sea lion".

Onk-Onk is a rhythm and observation game, with the players clapping their hands to a shared tempo; while still clapping to the tempo, the active player will cover two of her three cards, with the revealed third card determining where the TNT tuna is being tossed. The appropriate player must respond in turn, keeping the fish bouncing around until someone is caught lion down and the fish goes boom...
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Music, Nautical, Party Game

name: The Zombie Horde Approaches!
description:
A Zombie-Tile-Laying-game created for the "In-A-Tin" / "Express" Print-and-Play Design Contest - Discussion Thread

It shares the 3rd place (Overall Game Category, along with 6 others)

Add. categories:
1st Place "Best Worker Placement Game"
2nd Place "Best Abstract Game"
2nd Place "Best Tile Laying Game"
2nd Place "Most Original Game" (shared with two others)
3rd Place "Best In-A-Tin Game"
3rd Place "Best 2 Player Game"

Players have two actions: They can place a cube (worker or brains) and/or place a tile.
There are two main categories of tiles: Traps (each player has her/his own reserve) and Street Tiles.
Players build a control grid out of street tiles throughout the game, up until one point, at which the Zombie Horde starts to spread. The frantic construction continues, but may end at any point.
The game continues until either the entire Horde is stopped , or it spreads beyond the controlled city blocks.

Players will use saws, snipers and flamethrowers (traps) to collect the highest Zombie Killing Score.
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Millionenraub
description: A theft at the museum! Even though the museum is crowded with visitors admiring paintings and sculptures of great artists, nobody notices that the exhibition's most famous work of art has been stolen by an unknown thief. A voice sounds from the loudspeakers — "Nobody leaves the building!" — and the player inspectors are suddenly on hand to question visitors and find important clues. An exciting pursuit for the culprit begins in Millionenruab. Who will catch him first?

name: The Goose Egg Game
description:
This is a fun fast paced card game for 2 to 6 players. The goal of the game is to be the first player to have five point cards in your hand equaling zero. How do you do that? There are several strategies you can use. But, they all stem from taking the cards you don't want out of your hand and making them your opponent’s problem.

At Its Most Basic

There are 88 cards in each deck. There are three groups of cards. Each group of cards has their own purpose. Some hinder, some hurt, and some will win you the game.

name: Grandpa's Chest
description:
Grandpa owns an old chest, like no other!
"Things go in, things come out, its like a show!
Can you or can you not, tell them all, in a row?"
What happens when Granny and the Cheeky Monkey enter the game? It all becomes harder and you must seek help from Charlie, Betty and the Thief. But is their help enough?

A fun card game full of laughter for friends and family.

Players alternate turns placing object cards in a chest, face down. Each player during his/her turn must name all the objects that were placed in the chest from previous turns.

Greek description:
Ο Κυρ Γιάννης είναι ο ιδιοκτήτης ενός παλιού μπαούλου, που... δε μοιάζει με τα άλλα!
"Πράγματα μπαίνουν, πράγματα βγαίνουν γρήγορα και βιαστικά!
Άραγε, θα μπορείς να τα θυμάσαι όλα στη σειρά;"
Τι γίνεται όμως, όταν στο παιχνίδι μπαίνει η Θεία Λένα και η Ανακατώστρα Μαϊμού; Τότε όλα δυσκολεύουν και ελπίζεις στη βοήθεια του Λευτεράκη, της Βασούλας και του Κλέφτη!
Είναι ομως αρκετή;
Ένα διασκεδαστικό παιχνίδι με κάρτες που θα προσφέρει αξέχαστες στιγμές γέλιου σε όλη την παρέα!

Οι παίκτες τοποθετούν κάρτες αντικειμένων σε ένα μπαούλο κλειστές. Κάθε παίκτης στην σειρά του πρέπει να πει όλα τα αντικείμενα που έχουν ήδη τοποθετηθεί στο μπαούλο.

name: Whoya?
description:
Whoya? is the one and only party game that’s all about you. You make the game, you play the game, and you become famous. Whoya? is a fun, hilarious way to get to know all about the people you are with and for them to get to know all about you!

Every round there is a judge that reads the prompt on a Whoya? card out loud. All other players write their response down and turn it in. The reader then selects his or her favorite response, and tries to guess who submitted that response. If the judge guesses correctly, the judge keeps the Whoya? card and earns the point for that round. If the judge guesses incorrectly, the player who submitted the judge's favorite response gets the Whoya? card and earns the point for that round.

Many of the prompts on the Whoya? cards are crowd-sourced from users who have submitted card ideas. On these cards, the first name, last initial, and location that person is from is displayed in the bottom right hand corner of the card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Papecarz: The Papercraft Racing Board Game
description:
Papecarz is a "roll and move" racing game, a mix of strategy, placement & luck.
Two to six players control racing cars competing to win a single 8 lap race or a series of races.
As a driver, the player has to cunningly calculate every single move to make the most of the Caution Flags, restart, Slingshot Passes, Pushing and Shunting.
While as a crew chief, the player has to plan an effective and flexible race strategy and keep an eagle eye on the opponent's tactics.

The race is made up of four main phases:
-Pre start: you choose your setup and decide the start grid.
-Start: you want to try to get a good position straight away.
-First 7 laps: here you need to get as many Boost points as you can and try to avoid the Damage cards.
-Last lap: put the pedal to the metal! it’s your chance to cross the finish line first and win the race.
At the end of each lap you get a card depending on your position; the higher your position, the better your card.
1st: one White card =2 Boost points
2nd & 3rd: one green card =1 Boost points
4th & 5th: one brown card =damage (Watch out! you could be in trouble!)
6th: one black card= serious damage (Oh no! you're in big trouble!)
And when you pit, this is where your strategy comes in; each car has two possible setups.
It's the setup that tells you how many cards and kinds of cards you can turn over and convert.
Your setup also tells you when you can take a risk and roll the dice.
if the car in first place fails a dice roll...the yellow flag come out: CAUTION!
The race restarts with all the cars now bunched up together and some player starts cursing , while other players cheer (Yeah!); It all depends on your pit strategy!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Salvo! River Plate
description:
Salvo! River Plate is a solitaire WW2 naval wargame containing rules, game tables and warships simulating the Battle of the River Plate in December 1939.
You will need three dice (d6), paper and pencil to play.

name: 9-Masu Shogi
description:
9-Masu Shogi is played on a tiny three-by-three square board using only eight of the original Shogi’s types of pieces.

Movements and the goal of checkmate remain, but unlike regular Shogi there are 40 different starting positions to choose from.

name: HOSSA op kölsch
description:
This is a localized version for Cologne, Germany.

Ein Lied über Köln am Rhein? Einfach? Aber bekommst du den Text hin? Und die Melodie? Vielleicht helfen Dir ja deine MitspielerInnen.

"Mer losse d'r Dom in Kölle ..."
"Nit für Kooche ..."

name: It Dies With Me
description:
In most games - even your favorite one - there’s nothing really serious at stake. But, It Dies With Me is different. Take a peek into the soul; the deep, dark, twisted heart of your opponent. The player that wins, will learn a secret, something never told to anyone! One player at the table has a secret, and it's about them.
