They've even written in down and placed it in a secret envelope on the table. Do you want to read it? WIN THE GAME. The secret can never be shared, or be repeated. That's because it's written on EDIBLE PAPER with a FOOD COLORING MARKER, and it must be EATEN to make sure the secret DIES with the winner of the game!

Each player (including the player whose secret is in the game) has one six sided die and a mini coffin. Players use their coffins to hide a secret die number they've chosen, trying to be the highest or lowest unique number. That's right, no rolling of these dice. Players can choose any number from one to six. Everyone opens their coffin at the same time to see who wins each round. Choose wisely, or your number might get cancelled out!

Each round there are TWO winners! One winner draws a card. The other moves their token. Players try to collect a set of four cards to form the phrase: IT - DIES - WITH - ME. OR, move their token across the six grave tiles, all the way to the SECRET ENVELOPE. Complete just one of these goals, and you win. You get to READ THE SECRET! Just remember, that secret must die with you.

name: Space Freaks: Shapeshifter – The 28th Head Promo Card
description:
The 28th Head: Shapeshifter allows you to draw a head card at the start of your turn and use it for this turn. (Discard that card at the end of your turn)

The promo card was available at Spiel '18 in Essen.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: The Awesomest Petting Zoo
description:
Build fences for animal enclosures and put in all the cutest animals.

But beware! You can’t put different types of animals together and the visitors won’t like an enclosure that isn’t filled with animals.

Can you manage to make a lot of enclosures full of animals before your friends? Who will build the awesomest petting zoo?

In The Awesomest Petting Zoo, 1 to 6 players compete to score the most points for their petting zoo. Each turn, players choose dice from a shared pool and use them to either make new animal enclosures or put animals in those enclosures.

You can re-roll dice, discard a die or split an enclosure, but doing so will cost discard points.

Bonus points (or penalties) are awarded through a selection of random cards to players who achieve certain goals. For a single player game, a set of special solo challenge cards is included to give the player a unique experience.

Cards & boards available as print-&-play components; all you need is a pen, dice and some markers for the score track.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Math Fluxx: Turn It Up To 11
description:
5-card expansion for Math Fluxx.

Keeper:
Eleven (11)

Goals:
Convenience Store (7 11)
Information (411)
Speed Limit (55)
Emergency! (911)

name: あ～した天気にニャ～れ!! (Wishing for Fine Weather!!)
description:
In the trick-taking game あ～した天気にニャ～れ!! (Wishing for Fine Weather!!), the players are cat gods who get to play with rain, snow, and other weather conditions.

The game consists of a deck of fifty cards, with five suits of cards each numbered 1-10. Lightning is the trump suit, except that when snow (normally a losing suit) is played with lightning, then snow trumps lightning.

At the start of each of the three rounds, players reveal one of the eight scoring conditions to determine how many points positive or negative each card of a suit is worth in this particular round (-3 to +3). Players then play out the round, trying to collect tricks — or dodge them! — to maximize their score.
publishers: ビストロ怪談倶楽部 (Bistro Kaidan Club)

name: Enchanters: Port Dasix Promo Card
description:
Promo village card for enchanters, released in the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter.
Allows players to gain attack bonuses, healing and rerolls
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Team Story
description:
Oh no! A magical tornado has devastated the library and torn away the pages of the grimoire. Apprentice magicians, it's up to you to make up stories and bring back the pages... in the correct order!

In Team Story, players are either Listener or Storytellers. Once 20 cards are placed face down and the scroll board is created, each Storytellers pick 3 cards without letting the Listener see them.

Storyteller starts and continue the story using a card from their hand. Once they take part in the story with a card, they place it on the scroll board face down and draw another one from the pool. When the scroll board is full, the round ends. All cards are shuffled and given to the Listener. They now have to retrace the story.

But wait! Some cards have Twins! Will you be able to find the correct card and remake the story through the cards in 60 seconds?

The game ends once everyone has been Listener once. The player who scored the most stars wins the game!

name: Mio: Brädspelet
description:
Mio is a co-op game where the players takes the role of a friend of Mio from the book Mio My Son by Astrid Lindgren to help Mio defeat Knight Kato. All the players uses the same pawn, and that is a pawn of Mio. The game has a board with 9 locations, including start and last location (Kato's castle) on it, and paths between those locations with 2-9 steps to walk. On top of the board is also places for 5 courage and 5 stonehearts.

The game play has four phases:
1. Mio moves.

2. The player does actions.
a) travel.
b) regain health or courage.
c) pick up / change various protections.

3. You check if something bad or good happens (some steps on the paths are black, while most of them are white).

4. A cleaning phase where also Kato gradually gets stronger and stronger.

The game ends either when the players manage to take Mio to Kato's castle and defeat him, or when Mio loses all his courage and it has been replaced by Kato's stonehearts.
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Track Movement

name: Yacareté
description:
Card game to play hand in hand or by teams of 2 or 3 players. The deck is divided into cards from two teams: Yacaré (alligator) and Yaguareté (jaguar). You must choose one, playing your own cards in the game and those of the rival, exchanging them with the general deck.

After 6 rounds (changing the starting team for each round), the team with most victory points wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Juego de naipes para jugar mano a mano o por equipos de 2 o de 3 jugadores. El mazo está dividido en cartas de dos equipos: Yacaré y Yaguareté. Se deberá optar por uno, jugando las cartas propias en la partida y las del rival intercambiarlas con el mazo general.

—description from the publisher

name: Barnens alfapet
description:
Childrens Scrabble in two game modes.
One is regular Scrabble with a smaller board and simplified bonus scoring.
The other mode has two rows of words opposite each other. Players takes turns laying three tiles on the words on their side of the board. When completed the word is scored by length and if the opponent has any letters in an unfinished word directly opposite, the player gains those letters to place immediately also.

name: Warhammer Quest: Cursed City – Nemesis
description:
Ulfenkarn stands on a precipice once more. Our intrepid band of heroes managed to defeat a trio of vampiric villains in Warhammer Quest: Cursed City – Nightwars, but now a familiar foe is plotting his return, and all within the city bounds are hurtling towards a final, epic battle. Dive back into the doomed city of Ulfenkarn as the heroes of this fraught tale re-unite for one last quest – to save the survivors' enclave of Haven. For Radukar the Wolf darkens the city with his presence once more, and he's hell-bent on killing the last remaining mortal denizens of the place he once ruled.

In this second expansion for Warhammer Quest: Cursed City, use your collection of Soulblight Gravelords models to represent the undead hordes looking to reclaim Ulfenkarn for its exiled former dictator. You’ll find new missions, game mechanics, and even more challenging enemies. Plus, you might even bump into some old ‘friends’ along the way...

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Nemesis: Retaliation – Sangrevores Expansion
description:
Sangrevores are a new type of enemy race for Nemesis: Retaliation. There is no Queen this time - but a mighty "King", an ancient being awakened from a long slumber. Mining scavengers found a mysterious-looking "capsule" created out of non-human bones stacked together as if multiple beings had created this tomb from their own bodies. It was quickly transported to the closest human base for further investigation. This is how it all started.

While the history of the mighty Crimson Despot is a mystery, you can easily tell that he feeds himself on life energy and fully dominates will, making his victims mindless puppets serving his wishes.
He will be one of the most dangerous faction leaders, with a terrifying physical presence - he will also get stronger with every player he will eliminate.
By his side, he will have Blood Spectres - engineered, in a way, to master humans and drain their life force. Not only can they harm your mind, but they are also quite an opponent to face.
On top of that, you will have to face hordes of Ghoules - who are drained previous station residents. While not very smart, their numbers will be vast - so exploring the station will be a real challenge.
There are no larvae in this race. This is entirely by intent - first, it fits the thematic way of how this race "reproduces" (by contact with Crimson Despot). It is also essential for the mechanics!
In this expansion, we will also introduce a totally new mechanic that can drastically change the semi-co-op experience. During the contact with the King or Blood Spectres, your character might become converted! This can entirely change your secret objective mid-game without other players not being sure about it.
With some of the attacks, you will get special infection cards (added next to your special objective face down) that only you can see. Most of the time, they will be neutral - but sometimes, they can transform you into Hemodyne yourself and shift your objective into, for example, killing all other players or turning off all life-support.
On top of that, we will be changing the concept of contamination cards. Instead of a standard contamination card that will take a slot - you will actually get some unique ability representing your character getting mutated. This will happen only with contact with Crimson Despot or Blood Spectres.
Those abilities will work as regular cards - you can use either effect on the card or use it to pay for other actions. BUT you always will have to pay the price while using it, i.e., gain one light wound or some other stuff.
On top of it, those cards will be very… suspicious. Sometimes, you will be able to heal yourself by dealing wounds to other players. Sometimes, you will be able to control a group of Ghoules. Or make yourself invisible to all other Sangraverous for just a few moments.

Those cards will give a toolset for players to increase negative interactions - only if they wish for it. But combined with the possibility of them being turned, it will add new layers of paranoia to the game.

—description from the Gamefound campaign
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Sorry! Sliders
description:
A Burger King kid's meal giveaway, this game shares a name and a dexterity component with the original Sorry! Sliders, but not much else. In this game, a line of six stand-up paper markers numbered 1-3 (twice) are laid out in a line on a table. Each player in turn slides a colored disc along the line (from opposite sides). The second player has the advantage of being able to knock the first player's disc out of position. Discs are scored based on which marker they end up next to. Players play as many rounds as they agree, and the player with the highest total score wins.

—user summary

name: Pozimus
description:
What a clutter!the goblins have started playing in the shelf unit of the magic ingredients and now there's no way to find what's needed to make the potions.
Turn yourselves into witches and wizards, move the right goblins and finish your potions before the others. Oh! and don't forget to move the cat, as it always sits just on the ingredient you need the most.
To move the goblings, you should use the dices and move the cups with the same color of goblings as the dices shows.
The cat, block the ingredient to move some cup to this ingredient or to use it for a potion.

name: Creepy Cauldron
description:
CONTENTS
Playing board
4x player pieces (boys) with bases and 1 witch
16 rubber creatures (ingredients): 3x spiders, bats, lizards and snakes; 1x skull, bone, toad, rat.
1 green frog head
1 cauldron with spring handle
1 special d6 (1|2|3|4|witch|frog)

OBJECT of the GAME
Collect the 3 particular ingredients you need from the creepy cauldron (as listed in the spell book in your home base); once you have them, obtain the key from the mouth of the ugly witch's cauldron and make it to the exit.

But there are terrifying dangers: both the witch and the cauldron will try to get you before you escape!

A children's game with a fright!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Horror, Humor, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Jeux, MB Juegos, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Il Rischiatutto
description: Italian board game of the '70, based on the popular quiz show "Il rischiatutto" conducted by Mike Bongiorno.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Letterario
description:
From the publisher (translated):

First literary edition of Trivial Pursuit.
The rules are the same of the classic game, but the topic is different: in here, there are only questions about Literature.
1.200 questions, with different levels of difficulty, sort by color: Ancient Literature, Foreing Literature, Italian Literature, Movie Literature, Theatrical and Lyrical Literature, Mistery Literature.

User summary:
The object of the game is to move around the board by correctly answering trivia questions.
Once a player has collected one wedge of each color and filled up his/her playing piece, he or she must return to the hub and answer a question in a category selected by the other players. If this question is answered correctly, that player wins the game.

Original description:

Parliamo della prima versione esclusivamente letteraria di uno dei titoli storici e di maggior successo prodotti dalla società statunitense. La struttura e le regole del gioco sono le stesse del classico Trivial Pursuit ma quello che cambia è l’argomento trattato: la letteratura, infatti, è il topic su cui vertono le domande a cui si deve rispondere. Le categorie selezionate e contrassegnate da diversi colori sono: Letteratura antica, Letteratura straniera, Letteratura italiana, Letteratura nel cinema, Letteratura nel teatro e nella lirica e infine Letteratura gialla.

Sono 1.200 le domande, di differente difficoltà, elaborate dalla redazione della casa editrice, che permetteranno di cimentarsi in appassionanti sfide intellettuali.

name: Player of the Game Basketball
description:
Player of the Game Basketball is designed to provide a quick method of resolving a basketball game between any two teams. Where this game is truly unique is in its ability to not only provide you with a final score, but it will also give you individual point, rebound and assist totals for each player that participates in the game.

Once you understand the concepts behind the game, you’ll be able to play out a full game in 5 minutes for the basic game, and 7-10 minutes for the advanced game.

The game offers two levels of complexity. For those gamers that wish to use Player of the Game Basketball in conjunction with another basketball title that resolves games in a possession by possession manner, the basic version will more than likely provide you with all of the detail that you require. Since the basic version plays quicker, it should be a great tool for single team replayers that want to get a snapshot of the rest of the league.

The advanced version of the game is designed for gamers that wish to conduct a series, or a complete season using only Player of the Game Basketball. The advanced version will provide you with hot and cold streaks for players, as well as a realistic game pace factor that will provide you with a realistic method of reproducing the high and lower scoring affairs that occur in basketball, all with their real-life frequency. The advanced version is a great method of playing cross-era teams to see who was truly better.

You will need 2 D10, not included with the game. You use the d10 rolls to determine which players on a given team will play in a game and what his potential scoring total is. Additional rolls are used to calculate adjustments due to defense, home court advantage and other factors.

name: Slap Shot
description:
From the box: One on one or with teammates, win the opening face off and take control of the puck. SLAP SHOT cards let you make sequences of moves to advance the puck into the offensive zone, to take a shot and score a goal. But, watch out! Your opponent might have an interception card or throw you a penalty. With SLAP SHOT you'll experience the thrill of real hockey.

This game is played with 2,4,6 or 8 players forming 2 teams that compete in a game based on the rules of ice hockey. Games are short and play is quick.

name: Voll ins Schwarze
description:
Which number is supposed to bring bad luck in China? When were the Beatles founded? And what is the diameter of the biggest igloo?

In Voll ins Schwarze, all players are guessing these answers and others at the same time – but only the player who gets closest to the right answer scores the point! That is not as easy as it sounds: All players have number cards to use for their guesses, but sometimes those cards don't match the question being asked. Use your cards wisely to win the game!

name: The Hobbit: The Adventures of Bilbo in Middle-earth from The Lord of the Rings
description:
The game is actually played in the game box. The board is "3D" in that there are tiered areas and freestanding icons of trolls, spiders. elves, Smaug and Gollum.

High roller starts to move his/her hobbit across the board. The objective is to reach the last space on the board by exact dice roll. Foils to this are losing a turn (if another player lands on the space you are already occupying), trolls (who keep you stuck in the Misty Mountains until you land on "Escape"), Gollum (who keeps you trapped until you land on a space that matches your hobbit's cloak color), goblins (same concept as the trolls, but you have to land on "Saved by Eagles"), spiders (whom you have to "kill" by dice roll) and elves (whom you have to escape from by dice roll).

Game Art has a Rankin/Bass feel.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Sonic: The Card Game
description:
Race through Sonic the Hedgehog video game inspired stages built by flipping through a deck of cards. But watch out for the bad guys or you could be eliminated from the race.

Players will push their luck by deciding prior to each card flip if they will stay in the race or retire. Retire and you'll collect all the rings and bonus cards revealed in the stage so far. Keep racing and potentially earn even more rings and bonuses, but risk losing a life when a second villain card is revealed.

Players will have two cards in hand, one to show that they will keep racing and one to say that they will retire. Each turn all players still in the race will secretly select a card, they'll place it face down on the table. Once all players have made a selection the next card in the deck is turned over and added to the "course" of cards on the table. If there are two of the same boss cards in the course when it's flipped, all remaining players lose a life token (of which they have three) and a new round begins. The game is played over five total rounds. When players choose to retire, they will collect all ring tokens on the course at the time and keep them for end game scoring.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Catowl
description:
Cats and owls are witches’ favorite animals. The poor things are subjected to magic experiments so often that sometimes it’s difficult to say whether it’s a cat or an owl. Well, let’s figure out who is who!

Playing this incredibly designed game, kids learn to determine quantities in a split second, without the need for recount. The game process exercises attentiveness, concentration and speedy response, and
also trains memory. The box effectively contains three games, allowing players to practice different skills.

The game has several levels of difficulty for the kids of different ages. Cards, dice and totems are bright
and unusual, and the kids love them!

—description from the publisher

name: Images
description:
A drawing and guessing game similar to Pictionary.

Goal
Being the first to reach the finish space with your pawn by drawing and guessing well.

Game play
The board shows two different courses to choose from. Each course consists of differently coloured spaces; some also have symbols printed on them. The cards contain words from 6 different categories, each category corresponding to a colour on the board.

Players take turns drawing an item from the category their pawn is currently on. All the other players try to guess what he/she is drawing. If the word is correctly guessed before either of the two sand timers runs out, both the drawer and the person who guessed correctly move their pawn two spaces. If the correct guess takes more time and the first timer has already run out, they both get to move one space.

While the active player is not allowed to speak, he/she may use a little chart printed in one of the corners of the board to mark how close the guesses are (smiling, neutral and unhappy smilie) or if a part of the word is missing (something is missing at the beginning/end of the word).

Special spaces allow players to challenge other players, and on "x2" spaces you get double the points.

The player whose pawn reaches the finish space first wins the game.

name: Aéropostale
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #20

Players try to organize a transatlantic aerial postal services and try to bring back as many bags of mail to Paris.

name: Quazar
description:
Quazar is a large strategic science fantasy wargame - very large, in fact, with 4 27"x21" black and white mapsheets (for a total play area of 4.5'x3.5') and 840 counters.

One player takes the human side and defends the entire map against the other, who takes the invading X-Con (aliens, clones, and robots).

The game appears to be a reasonably straightforward wargame of its type, complicated by a fairly wide variety of different unit types and the rules writer, who adopted what I have to assume was a deliberately obtuse style. For example, the combat phase (with its 8 sub-phases) is called "Violent Interaction & Adaptive Reaction." The space combat results table is called the "Space Systematized Probabilistic Outcome." Etc.

There is a fair amount of chrome, including secret weapons for each side (e.g., the humans can get a planetary defense screen, the aliens can get a space creature which moves around and eats human units).

Contents:
840 counters
4 27"x21" mapsheets
2 order of appearance/secret weapon lists
2 guides to opposing forces (guides to your OWN are not included...)
2 "priority" sheets - one has some rules summaries, the other is just color)
Rules folder
Combat results table sheet
Alien pod chart sheet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Armored Assault
description:
From the Publishers site:

Armored Assault
ICE presents Space Master: Armored
Assault, an intricate boardgame of gripping, tactical planet side combat in the far future. Armored Assault also doubles as the vehicular expansion set for Space Master: The Role Playing Game'.

THE ULTIMATE IN FLEXIBILITY
Now you can simulate decisive futuristic planet-bound battles! Command small unit actions with a handful of tracked AFVs, or mobilize full-blown campaigns, mustering subs, surface ships, walkers, gray tanks, artillery, aircraft, and more!
Choose Basic, Standard or Advanced Rules to define your game's level of detail and realism. Challenge yourself further by adding even more exacting Optional Rules.
Armored Assault is completely compatible with Space Master: The Role Playing Game and Star Strike. It includes comprehensive construction systems for tracked vehicles, infantry teams, powered armor troopers, rear echelon assets, and more.

Space Master: Armored Assault includes:
Assault Book
• The Basic Game: Simple, easy-to-learn rules and scenarios for beginners.
• The Standard Game: Comprehensive rules for a wide range of surface combat units, weapon types, scenarios, and campaign suggestions.
• The Advanced Game: Rules which incorporate aerial and submersible vehicles into the action.
• Optional Rules: Add-on game systems for master players who desire even more detail.
• Construction Rules: Custom-design guidelines for infantry teams, powered troopers, ordnance, aircraft, rear echelon assets, installations, robots, and all manner of vehicles.
Tables and Forms Book
• Combat Tables: Attack charts for auto, MLA, and lob cannons, laser, blaster, disrupter, ion and plasma cannons, as well as shaped charge, seeking explosive, proximity explosive, nuclear and matter/ antimatter warheads. Also, there are 9 critical result tables for attacks against soft and hard targets, and another 5 for personal casualties.
• Game Charts: The most commonly used charts in one section for quick reference.
Playing Pieces
• 130 Vehicle Counters: Full color counters depicting a variety of vehicle types.
• 480 Utility Markers: Troops, torpedoes, mines, terrain, and other game system markers.
• 4 Tactical Maps: Each displays unique terrain features on a 100 meter hex scale. -
• 2 Percentile Dice

Offsite note:
Although this game is designed to be used with the space master RPG is a fully functional and fun stand- alone wargame.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Tenplus
description: A collection of three card based games from designer Susumu Kawasaki: Sums Ten, Countup Ten, and Hand Ten. The former plays with two or three players, while the others work for two to four players.

name: Česko Evropa
description: Expansion for both Evropa, otázky a odpovědi and Česko, otázky a odpovědi. It contains 600 questions about Europe and 600 questions about the Czech Republic. These can be added to the corresponding core games. Alternatively, they may be used as a stand-alone quiz game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: GOLD! Promotional Scoring Card
description:
A new scoring card for another scoring variant.

Game setup:
After the cards on offer have been revealed: the player sitting right to the starting player chooses a scoring variant and places a coin on the correspponding spot.

Final scoring:
Depending on the scoring variant the following changes apply:

The player with the most donkey cards loses the game regardless of his victory points. In case of a tie all of those players lose,

Each set of red cards counts 15 victory points instead of the values of the cards.

Each "3" counts 9 victory points instead of 3.

name: Wege
description:
Carcassone-like tile-laying game for two players.

Two players try to create a recreation park together. The finished park consists of all 36 tiles in a 6x6 square. There are water and land ways on the tiles (including bridges). Some tiles show black or white ducks.

Each player has a different goal: The "land" player tries to build a land way connecting all 4 edges of the park without building any islands and placing two black ducks next to each other. The "water" player tries the same with water ways (and avoiding lakes and placing two white ducks next to each other).

Like in "Carcassonne", on each turn a player draws a tile and places it next to an already played tile. At the end, there must be a 6x6 square. The players receive -1 point for not fulfilling parts of their goal (connecting edges, avoiding islands/lakes, placing black/white ducks together).

Note: The self published version features 36 cards, the Amigo version of Wege and The Legend of Landlock feature 40 tiles.

name: Alle meine Tiere
description:
Who knows best about the animals on this planet? Who knows the solitary ones, and the ones who travel in packs? Who knows their sizes, and whether they're endangered? If you do, you'll do well at Alle meine Tiere – and if not, you'll soon learn more about the animals around us.

To set up the game, someone lays out a 3x3 grid of animal cards, then sets the category deck and the remainder of the animal deck next to this grid.

On a turn, the active player draws a category card, which shows "height", "weight", "lifestyle" or "hazard"; the former categories will show whether you need to find cards in ascending or descending order, while the latter categories will indicate whether you need to find solo/pack animals or endangered/safe animals. Choose one of the rows in the grid, then reveal the backs of the cards, which will show whether you guessed correctly. If you did, you claim one of those cards, remove the other two from play, then replace them with new cards; if not, you turn the cards face down again, and the next player tries to find a set of animals that will fulfill that same category.

Whoever is first to collect an agreed-upon number of animal cards wins!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Boss Monster: Quothe Promo Card
description:
Promo hero for Boss Monster given out at Gencon 2013 and also distributed through The Tinker's Pack. Proceeds from the Quothe sales went to Heifer International.

The card itself in an homage to Kvothe, the hero of Patrick Rothfuss's Kingkiller Chronicle series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Das kleine Gespenst: Wettlauf zur Burg Eulenstein
description: Das kleine Gespenst: Wettlauf zur Burg Eulenstein is a cooperative memory game based on the well-known book by Otfried Preußler.

name: Special Buttons (fan expansion for Patchwork)
description:
Patchwork - Special Buttons extends the basic game by two modules:
Modul 1: 3. and 4. player
Modul 2: special buttons with special powers

22 new patches
5 Leather-patches
1 dark neutral figure
2 time marker
2 player boards
36 Special Buttons (9 black, 9 green, 9 red and 9 yellow ones)

—description from the designer (English)

Patchwork - Special Buttons erweitert das Grundspiel um zwei Module:
Modul 1: 3. und 4. Spieler
Modul 2: Spezial-Knöpfe mit verschiedenen Sonderfähigkeiten

22 neue Flicken
5 Leder-Flicken
1 dunkle neutrale Figur
2 Zeitsteine
2 Ablagepläne
36 Special Buttons (je 9 in schwarz, rot, grün und gelb)

—description from the designer (German)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Puzzle
mechanics: Tile Placement, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Re:Play
description:
A boxed version of the classic Celebrities game, Re:Play has players come up with 40 topics by writing them on small bits of card and then placing them in plastic holders. Players form teams and then start explaining the topics one by one to other members of their team.

On the first round, players can say anything except what the card says. On the second round, only pantomime is allowed. On the third round, one-word explanations are used to explain the topics. The topics are the same every turn, so players learn them during the game.

name: Las Divas
description:
Las Divas is a deduction-party card game in which each player becomes a fabulous Drag Queen of the Haus of Las Divas, the biggest, greatest and shiniest drag theater of Buenos Aires. In every show, the fierce competition between queens makes them give everything on stage, making the crowd go wild each night. But, who’s the best of the best? Which queen deserves to be recognized as the Divaest Diva of the show? It’s time for you to put on your heels, gown, nails and wig and show you deserve the crown, even if that implies sabotaging your fellow queens…

Setup: Each player gets one of four secret Divas, indicating with which card and how many copies of them in front of them, they have to get to win the game. If you’re Miss Kitty, the comedian, you’ll have to get 5 Laugh cards to become victorious. If you’re Pink Lemonade, the fashionista, you win with 4 Fame cards. Katie Hart, the showgirl, wins with 4 Spotlight cards and Lee O’poldo, the evil queen, wins when another player gets 4 Shade cards in their area.

So, there’s a deck with these four cards: Laugh, Fame, Spotlight and Shade. You get 4 initial cards. In your turn, you draw one card from the deck and play one of the cards in your hand in front of you (or if it’s Shade, in front of another player). Clockwise, players will draw and play cards until one reveals their secret identity, showing it accomplished their objective, winning the game.

But that’s not all! Each card, when played and even on the table, has an especial effect. Fame cards allow you to play additional cards in your turn. Shade cards cancel Fame cards and allows you to steal cards from that player’s hand. Laugh cards makes you switch a cards position on the table from one player or another. And finally, with the Spotlight cards, you draw 3 cards and discard 2. Every card is useful, even if they doesn’t make you win the game directly!
Balance is settled with card mix and double cards, that you can play using one of the sides only (and remain in that position even when stolen) and also affect the winning condition, making players hard to deduce how wins each player.

Las Divas is a game of temporal alliances, betrayal, deception and fabulous-ness, encouraging players to act like be a queen, making drama, stealing the show and revealing their hidden talents.

It was published in Argentina in 2018, thanks to a succesful crowdfunding campaign.

—description from the designer

name: iKNOW: Aikamme uudet ilmiöt
description:
In the "Special Edition" of trivia game iKNOW, you get to test what other players know while trying to score for yourself. The game includes 1,200 questions about the "new phenomenas of our time" in four categories, and each question comes with three hints at three levels of difficulty that reveal the answer piece by piece. Do you think you'll know the answer first – or should you let other players give the question a try?

iKNOW also includes a betting element that gives you a chance to win no matter how much – or how little – you know as long as you know who does or doesn't know. Do you think that your friend knows his sports forwards and backwards? Do you know that geography is your spouse's worst stumbling block? Place your bets for or against your friends, and collect the winnings.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Dock
description:
1612 A.D. – In a bustling, fishy dock somewhere on the east coast of the American continent, settlers’ ships bring vast amount of goods to the New World. There is a lot to do before the ships can set sail again.
– Listen up, lazy gang! No rest until the ship is unloaded! Pack those boxes tight, we have lots of stuff! Hurry up and move it! The Governor may arrive any minute!

In DOCK you play as settlers of the New World, tasked by the Governor to manage a warehouse. Different boxes are arriving from the ships. Can you load them more tightly than others to satisfy the Governor? Your efforts will be greatly rewarded with silver.

DOCK is roll and write game for up to 10 players and a solo mode for one player. You draw rectangles on a checkered playing area and try to fit them as tight as possible. The 2 dice shows the two side length of the boxes to be drawn.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Xmas PileUP
description:
A pocket-sized, Christmas-themed, stacking-dexterity game for the whole family. Featuring cute Christmas tree shaped meeples!

Players take it in turns to roll a dice and stack Christmas trees into piles, with a twist.
Each turn, you may decide to either add trees to your own pile, or force a friend to add the trees to their's.
If your pile topples you must start again and the player with the tallest pile wins.

Simple, yet effective, Xmas PileUP

—description from the publisher

name: Mandora Fever
description: Mandora Fever is a card game of some sort, and a "mandora" is a mandrake.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Egyszer volt...
description:
Once upon a time… not a literature quiz! Focus on the stories! We ask you to write your own bestseller!

Just like in an unforgettable novel, there are big laughs or even deep conversations waiting for you in this game. Once upon a time, there was no one - there was once a character you bring to life…, a dramatic turn that no one expects…, and the end result that puts the crown on your work. Creativity, playfulness, communication, imagination - all of which you will need in this great party game where the story can only be limited by your own imagination. Move the threads skillfully and be the best storyteller on your team!

The game lasts for 10 rounds. The first 9 rounds have 3 phases, Inspiration, Writing, and Evaluation.
In the Inspiration phase, we draw 2 characters, 2 dramas and 2 end cards to the playing field.
In the Writing phase, each player thinks about which combination of 3 cards they think could make the most interesting story. It is important that you choose one of each category.

Everyone will write on their page the letter combinations (for example, BAA) of the selected pages next to the current round number.
In the first three rounds, the text of the selected Character Cards is recorded, in rounds 4-6 the text of the selected Drama card, and in rounds 7-9 the text of the End Card.

In the Rating phase, players receive points for each of their teammates who have selected the same letter combination for their story. If exactly the same combination is written, everyone gets 4 points, if only the first 2 letters match, 2 points, if only the first letter matches, 1 point goes. No points are awarded if the first letter of the letter combination does not match anyone.

The tenth round is the Synopsis. In this round, we do not put new cards on the game board, but the Inspiration phase takes place from the texts of the previously selected cards. So in the Inspiration phase, we write the final story from the text of the 3-3-3 inspiration cards previously written on the scorecard.
As everyone completes in a row, tell the Final Story one after the other. Don’t forget to give the story a title.
After telling the Final Story, players secretly give each other points. Everyone can split 7 points among the other players, we give the most to the one who we think invented the best story.
After telling the story, everyone adds up the victory points earned during the 9+1 rounds.

name: Hero Tales: Card Game
description: 8-bit pixel art style, world view of sword and magic, your mission is to get more gold coins, and you can repeatedly jump between the brave and monster camps, play autism or plunder? Waiting for you to create a little legend.

name: Meeple Inc
description:
In Meeple Inc players take on the role of board game publishers collecting the perfect mix of artwork, components, and mechanisms to build the greatest board games in the world. Enter an alternate 1970s where meeples and humans have co-existed for millennia. The mix of human ingenuity and meeple industriousness has created a new golden age of tabletop games, and you are in the right place at the right time.

As CEO of a board game production company, you will be assigning your workers to jobs across a fabulous board game factory. Hiring Specialists, crafting components, and manufacturing mechanisms all in a bid to publish the most popular games, win tabletop awards and, of course gain victory points. Meeple Inc offers a novel take on the worker placement mechanism where players are rewarded for paying attention to and predicting the actions of their opponents.

On your turn you will be placing your workers to specific jobs, hiring new specialist employees with unique powers, building board games from components, artwork, and mechanisms, and submitting your games for prestigious awards. Meeple Inc is board game all about board games!

Meeple Inc is a fast-paced worker placement style game which is quick to learn but offers a rich depth of experience in the gameplay. A huge design emphasis was placed on replayability. With multiple paths to victory, a wide player count, and nearly 70,000 unique starting conditions, no two games will ever be the same!
mechanics: Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Chalice
description:
The goal of the game?
Don't die.

In this fast-paced card game of death, destiny, and deception, players compete for the kingdom in a classic battle of wits. Careful, though! Drink Wine to expand your lead, drink Water to keep your cards, but drink Poison and you'll lose half your hand! Who will live long enough to be crowned the king?

Players play cards and complete the instructions, hoping to avoid drinking a poisoned chalice. The last person alive wins.

name: Legend of the Lost Dutchman
description: A game of the 1890's Arizona Territory, where 2-5 players compete to discover the legendary Lost Dutchman gold mine. Players must outfit their expedition and search through the most rugged terrain imaginable, while avoiding rattlesnakes, thirst, extreme heat, bandits, Apache guards, and other player's greed. One 11 by 17 inch parchment map of the Superstition Mountains, 180 color counters, 108 Event and Search cards, complete rules, player character sheets, and a nugget of genuine Fool's Gold. Find the treasure of Jacob Waltz, or die trying.

name: Atta Ants: Expansion 2
description:
The second expansion to Atta Ants adds trees, store chambers and yellow beetles.

A tree is an inexhaustible source of leaves, store chambers give you a different way to win and the yellow beetles increase the danger as they can attack the ant nest.

Expands:

Atta Ants
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Skagway
description:
When gold was discovered near the Yukon River in a remote area of Canada in 1896, nobody could predict the massive gold rush that would follow and the effects it would have around the world. From small huts along the rivers, towns sprang up and some became large cities while others disappeared completely. The small town of Skagway became the launching port for expeditions into the Klondike area over the White Pass. But as the miners squandered away their newfound wealth, it was often the clever business men and women who profited the most.

In Skagway, you will play one of these entrepreneurs in the town of Skagway employing two workers to help you reach your goals of fame and fortune. Through purchasing key buildings in town, heading out to the mines, building a railroad into town, and possibly hiring extra hands to help you out, you will start to build your Alaskan Empire.

Will you choose to fight for good as the town sheriff, or become a legendary gunfighter or bank robber? Whatever path you choose, in the end, the player who has amassed the most wealth before the gold all dries up will be declared the winner!

Game Data:

Complexity: 2.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale

name: Trivial Pursuit: Entertainment Edition
description:
Expansion set for the well known Trivial Pursuit game. The German version sports the themes: Hollywood (Hollywood), Medien (media), Leute (people), Der Deutsche Film (German Film), Lebensart (Lifestyle) and Musik (music).
Inculdes 500 cards - i.e. 3,000 questions
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Playmix

name: How to Host a Murder: The Duke's Descent
description:
THE DUKE'S DESCENT
London Times
June 11, 1931
"Lofty" Aires, Duke of Airesborne, Killed In "Attack" Balloon Crash
Lofton "Lofty" Aires, twelfth Duke of Airesborne, and his son, Lord Lightern Aires, were killed yesterday while testing the duke's prototype "attack" balloon. Observers report that the balloon plummeted out of a cloudy sky into thick woods close to Airesborne Castle, killing both the duke and his son. The duke's brother, Drafton, succeeds to the title. "Drafty," as he is popularly known, is in poor health and remains secluded at Airesborne Castle.
Lofton received much attention several months ago when he presented a proposal to Parliament to defend the coast of England with an army of armored balloons, "constantly aloft, constantly alert, and threatening death to all intruders." Though the proposal was easily defeated, Lofton persisted in the study and development of the balloons, which he stated are "critical to the well-being and security of our nation."
It was one such balloon that the duke and his son were testing on the morning of the crash. A spokesman for the Aires family declared, "The duke had developed an advanced version of his armored balloon and was in the process of testing it when the accident occurred. Whether the crash was caused by a malfunction in the balloon or its weapons systems is not presently known."
Observers of matters concerning the nobility point out that it is not clear who will be Drafton's heir, since he has no children. In cases where the duke has no natural heir, he may nominate his heir from his immediate family, according to the Royal Grant of Privilege, bestowed by Queen Elizabeth when she created the Duchy of Airesborne in 1597. It is understood that the new duke has already made plans for a family council to invoke this privilege.

CHARACTERS
Spendwell P. Roppwash, Melissa C. Loudbanks, Lance Sallot, Damselyne D. Istresse, Rogan S. Coudrell, Gwendolyn O. Veere, Lonsford Glost Aires, Evonne B.N.Aires

name: London Bridge
description: Become the remaining player after all the other players have caused London Bridge to fall down. Players spin the spinner and move vehicles onto the bridge till it falls.

name: Karnöffel
description: This is one of the earliest European card games whose rules are known. Karnöffel is played with a deck of 48 cards, which is similar to a standard deck without the aces. Every player is dealt 5 cards, the trump is decided, and then 5 tricks are played. The team which wins 3 of those wins the round.
publishers: (Public Domain), AG Müller (AGMüller), Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Stadt Land Fluss Extreme
description: In Stadt Land Fluss Extreme, everyone plays at the same time to try to find nine terms that apply to each of two categories within two minutes.

name: Lateral Thinking
description:
Lateral Thinking is a game for two players or two teams.
Each player has six arrows and one defender. The board consists of 126 squares (14x9). The essence of the game is that the ball counter bounces off your own arrows and gets stopped by opposing arrows.The aim is to carve your way through your opponent's defense to score goals (a sort of abstract soccer).

name: Articulation
description:
Articulation is a word game that can be played either individually or in teams.

The five categories in the game are slang, jargon, word origins, spelling, and vocabulary. The cards, except spelling, are multiple-choice.

In Articulation, the player with the best vocabulary will not always win… The game has been designed to provide a level playing field. Duel squares, stop squares, and free roll squares are but some of the equalizing factors in Articulation.

name: Aiutino
description: Party game where each player secretly selects 6 words among tens listed on the Argument card received at game start. Then at his own turn, the player starts to show just the first letter of each word. Other players secretly write down their guess, then the second letter is revealed, then third and fourths ones. Points are assigned depending on which round (1 to 4 letters revealed) you have written the right word.
categories: Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Monopoly: Antwerpen
description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade the property of the Belgium city Antwerpen.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Age of Revive
description:
User summary:
エイジ・オブ・リバイブ (Age of Revive) is a construction game in which players try to reconstruct and revive a city devastated by a long war.

Initially, the city is full of rubble. You clear and reuse it into significant buildings. Constructed buildings form a ring-shaped world. Players move along the ring and collect resources for their next building.

The winner is the player who has collected most victory points by constructing glorious buildings and receiving King's favor.

The artwork for this game uses copyright free images.

Publisher's summary:
Age of Reviveは、復興と再生をテーマにした建築ゲームです。
舞台は長く続いた戦乱から解放された大都市です。
はじめはいたる所ガレキの山が重なるのみですが、これを撤去、再利用して立派な建築物に変えてゆきます。
建築された施設は円環状の世界を作り、プレイヤーはその上を転々と移動しながら、次の建築のための資源を集めるのです。
壮麗な建物と、王の支持をもっとも積み上げた人物が、勝者に選ばれます。
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

name: Leo: The Brush
description:
Leo: The Brush was first available at Stadt-Land-Spielt 2016 in Germany.

Once per game one player may use the function of the brush: the player may change the color of the card he just played, before moving Leo. He announces the color of his choice and moves Leo as many steps forward along the path as the value on the just-played card indicates. This way a card can be deliberately “redyed”, if the appropriate card is not available. After using the function, the paint palette with the brush is turned face-down and cannot be used again in this game.

name: Star Wars: Feel the Force
description:
Welcome brave fighters fighting for the freedom of the Rebellion! Another task is waiting for you. You have to decode the secret code which you received from the command and you must obtain secret information about Frist Order’s plans.
In the game you will be playing as Rey, Poe, Finn and Rose. Who will be the first to complete the mission? May the force be with you!

The goal of the game is to collect three white and three black information markers. At the moment when the first player puts the last of the six markers on his/hers the character board, the game ends immediately and the player wins the game.

Each round of the game is divided into two parts: coding and gaining information. In the first part, players set up their code as quickly as possible to determine in what order players will take turns and how many actions they will have. In the second part, they do as much actions as they get after the first round: you can move your pawn, explore squares, rotate them, and gain information markers.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: DICE WIDE SHUT
description:
User summary
DICE WIDE SHUT is a roll-and-write game that includes erasable markers and game boards. Try to fill the columns with checkmarks to score without bursting any rows!

In this game for 2-5 players, you'll use 3-6 red dice and 3-6 blue dice along with a single purple die no matter the player count. Each player has their own erasable game board with a red grid of dice faces at the top of it (with the red faces reading 1-5 as you go across a row) and a blue grid of dice faces at the bottom (with the blue faces reading 1-5 as you go down a column). On the right-hand side of each grid is a column of 6s; the 6s are grayed out and not considered to be part of the red or blue grid.

To start a round, one player rolls the dice. The starting player then chooses either red or blue, then chooses two dice numbered 1-5 or a single die numbered six in the named color. The purple die can be picked up whether you choose red or blue. After you take the die or dice, you check off empty die faces in that half of your player board that match the numbers taken. One exception: When you take a 6, you can check off a 6 in either the top or bottom of your board.

If you create a row of five horizontal checkmarks in the red or blue grid, then you must place a line through all of these checked die faces. Boom! Bad news! If, however, you have a checked 6 in that same row, you can choose to cross out the checkmark instead of placing the final check in the row and blowing it up.

Once all the dice have been claimed, then the next player in clockwise order from the starting player becomes the new starting player and begins a new round. As soon as one player has three filled columns in either the red or the blue grid, each other player takes one final turn (assuming enough dice remain), then the game ends. Players then score points for each column depending on the number of continuous check marks in that column; three separate checkmarks in a column in the red grid is worth 3 points (1 point for each check) while three continuous checkmarks is worth 6 points. An empty space or a crossed-out line breaks the continuity. Whoever has the highest total wins.

Publisher's summary
DICE WIDE SHUT is a dice game.

At the beginning of the game, you have two 5x5 squeare grids. Each round, the first player rolls certain number of dice. During your turn, you take one or two of them. For each die taken, you check a space of the same number of pips in one of your square grids.

At the end of the game, you score points according to how long vertical lines of coninuous checks you made in your grids. However, if you were forced to complete a horizontal line of five checks, all vertical lines on that grid are considered to be split by the horizontal line, resulting fewer points scored.

The rules are simple, but because of the split-line rule, sometimes you will find it difficult to make decisions.

「DICE WIDE SHUT」は、(1)ダイスを選び、(2)ボードの対応する部分にチェックを入れるだけの、簡単なルールのゲームです。
各列ごとに得点を計算し、ゲーム終了時に得点の高いプレイヤーが勝利します。
縦方向にチェックが連続すると得点が高くなります。しかし、横方向にチェックがつながると失点につながるルールがあなたを苦しめるでしょう。
多くの誘惑と疑念が立ちふさがり、ダイスの選択は決して容易ではありません。

name: Timmy macht Urlaub
description:
Timmy's things are scattered all over the place, but he should be packing for the upcoming holiday! For some reason, you're concerned that his parents haven't noticed that Timmy prefers to play instead of pack, so you've decided to help him get all his stuff ready so that the family can go on vacation as planned.

In Timmy macht Urlaub (Timmy's Vacation), you roll the dice, then try to attach an item of the rolled color to Timmy without dropping anything. If the players manage to set up Timmy with all the items without any of them falling, they win together and Timmy can set off on vacation.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Stacking and Balancing

name: Slyville: Jester's Gambit
description:
Medieval cities were home to very different types of people. Not only pious monks, humble scholars and trustworthy merchants, but also those mischievous, cunning and dishonest. Welcome to the city of Slyville, where you become one of the latter kind! As head of a guild operating in one of the world's major trade and cultural centers in the Middle Ages, you will be sending your trusted henchmen to various districts to find trade bargains, make deals, and provide your organization with more power and wealth — maybe not always in a way that is completely legal, but the end justifies the means, doesn’t it? After all, you want to get in the graces of the Prince, right?

The Jester’s Gambit expansion introduces two new types of cards: Events and Hidden Agendas, to spice up the struggle of the guild leaders in the slyest of all medieval cities! Select your secret goals to pursue, and experience most unusual events: pirates looting the city, a fire in the library, or an audience with the Prince himself - read out a paragraph from the The Book of Slyville Chronicles and see what happens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medieval, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Negotiation, Race, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Nachtschwärmer
description:
100% handcrafted, every game is 100% one of a kind, 100% made with love and passion in Cologne, Germany,

In Nachtschwärmer ("Night Owls"), each player is a moth that wants to reach the light in the center of the table before anyone else — but moths don't fly in a straight line, so you need to figure out how to wiggle well to win.

The game consists of one six-sided die and eight bar coasters: one a "flying" disc that has arcs marked 1, 2, 3, and 4 along its edge and seven moth/light discs. Each player takes a coaster and places it moth-side up in front of them, while one coast is placed light-side up equidistant from all players. The moth side of a coaster has two black lines intersecting the perimeter (180º apart) and a red line every 22.5º around the perimeter.

On your turn, announce a number from 1 to 6, then roll the die. If you guess correctly, you advance your moth, possibly take a second turn, or even send a player back to start; if you guess incorrectly, you might still advance (although not as much) or another player might move instead of you.

To move your moth, take the flying disc and place the edge of the 1, 2, 3 or 4 space (depending on what you rolled) adjacent to one of the black edges on the perimeter of your moth disc, then roll your moth disc until a red line on your disc hits the other black edge of the 1, 2, 3 or 4 space. The higher the number, the farther your moth will move — albeit in a curved manner instead of straight toward the light.

No disc can ever be placed on top of another, so if a moth is blocking your way, then you must fly elsewhere! Whoever first touches their moth to the light disc wins!

Nachtschwärmer includes three variants, one of which has you start the game with several obstacles in play, say pretzels or gummis. Any time you hit an obstacle, you must eat it, then return your moth to its starting point.

name: Kryptx
description: Every player has a secret code that only he/she knows. After each round, the players have to reveal one information after the other abour their individual code. Based on information about the card's value or color, the players try to guess the code. The first player who can reveal the secret code of another player wins.

name: Sleepy Cats
description:
Place cats next to each other. Similar cats like to sleep near, but be careful! They need to be around diferent food or toys to be valid matches, otherwise you will be eliminated! The first player to run out of cards win!

—description from the publisher

name: Game of Boom or Bust
description:
"HOW THE GAME IS PLAYED: Players move around the Board according to the throw of Dice. Properties such as Beauty Parlor, Department Store, etc., are bought and sold at prices that rise and fall quite unexpectedly depending on whether the conditions are NORMAL, BOOM times, or BUST (depression times). The game is quick moving and amusing. The game ends when all but one player becomes bankrupt and this surviving player WINS THE GAME. If the players prefer, a time limit may be set at the end of which time the player owning the greatest amount of property and cash (when added together) WINS THE GAME."

The Board has 16 properties (4/side) with purchase price and rent printed on the inside of each space. The Board has NORMAL prices printed thereon. A removable panel, which fits over two pegs in the center of the board, has BOOM prices and rents on the obverse and BUST prices and rents on the reverse. The game starts in NORMAL cycle, changes to BOOM cycle, then to BUST cycle, then back to NORMAL, etc., when any player lands on any of the three corner spaces marked with a Star. (The fourth corner is "Start Here.") Players try to increase their worth by buying properties at BUST or NORMAL prices, and selling properties at BOOM prices, while trying to bankrupt their opponents by collecting rents, the highest of which is $250,000. The standard rule concerning landing on Un-owned Property is "buy it or leave it." There is an AUCTION option in the Rules, similar to the Auction Rule in Monopoly.
This game plays like a simplified version of its more famous stable mate, Monopoly, but with the unique twist that all properties' values increase or decrease at the same time, sometimes in rapid succession, without having to develop the properties or have groups or sets.

The raised playing field (Board) actually sits in the 15"x15"x2" box bottom (it is not designed to stand alone). It has a slot on the outside of each property space, wherein the owner places his/her like-colored "T-card" vertically to show ownership. The bills, which are the size of older Monopoly games, come in denominations of $100, $1000, and $10,000. There are also blue/white discs worth $5,000 and silver/blue discs worth $50,000. Four painted wooden markers (red, blue, green, yellow) and two white dice complete the equipment. The Rules sheet states "Questions on the rules for BOOM OR BUST will be answered gladly if 3-cent stamp is enclosed."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Talk About
description:
Players talk as fast as they can in 20 seconds to guess the 10 hidden clue words that are all related to the “Subject” word displayed at the top of the card displayed on the game board.

The first team’s number of unguessed words determines how many clues the second Team will get to see in their attempt to guess a new “Subject” word.

For example: Team A guesses 7 out the 10 words under the subject of “Pizza.” The total score for this round will eventually be 7 points, but we don’t yet know which Team has won those points…

In our example, Team B is allowed only three clue words (10-7) on a new card to guess what the “Subject” of that card is. If Team B correctly guesses the new Subject from those clues, they win the points for the round (7, in this case). If Team B fails to identify the subject, Team A wins those points.

The game continues with Teams switching roles--Team B will try to guess the 10 hidden clue words on a new card. Team A will follow with using a limited number of words to guess a new Subject.

Talk About is a faithful adaptation of an Canadian television game show, whose gameplay seems to have been inspired by the board game Outburst!.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Rank Card Game
description:
Rank is a fast-paced shedding card game, which means you try to get rid of all your cards before the other players and obtain the highest rank. In Rank, players utilize numbered cards, special cards, and strategy to out think their opponents and play all their cards first.

The most important thing to remember is to not get stuck with only low cards towards the end, or you’re going to lose! The first player to get rid of all their cards becomes the King. Each time a player becomes/stays the King, they receive 2 Royal tokens. If you end the hand as the Queen, you receive 1 Royal token. Get 5 Royal tokens and you are the winner!

—description from the designer

name: 老師敬服～正派対邪教～ (Master of Respect: Orthodox vs. Heresy)
description:
In this 2 player version of Master of Respect, the players are rival instructors at different martial arts organizations. On their turn, a player will play an action tile from their hand and resolve its effects. The other player may then choose to "pay respect" to the player in order to also copy the effect of the tile. If they do, the active player's students may gain resources which the player will have access to in the next round.

The general effects of the action tiles are to acquire either of the games' two basic resources, additional respect tiles, buy more action tiles, or acquire/train new students.

In each round, each person will play 3 tiles from their hand and after 4 rounds the game ends. The player with the most points wins.

老師敬服が２人専用のゲームとして生まれ変わりました。
プレイヤーは道場の老師となり、道場の繫栄のために奮闘します。
アクションタイルを使用し、素材を集め、弟子や奥義を獲得していき、勝利点が最も高いプレイヤーが勝利します。
老師敬服でもあった「敬服」を行うことで相手プレイヤーの行うアクションと同じアクションができます。「敬服」されたプレイヤーは代わりに勝利点を少し受け取ることになります。
２人用になったことで、「敬服」以外にも相手プレイヤーの手番中にアクション出来るようになったり、弟子に「正派」と「邪教」という要素が追加されています。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Contracts, Hand Management

name: Watch
description:
Watch, a.k.a. Quick, is a game of tactics. The 25 wooden playing pieces in 10 different colors are placed on the 25 squares on the board. Each player has a playing token and in turn places their token over one of the wooden playing pieces on the board, but the second player can't choose the same color as the first. Following the rules of play, tokens are moved until one player either:


manages to move their token onto the piece occupied by their opponent, capturing it;
moves their token onto a piece of the same color as the piece on which their opponent's piece stands; or
ensures that their opponent is unable to move since all pieces in a vertical or horizontal line from the opposing token have already been removed.
publishers: ABACUSSPIELE, Campaign Game Company Inc., MPH Games Co.

name: Check Six!
description:
"Check Six! Air Combat in the Missile Era"

"Check Six! puts you in the cockpit of a modern, high-performance supersonic jet fighter, commanding a flight of up to eight jets. Your mission is to provide 'Air Superiority' by clearing the skies of enemy fighters . . . You can simulate an air engagement from the wars of Korea, Vietnam, Middle East, or you can fly in a hypothetical scenario which you create!"

This game of plane-to-plane combat was produced for the U.S. Air Force by Close Simulations as a part of Project Warrior. Avalon Hill would later print a revised version of the game under the name Flight Leader.

Re-implemented by:

Flight Leader
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: The World's Greatest Game Show
description: Contestants use words, phrases, sounds, props and stunts to get their teammates to guess provocative words. They have to be quick because the clock is ticking. Use the World's Greatest Remote Control to switch the timer from team to team. The team with time left wins the points. The team with the most points wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Simulation, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: ColorFever
description:
From the Back Cover:

Colorfever is point scoring game combining a perfect blend of strategy and chance.
You draw tiles, roll the dice, and place your tile accordingly. You score by building strings of tiles horizontally, vertically and diagonally. With every turn comes the chance to draw special tiles that give you extraordinary action!

Players take turns drawing a tile of one of five colors and then placing it in one of a limited choice of columns based on a die roll. The columns are built from the bottom up, much as in Connect 4. At the end of the game, players will score for horizontal, vertical, and diagonal runs of all-different tiles and all-alike tiles. Several special tiles and board spaces create additional scoring opportunities.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: CATch the CATs
description:
Cat detectives have begun investigations to search for missing cats. Will they be able to bring missing cats safely?

This game is designed to be enjoyed by two players.
Each player must be a cat-detective to find cats that have disappeared.

Each player mixes his own 15 tool cards to create a stack of cards, then draws 2 cards, puts them in front of him, draws one card into his hand.

combine 14 cat cards to create a stack of cards, then draw 3 cards and unfold them in the table.

On your turn, the player chooses one of the two cards you have unfolded or one card in your hand. Place the card in one of the cat cards in the center.

Each cat card has the number of tools the cats want. As soon as the number is filled, the number of cards used by each detective is compared immediately. Follow detectives with high numbers of tools.

When putting down the card, you can not put it down with the same sum.

The composition of the 15 tool cards is the same for each player, and once used, cards can not be reused until all cards are used. Take advantage of special cards, remember your opponent and my remaining cards, and use your cards to bring as many cats as you can.

First of all, collect 5 kinds of cats or collect 2 pairs of 2 or more identical cat cards.

name: Wunschmaschine 2.0
description:
Heavily revised new edition

It is the aim of the game to find out the
secret wishes a game master has chosen. An ice cream and a crown? Or maybe the plane and the heart? These things are depicted on cards. With three cards each, the game master puts a series - and then reveals how often his wishes are to be found in it. Further card series each with a hint do follow. Which agent solves the riddle first?

name: Cthulhu Wars: Investigators
description: Neutral investigator miniatures with loyalty cards to add to Cthulhu Wars. These human Investigators add an extra dimension of game play by being enemies to all players, even though they are purchased by one, and handicapping any player they are attached to. They represent humanity's last ditch effort in a post-apocalyptic battle to thwart the Great Old Ones' struggle for dominance over the earth.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling

name: Instacrime: Casino
description:
Granada is a beautiful city in the South of Spain where you can find all kinds of people. Like any other night, after a fancy dinner at the casino, four players meet around a poker table. They are Vladimir Lavrov “The Russian”, escorted by his bodyguard Sasha, Brad Clayton, Claudine, and her friend Sophie. One of the players will never see a new day.

Instacrime is a cooperative game system which introduces you to a mystery that needs to be solved by a group of detectives. Each player must describe the contents of their photographs in order to share the information at their disposal with the objective of setting out a joint theory that explains the case.

Each case is unique and unrepeatable, and therefore, it can only be played once.

But don’t worry! If you want to make the most of it, let a group of friends play it and have fun listening to their theories.

-description from the publisher

name: Mizuage
description:
In Mizuage you take on the role of an 18th century geisha. The objective is to perfect your art, and free yourself of the bonds of servitude.

Mizuage utilizes the dice rolling set collection mechanic to allow you to increase your abilities in each of 3 arts. Get 3 of 1 face and improve that art. Get 1 of each face and improve any art. Beware the geisha face as it stops you from re-rolling and accrues debt. The more you increase your skill the easier it will be to pay off your debt, but if you do not start paying off your debt early enough you will certainly end life in servitude.

You win by attaining wealth. At the easiest level you win if you can finish with just 1 coin. At greater difficulty levels you must finish with more wealth.

A multiplayer variant which allows players to trade dice is included for players interested in sharing the geisha experience.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Trading

name: Flinke Feger: Die magischen Pentagramme
description:
Expansion to Wicked Witches Way distributed at Essen 2007.

Four pentagrams tokens are placed randomly on spaces numbered 9, 12, 15 and 18. If a witch arrives on one of these spaces, the pentagram token is turned up, and a special action takes effect.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Memory, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition

name: Zicke & Zacke: Ran an die Federn
description:
It's eggactly high noon, and the chickens Zicke and Zacke have started a feather-trimming duel. Starting rump to rump, they flutter in opposite directions, but since they're running around the chicken yard in a circle, they will meet soon enough with loud clucking. Whoever manages to jump over the other adorns herself with a new tail feather — but the more the young chickens puff up their feathers, the slower they strut around. And the worms, who are skillful enough to flee time and again, also make for lots of stops during the race.

In the end, only the chicken that pays attention to closing her memory gaps will fill her rump with feathers and win by a beak.

In Zicke & Zacke: Ran an die Federn, thirteen face-up tiles lay in a circle around 13 face-down "yard tiles" that have the same pictures on them. Two players (or two teams) take turns moving the two chickens; each chicken needs to move to the space where a worm awaits, the worm being as many spaces ahead as the number of feathers not on the chicken. The player reveals a yard tile, and if it matches the space where his chicken's worm stands, he moves to that tile, then advances the worm the appropriate number of spaces, then tries to reveal that tile; if he reveals the wrong yard tile, his turn ends. If he manages to jump over the other chicken on his turn, his chicken gains a feather, but each feather slows a chicken down, making it harder to zoom around the chicken yard.

The player or team whose chicken gains four feathers first wins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Modular Board, Team-Based Game

name: Nuts!
description: You are a squirrel! Yes, you are and you need to collect nuts. But the other squirrels want them too. The tiles with the nuts have a different value. How to get them? You have cards for your movement. Each player has the same cards. The player with the most points of nuts wins. You have to bluff and manage with your cards. This is a fun and bluff game.

name: Memocards Suche Drei
description:
Suche 3 ("Search Three") is a variant of the classic game Memory.
Instead of looking for two identical cards, you have to look for three motives which are not identical, but have something in common (called a "trilogy") - for example, a red, yellow and green traffic light.

name: Turkey Day
description:
It's Thanksgiving day and the family has decided to celebrate at your house. Will this year's feast be a success, or will it be a disaster?

In Turkey Day, you have 12 hours (turns) to attempt to resolve all of the mishaps that might occur while you prepare and cook your holiday meal. Each turn you will have 3 actions but with any luck Gramma or your favorite Aunt will show up and lend a hand. Let's just hope that Chester doesn't show up this year.

Turkey Day is a free, simple, solo, print and play game.
Turkey Day was originally designed as a gift to the designer's extended family.

name: Cariboo Island
description:
Welcome to magical Cariboo Island... where you take turns matching letters, numbers, colors, and shapes to unlock doors and hunt for treasure!

Draw a card. Find a closed door that matches the requirement on the card. Open the door. If there is a coin, add it to the "sandy beach". Once the sixth coin is found, the treasure chest is unlocked and the game ends. Contains materials for two levels of play: beginner (ABC, 123, square circle triangle, red blue green) and advanced (1-10, all letters, colors).

Reimplemets:
Cranium Cariboo

name: Electronic Price is Right
description:
It is so easy to play! Just pick a card, enter the 3 digit number and a game appears on the screen! Includes 10 of the most popular games on the Price is Right TV show:
Pick a Pair, Magic Number, Cliff Hangers, Big Wheel, Plinko, Clock Game, Grocery Game, Showcase, Contestants Row, and Hi-Lo

Accurately guess the retail price of various prizes to win. Outbid opponents in 'Contestant's Row' to move on to individual challenges and the chance to win huge prizes playing your favorite games. If your pricing skills can stand the test, you'll earn a spin on the 'Big Wheel' - your chance to win even more money and earn your way to the 'Showcase Showdown'. Face off against your opponent there for your final chance to win the biggest and best prizes of all!

name: El Alamein: Turning Point in the Desert
description:
"El Alamein" is a two-player operational wargame simulating the 2nd Battle of El Alamein from 23 October – 11 November, 1942.

One player commands the attacking Allied forces (British, Commonwealth, Free French and Greek) while the other player commands the defending Axis forces (German and Italian). Each hex measures 5km across, unit scale is brigade, regimental and battalion, and most turns represent two days of combat.

The game consists of eight turns and each turn has four impulses. During each impulse the Allied player may perform actions with his units and then the Axis player. In each impulse, players choose to move, combat, or pass. Players use dice rolling and CRT to determine the combat result. If at the end of any impulse the Sidi Abd el Rahman and the Tel el Acqqaqir are both Allied-controlled the game ends immediately in an automatic Allied victory.

name: Magic & Fairy-Tale Dice
description:
First roll all eight story dice or roll them one at a time after completing an earlier one. Then weave together your own fairy-tale using the components shown on the dice. When the superhuman power symbol is rolled the current storyteller may throw the super power die and add a superhuman power to the hero, heroine or villain of the story.

Each player can tell a story just for fun, or you can take turns rolling dice or everybody can write down their story from the same ingredients and then you vote for the best story.
publishers: Laurence King Publishing Ltd, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Mixamatou
description: Observation game which stimulates the concentration. Find the common element on the displayed cards.﻿ The same hat, same cheeks or same jumper : three ways to combine cats and win the game by getting rid of all your cards.

name: Hacking Party
description:
With your team, hack websites.

Create alliances with other players, escape the police and earn reputation points.

But the other players are really allies ?

How to play:

- Websites are placed on the board to attack. Each website has a different level of defense.
