- At the same time, each player places his cards face down (hackers and possibly his other cards drawn) to websites that want to attack or defend.

- Each attacks are resolved. if the attack is successful, you earn reputation, and possibly attack, defense or money cards. if the attack is a failure, your hackers can go to jail for a ride.

How to win:


The first player to reach 12 reputation points wins the game.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Pacific Battles: Malaya 1941
description:
Pacific Battles is a wargame series of several campaigns in the Pacific Theater of Operations in World War II. The system is placed at the operational level, and deals with land and air operations. This is a two player game. One player controls the Japanese, the other the Allies. Pacific Battles Malaya is the fourth game in this series, and it covers the entire land-air campaign for the lower peninsula of Malaya, and the city of Singapore, December 1941 to February 1942. The other games in the series are Guadalcanal (#23), Nomonhan (#32), and Shanghai (#42).

Components: 22x34 inch map, 280 die-cut counters.

World at War #51; December 2016 - January 2017 issue.

name: Now Everyone Get The F%$# Out!
description:
Now Everyone Get The F%$# Out! is a fast-paced, screw-your-friends-over party game. You and your fellow players are college students trying to study for a final, but there's a huge dorm hall party happening where you live. The only way to get the partiers out and study is to make the other player's rooms more fun than yours.

During the game, players use a dice to keep track of how many partiers, or persons. are in their room. On a turn, they can place Items in other people's rooms, use Actions to affect various aspects of the game, or interrupt a play using Instant Actions. Whoever's room has the most fun in it, as determined by the Item's Fun ratings, becomes the Party Animal, and gains one person in their room after each turn. The least fun room's owner becomes Nerd and loses a person each turn. Once a player hits zero persons in their room, they win.

name: Recto Verso
description:
From the publisher (translated):
In this game, the two faces of the cards are useful and each has a different animal. To win, nothing more simple: Get a hand of cards of the same animal. But be careful because each card played imposes an action that could work against you!

From the publisher:
Dans ce jeu, les 2 faces des cartes sont utiles et chacune comporte un animal différent. Pour gagner, rien de plus simple : Obtenir dans sa main des cartes d'un même animal. Mais attention car chaque carte jouée impose une action qui pourrait se retourner contre vous !
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Warhammer 40,000: Spearhead
description:
Spearhead is a new way to play Warhammer 40,000 that enables you to unleash exciting tank battles and daring breakthrough missions on the tabletop, bringing the full mechanised fury of the 41st Millennium to bear in your games. June's White Dwarf will contain the main part of the supplement, including new rules and missions.
(from publisher)
Spearhead will make use of forces totally consisting of vechiles or monstrous creatures (in the case of the Tyranid and Daemon armies). This radical change from established Warhammer 40,00 will involve necessary changes to many core aspects of the rules system, most notably deployment of forces.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: I love brocoli
description:
Can you guess the likes and dislikes of others? I love brocoli will challenge you to do this with groups both large and small.

Each card in the deck has a collection of six statements on each side. When playing with a small group, one player will leave the room, then everyone else will choose a statement and place a card showing either YES or NO face up in front of themselves. The other player then returns to the room and, after seeing the answers, tries to determine which statement everyone chose, scoring 3, 2 or 1 points based on the number of guesses it took to determine the proper statement. With larger player counts, you avoid the YES/NO cards and split the players into two groups in the room, with all the YES people in one group and the NO in the other.

You can also play the game in teams to allow for more banter and discussion over who seems like the type of person who would say YES (or NO) to certain statements.

name: Checkers Gomoku
description:
The marriage of checkers and Gomoku.

Played on an 8X8 board, with 12 checkers each.

The game is played in two phases.

1) To start the game each player places a piece on an empty space and taking turns continue to do this until all pieces are on the board.

2) Then the second phase begins where they can move one piece each turn. A piece can move to any adjacent empty cell, in all 8 directions.

Players are attempting to create 5-in-a-row of their own colour either orthogonally or diagonally. When they achieve 5-in-a-row the player can remove one of the opponent's pieces.

The goal is to reduce the opponent's piece total to 4.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Outlaw
description:
You are a bounty hunter in the Wild West and you’re planning to retire...
You have found the perfect ranch and all you need is $50,000 to buy it...
But there is a problem; there are others that want the money as well...

Outlaw is a fun dice game where players fight it out to capture the most dangerous fugitives the West has ever known.

On their turn players use 4 dice to try and roll a score of under 10 or over 18. If successful place your marker on the outlaw with that number.
The more notorious the bandit, the more reward money you’ll get. Capture 3 outlaws and the cash is yours!

The first player to $50,000 is the winner.

Outlaw is a print and play game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Bezzerwizzer+ adult
description:
Adult version of the Bezzerwizzer+ family edition, the game is basically a trivia game with some new added elements.

The main differences between the normal trivia game and Bezzerwizzer+ Adult is that you have a xylofone and questions regarding picking the right tune, guessing the right song etc. Also there are questions regarding remembering differences on pictures, logic and numbers, but also normal trivia questions.

The game is played on a traditional Bezzerwizzer board, and the draw question mechanism ensures that previous versions of the game can be fully incorporated into this game also.

It can be played in up to four teams, consisting of as many players as you want, recommended is two-three per team.

name: Karate Fighters
description:
In this 1 on 1 fighting game, each player controls a "karate fighter" using a spinning dial that makes the fighter throw kicks and punches. The object is to kick your opponent in the chest hard enough to make him fly off the base. The electronic version would let out a blood-curdling scream when a fighter would fly off. Considered to be the "Rock'em Sock'em robots" of the 90's, Karate Fighters took the fighting genre to a new level. Imagine the video game "Mortal Kombat" brought to life.

Several Editions were released:
Red Ninja Vs. Dragon Kick
Samurai Ninja Vs. Headstone - Electronic
Tiger Ninja Vs. Cyberfist - Electronic
Razorjaw Vs. Sun Warrior
Serpent Strike Vs. The Iron Claw
Thunderfoot Vs. Skull Crusher
Kick Star Vs. Corporal Punishment

Other Playable Ninjas Sold Separately via Mail in Offer:
The Dark Ninja
Silver Sword

4 Player Combat Arena
Rex Havoc Vs. The Tattoo Terror

Alternate Editions:
Batman Vs. The Joker
GI:Joe: Duke Vs. Neo Viper
Transformers: Optimus Prime Vs. Megatron
Small Soldiers: Chip Hazard Vs. Archer

name: でんしゃクジラ (Densha Kujira)
description:
User summary
でんしゃクジラ (Densha Kujira) Whale Train is a card game with the same appeal as Mah Jong or Rummy. Pulling cards from the deck, the winner is the first to be able to make sets with all nine cards in their hand.

The rhino, goat, and alligator sets each consist of two cards, the whale of three cards, and the train and bullet train of three or more cars linked together in ever longer combinations. There are various routes to victory, collecting all the same color, focusing on all whale cards, or the legendary move of playing your entire hand all at once as a bullet train.

It’s a card game you can replay many times in different ways.

Publisher's summary
『でんしゃクジラ』は、麻雀をずっと親しみやすくしたような、カードゲームです。
山札からカードを引いて、自分のカード９枚すべてをセットにすると勝ちです。
２枚でセットになる、サイ・ヤギ・ワニ。３枚でセットになる、クジラ。３枚以上でセットになる、でんしゃと新幹線。でんしゃと新幹線は車両をつなげることでどんどん長くできます。
いくつかの役があります。すべて同じ色だったり、全部クジラだったりすると、ちょっと良い点でアガれます。 シンカンセンイッキという伝説の役も。
何度も繰り返し遊べるカードゲームです。
publishers: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

name: Speed the Card Game
description:
Speed is a game for two players of the matching and shedding family of card games, like Spit or Slam, in which each player tries to get rid of all of his cards first.

Objective: To play all your cards first.

How to Play:

Each player is dealt five cards to form a hand, and each player is dealt 15 cards face down to form a draw pile. If you are playing with jokers, you use them as wild cards and give each draw pile 16 cards. A stack of five cards, placed face down on each side between the players, serves as a replacement pile. Finally, two cards are placed face down in the center between the replacement piles.

Play cards from your "Hand" to the "Play Pile" if the card is higher or lower by 1 number or value. A 3 can be played on a 2 or 4 and a Jack can be played on a Queen or 10. The Ace's value is 1.

You can block your opponent from playing if you place your card faster.

You can have up to 5 card in your hand at all times. Refill your hand from your "Draw Pile".

First player to play all of his/her cards wins!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: 10 Tricks Later
description: 10 Tricks Later is a card game in which each player plays one card at a time in a series of mini games to determine who wins and loses. Survivor cards acquired through tricks are scored by moving them to the lower side of the board (inside the barricades), but if they stay on the upper side of the board (outside of the barricades), they risk being attacked by an infected card and make you lose victory points. The winner is the player who reaches the specified score at the end of the round.

name: Land of Dragons
description:
Strategy games for 6+, perfect game to introduce the youngest on the strategic games.
The Dragon has stolen all the town's weapons and gold and hidden them in the secret forest. Only the bravest explorers dare to go and look for them. From a team, go into the forest stealthily and try to be the ones who recoer the most treasures and weapons while dodging the fury of the Dragon.
Each player should throw the dices and move the warriors with the color of the dices, it doesn't matter if it's your warrior or not.
when two warriors (only two) are in the same square, both of them can take one of the cards of treasures.

name: Fortune Seeker
description: The board has 4 quadrants where players can seek their fortune in the Casino, Race Track, Real Estate, and Stock Market. In the Casino, you are playing blackjack while in the Race Track, you are horse racing. In Real Estate, you are buying and selling property, while in the Stock Market you are buying and selling stock. Each quadrant includes playing squares from the other three to keep the entire game active at all times e.g. there are Casino, Real Estate, and Stock Market playing squares in the Race Track quadrant. When you unfold the board it measures 38" by 24". There are two methods of winning Fortune Seeker. The most common is to be the first player to arrive at or pass through the boards center logo with at least $10,000,000 cash and no debt. The second is to be the owner of an oil field in Real Estate that has an oil gusher.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Monopoly: Planet Earth
description:
Planet Earth, our extraordinary world. America’s favorite board game and the award winning Planet Earth nature documentary come together to bring you MONOPOLY®: Planet Earth Edition. This unprecedented 11 part series comes to life as extremely rare photographs of the earth’s landscapes and animals decorate the game board. Travel and experience the earth’s natural habitats and elusive animals as you dive down the Cave of Swallows, migrate though the Gobi desert, climb the Himalayas and encounter caribou, crocodiles, foxes, giant pandas, orangutans, seals and dolphins. MONOPOLY®: Planet Earth Edition, as you’ve never seen it before.

Packaged in recyclable material, this special edition includes a “Can you find it?” geography game and six custom pewter tokens featuring animals seen in this incredible series: Elephant, Kangaroo, Penguin, Polar Bear, Blue Whale and Amur Leopard.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Schätzen Sie mal! Mann & Frau
description:
A knowledge or guessing game about various (historical) events. All somehow related to men and woman; more theme sets will follow.

The game lasts 10 rounds, each featuring an event (famous or quite unknown). Players have to guess (or know) when it happened. The unique feature is that the players don't choose an exact year, but may each select a time span consisting of any number of years. From the time spans that include the event in question, the shortest ones gain points (3,2,1). The player with the highest total after 10 rounds wins.

name: Dungeons of Peril (fan expansion for HeroQuest)
description:
Designer's Note: This is not a professionally published game; it is a series of homemade expansions for Hero quest. I have been selling the games for 2 1/2 years, and have sold well over 600 expansions. So I believe there is justification for presenting them in this forum.)

Dungeons of Peril is the collective name for my first four expansions for Hero Quest, a fantasy board game published by Games Workshop in conjunction with Milton Bradley.

The 4 expansions are:

1) Heroes of the Empire - Play one of 16 new Heroes - Cleric, Warrior-Monk, Mystic, Shapeshifter, Paladin, Halfling Thief, Alchemist, Wood Elf Mage, Vampire Hunter, Rogue, Elf Archer, Weaponmaster, Imperial Ogre, Troll Wizard, Dwarf Ranger, and Shadow Walker. This set includes 16 full-color Hero cards; 24 cards with new spells, equipment, etc. for these Heroes; a reference sheet with new Potions and Items; and a 4-page rulebook.

2) Endless Dungeons - Create a virtually endless number of dungeons with this set. It includes 32 different full-color dungeon tiles, a 10-page rulebook detailing the Special Tiles (with new traps, monsters, etc.), and a double-sided reference sheet. There are 16 standard tiles (4 of each of the following types: Corridor, Small Room, Medium Room, and Large Room), 2 Stairs tiles, and 14 Special Tiles. Use the tiles to create pre-generated dungeons, or create random ones in just a few minutes.

3) Servants of Darkness - This is a set of full-color 3-D stand-ups to use instead of miniatures. The set includes 128 stand-ups - 19 different Heroes, 8 Mercenaries, and 64 different monsters (there are multiple stand-ups for the mercenaries and some monsters). The stand- ups are (roughly) to scale and vary in size, from the standard human size to the very large Dragon and Rock Giant. Also included is a 14-page rulebook for using ALL of the monsters in Heroquest.

4) Perilous Quests – This expansion provides instructions on how to create and populate an entire dungeon. The rules walk you through how to create the dungeon and how to fill it with monsters, traps, dungeon features (like a Magic Mirror or strange Mould), and special rooms. This is done using two new types of cards (Encounter and Search). You can create an entire dungeon in just a few minutes. The rules are designed to allow as much flexibility as desired when creating a dungeon. The rules can be used for pre-generated quests, but they also allow you to play without a game master and are ideally suited for SOLO play! Finally, the Dungeon Bash rules allow parties of Heroes to go head-to-head!

Perilous Quests includes the following: 20 new Artifact cards, 16 Search cards, 8 Encounter cards, 4 Lich spells, 8 new Chaos spells, 8 Chaos monster cards (4 Sorcerers and 4 Chaos Spawn), 8 Elemental monster cards, and a sheet of dungeon counters (representing various special features).

Expands

HeroQuest
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Conjecture: the Hilarious Sculpting Game
description:
Quick! You’ve got to build a tarantula, but time is running out. Out of the corner of your eye you see the other team’s tarantula... and it’s looking pretty good! Will your teammate identify the sculpture first? It’s a race to the finish where the most creative sculptor wins.

Conjecture™ is a hilarious adaptation of the game of charades, only you make your clues with modeling dough. The game features four varieties of uniquely scented Tutti Frutti™. This classic party game will keep your family and friends entertained for hours. May the best sculptor win!

name: Kwazooloo
description:
KWAZOOLOO is a game of observation and speed. Roll the dice and match the pictures to the animals rings you are wearing on your fingers. At each turn, the action die shows what the players need to look for: the baby, the habitat or the favorite food of each animal. The fastest player removes a ring. The first player to have removed all their rings, wins!

Ages 5+
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice

name: Wir gehen einkaufen
description:
Louise packs eggs, apples, and bread into her basket. "Do we have all we need?", she asks. "No", yells Samuel as he rushes for milk and cheese. In the different game variations, children will recognize groceries by touching, assigning, and finding them, helped by a good memory.

Great looking wooden food, too!

name: Navigare
description:
A business game of international shipping where the players move the ship around the world earning money on it. The players can buy shares in each other ships and get a percentage of the ship's income.

There are two editions of this game, the latter is from 1984 but there was also an edition printed around 1960. The gameplay is the same, but all the components are different between the two editions.

The first edition had metal ships, with varying prices for the ships, as well as their operating costs, depending on the kind of vessel. As such, an ambitions player might choose an expensive ship, at a higher risk, but for a higher potential profit.

In the 1984 edition, the prices for the ships were the same across the board, detracting from the game in the view of many players of the original.

name: Timeout
description:
Timeout is a trivia game with time pressure. Each player start with the same amount of time, and the faster you answer the faster you get to stop your clock. When running out of time you are out of the game.

When it's your turn, a trivia question is read out loud to you by an opponent and your time begins ticking. If you answer correctly, you get to stop the electronic clock, that's counting down. If you do not answer correctly (or don't answer at all) the clock counts down 20 seconds and the stops.
The questions are divided into categories. Which category you get a question from depends on a die roll. Sometime you get to choose the category for yourself or for an opponent.
If a player fails to answer correctly, the next player has the chance to answer and thereby be rewarded with 10 bonus seconds. When out of time, a player is eliminated from the game.

name: Frontier Skies
description:
Based on the popular steampunk-themed minigame, Frontier Skies brings players on a tabletop journey through the unique world of Gaia Online. Players will compete to build the finest airship while managing their crew, stockpiling supplies and maintaining their valuable discoveries. In the end, only the most cunning captain can rule the frontier skies as the richest adventurer around!

In more detail, Frontier Skies consists of four seasons, spanning a total of twelve rounds of play. Each round consists of four phases: market, adventure, trade and draw. During the market phase, players compete in an open market to purchase new and upgraded parts for their airship. Purchasing new ship parts improves speed, attack power and cargo capacity, giving players special bonuses and extra space to carry valuable discoveries.

In the adventure phase, players embark on a new journey by revealing the top card in the adventure deck. The trade phase allows players to trade discoveries with each other, deciding which are worth keeping and which should be sold off to gain gold and free up cargo capacity for their next adventure. During the draw phase, players activate special abilities, gain an additional discovery, and compete for end-of-season and end-of-game goals which reward players with even more gold.

At the end of the final round, each player calculates their total value to find out which captain has amassed the greatest riches!
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Poisoner's Pour
description:
Each round one player will be the Pourer. They will take the Drink Cards and decide where the poison will be placed around the Center Mat. The Center Mat has 5 places to set drinks that
give 0 to 3 Gold to the person that takes from it. Starting with the player on the Pourer's left, each player will take a Drink Card and adjust their Gold level based on where they took the
drink from. Once every player has taken a Drink Card the Pourer will take the last one for themselves. All players will then Reveal which Drink Card they have taken and adjust their
Poison level accordingly. When a player reaches 10 Gold or is the last one standing they win.

What makes Poisoner's Pour tricky is figuring out where the Pourer placed the poison. They can tell you as little or as much as they like and are probably lying when they do. Or are they?
Can you guess where they would place it knowing that they know you are trying to out­think them? Are they counting on you to know that you know they know your are trying to think like them? You just have to take a drink and hope you know them as well as you think you do.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Splittissimo
description:
Description from the publisher:

Signora ordered five eighths with tomatoes!

This game will make you sweat, as you’ll be working for the famous and respected Italian pizzeria called Splittissimo. Its fussy clients love to order pizza by slices. By playing this game you'll become such an expert in fractions that you'll be second to none.

The game set is designed in a charming Italian style. It includes both rectangular cards with orders and fascinating round cards. The latter are trays with different numbers of pizza slices. Apart from cheese and olives, pizzas include tomatoes, mushrooms, and peppers in various combinations; each one can have two additional ingredients.

Splittissimo offers the fastest delivery!

There are several versions of the game.

Let’s start with the easiest one. If you’re playing with children of five and older, use only round cards. Beginner level cards are marked with one dot (to make it more challenging, you can add cards with two or three dots later). Each player takes three cards and puts them face-up in front of him; the same number of cards is placed face-up on the table (playing by the rules of a more challenging version, the players draw 4 cards and 4 cards are placed on the table) The task is to use several playing field cards to assemble a pizza , so that the number of its slices would be equal to the number of slices in one of your pizzas. Or, conversely, you can choose one of the playing field pizzas and assemble it using several of your own cards.

Playing with older kids, add the rectangular order cards. The task is to assemble the ordered pizzas using the cards on the playing field, taking into account both their size and the ingredients. To add excitement to the game, use a number of special cards, which allow you to slow down your opponents’ work and accelerate your own pace using “last minute” orders.

All versions of the game end with counting the whole pizzas that players managed to put together. In other words, the players should make whole pizzas from the slices they have, which helps them to reinforce addition of fractions once again.

name: Mission Calaveras
description:
Mexico City - November 1983

Exceeded by her discovery, the scientist Nicole Gomez Santos decides to flee her country and to reveal everything publicly to protect herself. For this, she asks for help from a journalist friend. But at the time of appointment, the latter is missing. She then decides to go to his hotel and discovers the body of his friend, murdered.

Each player embodies an agent who will try with his partner to convince Nicole to choose his organization to protect it. For this, one solution: win his trust by appointing a culprit for the murder of his friend. In turn, the players will place a card representing a place on the game space. Each card will sometimes innocent players, sometimes raise suspicions on them, until a culprit in the eyes of Nicole. It does not matter who really committed the murder: the only thing that counts is that it believes you, you, rather than others!

name: Boombox Game: Rewind to The 80's & 90's
description:
Become the mix master of this 80's and 90's jam.

The players create compilations of songs for unique "life scenarios," like: a song to play at a campfire -- or a song to do an interpretive dance to.

A turn plays out as follows: One player places a card describing the scenario. Each of the other players contributes a face down song-title card from their hand which is their pick for the 'perfect' song for the current scenario. The player who chose the scenario then picks which song is best. The player who submitted that song wins a token.

The winner is the player with the most scoring tokens after four rounds of play.
categories: Card Game, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Wonders of the World
description:
Take a trip around the world and get to know some of the most amazing and unique sights on the planet! On your turn, try to recognize famous wonders and place them on the right continents. If you don’t guess correctly, the clues will help you find the right answer!

This Fact-Packed educational game tests your knowledge and takes you on a trip. Name the manmade and natural wonders on each card. Then guess their location or purpose to win the cards and score points. The player with the most points wins.

Contains 195 wonders from all corners of the world, and a map marked with their locations.

Note: Reimplements an earlier 2004 game of the same name, Wonders of the World.

name: Psychic Links
description:
It might seem like it's all fun and games being psychically linked, but have you ever tried to hit a nice fairway drive while your opponent is moving the entire green with their mind?

Players first take turns to draw cards and place them building the course (until the hole card is placed). Each player starts with his token (ball) on a solid green square of the starting card.

Players will then take turns making shots (shown on the top of each card). To make a shot, choose any of the four face up options and move the ball as shown in the diagram. You may not choose the same option twice in a row. Sand and slope squares affect your shot. If the shoot includes an action, for example modifying the course, perform it as stated.

The first player to end a shot with the ball exactly in the hole wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Crossbows and Catapults: Sea Battle Set
description:
This could be combined with the master battle set or played on its own.

The game is standard Crossbows and Catapults but with some new sea rules. As well as the standard equipment, the game came with 4 ships which fired projectiles in a similar manner to crossbows. The ships had 'shields' on their sides, and if all of the shields were knocked down by your opponent the ship was sunk.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Nautical

name: Sack Stackers
description:
It’s Christmas Eve, and every gift in Santa’s workshop has been carefully wrapped ready for delivery. You and your fellow Elves have been trusted to load up the sleigh, but the Sack Stacker 5000 is misbehaving! All of the presents are coming out in the wrong order and getting mixed up with lumps of coal... Can you sort out the gifts and make sure everyone gets what they hoped for on Christmas morning?

Sack Stackers is a festive, family-weight roll-and-write game that can be played solo or as a group; in person or remotely.

Use shared dice rolls to collect gifts, drop them into Santa’s sack and build patterns to earn points. You'll need to manipulate the dice, but beware of gathering coal that might interfere with your plans!

Simple rules, crunchy decisions and familiar gameplay akin to Tetris and Connect4 make this the ideal game for a family get-together.

—description from the designer

name: Das Prestel Nasenspiel
description:
Players effectively make a large pattern of groups of noses and score points at the end for owning groups. There are 10 noses, all taken from art, shown paired up in every combination on large tiles (excepting one pairing because there are only 54 tiles in the game). The tiles are shuffled face-down and distributed evenly (excess can go in the box). Players then turn up and sort their noses out.

They take it in turns to add a nose to the pattern according to the rules, and when a player makes or increases a group of one type of nose, they place one of their five colored markers on it. (If you happen to increase two groups, you place 2 markers.)

But as soon as another player increases that group, their marker replaces the first, which goes back to the other player. In this way, the pattern gets bigger and players fight to control the noses. But because of the random distribution, you will have some fewer noses than others, so the placement becomes very tactical as you try to close off groups and secure your scoring.

The pattern must sit within a 10x10 grid, and all the tiles are open, so it pays to deliberately extend the grid in one direction, giving or taking away opportunities. When no more tiles can be placed, you score one point for each nose you own.

A surprisingly tricky game given the range of noses, Nasenspiel entertains with a delightful combination of sacrifice and reward and a very unusual theme.

name: SMS
description:
In SMS two players compete to get the other players to guess a word or a person. But whoever used the fewer number of letters will get to show their word first. As if you were using a smartphone and sending a text message, you can use letters and a few special characters.

Each player gets a board with a dry-erase marker on which they can write letters and characters.

Want to get people to guess "marathon" ? Then maybe you could write "26mi" or "42km".

When you show your board, players have 30 seconds to find the correct answer. If they don't, then your opponent will get to show his word.

You get points by finding correct words and by being the one whose board helped players find the correct answer.

name: Chicken Out
description:
This delightful children's game cosists of six contests, each requiring a player to take a chance and advance or "chicken out."

A bright plastic spinning chicken controls movement by bobbing its head until it suddenly stops and pecks a number (from 1 to 4)... players must move the number that was spun.

Players may stop at any time, call "Chicken!", and collect money equal to the space where their token lies; otherwise, they spin the chicken again to try and collect a higher reward. If a token moves past the end of a track, it collects nothing.

After six different tracks are played, the player with the highest total is the winner.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sleeping Beauty
description:
From Tactic's webpage:

Sleeping Beauty is a classic fairy tale loved by children everywhere. In this game you get to take the prince’s role as you try to make your way through the rose thistles into the castle. The player who is the first to reach the castle and wake up the princess wins. Sleeping Beauty is a fun board game where good memory and luck will help you to reach the princess - and win.

The game also includes the fairy tale Sleeping Beauty. Once upon a time…

Recommended age 4+

name: Teacher's Quiz
description:
Teacher's Quiz is aimed at children aged 7 - 14 years. It is a simple roll and move trivia game, with a "Snakes and Ladders" mechanism added to the movement. Questions come in two difficulty levels from six categories (history/geography, facts and fantasy, spelling, math, science, and words).

The box contains:
- 480 cards in six categories
- 6 colored pawns
- 1 numbered die
- 1 category die
- 1 gameboard
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Math, Trivia, Word Game
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., Waddington Sanders Ltd., Waddingtons

name: Zoned
description: A wooden game with a very limited print run. The pieces in the game are a single square attached to a triangle with a base twice the size of the square side (like a house with a full roof but only one half below). Similar to 1 Stein + Co, pieces are placed on a grid with the goal of blocking off territory. Cubes are placed in the closed in spaces and the player who can place most of their cubes wins.

name: Flip-'n-Stack Tiki Island
description:
Game consists of a metal, two-sided board; a teeter-totter launching platform; and 6 little Tiki statue figures -- 3 blue and 3 green -- each with strong magnets in their hands and feet. The blue and green figures are of opposite polarity.

Play is simple:
1. Place tiki on launcher.
2. Place launcher close to the metal board.
3. Place finger on launcher and press.

The figure flips into the air and hopefully lands on the the board. The magnets are strong enough that generally the tiki will right itself vertically (either right-side up or upside down). You alternate colors in hopes of forming a stack of figures.

Score is based on where the figures land on the island depicted on the board and how high the stacks are.

The reverse side of the board contains a dartboard-like target.

name: Express 01: Mountains Expansion
description:
from the rules:
"The game play is essentially the same as in the base game. There is one new rule though. If you upgrade a card with a mountain marker on it, you have to pay 1 additional card from your hand..."
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: ZooRegatta
description:
Board game ‘ZooRegatta’ is a family learning game that acquaints Players with Geography and Animal world of our planet during fascinating sailing regatta. Children will like playing process as well as preparation to the game, during which it will be necessary to assemble 4 ships miniatures.

Players appear in the role of captains of sailing ships that received task of particular importance: “To make a round-the-world voyage and collect animals – one animal from each continent. All animals must be shipped to the own port in order to organize a zoo.” Winner is the Player, who first transports full collection of animals to the port, where his trip started.

Gameplay is divided to rounds. During a round all Players move their ships according to the turn order.

Distance that can be passed by a ship is determined by each Player with a die roll.

Oceans have plenty of currents and an experienced captain can use favorable ones in order to speed up his trip over the oceans vastness. A ship that moved to a hex with a current passes one hex in a direction of a current and this movement does not decrease remaining movement points.

In order to quickly pass large distances, desperate captain can use whirlpools (their total number is 6). In order to use whirpools, Player rolls a die, passes corresponding number of hexes and if he finishes in a whirlpool, he rolls a die once more. New number will show in which whirlpool the Player will start his new turn.

Each Player at the beginning of the game has 2 shots (so 2 fire tokens are put on a ship card). In order to fire, a Player has to finish his movement near an opponent’s ship. After that he rolls a die and result indicates a cabin, which was hit. (e.g., cabin 6 is hit in a die roll of 6). If the cabin is empty, a shot is unlucky. If an animal was in cabin, a shoot hits an animal out of the ship, and wind and waves return it to its natural living place (a captain must place an animal token to any of the empty red hexes on the animal’s continent).

SECOND GAME.
The board is 2-sided. On the second side of the board there is another game: ‘Dangerous race’. It will suit to the smallest Players that only get their first steps in a board game world!

A winner is a Player who first passes a route from a starting fort to a finishing one. Each Player rolls a die and moves at corresponding number of circles along the line. Lines are of red and yellow colors. Red solid line is a main path. Yellow solid line is shorter but more dangerous way.
AWARDS
Winner of the "Baby Expo Ukraine 2018" (best geography game)
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Nautical, Transportation
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Indochine 1952: Opération "Bruno"
description:
Opération "Bruno" (Operation "Bruno") retraces the odyssey of the (French) 6th Colonial Parachute Battalion (6eme bataillon de parachutistes coloniaux - 6éme BPC) across 80 km of jungle with the Viet Minh troops on their heels, following the combats in Tu Le.

Components:

A3 map
108 die-cut counters


The game requires a six-sided die.

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from the Vae Victis website.

name: Nomads No More
description:
Nomads No More (NNM) is a free game system that includes two different games: Ungern’s Mongolia and Pasha’s Bokhara. Both games in the NNM system use the same core rules but use separate maps and pieces to cover concurrent conflicts that erupted on the eastern perimeter of Soviet Russia soon after the Russian Civil War – the early 1920s. Ungern’s Mongolia simulates the invasion of Mongolia by fleeing Whites, their clash with the Chinese and subsequent pursuit by Reds. Pasha’s Bokhara covers the Basmachi uprising against Soviet rule around Bokhara - present day Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan and Uzbekistan.

Published in Paper Wars #86 (Summer 2017 issue); publisher Compass Games.

name: A Bloody Crown: A Solitaire Game of the Wars of the Roses.
description:
A Bloody Crown is semi-historical simulation of the Wars of the Roses. The game begins as Henry VI is struggling to retain his position as King of England. The Player represents Edward, Duke of York with the ambition of attaining the Crown due to King Henry’s mental instability and lack of leadership. As the Commander of Yorkist Allied Forces, you must control a significant number of Cities and Towns before the last Campaign Card is Played.

Game Objective: Player takes command of the House of York. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to control at least 16 Cities and 12 Towns before the last Campaign Card is Played. If the Lancaster Army controls 16 Cities and 12 Towns at the end of their Turn, the Lancastrians win.

During the Player's Turn, he/she must draw Campaign Cards which may result in Events, Actions, or Forces. The Player must gather his Nobles and their forces in order to take control of Cities and Towns. Random Events play a major part in the game, however, the Player must manage his Nobles and Action Points wisely in order to acheive victory.

The Game includes many colorful counters representing Nobles, Foot Levies, Men-at-Arms, Knights, Longbowmen, Hand-gunners, and Cannon.

A Bloody Crown can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Myth: 'Who Brought Jokerman?' Promo
description:
A Myth promo card released at Gencon 2014.

"Play this card immediately after another hero fails to hit with an Attack Action with an AP cost of 2. That hero may reroll his dice pool. If he fails to hit again, a Darkness Cycle activates immediately."

This card may be played as a reaction, adds 1 AP and can be used no matter what your movement has been.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, MegaCon Games, Ulisses Spiele

name: Texto!
description:
In each turn of Texto!, the players reveal a card, revealing a category and three letters. Only one of the cards matches the color of the category. You should be the quickest to find a word that starts with that letter and belongs to the category. The first one that succeeds wins the card. Then we start a new round! Whoever accumulates more cards wins.

Texto! is a totally addictive game that will test your wits. It is accessible to all, and everyone plays at the same time.

name: Khronos Hunter
description:
Designed by Hiroyuki Okinoi, this game is published in a Japanese / English edition.

The Empress of Time inadvertently triggers a malfunction that causes different time intervals and parallel words to intersect. You are an adventurer who is unwittingly sucked into this time spiral. Your objective is collecting a form of energy called mana and bringing the world back to order, allowing you to return to your own time.

The objective of play is to travel the game board and collect mana, a strange form of energy, before the other players. Players advance the number of squares according to the number rolled on the die. Cast Cards can be set along points of the board, allowing a player to collect payment from others. “Cast” refers to the residents of the alien world. Once a player collects 100 mana, he wins by returning to Start. This means that even if another player has more mana than you, if you reach the goal with 100 mana in hand, you are the winner. To decide runners-up, count the number of mana each player has at the end of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 誰も出てこない。 (Everyone Does Not Come Out)
description:
User summary:
誰も出てこない。 (Dare Mo Detekonai) means "Nobody comes out" in English.

You are an adventurer who is exploring an ancient ruin for treasures. But the ruin is guarded by a dreadful golem. You have to escape from the approaching golem and get out of the ruin alive, while collecting more treasures than everyone else.

But I bet you won't be able to survive it.

Enjoy watching how the adventurers lose their lives!

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは冒険者となり、古代遺跡に眠る数多の財宝を持ち帰る事が目的です。しかし！その遺跡には恐ろしい門番「ゴーレム」がいます・・・
迫り来るゴーレムから逃げ延び、誰よりも多くの財宝を持ち帰りましょう！
でもきっと、誰も持ち帰れないでしょう。
是非プレイヤーが次々と散ってゆくさまを楽しんでください。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Patronage
description:
In this game, you play a role of a maestro in Renaissance Era.
Under patoronage and hence annual budget, you hire artists and engage in creative projects.
If you want to become number-one maestro, expand your bottega and hire better artists in each genre of paintings sculpure and architecture.
You need more money to hire better artists, but their genious will inspire more splendid works.
You'll be able to get more budget by offering fashonable works to prominent characters.
After 9 rounds, you will become the winner if you acquire the highest fame.

—description from the designer

name: Okazaki
description:
Okazaki is a 1-2 player card game featuring a unique combination of hand management, and ability activation to create a tense strategic experience using nothing but 18 identical cards.

In Okazaki, players are competing to replicate a small string of DNA by creating base-pairs and writing them into a new sequence of DNA. Players will be able to utilize numerous mutation and DNA reparation abilities to manipulate their hand and their written sequence. The first player to correctly replicate the origin sequence wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Trivial Pursuit: Lord of the Rings – Bite Size
description:
This Trivial Pursuit Bitesize edition contains 600 questions about The Lord of the Rings, which are a challenge for even the biggest fans of Middle-earth. Take the handy travel wedge with you wherever you go, and use the special playing token in your boxed game at home!

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Winning Moves Germany, Winning Moves International Ltd

name: たすけてプリンセス (Save the Princess)
description:
The gluttonous Demon Lord has kidnapped the Princesses of the Land of Sweets!
Save the Princesses from the Demon Lord's clutches and take back our sweets!

One player is the Demon Lord, and the rest of the players are rescuers (players take turns being the Demon Lord). Line up Princess cards equal to the number of players +1. The Demon Lord places ◯ and ☓ cards below the Princess cards face-down. When a rescuer reveals a ◯, they successfully gain a Princess card; if they reveal a ☓, they fail to do so.

name: Taggle d'amour
description:
Taggle d'amour is an expansion to Taggle that may be played standalone.

Taggle d'amour adds 35 'Thoughts' and 20 'Retort' Love-themed cards to the classic Taggle game.

As in Taggle, each player draws a 'Retort' card. Each turn, a new player reads out loud one of the 'Thoughts' lines and the other players, one after another, must use one of their 'Retort' lines to snap back the silliest or funniest retort. The player who read the "Thoughts" card then gives a "Taggle" counter to the player who provided the lamest retort.

Once a player has accumulated 5 "Taggle" counters, he is declared loser.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Le Droit de Perdre

name: Diamant
description: The mystic board is in itself enticing. Almost hand-wide in height with ponderous bulges, in magical midnight- blue with glittering diamonds. The game is to light up the individual diamonds with invisible beam. This is done by clever placing of the silver colored stones on the board thus directing the invisible beam onto the right diamonds.

name: Entenmarsch
description:
From the box:

"Chop chop, out of the water!" quacks mummy duck.
The ducklings however want to go on diving.

Who will lure them out of the pond for mummy duck and uncover the right duckling at the right moment? This is a memory game for young children.

name: Bauer schnell! Es wird schon hell
description:
On the farm, the work always begins early. Who can help the farmer to carry the food and bring it to the right animal?

This is a cooperative game, where the players must work together to feed the animals before the sun goes down.

Ages 3-10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: I, Dungeon
description: It's not easy being a dungeon. Especially since those grubby humans started some stupid crusade to pilfer and rob every last gem and ore from your beautiful depths after you've spent millennia cultivating them. Well, you may have been carved from the earth at night, but it sure as heck wasn't last night. Everyone knows that treasures kept by dungeons hold mystical and dangerous powers; that's probably why those invaders want them. Well, it's time to fight fire with fire. Who knows... maybe with a little "convincing" that adventuring party is willing to make a donation or two to your fine collection. One thing's for sure, they picked the wrong sentient cavern to mess with!
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Worker Placement

name: Rate It!
description:
Do you have what it takes to know how others rate?

Rate It! is the greatest of all the get-to-know-you family party games and guarantees fun and exciting surprises with every turn of a card. You'll be amazed at the things you will find out about your family and your friends!

Players have to rate different people, movies, sports team, etc... Players also use the erasable paddle to predict how other players will rate it. On the back of the paddle is an erasable tally. First to ten wins. To keep the game interesting...there are many ways to rate items:

Thumbs up/thumbs down
Making the grade
Overrated/underrated
Star Rating
Face Rating
All Play (1-10)

name: Co-opoly
description:
In Co-opoly: The Game of Cooperatives , players must collaborate to found and run a democratic business. In order to survive as individuals and to strive for the success of their co-op, players make tough choices regarding big and small challenges while putting their teamwork abilities to the test.

Challenges consist of mini games of charades, guess the drawing or "unspoken", in which the active player has to get the other players to guess the word on the card without saying the word or related words. Completing challenges earns points for your co-op. As the co-op marker moves around the board world cards may have to be drawn that can take points from the individual players, from the co-op pool of points or can be beneficial by giving bonus challenges or points. The players win when they achieve the goal of starting up a second co-op.

This is an exciting game of skill and solidarity, where everyone wins – or everybody loses. Will the Point Bank continue to dominate the players’ lives, or will they break free and take control by jump-starting the movement for a truly democratic and cooperative economy in their community?

By playing Co-opoly, players discover the unique benefits, challenges, and operations of the cooperative world – as well as the skills needed to participate in a co-op!
Co-opoly is for teens and adults.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Queen Esther Dancing Dreidels
description:
This game is part of a series of games and is themed for the Jewish holiday of Purim. This entry is the series specifically is aimed at little girls and so focuses on Queen Esther from the Purim story.

Each player has a set of pieces which depict Queen Esther. These start on a side giving a black and white picture. After the end of each circuit round the board or after certain actions, a player flips a piece to the colored side. The first player to flip all pieces of the picture of Queen Esther to the colored side wins.

The game uses a dreidel in lieu of a d4, and players move round the six points of a Star of David based on the result of a spin. The movement value of a spin and the associated action in regards to a pool of cards for each spin corresponds to the value of a given spin in the traditional game of Dreidel. One set of cards serves to modify the movement results of spins, to protect one from other players' actions and to challenge other players. Another set of cards serves to create sets and so earn Hamentaschen (cookie) tokens which can in turn be used to turn over pieces of the picture of Queen Esther.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ti'Mur Vulcan Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Collective.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: テトラコンボ (Tetra Combo)
description:
In テトラコンボ (Tetra Combo), each player controls four colored blocks on a 4x4 game board. They alternate taking turns, moving one block on each turn in order to create tetrominos, a tetromino being a pattern created by four adjacent blocks. (Think of the pieces in Tetris, with five tetrominos being the only shapes possible.)

Each time that a player creates a tetromino — whether with their own pieces or with four empty spaces on the game board — that player scores a point for that particular type of tetromino. If you manage to create two more of a tetromino than the opponent, you win!

name: Symboletto
description:
Description from the designer:

The game is a blind bidding game with a hint of bluffing. Each player has some money and a set of bidding cards which they use buy victory point cards with the twist that the used bidding cards will return for further use later on.

The game proceeds over several rounds, in which a) first a set of available victory point cards are revealed, then b) each player places their blind bid on each available victory point card and c) finally each victory point are resolved in order to see, which player will eventually get it.

The two (or more, if tied) players who placed the highest bids on a victory point card will have one change to raise their original bid and the player with the highest bid will get the victory point card. The winning playes pays his/her bid: the used bidding cards will be gone for some rounds (indicated by the victory point card) and used money will go the other player(s) in the duel.

In the end victory points are gained with a) victory points cards directly, b) money and c) suitable sets victory point cards. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: The Lepak Game
description:
Malaysianised card game based on the same engine as Cards against Humanity.

START
Choose a ‘Boss’ (the judge)
Boss deals all players 8 cards

MATCH
Boss displays and reads aloud a Yellow card
All players (except the Boss) match a Blue card within their hand to the Yellow card

BODEK
Players bodek (persuade) the Boss to choose their card
Boss picks a winner

name: ホシゾラトリテ (Starry Sky Trick-Taking)
description:
Starry Sky Trick-Taking is a 3-player only game in which the players draw constellations on a communal board based upon the cards played to a trick. The specific path(s) drawn are determined by the majority color played and the majority high/low numbers played, and the path is drawn by the winner of the trick.

Play continues until players have 1 card left in hand. In addition to their traditional rank, the cards also show a bid number for how many points the drawn constellations will be worth. The winner of the game is the player whose bid was closest to the value of the constellations.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Dinosaurs
description:
This set contains 600 questions and answers about Dinosaurs on 100 cards from the following categories:

Traits
Pop Culture
Friends, Foes and Families
Discoveries
Habits
Name-it

This set can be used as an expansion along with any Trivial Pursuit base game or played stand-alone with the enclosed rules and customized die.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Party Game, Prehistoric, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Oh! Sushi Game
description:
It doesn't get more Japanese than this: 10 different games all using a set of pieces shaped like nigiri sushi! The Oh! Sushi Game is all the fun you'd expect and will help you built some skills which will prove very handy during your next trip to Japan among them, your use of chopsticks, your knowledge of a sushi menu, or the classic strategy game shogi (Japanese chess).

Oh! Sushi Game's basic gameplay is building Jenga-like towers (taking blocks stacked in a tower formation one by one and placing it on the topmost story. If the tower falls, you lose). But its creators have come up with several variations, including making a tower with chopsticks, picking your next piece using a die, or using the pieces as shogi pieces, dominoes, flash cards for memory games, and even as bullets for a variation of Russian roulette with wasabi.

name: International Soccer The Game
description:
From the box:

True to life Action-Packed soccer where you command the country of your choice to victory! Challenge your opponent... Strategize your shots... And be the coach!

Game includes 10 countries, 13 players per team with different skill level per player and soccer cards for injuries, penalties, corner kicks, throw ins and more!

name: Country Trains
description:
The idea for country trains came when the designer was playing Kings Gate one evening. The rectangular tiles could be stations and the tiles around them and joining them could be services and track. This was way back in 2006.

Over the years the design has been revisited many times and the game developed.

On a turn a player must lay a tile and may move their train. If the train is on connection between two stations it must move back to a station to re-coal. If the train is at a station, it may move onto a track connection to make a delivery. Deliveries are payed out based on the goods at the source and the type in demand at the destination (timber, sheep, ore). All stations have spaces for goods to be delivered too. When these are full, that station can receive no more goods. However, space can be made for more goods by delivering passengers.

The tiles players lay represent track, which they are paid to lay (land grant railway style). Country tiles which provide goods for carriage. Plus passengers which consume the carried goods as described above.

The game also has station tiles which are owned by the players. Players start with one station, but may lay extra as their existing stations are properly surrounded. Owning a station also earns players a small income as other player use the facilities there.

The game continues until one of the tile stacks runs out.

The latest version of the rules and tiles are May 2019. If you have been playing an earlier version, the designer suggests at least looking at the improvements and/or viewing the "how to" video section here on the geek.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: MaGCK: The Matrix Game Construction Kit
description: MaGCK contains everything needed to play and design Engle "matrix games" — free-form narrative games that encourage player discussion. The kit includes rules, hundreds of customizable tokens and stickers, disks (to mark status or conditions), isomorphic map tiles, various tracking mats (phases, turns, time, die roll modifiers), dice, and links to additional online resources. MaGCK also contains rules and briefing materials for two games: ISIS CRISIS (a conflict simulation of contemporary Iraq) and A RECKONING OF VULTURES (coup-plotting and political skullduggery in the fictional Republic of Matrixia). Matrix games are already used within the national security and foreign policy communities for training and analysis. With MaGCK the user can develop their own games on a wide range of topics, whether for professional use or hobby gaming.
categories: Game System, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Role Playing, Simulation, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Disney Cookie Swap Card Game
description:
The fast-paced cookie flipping and finding game! Join all your favorite Disney and Pixar friends for a holiday treat!

Players share and swap cookies from the sheet. When you collect four cards of the same character—DING! They’re done! Pour a glass of milk and enjoy this deliciously fun card game.

Player draws and trade cards on their turn until the deck runs on.

When deck is out, the player with most points (sets) wins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Trading

name: New World Order, Axis & Allies Variant
description:
A set of future-war variant pieces and rules from Table Tactics.

"This game adds 200 new color matched plastic pieces and directions on how to play this with WWIII version. When playing New World Order you use the original game board and over 200 of the original pieces. For a fast paced game add F16 Fighters, Abrams Tanks, Helicopters, Armored Personnel Carriers, & Hovercraft."

Expands:

Axis & Allies

name: Mellan tummen och pekfingret
description: Trivia game where the object is to come closest to the answer, which always is a number ie. How many people live in USA. The closer you get to the right number the more points you get. If you don't get the answer completely right then the other players may guess. The quiz-asker gets the remainder of the points if any.

name: Battle of the Ring
description:
Game included with The Wargamer Magazine Issue #1 and later republished as a stand-alone.

Grand Strategic, low complexity (2 page rules), game of the War of the Ring from the Tolkein book. Apparently unlicensed publication was a hoot to play with the orc hordes rolling out in waves. Needs more beer than pretzels to enjoy, but charming in a 1970's DTP kind of way.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid
